verses.latin: Beatus vir qui non abiit in consilio impiorum, et in via peccatorum non stetit, et in cathedra pestilentiae non sedit:
verses.english: Truly blessed is the man who does not follow the advice of the ungodly, nor stands in the path of sinners, nor sits in the seat of those who mock or spread moral corruption.

verses.latin: sed in lege Domini voluntas ejus, et in lege ejus meditatus est die ac nocte.
verses.english: Instead, his deepest desire is found in the Law of the Lord, and he ponders over His Law both day and night.

verses.latin: Et erit tamquam lignum quod plantatum est secus decursus aquarum, quod fructum suum dabit in tempore suo: et folium ejus non defluet; et omnia quaecumque faciet prosperabuntur.
verses.english: Such a one will be like a tree planted by flowing streams of water, which yields its fruit in its proper season. Its leaves will not wither, and everything he undertakes will truly prosper.

verses.latin: Non sic impii, non sic: sed tamquam pulvis quem projicit ventus a facie terrae.
verses.english: The ungodly are not like this; they are certainly not! Instead, they are like the chaff which the wind drives away from the surface of the earth.

verses.latin: Ideo non resurgent impii in judicio: neque peccatores in concilio justorum.
verses.english: For this reason, the ungodly will not be able to stand righteous in the great judgment, nor will sinners be found among the assembly of the truly just.

verses.latin: Quoniam novit Dominus viam justorum: et iter impiorum peribit.
verses.english: Because the Lord intimately knows and approves the path taken by the just, but the way of the ungodly will utterly perish and lead to destruction.

verses.latin: Quare fremuerunt gentes, et populi meditati sunt inania?
verses.english: Why have the nations risen in tumult, and why do the peoples devise futile plans?

verses.latin: Astiterunt reges terrae, et principes convenerunt in unum adversus Dominum, et adversus christum ejus.
verses.english: The kings of the earth take their stand, and the rulers have gathered together against the Lord and against His Anointed One, the Christ.

verses.latin: Dirumpamus vincula eorum, et projiciamus a nobis jugum ipsorum.
verses.english: They say: 'Let us break their bonds and throw off their yoke from us!'

verses.latin: Qui habitat in caelis irridebit eos, et Dominus subsannabit eos.
verses.english: The One enthroned above and beyond creation will laugh at them, and the Lord will utterly mock them.

verses.latin: Tunc loquetur ad eos in ira sua, et in furore suo conturbabit eos.
verses.english: Then He will speak to them in His anger, and in His burning wrath He will terrify them.

verses.latin: Ego autem constitutus sum rex ab eo super Sion montem sanctum ejus, praedicans praeceptum ejus.
verses.english: Yet I have been appointed King by Him over Sion, His holy mountain, proclaiming His decree.

verses.latin: Dominus dixit ad me: Filius meus es tu; ego hodie genui te.
verses.english: The Lord has said to me: 'You are my Son; this very day I have begotten you.'

verses.latin: Postula a me, et dabo tibi gentes haereditatem tuam, et possessionem tuam terminos terrae.
verses.english: 'Ask of Me, and I will give you the nations as your inheritance, and the very ends of the earth as your possession.'

verses.latin: Reges eos in virga ferrea, et tamquam vas figuli confringes eos.
verses.english: 'You will rule them with a rod of iron, and you will shatter them like a potter's vessel.'

verses.latin: Et nunc, reges, intelligite; erudimini, qui judicatis terram.
verses.english: And now, you kings, be wise; take instruction, you who govern the earth.

verses.latin: Servite Domino in timore, et exsultate ei cum tremore.
verses.english: Serve the Lord with reverent fear, and rejoice in Him with trembling awe.

verses.latin: Apprehendite disciplinam, nequando irascatur Dominus, et pereatis de via justa.
verses.english: Embrace His discipline and teaching, lest the Lord become angry and you perish from the just path.

verses.latin: Cum exarserit in brevi ira ejus, beati omnes qui confidunt in eo.
verses.english: When His wrath flares up suddenly and for a short time, truly blessed are all who trust in Him.

verses.latin: Domine, quid multiplicati sunt qui tribulant me? multi insurgunt adversum me.
verses.english: O Lord, why have my tormentors multiplied? Many rise up against me!

verses.latin: Multi dicunt animae meae: Non est salus ipsi in Deo ejus.
verses.english: Many are saying to my very soul: 'There is no salvation for him in his God!'

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine, susceptor meus es, gloria mea, et exaltans caput meum.
verses.english: But You, O Lord, are my protector, my glory, and the One who lifts up my head.

verses.latin: Voce mea ad Dominum clamavi: et exaudivit me de monte sancto suo.
verses.english: With my voice, I cried out to the Lord, and He heard me from His holy mountain.

verses.latin: Ego dormivi, et soporatus sum: et exsurrexi, quia Dominus suscepit me.
verses.english: I lay down and slept deeply, and I awoke again, because the Lord sustained me.

verses.latin: Non timebo millia populi circumdantis me: exsurge, Domine; salvum me fac, Deus meus.
verses.english: I will not fear the thousands of people who surround me. Rise up, O Lord; save me, O my God!

verses.latin: Quoniam tu percussisti omnes adversantes mihi sine causa: dentes peccatorum contrivisti.
verses.english: For You have struck all those who opposed me without just cause; You have broken the teeth of the wicked sinners.

verses.latin: Domini est salus: et super populum tuum benedictio tua.
verses.english: Salvation comes from the Lord, and Your blessing rests upon Your people.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End, or for the director of music, to be accompanied by stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Cum invocarem, exaudivit me Deus justitiae meae: in tribulatione dilatasti mihi. Miserere mei, et exaudi orationem meam.
verses.english: When I called upon Him, the God of my righteousness heard me. In my tribulation, You gave me room to breathe. Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

verses.latin: Filii hominum, usquequo gravi corde? ut quid diligitis vanitatem, et quaeritis mendacium?
verses.english: O sons of men, how long will your hearts be heavy with sorrow and stubbornness? Why do you love what is vain and seek what is false?

verses.latin: Et scitote quoniam mirificavit Dominus sanctum suum: Dominus exaudiet me, cum clamavero ad eum.
verses.english: And know this: the Lord has shown His holy one a wondrous favor. The Lord will hear me when I cry out to Him.

verses.latin: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: quae dicitis in cordibus vestris, in cubilibus vestris compungimini.
verses.english: Be angry, but do not sin. Reflect on what you speak in your hearts, and in your silent chambers, be contrite.

verses.latin: Sacrificate sacrificium justitiae, et sperate in Domino.
verses.english: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness, and place your hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Multi dicunt: Quis ostendit nobis bona? Signatum est super nos lumen vultus tui, Domine.
verses.english: Many are asking: 'Who will show us good things?' The light of Your face, O Lord, has been impressed upon us as a sign.

verses.latin: Dedisti laetitiam in corde meo: a fructu frumenti, vini, et olei sui multiplicati sunt.
verses.english: You have given joy to my heart, more than they have from the abundance of their grain, wine, and oil.

verses.latin: In finem, pro ea quae haereditatem consequitur. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End, or for the director of music, concerning the one who obtains the inheritance (possibly referring to a liturgical melody or the Church). A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Verba mea auribus percipe, Domine; intellige clamorem meum.
verses.english: Lord, perceive my words with Your ears; understand my cry.

verses.latin: Intende voci orationis meae, rex meus et Deus meus: quoniam ad te orabo.
verses.english: Attend to the voice of my prayer, O my King and my God, because it is to You alone that I will pray.

verses.latin: Domine, mane exaudies vocem meam. Mane astabo tibi, et videbo:
verses.english: O Lord, in the morning You will hear my voice. In the morning, I will stand ready before You and look for Your answer.

verses.latin: quoniam non Deus volens iniquitatem tu es.
verses.english: For You are not a God who desires iniquity.

verses.latin: Quare fremuerunt gentes, et populi meditati sunt inania?
verses.english: Why do the nations rage, and the peoples devise useless schemes?

verses.latin: Astiterunt reges terrae, et principes convenerunt in unum adversus Dominum, et adversus christum ejus.
verses.english: The kings of the earth have taken their stand, and its rulers have assembled together against the Lord and against His Anointed King.

verses.latin: Dirumpamus vincula eorum: et projiciamus a nobis jugum ipsorum.
verses.english: (The rebellious kings say,) "Let us break their chains, and let us cast off their yoke from us!"

verses.latin: Qui habitat in caelis, irridebit eos: et Dominus subsannabit eos.
verses.english: He who sits enthroned in the highest heavens will laugh at them, and the Lord will mock them.

verses.latin: Tunc loquetur ad eos in ira sua, et in furore suo conturbabit eos.
verses.english: Then He will speak to them in His anger, and in His burning rage He will terrify them.

verses.latin: Ego autem constitui regem meum super Sion, montem sanctum meum, praedicans praeceptum ejus.
verses.english: But I have established My King upon Zion, My holy mountain, and I will now declare My decree concerning Him.

verses.latin: Dominus dixit ad me: Filius meus es tu, ego hodie genui te.
verses.english: The Lord said to me, "You are My Son. Today I have begotten you and declared your divine Sonship."

verses.latin: Postula a me, et dabo tibi gentes haereditatem tuam, et possessionem tuam terminos terrae.
verses.english: Ask of Me, and I will give you the nations as your inheritance, and the ends of the earth as your possession.

verses.latin: Reges eos in virga ferrea, et tamquam vas figuli confringes eos.
verses.english: You shall rule them with an iron scepter, and shatter them like a potter's vessel.

verses.latin: Et nunc, reges, intelligite: erudimini, qui judicatis terram.
verses.english: Therefore, now, O kings, be wise; be instructed, you who govern the earth.

verses.latin: Servite Domino in timore: et exsultate ei cum tremore.
verses.english: Serve the Lord with reverence, and rejoice in Him with awe and trembling.

verses.latin: Apprehendite disciplinam, nequando irascatur Dominus, et pereatis de via justa. Cum exarserit in brevi ira ejus, beati omnes qui confidunt in eo.
verses.english: Embrace His instruction, lest the Lord become angry, and you perish from the righteous path. For when His wrath is quickly kindled, blessed are all who trust in Him.

verses.latin: Psalmus David, cum fugeret a facie Absalom filii sui.
verses.english: This Psalm by David was written when he fled from his own son, Absalom.

verses.latin: Domine, quid multiplicati sunt qui tribulant me? multi insurgunt adversum me.
verses.english: Oh Lord, why have those who trouble me multiplied so much? Many have risen up against me.

verses.latin: Multi dicunt animæ meæ: Non est salus ipsi in Deo ejus.
verses.english: Many say to my very soul, 'There is no salvation for him, not even in his God.'

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine, susceptor meus es; gloria mea, et exaltans caput meum.
verses.english: But You, Oh Lord, You are my protector and defender; You are my glory, and You are the one who lifts up my head.

verses.latin: Voce mea ad Dominum clamavi; et exaudivit me de monte sancto suo.
verses.english: With my voice, I cried out to the Lord, and He heard me from His holy mountain.

verses.latin: Ego dormivi, et soporatus sum; et exsurrexi, quia Dominus suscepit me.
verses.english: I lay down and fell into a deep sleep; and I awoke again, because the Lord sustains and protects me.

verses.latin: Non timebo millia populi circumdantis me: exsurge, Domine; salvum me fac, Deus meus.
verses.english: I will not fear the thousands of people surrounding me. Rise up, Oh Lord; save me, Oh my God.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu percussisti omnes adversantes mihi sine causa; dentes peccatorum contrivisti.
verses.english: For You have struck down all who opposed me without cause; You have crushed the teeth of sinners, shattering their power and ability to harm.

verses.latin: Domini est salus; et super populum tuum benedictio tua.
verses.english: Salvation belongs to the Lord alone; and Your blessing is upon Your people.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End of all things, to be sung with stringed instruments. A Psalm by David.

verses.latin: Cum invocarem, exaudivit me Deus justitiæ meæ: in tribulatione dilatasti mihi. Miserere mei, et exaudi orationem meam.
verses.english: When I called upon Him, the God of my righteousness heard me. In my tribulation, You made room for me and eased my distress. Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

verses.latin: Filii hominum, usquequo gravi corde? ut quid diligitis vanitatem, et quæritis mendacium?
verses.english: Oh sons of men, how long will your hearts be hardened and heavy with sin? Why do you love vanity and seek after falsehood?

verses.latin: Et scitote quoniam mirificavit Dominus sanctum suum: Dominus exaudiet me, cum clamavero ad eum.
verses.english: And know this: the Lord has marvelously set apart His holy one. The Lord will hear me when I cry out to Him.

verses.latin: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: quæ dicitis in cordibus vestris, in cubilibus vestris compungimini.
verses.english: Be angry, but do not sin. What you speak in your hearts, reflect on it in your beds and be pierced with sorrow for it.

verses.latin: Sacrificate sacrificium justitiæ, et sperate in Domino.
verses.english: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness, and place your hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Multi dicunt: Quis ostendit nobis bona? Signatum est super nos lumen vultus tui, Domine.
verses.english: Many say, 'Who will show us good things?' The light of Your face, Oh Lord, has been impressed and shone upon us.

verses.latin: Dedisti lætitiam in corde meo, a tempore frumenti, vini, et olei sui multiplicati sunt.
verses.english: You have given joy to my heart, more than the joy they find when their grain, wine, and oil have multiplied and overflowed abundantly.

verses.latin: In pace in idipsum dormiam, et requiescam; quoniam tu, Domine, singulariter in spe constituisti me.
verses.english: In peace, I will lie down and rest in that very same hope; for You, Oh Lord, have singularly established me in hope, setting me apart for it.

verses.latin: In finem, pro ea quæ hæreditatem consequitur. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End of all things, concerning the one who obtains the spiritual inheritance. A Psalm by David.

verses.latin: Verba mea auribus percipe, Domine; intellige clamorem meum.
verses.english: Receive my words into Your ears, Oh Lord; understand the deep meaning of my cry.

verses.latin: Intende voci orationis meæ, Rex meus et Deus meus; quoniam ad te orabo.
verses.english: Give heed to the voice of my prayer, my King and my God; for I will pray to You alone.

verses.latin: Domine, mane exaudies vocem meam. Mane astabo tibi, et videbo;
verses.english: Oh Lord, in the morning You will hear my voice. In the morning, I will stand before You in expectation, and I will see Your answer.

verses.latin: quoniam non Deus volens iniquitatem tu es. Neque habitabit juxta te malignus;
verses.english: For You are not a God who desires or permits iniquity. Nor will the wicked dwell near You;

verses.latin: neque permanebunt injusti ante oculos tuos.
verses.english: nor will the unjust endure or remain before Your eyes.

verses.latin: Odisti omnes qui operantur iniquitatem; perdes omnes qui loquuntur mendacium.
verses.english: You hate all who practice iniquity; You will destroy all who speak lies.

verses.latin: Virum sanguinum et dolosum abominabitur Dominus.
verses.english: The Lord will utterly detest the man who sheds blood and is full of deceit.

verses.latin: Ego autem in multitudine misericordiæ tuæ introibo in domum tuam; adorabo ad templum sanctum tuum in timore tuo.
verses.english: But I, in the abundance of Your mercy, will enter into Your house; I will worship toward Your holy temple with reverent fear of You.

verses.latin: Domine, deduc me in justitia tua; propter inimicos meos dirige in conspectu tuo viam meam.
verses.english: Oh Lord, lead me in Your righteousness; because of my enemies, guide my path directly before Your face.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est in ore eorum veritas; cor eorum vanum est. Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant. Judica illos, Deus.
verses.english: For there is no truth in their mouths; their heart is empty and vain. Their throat is an open sepulchre, a source of corruption; with their tongues, they acted deceitfully. Judge them, Oh God.

verses.latin: Decidant a cogitationibus suis; secundum multitudinem impietatum eorum expelle eos, quoniam irritaverunt te, Domine.
verses.english: Let them fall short of their own schemes; according to the multitude of their impieties, cast them out, for they have provoked You, Oh Lord, to anger.

verses.latin: Et lætentur omnes qui sperant in te; in æternum exsultabunt, et obumbrabis eis: et gloriabuntur in te omnes qui diligunt nomen tuum.
verses.english: And let all who hope in You rejoice; they will exult forever, and You will overshadow them with Your protection. And all who love Your name will glory in You.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu benedices justo, Domine: ut scuto bonæ voluntatis tuæ coronasti nos.
verses.english: For You, Oh Lord, will bless the just person. You have crowned us with the shield of Your good will, providing us with ultimate defense and favor.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus, pro octava. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End of all things, to be sung with stringed instruments, on the eighth note. A Psalm by David.

verses.latin: Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me, neque in ira tua corripias me.
verses.english: Oh Lord, do not rebuke me in Your burning fury, nor chasten me in Your intense anger.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam infirmus sum; sana me, Domine, quoniam conturbata sunt ossa mea.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, Oh Lord, for I am weak and frail. Heal me, Oh Lord, for my very bones are troubled and shaken.

verses.latin: Et anima mea turbata est valde; sed tu, Domine, usquequo?
verses.english: And my soul is greatly troubled and disturbed; but You, Oh Lord, how long will this last?

verses.latin: Convertere, Domine, et eripe animam meam; salvum me fac propter misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Turn back to me, Oh Lord, and rescue my soul; save me because of Your steadfast mercy.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est in morte qui memor sit tui; in inferno autem quis confitebitur tibi?
verses.english: For among the dead, there is no one who remembers You; and in the underworld (Sheol), who will give You praise or confess Your name?

verses.latin: Laboravi in gemitu meo; lavabo per singulas noctes lectum meum: lacrimis meis stratum meum rigabo.
verses.english: I am exhausted with my groaning; every single night I will wash my bed with tears. With my tears, I will drench and saturate my couch.

verses.latin: Turbatus est a furore oculus meus; inveteravi inter omnes inimicos meos.
verses.english: My eye is troubled and dimmed by my anguish; I have grown old and weary among all my enemies.

verses.latin: In finem. In carminibus. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End. With stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Cum invocarem, exaudivit me Deus justitiae meae: in tribulatione dilatasti mihi. Miserere mei, et exaudi orationem meam.
verses.english: When I called out, the God who is my righteousness heard me. You brought me relief in my distress. Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

verses.latin: Filii hominum, usquequo gravi corde? Ut quid diligitis vanitatem, et quaeritis mendacium?
verses.english: O sons of men, how long will your hearts be so hardened? Why do you love empty things and seek out lies?

verses.latin: Et scitote quoniam mirificavit Dominus sanctum suum: Dominus exaudiet me, cum clamavero ad eum.
verses.english: Know this: the Lord has wonderfully set apart His holy one. The Lord will hear me when I cry out to Him.

verses.latin: Irascimini, et nolite peccare: quae dicitis in cordibus vestris, in cubilibus vestris compungimini.
verses.english: Be angry, but do not sin. The things you say in your hearts—reflect on them in your beds and be contrite.

verses.latin: Sacrificate sacrificium justitiae, et sperate in Domino.
verses.english: Offer sacrifices that are righteous, and place your hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Multi dicunt: Quis ostendit nobis bona? Signatum est super nos lumen vultus tui, Domine.
verses.english: Many are saying: 'Who will show us good things?' But the light of Your face, O Lord, is imprinted upon us.

verses.latin: Dedisti laetitiam in corde meo: a fructu frumenti, vini et olei sui multiplicati sunt.
verses.english: You have put joy in my heart—a joy far greater than the wicked's increase in their grain, wine, and oil.

verses.latin: In pace in idipsum dormiam, et requiescam: quoniam tu, Domine, singulariter in spe constituisti me.
verses.english: In peace, I will lie down and rest, for You alone, O Lord, have set me securely in hope.

verses.latin: In finem, Pro iis qui hereditatem consequuntur. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the End-Times, for those who will receive their eternal inheritance. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Verba mea auribus percipe, Domine; intellege clamorem meum.
verses.english: Listen closely to my words, O Lord; understand my cry for help.

verses.latin: Intende voci orationis meae, Rex meus et Deus meus, quoniam ad te orabo.
verses.english: Pay attention to the sound of my prayer, my King and my God, because I will pray to You.

verses.latin: Domine, mane exaudies vocem meam; mane astabo tibi et videbo.
verses.english: O Lord, in the morning You will hear my voice; in the morning I will stand before You and I will watch expectantly.

verses.latin: Quoniam non Deus volens iniquitatem tu es; neque habitabit juxta te malignus.
verses.english: For You are not a God who wills wickedness; nor will the malicious dwell with You.

verses.latin: Neque permanebunt injusti ante oculos tuos; odisti omnes qui operantur iniquitatem.
verses.english: Nor will the unjust remain before Your eyes; You hate all who work iniquity.

verses.latin: Perdes omnes qui loquuntur mendacium; virum sanguinum et dolosum abominabitur Dominus.
verses.english: You will destroy all who speak lies; a man of bloodshed and deceit the Lord will abhor.

verses.latin: Ego autem in multitudine misericordiae tuae introibo in domum tuam; adorabo ad templum sanctum tuum in timore tuo.
verses.english: But I, in the abundance of Your mercy, will enter into Your house; I will worship at Your holy temple in reverent awe of You.

verses.latin: Domine, deduc me in justitia tua propter inimicos meos; dirige in conspectu tuo viam meam.
verses.english: O Lord, lead me in Your justice because of my enemies; direct my way in Your sight.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est in ore eorum veritas; interior eorum vanitas.
verses.english: For there is no truth in their mouths; their inner being is emptiness.

verses.latin: Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant. Judica illos, Deus: decidant a cogitationibus suis. Secundum multitudinem impietatum eorum expelle eos, quoniam irritaverunt te, Domine.
verses.english: Their throat is an open tomb; with their tongues they acted deceitfully. Judge them, O God: let them fall from their own schemes. According to the multitude of their impieties, cast them out, for they have provoked You, O Lord.

verses.latin: Et laetentur omnes qui sperant in te; in aeternum exsultabunt, et obumbrabis eis; et gloriabuntur in te omnes qui diligunt nomen tuum.
verses.english: And let all who hope in You rejoice; they will exult eternally, and You will overshadow them; and all who love Your Name will glory in You.

verses.latin: Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me, neque in ira tua corripias me.
verses.english: O Lord, do not rebuke me when you are full of fury, and do not chastise me when you are full of wrath.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam infirmus sum; sana me, Domine, quoniam conturbata sunt ossa mea.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, O Lord, because I am frail. Heal me, O Lord, because my very bones are disturbed and agitated.

verses.latin: Et anima mea turbata est valde; sed tu, Domine, usquequo?
verses.english: My very soul is also greatly troubled. But you, O Lord, how long will this last?

verses.latin: Convertere, Domine, et eripe animam meam; salvum me fac propter misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Turn your attention to me, O Lord, and rescue my soul. Save me for the sake of your tender mercy.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est in morte qui memor sit tui; in inferno autem quis confitebit tibi?
verses.english: For no one in the realm of death can remember you. And in the underworld, who will be able to praise you?

verses.latin: Laboravi in gemitu meo; lavabo per singulas noctes lectum meum; lacrimis meis stratum meum rigabo.
verses.english: I have exhausted myself with my groaning. Every night I drench my bed with my tears; my very couch I water with my weeping.

verses.latin: Turbatus est a furore oculus meus; inveteravi inter omnes inimicos meos.
verses.english: My vision is blurred from anguish; I have grown weary and aged amidst all my enemies.

verses.latin: Discedite a me, omnes qui operamini iniquitatem, quoniam exaudivit Dominus vocem fletus mei.
verses.english: Go away from me, all you who commit evil deeds, because the Lord has truly heard the sound of my weeping.

verses.latin: Exaudivit Dominus deprecationem meam; Dominus orationem meam suscepit.
verses.english: The Lord has heard my humble plea; the Lord has accepted my prayer.

verses.latin: Erubescant, et conturbentur vehementer omnes inimici mei; convertantur et erubescant valde velociter.
verses.english: Let all my enemies be utterly put to shame and be greatly confounded. Let them retreat, turning away in deep shame, and let it happen very swiftly.

verses.latin: Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me, neque in ira tua corripias me.
verses.english: My Lord, do not rebuke me by means of Your righteous wrath, nor punish me by means of Your intense anger—for Your anger is always just.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam infirmus sum; sana me, Domine, quoniam conturbata sunt ossa mea.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, My Lord, for I am weak and afflicted; heal me, My Lord, for my entire being is deeply distressed, affecting me to my very core.

verses.latin: Et anima mea turbata est valde; sed tu, Domine, usquequo?
verses.english: And my soul is profoundly troubled, truly disturbed; but You, My Lord, how long will you delay granting my petition?

verses.latin: Convertere, Domine, et eripe animam meam; salvum me fac propter misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Turn back to me, My Lord, and rescue my very life—my soul; save me purely by reason of Your loving mercy.

verses.latin: Quoniam non est in morte qui memor sit tui; in inferno autem quis confitebitur tibi?
verses.english: For among those who have died, there is no one who can remember You in praise; and in the realm of the dead, who will confess Your greatness and give You glory?

verses.latin: Laboravi in gemitu meo; lavabo per singulas noctes lectum meum; lacrimis meis stratum meum rigabo.
verses.english: I am utterly exhausted and worn out from my constant groaning; every single night I drench my sleeping place with tears; with my tears, I completely soak my bed.

verses.latin: Turbatus est a furore oculus meus; inveteravi inter omnes inimicos meos.
verses.english: My eye is dimmed and swollen from the intensity of my grief and sorrow; I have grown weary and aged amidst all my adversaries.

verses.latin: Discedite a me, omnes qui operamini iniquitatem, quoniam exaudivit Dominus vocem fletus mei.
verses.english: Depart from me, all you who commit wicked deeds, for the Lord has heard the sound of my weeping and has now answered my prayer.

verses.latin: Exaudivit Dominus deprecationem meam; Dominus orationem meam suscepit.
verses.english: The Lord has heard my urgent and heartfelt plea; the Lord has indeed accepted my prayer.

verses.latin: Erubescant, et conturbentur vehementer omnes inimici mei; convertantur et erubescant valde velociter.
verses.english: May all my enemies be put to shame and be profoundly confused and thrown into disarray; may they turn back from their evil intentions and be shamed very swiftly.

verses.latin: Psalmus David, quem cantavit Domino pro verbis Chusi filii Jemini.
verses.english: A Psalm of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the malicious words of Cush, the son of Jemini.

verses.latin: Domine Deus meus, in te speravi; salvum me fac ex omnibus persequentibus me, et libera me.
verses.english: O Lord, my God, in You I have placed my trust. Rescue me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me from their grasp.

verses.latin: Nequando rapiat ut leo animam meam, dum non est qui redimat, neque qui salvum faciat.
verses.english: Otherwise, they may tear my life away like a lion, with no one to rescue me and no one to save me from their attack.

verses.latin: Domine Deus meus, si feci istud, si est iniquitas in manibus meis;
verses.english: O Lord, my God, if I have committed this offense—if there is any wickedness on my hands—

verses.latin: si reddidi retribuentibus mihi mala, excidam merito ab inimicis meis inanis.
verses.english: if I have repaid evil to those who treated me poorly, then let my enemies justly overtake me and leave me desolate.

verses.latin: Persequatur inimicus animam meam, et comprehendat; et conculcet in terra vitam meam, et gloriam meam in pulverem deducat.
verses.english: Let the enemy pursue my life and capture it. Let him trample my life to the ground and lay my honor in the dust.

verses.latin: Exsurge Domine in ira tua, et exaltare in finibus inimicorum meorum: et exsurge Domine Deus meus in praecepto quod mandasti.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord, in Your righteous anger! Lift Yourself up against the outrage of my enemies. Arise, O Lord my God, by the decree of justice that You have commanded.

verses.latin: Et synagoga populorum circumdabit te: et propter hanc in altum regredere.
verses.english: Then the assembly of all nations will gather around You to witness Your judgment. Because of this, return to Your high throne to judge them.

verses.latin: Dominus judicat populos. Judica me Domine secundum justitiam meam, et secundum innocentiam meam super me.
verses.english: The Lord is the judge of all peoples. Judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to the blamelessness that is found in me.

verses.latin: Consumetur nequitia peccatorum, et diriges justum, scrutans corda et renes Deus.
verses.english: Let the wickedness of sinners be brought to an end, but You, O God, will guide the righteous. You are the God who searches the innermost thoughts and desires of hearts and minds.

verses.latin: Justum adjutorium meum a Domino, qui salvos facit rectos corde.
verses.english: My righteous help comes from the Lord, who saves all those with an upright heart.

verses.latin: Deus judex justus, fortis, et patiens; numquid irascitur per singulos dies?
verses.english: God is a righteous Judge; He is strong and patient. Does He become angry and judge every single day? —No, He is patient.

verses.latin: Nisi conversi fueritis, gladium suum vibrabit; arcum suum tetendit, et paravit illum.
verses.english: If you do not repent and turn away from your sins, He will brandish His sword against you. He has already strung His bow and prepared it for judgment.

verses.latin: Et in eo paravit vasa mortis, sagittas suas ardentibus effecit.
verses.english: And in His hand, He has prepared the instruments of death; He has made His arrows burning with divine justice.

verses.latin: Ecce parturiit injustitiam; concepit dolorem, et peperit iniquitatem.
verses.english: Behold, the wicked man has conceived injustice; he has become pregnant with mischief and has given birth to iniquity.

verses.latin: Lacum aperuit, et effodit eum; et incidit in foveam quam fecit.
verses.english: The wicked man opened a pit and dug it deep, but he himself has fallen into the very trap he created.

verses.latin: Convertetur dolor ejus in caput ejus, et in verticem ipsius iniquitas ejus descendet.
verses.english: His mischief will return upon his own head, and his violent iniquity will descend upon his own skull.

verses.latin: Confitebor Domino secundum justitiam ejus; et psallam nomini Domini altissimi.
verses.english: I will give thanks to the Lord according to His perfect justice, and I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.

verses.latin: In finem, pro torcularibus. Psalmus David. Domine, Dominus noster, quam admirabile est nomen tuum in universa terra! Quoniam elevata est magnificentia tua super caelos.
verses.english: This Psalm is for the chief musician, set to 'The Gittith', a psalm of David. O Lord, our Master, how wonderful is Your name across the entire earth! For Your majesty is lifted up beyond all the created skies and even the spiritual heavens.

verses.latin: Ex ore infantium et lactentium perfecisti laudem propter inimicos tuos, ut destruas inimicum et ultorem.
verses.english: From the mouths of babes and suckling infants, You have perfected praise to put Your enemies to shame, so that You might silence every enemy and avenger.

verses.latin: Quoniam videbo caelos tuos, opera digitorum tuorum, lunam et stellas quae tu fundasti.
verses.english: When I consider Your heavens—the work of Your fingers—the moon and the stars that You have set in place:

verses.latin: Quid est homo quod memor es ejus? Aut filius hominis quoniam visitas eum?
verses.english: What is humanity, that You are mindful of it? Or the children of men, that You look after them?

verses.latin: Minuisti eum paulo minus ab Angelis, gloria et honore coronasti eum:
verses.english: You have made humanity a little lower than the angels, and You have crowned them with glory and honor.

verses.latin: et constituisti eum super opera manuum tuarum.
verses.english: And You have given them dominion over the works of Your hands.

verses.latin: Omnia subjecisti sub pedibus ejus, oves et boves universas: insuper et pecora campi.
verses.english: You have put all things under their feet: all sheep and oxen, and also the animals of the field.

verses.latin: Volucres caeli et pisces maris, qui perambulant semitas maris.
verses.english: The birds of the air and the fish of the sea, who travel the pathways of the sea.

verses.latin: Domine, Dominus noster, quam admirabile est nomen tuum in universa terra!
verses.english: O Lord, our Master, how wonderful is Your name across the entire earth!

verses.latin: In finem, pro torcularibus. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the ultimate fulfillment, a song of the winepresses; A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Domine, Dominus noster, quam admirabile est nomen tuum in universa terra! Quoniam elevata est magnificentia tua super caelos.
verses.english: O Lord, our Lord, how wonderful and awe-inspiring is your name across the entire earth! For your magnificent glory is raised high above all the created skies and the universe.

verses.latin: Ex ore infantium et lactentium perfecisti laudem propter inimicos tuos, ut destruas inimicum et ultorem.
verses.english: From the mouths of infants and nursing babies, you have established strength as a perfect praise, designed to silence your enemies and destroy both the malevolent foe and the avenger.

verses.latin: Quoniam videbo caelos tuos, opera digitorum tuorum; lunam et stellas, quae tu fundasti.
verses.english: For when I observe your skies, the very work of your divine fingers, and behold the moon and the stars which you have securely founded and established,

verses.latin: Quid est homo, quod memor es ejus? aut filius hominis, quoniam visitas eum?
verses.english: What is humanity that you are so mindful of it? Or what is the son of man, that you would lovingly visit him?

verses.latin: Minuisti eum paulo minus ab angelis, gloria et honore coronasti eum.
verses.english: You have made him only a little lower than the angels, and you have crowned him with glory and honor.

verses.latin: Et constituisti eum super opera manuum tuarum; omnia subjecisti sub pedibus ejus:
verses.english: And you have set him in authority over the works of your hands; you have placed all things in submission under his feet:

verses.latin: oves et boves universas, insuper et pecora campi.
verses.english: All sheep and oxen, and also the wild beasts of the open field;

verses.latin: Volucres caeli, et pisces maris, qui perambulant semitas maris.
verses.english: The birds of the sky, and the fish of the sea, which traverse the watery pathways of the ocean.

verses.latin: Domine, Dominus noster, quam admirabile est nomen tuum in universa terra!
verses.english: O Lord, our Lord, how wonderful and awe-inspiring is your name across the entire earth!

verses.latin: In finem, pro occultis filii. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the ultimate fulfillment, concerning the hidden mysteries of the Son; A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, Domine, in toto corde meo; narrabo omnia mirabilia tua.
verses.english: I will give thanks to you, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will recount all your wondrous and miraculous deeds.

verses.latin: Laetabor et exsultabo in te; psallam nomini tuo, Altissime.
verses.english: I will rejoice and exult in your presence; I will sing praises to your holy name, O Most High God.

verses.latin: In convertendo inimicum meum retrorsum; infirmabuntur et peribunt a facie tua.
verses.english: When my enemies are turned back and retreat, they will stumble, become weak, and perish from before your very presence.

verses.latin: Quoniam fecisti judicium meum et causam meam; sedisti super thronum, qui judicas justitiam.
verses.english: For you have undertaken my judgment and pleaded my cause; you are seated upon your throne, you who judge with perfect justice.

verses.latin: Increpasti gentes, et periit impius; nomen eorum delesti in aeternum, et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: You have rebuked the Gentile nations, and the wicked one has utterly perished; their very name you have erased for all eternity and for every generation to come.

verses.latin: Inimici defecerunt frameae in finem, et civitates eorum destruxisti; periit memoria eorum cum sonitu.
verses.english: The swords of the enemies have failed, brought to an absolute end, and their cities you have utterly destroyed; their memory has perished with a loud, resounding crash of ruin.

verses.latin: Et Dominus in aeternum permanet; paravit in judicium thronum suum.
verses.english: But the Lord remains steadfast forever; He has established His throne ready for the final judgment.

verses.latin: Et ipse judicabit orbem terrae in aequitate; judicabit populos in justitia.
verses.english: And He himself will judge the entire world with perfect equity and fairness; He will judge all peoples with true justice.

verses.latin: Et factus est Dominus refugium pauperi; adjutor in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione.
verses.english: And the Lord has become a secure refuge for the poor; a timely helper in moments of urgent need, and a strong support in tribulation.

verses.latin: Et sperent in te qui noverunt nomen tuum, quoniam non dereliquisti quaerentes te, Domine.
verses.english: And let all those who truly know your name place their hope and trust in you, for you have never forsaken those who earnestly seek you, O Lord.

verses.latin: Psallite Domino, qui habitat in Sion; annuntiate inter gentes studia ejus.
verses.english: Sing praises to the Lord, who dwells in the holy city of Zion; declare His mighty deeds and purposes among all the Gentile nations.

verses.latin: Quoniam requirens sanguinem eorum recordatus est; non est oblitus clamorem pauperum.
verses.english: For He, who seeks justice for their shed blood, has remembered the wronged; He has not forgotten the piteous cry of the poor and afflicted.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine; vide humilitatem meam de inimicis meis, qui exaltas me de portis mortis,
verses.english: Have mercy on me, O Lord; see my humble affliction caused by my enemies, you who lift me up from the very gates of death,

verses.latin: ut annuntiem omnes laudationes tuas in portis filiae Sion.
verses.english: So that I may proclaim all your praises publicly within the gates of the daughter of Zion, Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Exsultabo in salutari tuo; infixae sunt gentes in fovea quam fecerunt.
verses.english: I will exult in your saving power; the Gentile nations have become stuck fast in the very pit which they themselves dug.

verses.latin: In laqueo isto quem absconderunt comprehensus est pes eorum.
verses.english: In that very snare which they cunningly hid, their own foot has been caught.

verses.latin: Cognoscetur Dominus judicia faciens; in operibus manuum suarum comprehensus est peccator.
verses.english: The Lord will be known and recognized by the judgments He executes; the sinner is caught and entrapped by the works of his own hands.

verses.latin: Convertantur peccatores in infernum, omnes gentes quae obliviscuntur Deum.
verses.english: Let all sinners be turned towards the grave and the underworld, all the Gentile nations that forget God and His ways.

verses.latin: Quoniam non in finem oblivio erit pauperis; patientia pauperum non peribit in finem.
verses.english: For the poor will not be forgotten permanently; the patient expectation and hope of the afflicted will not perish and will not be lost forever.

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine; non confortetur homo; judicentur gentes in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord; do not let humanity prevail by its own strength; let the Gentile nations be judged in your just sight.

verses.latin: Constitue, Domine, legislatorem super eos, ut sciant gentes quoniam homines sunt.
verses.english: Appoint, O Lord, a lawgiver or a terror over them, so that the Gentile nations may truly know that they are merely mortal men and not gods.

verses.latin: Ut quid, Domine, recessisti longe, despicis in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione?
verses.english: Why, O Lord, have you withdrawn so far away? Why do you seem to ignore or hide yourself in times of opportune need, especially during tribulation?

verses.latin: Dum superbit impius, incenditur pauper; comprehenduntur in consiliis quae cogitant.
verses.english: While the wicked person proudly exalts himself, the poor and righteous are inflamed with suffering; they are ensnared by the very schemes which the wicked devise.

verses.latin: Quoniam laudatur peccator in desideriis animae suae, et iniquus benedicitur.
verses.english: For the sinner is praised for the desires of his own soul, and the iniquitous one is seemingly blessed and favored.

verses.latin: Exacerbavit Dominum peccator; secundum multitudinem irae suae non quaeret.
verses.english: The sinner has greatly provoked the Lord; in his abundant pride and wrath, he will not seek out God.

verses.latin: Non est Deus in conspectu ejus; inquinatae sunt viae illius in omni tempore.
verses.english: God is not in his thoughts or before his eyes; his ways are corrupted and defiled at every moment.

verses.latin: Auferuntur judicia tua a facie ejus; omnium inimicorum suorum dominabitur.
verses.english: Your divine judgments are far removed from his consideration, and he boasts that he will surely dominate all his enemies.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Non movebor a generatione in generationem, sine malo.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'I will not be shaken for generations to come, and no evil will ever befall me.'

verses.latin: Cujus maledictione os plenum est, et amaritudine, et dolo; sub lingua ejus labor et dolor.
verses.english: His mouth is full of curses, bitterness, and deceit; beneath his tongue lie trouble and the pain of malice.

verses.latin: In finem. Pro occultis filii. Psalmus David. Confitebor tibi, Domine, in toto corde meo; narrabo omnia mirabilia tua.
verses.english: To the chief musician, regarding the death of the son (or concerning hidden things of the son). A Psalm of David. I will praise you, Lord, with my whole heart; I will recount all your wondrous deeds.

verses.latin: Lætabor et exultabo in te; psallam nomini tuo, Altissime.
verses.english: I will rejoice and exult in you; I will sing praises to your Name, O Most High.

verses.latin: In convertendo inimicum meum retrorsum, infirmabuntur, et peribunt a facie tua.
verses.english: When my enemies turn back in retreat, they will weaken and perish from your presence.

verses.latin: Quoniam fecisti judicium meum et causam meam; sedisti super thronum, qui judicas justitiam.
verses.english: For you have executed my judgment and defended my cause; you have sat upon your throne, judging justly and with righteousness.

verses.latin: Increpasti gentes, et peristi impium: nomen eorum delesti in æternum, et in sæculum sæculi.
verses.english: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you have blotted out their name forever and for all ages.

verses.latin: Inimici defecerunt frameæ in finem, et civitates eorum destruxisti. Periit memoria eorum cum sonitu.
verses.english: The swords and threats of the enemy have come to an end; you have destroyed their cities. Their very memory has perished with a loud crash.

verses.latin: Et Dominus in æternum permanet; paravit in judicium thronum suum.
verses.english: And the Lord remains forever; He has prepared His throne for judgment.

verses.latin: Et ipse judicabit orbem terræ in æquitate; judicabit populos in justitia.
verses.english: And He Himself will judge the whole earth with equity; He will judge the peoples with justice.

verses.latin: Et factus est Dominus refugium pauperi, adjutor in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione.
verses.english: And the Lord has become a refuge for the poor, a helper in times of need, in affliction.

verses.latin: Et sperent in te qui noverunt nomen tuum, quoniam non dereliquisti quærentes te, Domine.
verses.english: And may those who know your Name—who know your character and power—hope in you, for you have not forsaken those who seek you, Lord.

verses.latin: Psallite Domino qui habitat in Sion; annuntiate inter gentes studia ejus:
verses.english: Sing praises to the Lord who dwells in Zion; proclaim His deeds among the nations.

verses.latin: Quoniam requirens sanguinem eorum recordatus est, non est oblitus clamorem pauperum.
verses.english: For seeking justice for their blood, He has remembered; He has not forgotten the cry of the oppressed.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine: vide humilitatem meam de inimicis meis, qui exaltas me de portis mortis,
verses.english: Have mercy on me, Lord; see my lowliness from my enemies, You who lift me up from the gates of death—from the power of the grave itself,

verses.latin: Ut annuntiem omnes laudationes tuas in portis filiæ Sion. Exultabo in salutari tuo.
verses.english: So that I may declare all your praises in the gates of the daughter of Zion. I will exult in your salvation.

verses.latin: Infixæ sunt gentes in interitu quem fecerunt; in laqueo isto quem absconderunt comprehensus est pes eorum.
verses.english: The nations are trapped in the destruction they made for others; their foot is caught in the very snare they hid.

verses.latin: Cognoscetur Dominus judicia faciens; in operibus manuum suarum comprehensus est peccator. Canticum. Diapsalma.
verses.english: The Lord is known by the judgments He executes; the sinner is caught by the works of his own hands. A song. (A musical interlude.)

verses.latin: Convertantur peccatores in infernum, omnes gentes quæ obliviscuntur Deum.
verses.english: May sinners be turned into the realm of the dead—all nations that forget God.

verses.latin: Quoniam non in finem oblivio erit pauperis; patientia pauperum non peribit in finem.
verses.english: For the poor will not be forgotten forever; the patience of the oppressed will not perish eternally.

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine, non confortetur homo; judicentur gentes in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: Arise, Lord, let no human be strengthened against You; let the nations be judged in your sight.

verses.latin: Constitue, Domine, legislatorem super eos, ut sciant gentes quoniam homines sunt. Diapsalma.
verses.english: Appoint, Lord, a lawgiver over them, so that the nations may know that they are but men. (A musical interlude.)

verses.latin: Ut quid, Domine, recessisti longe; despicis in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione?
verses.english: Why, Lord, have you withdrawn so far away? Why do you hide yourself in times of need, in affliction?

verses.latin: Dum superbit impius, incenditur pauper: comprehenduntur in consiliis quibus cogitant.
verses.english: While the wicked person acts proudly, the poor are set ablaze by his actions; they are caught in the very schemes the wicked devise.

verses.latin: Quoniam laudatur peccator in desideriis animæ suæ, et iniquus benedicitur.
verses.english: For the sinner is praised for the desires of his own soul, and the unrighteous is blessed by others for his evil ways.

verses.latin: Exacerbavit Dominum peccator: secundum multitudinem iræ suæ non quæret.
verses.english: The sinner has provoked the Lord; in the arrogance of his anger, he will not seek God.

verses.latin: Non est Deus in conspectu ejus: inquinatæ sunt viæ illius in omni tempore. Auferuntur judicia tua a facie ejus: omnium inimicorum suorum dominabitur.
verses.english: There is no God in his sight, so he acts as if God doesn't exist; his ways are defiled at all times. Your judgments are far from his mind; he will lord it over all his enemies.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Non movebor a generatione in generationem, sine malo.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'I will not be moved from generation to generation; no misfortune will touch me.'

verses.latin: Cujus maledictione os plenum est, et amaritudine, et dolo; sub lingua ejus labor et iniquitas.
verses.english: His mouth is full of cursing, and bitterness, and deceit; under his tongue are mischief and iniquity.

verses.latin: Sedet in insidiis cum divitibus in occultis, ut interficiat innocentem. Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt.
verses.english: He sits in ambush with the rich in hidden places, so that he may kill the innocent. His eyes watch for the poor.

verses.latin: Insidiatur in abscondito, quasi leo in spelunca sua; insidiatur ut rapiat pauperem: rapere pauperem, dum attrahit eum.
verses.english: He lies in wait secretly, like a lion in his den; he lies in wait to seize the poor: to seize the poor when he draws him in.

verses.latin: In laqueo suo humiliabit eum; corruet in illo, cum invaluera pauperum.
verses.english: In his snare, he will bring him low; the poor man will fall into it, when the wicked's strength against the poor increases.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Oblitus est Deus, avertit faciem suam, ne videat in finem.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'God has forgotten, He has turned away His face, so that He will not see until the end.'

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine Deus, exaltetur manus tua: ne obliviscaris pauperum.
verses.english: Arise, Lord God, let your hand be exalted: do not forget the oppressed.

verses.latin: Propter quid exacerbavit impius Deum? Dixit enim in corde suo: Non requiret.
verses.english: Why has the wicked person provoked God? For he has said in his heart: 'He will not seek vengeance for my actions.'

verses.latin: Vides, quoniam tu laborem et dolorem consideras, ut tradas eos in manus tuas. Tibi derelictus est pauper; orphano tu es adjutor.
verses.english: You see, for you consider trouble and sorrow, that you may deliver them into your hands. To you the poor is left; you are the helper of the orphan.

verses.latin: Contere brachium peccatoris et maligni: quæretur peccatum illius, et non invenietur.
verses.english: Break the arm of the sinner and the malicious one: his sin will be sought out, but none will be found for him to commit.

verses.latin: Dominus regnabit in æternum et in sæculum sæculi: peribitis, gentes, de terra illius.
verses.english: The Lord will reign forever and for all ages; you, nations, will perish from His land.

verses.latin: Desiderium pauperum exaudivit Dominus; præparationem cordis eorum audivit auris tua:
verses.english: The Lord has heard the desire of the oppressed; your ear has heard the preparation of their heart as they prayed.

verses.latin: Judicare pupillo et humili, ut non apponat ultra magnificare se homo super terram.
verses.english: To judge for the orphan and the humble, so that man may no longer presume to exalt himself upon the earth.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David. In Domino confido: quomodo dicitis animæ meæ: Transmigra in montem sicut passer?
verses.english: To the chief musician. A Psalm of David. In the Lord I take refuge: how can you say to my soul: 'Flee to the mountain like a sparrow?'

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce peccatores intenderunt arcum, paraverunt sagittas suas in pharetra, ut sagittent in obscura lunæ rectos corde.
verses.english: For behold, sinners have bent their bow, they have prepared their arrows in their quiver, so that they may shoot the upright in heart in the darkness of the moon—in secret.

verses.latin: In finem, pro occultis filii. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the director of the choir, for the hidden mysteries of the Son. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, Domine, in toto corde meo; narrabo omnia mirabilia tua.
verses.english: I will give You praise, O Lord, with all my heart; I will recount all Your wonderful works.

verses.latin: Lætabor et exsultabo in te; psallam nomini tuo, Altissime.
verses.english: I will rejoice and be filled with gladness in You; I will sing praises to Your name, O Most High.

verses.latin: In convertendo inimicum meum retrorsum, infirmabuntur et peribunt a facie tua.
verses.english: When my enemy turns back, they will stumble and perish from Your presence.

verses.latin: Quoniam fecisti judicium meum et causam meam; sedisti super thronum, qui judicas justitiam.
verses.english: Because You have upheld my right and my cause; You are seated on Your throne, judging all things with perfect justice.

verses.latin: Increpasti gentes, et periit impius: nomen eorum delesti in æternum et in sæculum sæculi.
verses.english: You have rebuked the nations, and the wicked have perished; You have blotted out their name forever and for all ages of ages.

verses.latin: Inimici defecerunt frameæ in finem, et civitates eorum destruxisti: periit memoria eorum cum sonitu.
verses.english: The swords of the enemy have come to their end, and You have utterly destroyed their cities; their memory has perished with a loud crash.

verses.latin: Et Dominus in æternum permanet; paravit in judicium thronum suum.
verses.english: But the Lord remains enthroned forever; He has prepared His throne for judgment.

verses.latin: Et ipse judicabit orbem terræ in æquitate, judicabit populos in justitia.
verses.english: And He Himself will judge the whole earth with equity, He will judge the peoples with perfect justice.

verses.latin: Et factus est Dominus refugium pauperi, adjutor in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione.
verses.english: The Lord has become a refuge for the poor, a helper in times of need, in all tribulation.

verses.latin: Et sperent in te qui noverunt nomen tuum, quoniam non dereliquisti quærentes te, Domine.
verses.english: And let those who know Your name hope in You, for You have not abandoned those who seek You, O Lord.

verses.latin: Psallite Domino, qui habitat in Sion; annuntiate inter gentes studia ejus.
verses.english: Sing praises to the Lord, who dwells in Sion; proclaim His deeds among the nations.

verses.latin: Quoniam requirens sanguinem eorum recordatus est; non est oblitus clamorem pauperum.
verses.english: For He who seeks vengeance for their blood has remembered them; He has not forgotten the cry of the poor.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine: vide humilitatem meam de inimicis meis,
verses.english: Have mercy on me, O Lord: see my affliction from my enemies,

verses.latin: qui exaltas me de portis mortis,
verses.english: You who lift me up from the gates of death,

verses.latin: ut annuntiem omnes laudationes tuas in portis filiæ Sion.
verses.english: so that I may proclaim all Your praises within the gates of the Daughter of Sion.

verses.latin: Exsultabo in salutari tuo.
verses.english: I will rejoice greatly in Your salvation.

verses.latin: Infixæ sunt gentes in interitu quem fecerunt; in laqueo isto quem absconderunt comprehensus est pes eorum.
verses.english: The nations have sunk into the destruction they themselves made; their foot has been caught in the snare they had hidden.

verses.latin: Cognoscitur Dominus judicia faciens; in operibus manuum suarum comprehensus est peccator.
verses.english: The Lord is known by the judgments He executes; the sinner is caught in the works of his own hands.

verses.latin: Convertantur peccatores in infernum, omnes gentes quæ obliviscuntur Deum.
verses.english: Let sinners turn back to hell—to the place of the dead—all the nations that forget God.

verses.latin: Quoniam non in finem oblivio erit pauperis; patientia pauperum non peribit in finem.
verses.english: For the poor will not be forgotten forever; the patience of the poor will not perish for all time.

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine; non confortetur homo: judicentur gentes in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord; let not man prevail: let the nations be judged in Your sight.

verses.latin: Constitue, Domine, legislatorem super eos, ut sciant gentes quoniam homines sunt.
verses.english: Appoint, O Lord, a lawgiver over them, so that the nations may know that they are merely men.

verses.latin: Ut quid, Domine, recessisti longe, despicis in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione?
verses.english: Why, O Lord, have You withdrawn afar? Why do You disregard us in our times of need, in tribulation?

verses.latin: Dum superbit impius, incenditur pauper; comprehenduntur in consiliis quibus cogitant.
verses.english: While the wicked man boasts, the poor are set on fire; they are caught in the very schemes they devise.

verses.latin: Quoniam laudatur peccator in desideriis animæ suæ, et iniquus benedicitur.
verses.english: For the sinner is praised for the desires of his own soul, and the wicked man blesses himself.

verses.latin: Exacerbavit Dominum peccator; secundum multitudinem iræ suæ non quæret.
verses.english: The sinner has provoked the Lord; in the multitude of his wrath, he will not seek God.

verses.latin: Non est Deus in conspectu ejus; inquinatæ sunt viæ illius in omni tempore.
verses.english: God is not in his sight; his ways are defiled at all times.

verses.latin: Auferuntur judicia tua a facie ejus; omnium inimicorum suorum dominabitur.
verses.english: Your judgments are far removed from his sight; he will lord it over all his enemies.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Non movebor a generatione in generationem, sine malo.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'I will not be moved from generation to generation, I will suffer no evil.'

verses.latin: Cujus maledictione os plenum est, et amaritudine, et dolo; sub lingua ejus labor et dolor.
verses.english: His mouth is full of cursing, and bitterness, and deceit; under his tongue are mischief and pain.

verses.latin: Sedet in insidiis cum divitibus in occultis, ut interficiat innocentem.
verses.english: He sits in ambush with the rich in hidden places, so that he may kill the innocent.

verses.latin: Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt; insidiatur in abscondito, quasi leo in spelunca sua.
verses.english: His eyes watch for the poor; he lies in wait in secret, like a lion in its den.

verses.latin: Insidiatur ut rapiat pauperem; rapere pauperem, dum attrahit eum.
verses.english: He lies in wait to seize the poor; he seizes the poor while he draws them in.

verses.latin: In laqueo suo humiliabit eum; curvabit se, et cadet cum dominatus fuerit pauperum.
verses.english: He will humble him with his snare; he will bow down, and fall when he has gained mastery over the poor.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Oblitus est Deus; avertit faciem suam, ne videat in finem.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'God has forgotten; He has turned away His face, so that He may not see for all time.'

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine Deus, exaltetur manus tua; ne obliviscaris pauperum.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord God, let Your hand be lifted high; do not forget the poor.

verses.latin: Propter quid exacerbavit impius Deum? Dixit enim in corde suo: Non requiret.
verses.english: Why has the wicked man provoked God? For he has said in his heart: 'He will not investigate.'

verses.latin: Vides, quoniam tu laborem et dolorem consideras, ut tradas eos in manus tuas.
verses.english: You see, for You consider toil and sorrow, so that You may deliver them into Your hands.

verses.latin: Tibi derelictus est pauper; orphano tu es adjutor.
verses.english: To You the poor man is abandoned; You are the helper of the orphan.

verses.latin: Usquequo Domine recessisti longe, despicis in opportunitatibus, in tribulatione?
verses.english: How long, O Lord, have You withdrawn from us, standing far off and looking down upon us during times of need and tribulation?

verses.latin: Dum superbit impius, incenditur pauper: comprehenduntur in consiliis quibus cogitant.
verses.english: When the wicked act with pride, the poor are set aflame with suffering. The poor are trapped by the very plans the wicked devise against them.

verses.latin: Quoniam laudatur peccator in desideriis animae suae: et iniquus benedicitur.
verses.english: For the sinner is praised by others because of the desires of his own soul, and the unrighteous person is seen by many as blessed.

verses.latin: Exacerbavit Dominum peccator, secundum multitudinem irae suae non quaeret:
verses.english: The sinner has provoked the Lord; in the greatness of his pride and anger, he does not seek God's presence or judgment.

verses.latin: Non est Deus in conspectu ejus: inquinatae sunt viae illius in omni tempore. Auferuntur judicia tua a facie ejus: omnium inimicorum suorum dominabitur.
verses.english: God is not in his thoughts. His ways are corrupt at all times. Your judgments, O God, are too high for him to see, and he believes he will dominate all his enemies.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Non movebor a generatione in generationem, sine malo.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'I will never be shaken from my position, from generation to generation, and no harm will ever come to me.'

verses.latin: Cujus maledictione os plenum est, et amaritudine, et dolo: sub lingua ejus labor et iniquitas.
verses.english: His mouth is full of cursing, bitterness, and deceit. Under his tongue are both trouble and iniquity.

verses.latin: Sedet in insidiis cum divitibus in occultis, ut interficiat innocentem.
verses.english: He sits in ambush, hidden with other powerful and rich men, to murder the innocent.

verses.latin: Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt: insidiatur in abscondito quasi leo in spelunca sua. Insidiatur ut rapiat pauperem: rapere pauperem, dum attrahit eum.
verses.english: His eyes watch the poor. He lies in wait in secret, like a lion in its den. He lies in wait to seize the poor; he seizes the poor by dragging him into his trap.

verses.latin: In laqueo suo humiliabit eum: incurvabitur, et cadet, cum dominatus fuerit pauperum.
verses.english: With his snare, he humiliates the poor. The poor man is bowed down and falls when the wicked man has gained mastery over him.

verses.latin: Dixit enim in corde suo: Oblitus est Deus, avertit faciem suam ne videat in finem.
verses.english: For he has said in his heart: 'God has forgotten. He has turned away His face so that He will never see anything.'

verses.latin: Exsurge, Domine Deus, exaltetur manus tua: ne obliviscaris pauperum.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord God! Let Your hand be lifted high in power. Do not forget the suffering poor.

verses.latin: Propter quid irritavit impius Deum? dixit enim in corde suo: Non requiret.
verses.english: Why has the wicked man provoked God? For he has said in his heart: 'God will not seek or investigate these things.'

verses.latin: Vides, quoniam tu laborem et dolorem consideras, ut tradas eos in manus tuas. Tibi derelictus est pauper: orphano tu eris adjutor.
verses.english: You see it all, for You consider the trouble and sorrow of the poor, so that You may take them into Your hands. The poor man is left to Your care; You will be the helper for the orphan.

verses.latin: Contere brachium peccatoris et maligni: quaeretur peccatum illius, et non invenietur.
verses.english: Break the power of the wicked and malicious sinner. His sin will be sought out, but it will not be found; it will be utterly removed.

verses.latin: Dominus regnabit in aeternum, et in saeculum saeculi: peribitis gentes de terra illius.
verses.english: The Lord will reign forever, throughout all ages. The nations that oppose Him will perish from His land.

verses.latin: Desiderium pauperum exaudivit Dominus: praeparationem cordis eorum audivit auris tua;
verses.english: The Lord has heard the desire of the poor. Your ear has listened to the preparation of their heart, the intentions of their prayers.

verses.latin: Judicare pupillo et humili, ut non apponat ultra magnificare se homo super terram.
verses.english: You will judge on behalf of the orphan and the humble, so that man will no longer presume to exalt himself on the earth.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the Consummation: A Psalm of David. (Commentary: "In finem" signifies the ultimate purpose or fulfillment, often understood eschatologically in Christian tradition, pointing to Christ.)

verses.latin: In Domino confido: quomodo dicitis animae meae: Transmigra in montem sicut passer?
verses.english: I take my refuge in the Lord. How can you say to my soul: "Flee to the mountain like a small bird?"

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce peccatores intenderunt arcum, paraverunt sagittas suas in pharetra, ut sagittent in obscura luna rectos corde.
verses.english: For behold, the wicked have drawn their bows; they have made ready their arrows in their quivers, to shoot under cover of darkness at the upright in heart.

verses.latin: Quoniam quae perfecisti, destruxerunt: justus autem quid fecit?
verses.english: For what You, O Lord, have established, they have torn down. But what can the righteous do in such times?

verses.latin: Dominus in templo sancto suo, Dominus in caelo sedes ejus. Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt, palpebrae ejus interrogant filios hominum.
verses.english: The Lord is in His holy temple; the Lord's throne is in the heavens above, where He reigns. His eyes look upon the afflicted; His gaze examines the children of men.

verses.latin: Dominus interrogat justum et impium: qui autem diligit iniquitatem, odit animam suam.
verses.english: The Lord examines the righteous and the wicked. But he who loves wickedness hates his own soul, bringing destruction upon himself.

verses.latin: Pluet super peccatores laqueos: ignis et sulphur, et spiritus procellarum pars calicis eorum.
verses.english: He will rain down snares upon the wicked. Fire and brimstone, and a tempestuous wind, are the portion of their cup—their decreed fate.

verses.latin: Quoniam justus Dominus, et justitias dilexit: aequitatem vidit vultus ejus.
verses.english: For the Lord is righteous, and He loves acts of righteousness. His countenance beholds uprightness and justice.

verses.latin: In finem. Pro octava. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the Consummation. For the Eighth String (a musical instruction): A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Salvum me fac, Domine, quoniam defecit sanctus, quoniam diminutae sunt veritates a filiis hominum.
verses.english: Save me, O Lord, for the holy person has vanished. Truths have diminished among the children of men.

verses.latin: Vana locuti sunt unusquisque ad proximum suum: labia dolosa in corde et corde locuti sunt.
verses.english: They have spoken falsehoods, each one to his neighbor. They have spoken with deceptive lips and a divided heart, meaning they say one thing and believe another.

verses.latin: Dispersionem labiorum, et linguam magnificam, faciet Dominus.
verses.english: The Lord will bring to an end the scattered words and the boastful tongue.

verses.latin: Omnes labia dolosa, et linguam magniloquam.
verses.english: All who speak with deceitful lips and a boastful tongue will be silenced.

verses.latin: Cum his qui dixerunt: Linguam nostram magnificabimus; labia nostra a nobis sunt: quis noster dominus est?
verses.english: He will deal with those who have said: "We will make our tongue great. Our lips are our own power. Who is our master?"

verses.latin: Propter miseriam inopum, et gemitum pauperum, nunc exsurgam, dicit Dominus. Ponam in salutari: fiducialiter agam in eo.
verses.english: Because of the misery of the needy and the groaning of the poor, "Now I will arise," says the Lord. "I will place him in safety; I will act with certainty for him."

verses.latin: Eloquia Domini, eloquia casta: argentum igne examinatum, terrae purgatum septuplum.
verses.english: The words of the Lord are pure words. They are like silver tested by fire, purified seven times in the crucible of the earth, meaning they are utterly flawless.

verses.latin: Tu, Domine, servabis nos, et custodies nos a generatione hac in aeternum.
verses.english: You, O Lord, will preserve us and keep us safe from this evil generation forever.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the Consummation: A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Usquequo, Domine, oblivisceris me in finem? usquequo avertis faciem tuam a me?
verses.english: How long, O Lord, will You forget me completely? How long will You turn Your face away from me?

verses.latin: Quamdiu ponam consilia in anima mea, dolorem in corde meo per diem?
verses.english: How long must I harbor anxieties in my soul, and sorrow in my heart day after day?

verses.latin: Usquequo exaltabitur inimicus meus super me?
verses.english: How long will my enemy be exalted over me?

verses.latin: Respice, et exaudi me, Domine Deus meus. Illumina oculos meos, ne unquam obdormiam in morte:
verses.english: Look upon me and hear me, O Lord my God. Enlighten my eyes with Your truth, lest I ever fall asleep in the sleep of death, losing hope and faith.

verses.latin: nequando dicat inimicus meus: Praevalui adversus eum. Qui tribulant me exsultabunt, si motus fuero.
verses.english: Let my enemy never say, "I have prevailed against him." Let those who trouble me not rejoice if I am moved from my faith.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the Consummation: A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus. Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in studiis suis: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They have become corrupt and abominable in their pursuits. There is no one who does good, not even one person.

verses.latin: Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum, ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: The Lord looked down from the heavens upon the children of men to see if there was anyone who understood, or anyone who sought God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum. Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant, venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum. Os eorum maledictione et amaritudine plenum est: veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem. Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt: non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.
verses.english: All have turned away; together they have become useless. There is no one who does good, not even one. Their throat is like an open tomb, their tongues practice deceit. The venom of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness. Their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and misery are in their ways, and they have not known the path of peace. There is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.latin: Nonne cognoscent omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam sicut escam panis?
verses.english: Will they not come to know, all those who work wickedness, who devour My people as if they were bread to be eaten?

verses.latin: Deum non invocaverunt: illic trepidaverunt timore, ubi non erat timor.
verses.english: They have not called upon God. There, they trembled with fear where no fear truly existed.

verses.latin: Quoniam Dominus in generatione justa est: consilium inopis confudistis, quoniam Dominus protector ejus est.
verses.english: For the Lord is with the righteous generation. You have confounded the plan of the poor, because the Lord is his protector.

verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Dominus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israel.
verses.english: Who will grant salvation to Israel from Sion? When the Lord reverses the captivity of His people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Domine, quis habitabit in tabernaculo tuo? aut quis requiescet in monte sancto tuo?
verses.english: A Psalm of David. O Lord, who will dwell in Your tabernacle? Or who will rest on Your holy mountain?

verses.latin: Qui ingreditur sine macula, et operatur justitiam:
verses.english: He who walks without blemish, and practices righteousness;

verses.latin: qui loquitur veritatem in corde suo, qui non egit dolum in lingua sua, nec fecit proximo suo malum, et opprobrium non accepit adversus proximos suos.
verses.english: he who speaks truth in his heart, who has not practiced deceit with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor, nor taken up a reproach against his neighbors;

verses.latin: Ad nihilum deductus est malignus in conspectu ejus; timentes autem Dominum glorificat: qui jurat proximo suo, et non decipit;
verses.english: the wicked person is brought to nothing in his sight, but he glorifies those who fear the Lord. He who swears to his neighbor and does not deceive him;

verses.latin: qui pecuniam suam non dedit ad usuram, et munera super innocentem non accepit. Qui facit haec, non movebitur in aeternum.
verses.english: he who has not lent his money at interest, and has not accepted bribes against the innocent. He who does these things will not be moved from his righteous state forever.

verses.latin: Tituli inscriptio ipsi David. Conserva me, Domine, quoniam in te speravi.
verses.english: An inscription of a title belonging to David. Preserve me, O Lord, for in You I have placed my hope and trust.

verses.latin: Dixi Domino: Deus meus es tu, quoniam bonorum meorum non eges.
verses.english: I said to the Lord: "You are my God, for You have no need of my good deeds or possessions."

verses.latin: Sanctis qui sunt in terra ejus, mirificavit omnes voluntates meas in illis.
verses.english: For the saints who are on His earth, He has made all my desires wonderful in them, fulfilling His will through them.

verses.latin: Multiplicatae sunt infirmitates eorum: post haec acceleraverunt. Non congregabo conventicula eorum de sanguinibus, nec memor ero nominum eorum per labia mea.
verses.english: The infirmities of those who worship other gods have multiplied; after this, they hastened to their ruin. I will not gather their assemblies of bloody sacrifices, nor will I remember their names with my lips.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David. In Domino confido: quomodo dicitis animae meae: Transmigra in montem sicut passer?
verses.english: This Psalm is for the End Times. A Psalm of David. I place my complete trust in the Lord. How can you say to my very soul: 'You must flee to the mountains, like a bird escaping a trap?'

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce peccatores intenderunt arcum, paraverunt sagittas suas in pharetra, ut sagittent in obscuro rectos corde.
verses.english: For, just look at this: the wicked have strung their bows and are aiming. They have their arrows ready in their quivers. Their goal is to shoot, from the cover of darkness, those who are righteous in heart.

verses.latin: Quoniam quae perfecisti, destruxerunt: justus autem quid fecit?
verses.english: Because they have torn down everything good that You, O Lord, have established and perfected. When such things are destroyed, what good can the righteous do?

verses.latin: Dominus in templo sancto suo, Dominus in caelo sedes ejus. Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt, palpebrae ejus interrogant filios hominum.
verses.english: The Lord resides in His holy temple. The Lord has His throne in the universe. His eyes are observing the humble and the suffering, and His gaze carefully scrutinizes all humanity.

verses.latin: Dominus interrogat justum et impium: qui autem diligit iniquitatem, odit animam suam.
verses.english: The Lord thoroughly investigates both the righteous and the wicked. But anyone who loves evil hates his own soul, condemning himself.

verses.latin: Pluet super peccatores laqueos, ignis et sulphur et spiritus procellarum pars calicis eorum.
verses.english: He will rain down snares upon the wicked: fire, burning sulfur, and the consuming winds of a tempest. This will be the cup of judgment they must drink.

verses.latin: Quoniam justus Dominus et justitias dilexit: aequitatem vidit vultus ejus.
verses.english: Because the Lord is righteous, and He loves acts of justice and righteousness. His very face beholds and favors all that is equitable and right.

verses.latin: In Domino confido; quomodo dicitis animae meae: Transmigra in montem sicut passer?
verses.english: In the Lord I trust. How do you say to my very self: "Flee to the mountains like a sparrow?"

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce peccatores intenderunt arcum, paraverunt sagittas suas in pharetra, ut sagittent in obscuro rectos corde.
verses.english: For behold, the wicked have aimed their bows; they have prepared their arrows in their quivers, so that in the darkness they may shoot at those who are upright in heart.

verses.latin: Quoniam quae perfecisti, destruxerunt; justus autem quid fecit?
verses.english: For the moral order you established, they have destroyed. But the righteous man, what has he done in response?

verses.latin: Dominus in templo sancto suo; Dominus in caelo sedes ejus.
verses.english: The Lord is in His holy temple; the Lord’s throne is in His celestial dwelling.

verses.latin: Oculi ejus in pauperem respiciunt; palpebrae ejus interrogant filios hominum.
verses.english: His eyes look upon the poor; His eyelids scrutinize the children of men.

verses.latin: Dominus interrogat justum et impium; qui autem diligit iniquitatem, odit anima sua.
verses.english: The Lord examines both the righteous and the wicked; but His very being detests him who loves injustice.
