verses.latin: Pluet super peccatores laqueos, ignem et sulphur, et spiritum procellarum, pars calicis eorum.
verses.english: He will rain down snares, fire, and brimstone upon sinners; and a scorching wind will be the portion of their cup.

verses.latin: Quoniam justus Dominus et justitias dilexit; aequitatem vidit vultus ejus.
verses.english: For the Lord is righteous and loves acts of righteousness; His very presence beholds integrity.

verses.latin: In finem, Psalmus David.
verses.english: This Psalm is for the ultimate fulfillment—a Psalm by David.

verses.latin: Usquequo, Domine, oblivisceris me in finem? usquequo avertis faciem tuam a me?
verses.english: How long, O Lord? Will you forget me completely, forever? How long will you turn your face away from me?

verses.latin: Usquequo ponam consilia in anima mea, dolorem in corde meo per diem?
verses.english: How long must I bear worries in my soul and carry sorrow in my heart all day long?

verses.latin: Usquequo exaltabitur inimicus meus super me?
verses.english: How long will my enemy triumph over me?

verses.latin: Respice, et exaudi me, Domine Deus meus. Illumini oculos meos, ne unquam obdormiam in morte:
verses.english: Look on me and hear me, O Lord my God. Enlighten my eyes, lest I ever sleep the sleep of death:

verses.latin: Nequando dicat inimicus meus: Praevalui adversus eum. Qui tribulant me exsultabunt, si motus fuero:
verses.english: Lest my enemy ever say, 'I have overcome him.' Those who trouble me will rejoice if I am shaken.

verses.latin: Ego autem in misericordia tua speravi. Exsultabit cor meum in salutari tuo: cantabo Domino, qui bona tribuit mihi:
verses.english: But I have hoped in your mercy. My heart will rejoice in your salvation. I will sing to the Lord, who grants good things to me:

verses.latin: et psallam nomini Domini altissimi.
verses.english: And I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.

verses.latin: In finem. Pro octava. Psalmus David.
verses.english: A Psalm of David, for the ultimate purpose [of salvation], to be sung to the accompaniment of an eight-stringed instrument.

verses.latin: Salvum me fac, Domine, quoniam defecit sanctus, quoniam diminutae sunt veritates a filiis hominum.
verses.english: Save me, Lord, because the holy have grown few. Because true teachings have been diminished among all people.

verses.latin: Vana locuti sunt unusquisque ad proximum suum: labia dolosa in corde et corde locuti sunt.
verses.english: They have spoken empty words, each one to their neighbor. With flattering lips and a deceitful heart, they spoke.

verses.latin: Disperdat Dominus universa labia dolosa et linguam magniloquam.
verses.english: May the Lord destroy all deceitful lips and every boastful tongue.

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Labia nostra magnificabimus; lingua nostra a nobis est: quis noster dominus est?
verses.english: Those who say: 'We will make our mouths sound great! Our tongue is ours alone! Who is our master?'

verses.latin: Propter miseriah inopum et gemitum pauperum, nunc exsurgam, dicit Dominus. Ponam in salutari: fiducialiter agam in eo.
verses.english: Because of the misery of the needy and the groaning of the poor, now I will arise, says the Lord. I will place them in salvation. I will act confidently in it.

verses.latin: Eloquia Domini, eloquia casta; argentum igne examinatum, terre purgatum septuplum.
verses.english: The words of the Lord are pure words, like silver tested by fire, purged of impurities from the earth seven times over.

verses.latin: Tu, Domine, servabis nos, et custodies nos a generatione hac in aeternum.
verses.english: You, Lord, will preserve us, and You will guard us from this generation forever.

verses.latin: Usquequo, Domine, oblivisceris me in finem? Usquequo avertis faciem tuam a me?
verses.english: How long, Lord? Will You forget me forever? How long will You turn Your face away from me?

verses.latin: Quamdiu ponam consilia in anima mea, dolorem in corde meo per diem?
verses.english: How long must I put thoughts in my soul, and sorrow in my heart day after day?

verses.latin: Usquequo exaltabitur inimicus meus super me?
verses.english: How long will my enemy be exalted over me?

verses.latin: Respice, et exaudi me, Domine Deus meus. Illumina oculos meos, ne unquam obdormiam in morte:
verses.english: Look at me, and hear me, Lord my God. Enlighten my eyes, lest I ever fall asleep in death.

verses.latin: Ne quando dicat inimicus meus: Praevalui adversus eum. Qui tribulant me exsultabunt, si motus fuero.
verses.english: Lest my enemy ever say, 'I have prevailed against him.' My tormentors will rejoice if I am moved [from my position].

verses.latin: Ego autem in misericordia tua speravi. Exsultabit cor meum in salutari tuo: cantabo Domino qui bona tribuit mihi: et psallam nomini Domini altissimi.
verses.english: But I have hoped in Your mercy. My heart will rejoice in Your salvation. I will sing to the Lord who has granted me good things, and I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David. Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus.
verses.english: A Psalm of David, for the ultimate purpose [of salvation]. The foolish one has said in his heart: 'There is no God.'

verses.latin: Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in studiis suis: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: They have become corrupt, and abominable in their pursuits. There is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum, ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: The Lord looked down from His dwelling place [the spiritual heaven] upon humanity, to see if there is anyone with understanding, or anyone seeking God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: All have turned aside. Together they have become useless. There is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant: venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum.
verses.english: Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues, they acted deceitfully. The poison of asps is under their lips.

verses.latin: Quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est: veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem.
verses.english: Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness. Their feet are swift to shed blood.

verses.latin: Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt: non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.
verses.english: Destruction and unhappiness are in their ways, and they have not known the path of peace. There is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.latin: Nonne scient omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam sicut escam panis?
verses.english: Will all those who work iniquity not know? Those who devour My people as if they were eating bread?

verses.latin: Deum non invocaverunt: illic trepidabunt timore, ubi non erat timor.
verses.english: They have not called upon God. There they will tremble with fear, where there was no [natural] cause for fear.

verses.latin: Quoniam Dominus in generatione justa est: consilium inopis confudistis, quoniam Dominus protector ejus est.
verses.english: For the Lord is with the just generation. You have confounded the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is their protector.

verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Dominus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israel.
verses.english: Who will bring salvation for Israel from Zion? When the Lord turns away the captivity of His people, Jacob will exult, and Israel will be glad.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Domine, quis habitabit in tabernaculo tuo? aut quis requiescet in monte sancto tuo?
verses.english: A Psalm of David. Lord, who will live in Your tabernacle? Or who will rest on Your holy mountain?

verses.latin: Qui ingreditur sine macula, et operatur justitiam;
verses.english: He who walks without blemish, and works justice;

verses.latin: Qui loquitur veritatem in corde suo, qui non egit dolum in lingua sua, nec fecit proximo suo malum, et opprobrium non accepit adversus proximos suos.
verses.english: He who speaks truth in his heart, who has not acted deceitfully with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor, nor accepted reproach against his neighbors.

verses.latin: Ad nihilum deductus est malignus in conspectu ejus: timentes autem Dominum glorificat. Qui jurat proximo suo, et non decipit;
verses.english: The wicked one is brought to nothing in his sight. But he glorifies those who fear the Lord. He who swears to his neighbor and does not deceive;

verses.latin: Qui pecuniam suam non dedit ad usuram, et munera super innocentem non accepit. Qui facit haec non movebitur in aeternum.
verses.english: He who has not lent his money at usury, and has not accepted bribes against the innocent. He who does these things will not be shaken forever.

verses.latin: Tituli inscriptio ipsi David. Conserva me, Domine, quoniam speravi in te.
verses.english: A title inscription for David himself. Preserve me, Lord, because I have hoped in You.

verses.latin: Dixi Domino: Deus meus es tu, quoniam bonorum meorum non eges.
verses.english: I said to the Lord: 'You are my God, because You have no need of my good things [my merits].'

verses.latin: Sanctis, qui sunt in terra ejus, mirificavit omnes voluntates meas in eis.
verses.english: To the saints who are on His land, He has fulfilled all my desires in them [through His grace and their intercession].

verses.latin: Multiplicatae sunt infirmitates eorum: postea acceleraverunt. Non congregabo conventicula eorum de sanguinibus, nec memor ero nominum eorum per labia mea.
verses.english: Their weaknesses have multiplied; afterwards, they hastened. I will not gather their assemblies of bloodshed, nor will I remember their names with my lips.

verses.latin: Dominus pars haereditatis meae, et calicis mei: tu es qui restitues haereditatem meam mihi.
verses.english: The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup. You are the one who will restore my inheritance to me.

verses.latin: Funes ceciderunt mihi in praeclaris: etenim haereditas mea praeclara est mihi.
verses.english: The boundary lines have fallen for me in beautiful places. Indeed, my inheritance is beautiful to me.

verses.latin: Benedicam Dominum, qui tribuit mihi intellectum: insuper et usque ad noctem increpuerunt me renes mei.
verses.english: I will bless the Lord, who has given me understanding. Moreover, even throughout the night, my innermost being [literally 'kidneys'] has instructed me.

verses.latin: Providebam Dominum in conspectu meo semper: quoniam a dextris est mihi, ne commovear.
verses.english: I kept the Lord before my sight always, because He is at my right hand, so that I may not be shaken.

verses.latin: Propter hoc laetatum est cor meum, et exsultavit lingua mea: insuper et caro mea requiescet in spe.
verses.english: Because of this, my heart is glad, and my tongue rejoices. Moreover, my flesh will rest in hope.

verses.latin: Quoniam non derelinques animam meam in inferno: nec dabis sanctum tuum videre corruptionem.
verses.english: Because You will not abandon my soul in the netherworld [Sheol/Hades], nor will You allow Your holy one to see corruption.

verses.latin: Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus. Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in studiis suis; non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: The fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They have become corrupt, and their works are abominable; there is no one who does good, not even one person.

verses.latin: Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum, ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: The Lord looked down from the sky upon the children of men to see if there was anyone who understood, or anyone who sought God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt. Non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum. Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant. Venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum.
verses.english: Everyone has turned away; they have all become useless. There is no one who does good, not even one. Their throat is like an open tomb; they have dealt deceitfully with their tongues. The venom of asps is under their lips.

verses.latin: Quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est; veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem. Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt. Non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.
verses.english: Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and misery are in their ways, and they have not known the way of peace. There is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.latin: Nonne cognoscent omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam sicut escam panis?
verses.english: Do all those who work wickedness not know this—those who devour My people as if they were eating bread?

verses.latin: Dominum non invocaverunt; illic trepidaverunt timore, ubi non erat timor. Quoniam Dominus in generatione justa est.
verses.english: They have not called upon the Lord. There they trembled with fear where there was no reason to fear, because the Lord is with the generation of the just.

verses.latin: Consilium inopis confudistis, quoniam Dominus spes ejus est. Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Dominus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israel.
verses.english: You have confounded the plan of the poor, for the Lord is his hope. Who will bring salvation for Israel out of Zion? When the Lord turns away the captivity of His people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David. Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus.
verses.english: The fool has said in his heart: "There is no God."

verses.latin: Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in studiis suis: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: They have become corrupt, and abominable in their pursuits. There is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum, ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: The Lord looked down from the sky upon the children of men, to see if there is anyone with understanding, or anyone seeking God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: All have turned away. Together, they have become useless. There is no one who does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant. Venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum. Quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est: veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem. Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum, et viam pacis non cognoverunt: non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.
verses.english: Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues, they dealt deceitfully. The venom of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness. Their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and misery are in their ways, and they have not known the way of peace. The fear of God is not before their eyes.

verses.latin: Nonne cognoscent omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam sicut escam panis? Dominum non invocaverunt.
verses.english: Will all those who work iniquity never understand? They devour My people as if they were eating bread. They have not called upon the Lord.

verses.latin: Illuc trepidaverunt timore, ubi non erat timor, quoniam Dominus in generatione justa est.
verses.english: There they trembled with fear, where there was no fear, because the Lord is with the righteous generation.

verses.latin: Consilium inopis confudistis, quoniam Dominus spes ejus est.
verses.english: You have confounded the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is their hope.

verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Dominus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israel.
verses.english: Who will bring salvation for Israel out of Zion? When the Lord turns away the captivity of His people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.
The fool says in his heart: 'There is no God.' They have become corrupt, and their deeds are detestable; there is not one among them who does good, not even one.
verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David. Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus. Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in studiis suis: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.

verses.english: The Lord looked down from the sky upon the children of men to see if anyone understands or seeks God.
verses.latin: Dominus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum: ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.

verses.english: They have all turned away; together they have become worthless. There is no one who does good, not even one.
verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.

verses.english: Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues they practice deceit. The venom of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.
verses.latin: Sepulchrum patens est guttur eorum; linguis suis dolose agebant. Venenum aspidum sub labiis eorum. Quorum os maledictione et amaritudine plenum est.

verses.english: Their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and misery are in their paths, and they have not known the way of peace. There is no fear of God before their eyes.
verses.latin: Veloces pedes eorum ad effundendum sanguinem. Contritio et infelicitas in viis eorum; et viam pacis non cognoverunt. Non est timor Dei ante oculos eorum.

verses.english: Will all those who work iniquity not know this—those who devour My people as if eating bread?
verses.latin: Nonne cognoscent omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam sicut escam panis?

verses.english: They have not called upon the Lord. There they trembled with fear where there was no fear.
verses.latin: Dominum non invocaverunt: illic trepidaverunt timore, ubi non erat timor.

verses.english: For the Lord is with the generation of the just. You have confounded the counsel of the poor, because the Lord is his refuge.
verses.latin: Quoniam Dominus in generatione justa est: consilium inopis confudistis, quoniam Dominus refugium ejus est.

verses.english: Who will bring salvation for Israel from Sion? When the Lord restores the fortunes of His people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.
verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Dominus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israel.

verses.english: Lord, who is worthy to dwell in Your holy presence, in Your tabernacle of worship? And who is worthy to rest on Your holy mountain of divine communion?
verses.latin: Psalmus David. Domine, quis habitabit in tabernaculo tuo? aut quis requiescet in monte sancto tuo?

verses.english: It is he who lives a blameless life and acts always with justice,
verses.latin: Qui ingreditur sine macula, et operatur justitiam;

verses.english: who speaks the truth from his heart,
verses.latin: qui loquitur veritatem in corde suo,

verses.english: who does not use his tongue to deceive others, and does not do evil to his neighbor, nor spreads slander or disgrace against those around him.
verses.latin: qui non egit dolum in lingua sua, nec fecit proximo suo malum, et opprobrium non accepit adversus proximos suos.

verses.english: In his eyes, the wicked person is despised and considered nothing; but he honors those who revere the Lord. He keeps his promises to his neighbor, even if it brings him harm,
verses.latin: Ad nihilum deductus est in conspectu ejus malignus; timentes autem Dominum glorificat: qui jurat proximo suo, et non decipit;

verses.english: he does not lend his money at excessive interest to profit from the needy, nor does he accept bribes to harm an innocent person.
verses.latin: pecuniam suam non dedit ad usuram, et munera super innocentem non accepit.

verses.english: Whoever lives by these virtues will never be shaken from God's presence, for all eternity.
verses.latin: Qui facit haec, non movebitur in æternum.

verses.english: Lord, preserve me, for I have placed all my hope in you.
verses.latin: Conserva me Domine quoniam in te speravi.

verses.english: I said to the Lord, "You are my God; you have no need of anything I can do for you."
verses.latin: Dixi Domino: Deus meus es tu, quoniam bonorum meorum non eges.

verses.english: My entire delight is in the holy ones who live in His land.
verses.latin: Sanctis qui sunt in terra ejus, mirificavit omnes voluntates meas in illis.

verses.english: Those who rush after other gods will only multiply their sorrows. I will not offer their blood sacrifices, nor will I even speak their names with my lips.
verses.latin: Multiplicatae sunt infirmitates eorum: post haec acceleraverunt. Non congregabo conventicula eorum de sanguinibus, nec memor ero nominum eorum per labia mea.

verses.english: The Lord is my inheritance, the portion of my cup of blessing; it is you who will maintain my lot in life.
verses.latin: Dominus pars haereditatis meae, et calicis mei: tu es qui restitues haereditatem meam mihi.

verses.english: The measuring lines have marked out for me a beautiful land; indeed, my inheritance is truly magnificent.
verses.latin: Funes ceciderunt mihi in praeclaris: etenim haereditas mea praeclara est mihi.

verses.english: I will bless the Lord, who has given me wisdom and understanding. Even in the depths of my being, my conscience guides me throughout the night.
verses.latin: Benedicam Dominum qui tribuit mihi intellectum: insuper et usque ad noctem increpuerunt me renes mei.

verses.english: I always keep the Lord before my eyes, for He is at my right hand, so I will never be shaken.
verses.latin: Providebam Dominum in conspectu meo semper: quoniam a dextris est mihi, ne commovear.

verses.english: Because of this, my heart is full of joy, and my tongue sings praises. Moreover, my body will rest securely in hope.
verses.latin: Propter hoc laetatum est cor meum, et exsultavit lingua mea: insuper et caro mea requiescet in spe.

verses.english: For you will not abandon my soul to the realm of the dead, nor will you allow your Holy One to undergo decay.
verses.latin: Quoniam non derelinques animam meam in inferno: nec dabis sanctum tuum videre corruptionem.

verses.english: You have revealed to me the path of life. You will fill me with joy through your presence; at your right hand there are eternal delights.
verses.latin: Notas mihi fecisti vias vitae, adimplens me laetitia cum vultu tuo: delectationes in dextera tua usque in finem.

verses.english: I will love you, O Lord, for you are my strength.
verses.latin: Diligam te, Domine, fortitudo mea;

verses.english: The Lord is my rock, my refuge, and my deliverer. My God is my helper, and I will place my hope in Him; He is my protector, the source of my strength and salvation, and my shield.
verses.latin: Dominus firmamentum meum, et refugium meum, et liberator meus. Deus meus adjutor meus, et sperabo in eum: protector meus, et cornu salutis meae, et susceptor meus.

verses.english: I will call upon the Lord with praises, and I will be saved from my enemies.
verses.latin: Laudans invocabo Dominum, et ab inimicis meis salvus ero.

verses.english: The sorrows of death surrounded me, and overwhelming floods of wickedness greatly troubled me.
verses.latin: Circumdederunt me dolores mortis, et torrentes iniquitatis conturbaverunt me.

verses.english: The pains of the underworld surrounded me; the snares of death suddenly came upon me.
verses.latin: Dolores inferni circumdederunt me; praeoccupaverunt me laquei mortis.

verses.english: In my tribulation, I called upon the Lord, and to my God I cried for help. From His holy temple, He heard my voice, and my cry came into His hearing, before His very presence.
verses.latin: In tribulatione mea invocavi Dominum, et ad Deum meum clamavi: et exaudivit de templo sancto suo vocem meam, et clamor meus in conspectu ejus introivit in aures ejus.

verses.english: The earth was shaken and trembled; the mountains, too, were greatly disturbed and moved from their places, because He was angry with them.
verses.latin: Commota est et contremuit terra; montes quoque turbati sunt, et commota sunt, quoniam iratus est illis.

verses.english: Smoke ascended in His wrath, and fire flared from His presence; burning coals were ignited by Him.
verses.latin: Ascendit fumus in ira ejus, et ignis a facie ejus exarsit; carbones succensi sunt ab eo.

verses.english: He bent down the skies and descended; and dense darkness was beneath His feet.
verses.latin: Inclinavit caelos, et descendit; et caligo sub pedibus ejus.

verses.english: And He ascended upon the cherubim, and flew; He flew upon the wings of the winds.
verses.latin: Et ascendit super cherubim, et volavit; volavit super pennas ventorum.

verses.english: And He made darkness His hiding place; His dwelling surrounded Him, with dark water gathered in the clouds of the air.
verses.latin: Et posuit tenebras latibulum suum; in circuitu ejus tabernaculum ejus, tenebrosa aqua in nubibus aeris.

verses.english: Before the brightness of His presence, the clouds passed away, followed by hail and burning coals.
verses.latin: Prae fulgore in conspectu ejus nubes transierunt, grando et carbones ignis.

verses.english: And the Lord thundered from the skies, and the Most High uttered His voice: hail and burning coals.
verses.latin: Et intonuit de caelo Dominus, et Altissimus dedit vocem suam: grando et carbones ignis.

verses.english: He sent out His arrows—His lightning bolts—and scattered them; He multiplied His flashes of lightning and threw them into confusion.
verses.latin: Misit sagittas suas, et dissipavit eos; fulgura multiplicavit, et conturbavit eos.

verses.english: And the sources of the waters appeared, and the very foundations of the earth were revealed, at Your rebuke, O Lord, at the fierce blast of the breath of Your wrath.
verses.latin: Et apparuerunt fontes aquarum, et revelata sunt fundamenta orbis terrarum, ab increpatione tua, Domine, ab inspiratione spiritus irae tuae.

verses.english: He sent down from the highest place and took hold of me; He drew me out of overwhelming troubles, like many waters.
verses.latin: Misit de summo, et accepit me; et assumpsit me de aquis multis.

verses.english: He rescued me from my most powerful enemies, and from those who hated me, because they had become too strong for me.
verses.latin: Eripuit me de inimicis meis fortissimis, et ab his qui oderant me, quoniam confortati sunt super me.

verses.english: They confronted me on the day of my affliction; but the Lord became my protector.
verses.latin: Praevenerunt me in die afflictionis meae; et factus est Dominus protector meus.

verses.english: And He brought me out into a place of freedom; He saved me, because He delighted in me.
verses.latin: Et eduxit me in latitudinem; salvum me fecit, quoniam voluit me.

verses.english: And the Lord will reward me according to my righteousness; He will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands.
verses.latin: Et retribuet mihi Dominus secundum justitiam meam; et secundum puritatem manuum mearum retribuet mihi:

verses.english: For I have kept the ways of the Lord, and have not acted wickedly against my God.
verses.latin: quia custodivi vias Domini, nec impie gessi a Deo meo.

verses.english: For all His judgments are before me, and I have not cast away His righteous decrees from me.
verses.latin: Quoniam omnia judicia ejus in conspectu meo, et justitias ejus non repuli a me.

verses.english: And I will be blameless before Him, and I will keep myself from my iniquity.
verses.latin: Et ero immaculatus cum eo; et observabo me ab iniquitate mea.

verses.english: And the Lord will reward me according to my righteousness, and according to the cleanness of my hands in the sight of His eyes.
verses.latin: Et retribuet mihi Dominus secundum justitiam meam, et secundum puritatem manuum mearum in conspectu oculorum ejus.

verses.english: With the holy, You show Yourself holy; and with the innocent man, You show Yourself innocent.
verses.latin: Cum sancto sanctus eris, et cum viro innocente innocens eris;

verses.english: And with the upright, You show Yourself upright; but with the perverse, You show Yourself contrary.
verses.latin: et cum electo electus eris, et cum perverso perverteris.

verses.english: For You will save the humble people, and You will humble the proud.
verses.latin: Quoniam tu populum humilem salvum facies, et oculos superborum humiliabis.

verses.english: For You, O Lord, light my lamp; my God, You enlighten my darkness.
verses.latin: Quoniam tu illuminas lucernam meam, Domine; Deus meus, illumina tenebras meas.

verses.english: For by You I shall be delivered from any attack; and by my God, I shall scale any wall.
verses.latin: Quoniam in te eripiar a tentatione; et in Deo meo transgrediar murum.

verses.english: My God, His way is perfect; the words of the Lord are refined by fire. He is a protector to all who hope in Him.
verses.latin: Deus meus, impolluta via ejus; eloquia Domini igne examinata: protector est omnium sperantium in se.

verses.english: For who is God except the Lord? Or who is God except our God?
verses.latin: Quoniam quis Deus praeter Dominum? aut quis Deus praeter Deum nostrum?

verses.english: It is God who has girded me with strength, and has made my way perfect.
verses.latin: Deus qui praecinxit me virtute, et posuit immaculatam viam meam.

verses.english: He made my feet like the feet of deer, and set me securely upon high places.
verses.latin: Qui perfecit pedes meos tamquam cervorum, et super excelsa statuens me.

verses.english: He trains my hands for battle; and You have strengthened my arms like a bow made of bronze.
verses.latin: Qui docet manus meas ad praelium; et posuisti arcum aereum brachia mea.

verses.english: And You have given me the shield of Your salvation; Your right hand has sustained me, and Your discipline has guided me completely, and Your instruction itself will teach me.
verses.latin: Et dedisti mihi protectionem salutis tuae; et dextera tua suscepit me, et disciplina tua correxit me in finem, et disciplina tua ipsa me docebit.

verses.english: You have made a wide path for my steps beneath me, and my feet have not faltered.
verses.latin: Dilatasti gressus meos subtus me, et non sunt infirmata vestigia mea.

verses.english: I will pursue my enemies and overtake them; and I will not turn back until they are utterly defeated.
verses.latin: Persequar inimicos meos, et comprehendam illos; et non convertar donec deficiant.

verses.english: I will crush them, and they will not be able to stand; they will fall beneath my feet.
verses.latin: Confringam illos, nec poterunt stare; cadent subtus pedes meos.

verses.english: And You have girded me with strength for battle; You have made those who rise against me fall beneath me.
verses.latin: Et praecinxisti me virtute ad bellum; et supplantasti insurgentes in me subtus me.

verses.english: And You have made my enemies turn their backs and flee; You have utterly destroyed those who hated me.
verses.latin: Et inimicos meos dedisti mihi dorsum, et odientes me disperdidisti.

verses.english: They cried out, but there was no one to save them; they cried even to the Lord, but He did not hear them.
verses.latin: Clamaverunt, nec erat qui salvos faceret; ad Dominum, nec exaudivit eos.

verses.english: And I will crush them like dust before the wind; I will cast them out like the mud of the streets.
verses.latin: Et comminuam illos ut pulverem ante faciem venti; ut lutum platearum delebo eos.

verses.english: You will rescue me from the strife of the people; You will make me the head of nations. A people I have not known have served me.
verses.latin: Eripies me de contradictionibus populi; constitues me in caput gentium. Populus quem non cognovi servivit mihi;

verses.english: At the mere hearing of my voice, they obeyed me. The sons of foreigners have lied to me.
verses.latin: in auditu auris obedivit mihi. Filii alieni mentiti sunt mihi,

verses.english: The sons of foreigners have withered away and they have stumbled from their paths.
verses.latin: filii alieni inveterati sunt, et claudicaverunt a semitis suis.

verses.english: The Lord lives! And blessed be my God! And let the God of my salvation be greatly exalted!
verses.latin: Vivit Dominus, et benedictus Deus meus; et exaltetur Deus salutis meae.

verses.english: It is God who grants me vengeance, and subdues peoples under me; He is my deliverer from wrathful nations.
verses.latin: Deus qui das vindictas mihi, et subdis populos sub me; liberator meus de gentibus iracundis.

verses.english: And You will exalt me above those who rise against me; You will rescue me from the wicked man.
verses.latin: Et ab insurgentibus in me exaltabis me; a viro iniquo eripies me.

verses.english: Therefore, I will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the nations, and I will sing a psalm to Your name.
verses.latin: Propterea confitebor tibi in nationibus, Domine, et nomini tuo psalmum dicam:

verses.english: He greatly delivers His king, and shows mercy to His Anointed One, David, and to his offspring forever and ever.
verses.latin: Magnificans salutes regis ejus, et faciens misericordiam christo suo David, et semini ejus usque in saeculum saeculi.

verses.english: A Psalm of David, for the director.
verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.

verses.english: The vast universe itself declares the glory of God. The very expanse of the sky proclaims the work of His hands.
verses.latin: Caeli enarrant gloriam Dei, et opera manuum ejus annuntiat firmamentum.

verses.english: Each day speaks to the next day, pouring out a message; each night points to the next night, revealing knowledge about God.
verses.latin: Dies diei eructat verbum, et nox nocti indicat scientiam.

verses.english: There are no spoken words, no human languages, and no voices that can explain it, yet their message is understood everywhere.
verses.latin: Non sunt loquelae, neque sermones, quorum non audiantur voces eorum.

verses.english: Their message travels across the entire earth; their words reach the very ends of the inhabited world. God has placed His dwelling of light in the sun.
verses.latin: In omnem terram exivit sonus eorum, et in fines orbis terrae verba eorum. In sole posuit tabernaculum suum:

verses.english: And the sun, like a bridegroom leaving his wedding chamber, is joyful. It exults like a mighty man running his race.
verses.latin: et ipse tamquam sponsus procedens de thalamo suo. Exsultavit ut gigas ad currendam viam;

verses.english: Its rising begins at one end of the sky, and its journey carries it to the other end. Nothing can hide from its warmth and light.
verses.latin: a summo caelo egressio ejus. Et occursus ejus usque ad summum ejus: nec est qui se abscondat a calore ejus.

verses.english: The Law of the Lord is perfect and flawless, restoring people's souls. The testimony of the Lord is trustworthy, giving wisdom to those who are simple in heart.
verses.latin: Lex Domini immaculata, convertens animas; testimonium Domini fidele, sapientiam praestans parvulis.

verses.english: The Lord's commands are just and right, bringing joy to one's heart. The commandment of the Lord is clear and bright, enlightening one's eyes.
verses.latin: Justitiae Domini rectae, laetificantes corda; praeceptum Domini lucidum, illuminans oculos.

verses.english: The reverence for the Lord is holy, lasting for all generations. The judgments of the Lord are true, being righteous in every way.
verses.latin: Timor Domini sanctus, permanens in saeculum saeculi; judicia Domini vera, justificata in semetipsa.

verses.english: These laws are more desirable than the finest gold and more valuable than many precious jewels. They are sweeter to taste than honey, even the fresh honey from the comb.
verses.latin: Desiderabilia super aurum et lapidem pretiosum multum; et dulciora super mel et favum.

verses.english: Your servant, O Lord, diligently guards and keeps these teachings. In the keeping of them, there is great reward and fulfillment.
verses.latin: Etenim servus tuus custodit ea; in custodiendis illis retributio multa.

verses.english: Who can truly understand their own missteps and sins? Cleanse me, Lord, from my unintentional and hidden faults.
verses.latin: Delicta quis intelligit? ab occultis meis munda me.

verses.english: Keep your servant from sins committed out of pride or presumption. If these powerful sins do not gain control over me, then I will be without blemish, and I will be cleansed from the greatest of transgressions.
verses.latin: Ab alienis parce servo tuo, si mei non fuerint dominati, tunc immaculatus ero, et emundabor a delicto maximo.

verses.english: May the words that I speak and the thoughts of my heart always be pleasing in your sight, O Lord, my Helper and my Redeemer.
verses.latin: Et erunt ut complaceant eloquia oris mei, et meditatio cordis mei in conspectu tuo semper. Domine, adjutor meus, et redemptor meus.

verses.english: A Psalm of David, for the End.
verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.

verses.english: The entire universe declares the glory of God. The atmosphere and all the works of His hands announce His greatness.
verses.latin: Cæli enarrant gloriam Dei, et opera manuum ejus annuntiat firmamentum.

verses.english: Day after day, creation pours forth knowledge of God; night after night, it reveals His wisdom.
verses.latin: Dies diei eructat verbum, et nox nocti indicat scientiam.

verses.english: No words are spoken, no verbal language is used, yet their voice, a silent testimony, is heard throughout the world.
verses.latin: Non sunt loquelæ, neque sermones, quorum non audiantur voces eorum.

verses.english: Their silent witness has gone out into every land. Their message reaches the very ends of the inhabited world.
verses.latin: In omnem terram exivit sonus eorum, et in fines orbis terræ verba eorum.

verses.english: In the sky, God has set a dwelling place for the sun. And the sun itself, like a bridegroom coming forth from his bridal chamber,
verses.latin: In sole posuit tabernaculum suum: et ipse tanquam sponsus procedens de thalamo suo.

verses.english: It rejoices like a mighty hero ready to run its course. Its going forth is from one end of the sky,
verses.latin: Exultavit ut gigas ad currendam viam: a summo cælo egressio ejus.

verses.english: And its circuit reaches all the way to the other end of the sky. Nothing is hidden from its heat.
verses.latin: Et occursus ejus usque ad summum ejus: nec est qui se abscondat a calore ejus.

verses.english: The law of the Lord is perfect; it restores the soul. The testimony of the Lord is trustworthy; it gives wisdom to the simple.
verses.latin: Lex Domini immaculata, convertens animas: testimonium Domini fidele, sapientiam præstans parvulis.

verses.english: The statutes of the Lord are right; they bring joy to the heart. The commandment of the Lord is clear; it enlightens the eyes.
verses.latin: Justitiæ Domini rectæ, lætificantes corda: præceptum Domini lucidum, illuminans oculos.

verses.english: The fear of the Lord is holy; it endures forever. The judgments of the Lord are true and altogether righteous.
verses.latin: Timor Domini sanctus, permanens in sæculum sæculi: judicia Domini vera, justificata in semetipsa.

verses.english: They are more desirable than gold, than much fine gold, and sweeter than honey, even honeycomb.
verses.latin: Desiderabilia super aurum et lapidem pretiosum multum: et dulciora super mel et favum.

verses.english: Moreover, your servant keeps them; in keeping them, there is great reward.
verses.latin: Etenim servus tuus custodit ea; in custodiendis illis retributio multa.

verses.english: Who can discern his own hidden faults? Cleanse me from those sins I do not know.
verses.latin: Delicta quis intelligit? ab occultis meis munda me.

verses.english: Keep your servant also from sins of pride and presumption; do not let them gain dominion over me. Then I shall be blameless and innocent of great transgression.
verses.latin: Ab alienis parce servo tuo, si mei non fuerint dominati, tunc immaculatus ero, et emundabor a delicto maximo.

verses.english: May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be always pleasing in Your sight,
verses.latin: Et erunt ut complaceant eloquia oris mei, et meditatio cordis mei in conspectu tuo semper.

verses.english: O Lord, my strength and my redeemer.
verses.latin: Domine, adjutor meus, et redemptor meus.

verses.english: For the conductor, a Psalm of David.
verses.latin: In finem, Psalmus David.

verses.english: May the Lord hear you in your time of trouble; may the name of the God of Jacob protect you.
verses.latin: Exaudiat te Dominus in die tribulationis; protegat te nomen Dei Jacob.

verses.english: May He send you help from His holy dwelling place and defend you from Zion.
verses.latin: Mittat tibi auxilium de sancto, et de Sion tueatur te.

verses.english: May He remember all your sacrifices, and may He accept your burnt offering as pleasing.
verses.latin: Memor sit omnis sacrificii tui, et holocaustum tuum impinguet.

verses.english: May He grant you what your heart desires and confirm all your plans.
verses.latin: Tribuat tibi secundum cor tuum, et omne consilium tuum confirmet.

verses.english: We will rejoice in the salvation He brings you, and in the name of our God, we will triumph.
verses.latin: Laetabimur in salutari tuo, et in nomine Dei nostri magnificabimur.

verses.english: May the Lord fulfill all your requests. Now I know that the Lord has saved His anointed one, the king.
verses.latin: Impleat Dominus omnes petitiones tuas; nunc cognovi quoniam salvum fecit Dominus christum suum.

verses.english: He will hear him from His holy dwelling place, through the omnipotent saving power of His right hand.
verses.latin: Exaudiet illum de caelo sancto suo; in potentatibus salus dexterae ejus.

verses.english: Some nations trust in their chariots, and some in their horses, but we will call upon the name of the Lord our God.
verses.latin: Hi in curribus, et hi in equis; nos autem in nomine Domini Dei nostri invocabimus.

verses.english: They were brought down and have fallen, but we have risen and stand firm.
verses.latin: Ipsi obligati sunt, et ceciderunt; nos autem surreximus, et erecti sumus.

verses.english: Lord, save the king, and hear us when we call upon You.
verses.latin: Domine, salvum fac regem; et exaudi nos in die qua invocaverimus te.

verses.english: My God, my God, look upon me. Why have You forsaken me? My words, even those crying out in my deep distress because of my sins, feel far from bringing me salvation.
verses.latin: Deus, Deus meus, respice in me: quare me dereliquisti? longe a salute mea verba delictorum meorum.

verses.english: My God, I cry out to You all day long, yet You do not answer me. I cry out through the night, and my constant prayer is not foolishness.
verses.latin: Deus meus, clamo per diem, et non exaudis: et nocte, et non ad insipientiam mihi.

verses.english: But You, O God, dwell among Your holy ones, and You are the very object of Israel's praise.
verses.latin: Tu autem in sanctis habitas, Laus Israel.

verses.english: Our fathers hoped in You. They hoped, and You rescued them from their troubles.
verses.latin: In te speraverunt patres nostri: speraverunt, et liberasti eos.

verses.english: They cried out to You, and they found salvation. They placed their hope in You, and they were never put to shame.
verses.latin: Ad te clamaverunt, et salvi facti sunt: in te speraverunt, et non sunt confusi.

verses.english: But I feel like a mere worm, not even a true man. I have become a disgrace among all men, and I am despised by the common people.
verses.latin: Ego autem sum vermis, et non homo: opprobrium hominum, et abjectio plebis.

verses.english: All who saw me mocked me openly. They spoke contemptuously and shook their heads at me in scorn.
verses.latin: Omnes videntes me, deriserunt me: locuti sunt labiis, et moverunt caput.

verses.english: They mock me, saying: "He trusted in the Lord, so let the Lord rescue him! Let the Lord save him, if the Lord truly delights in him!"
verses.latin: Speravit in Domino, eripiat eum: salvum faciat eum, quoniam vult eum.

verses.english: For it was You, O God, who brought me safely from my mother's womb. My hope in You began when I was still at my mother's breast.
verses.latin: Quoniam tu es, qui extraxisti me de ventre: spes mea ab uberibus matris meae.

verses.english: I was entrusted to Your care from the moment I left my mother's womb. From my very birth, You have been my God.
verses.latin: In te projectus sum ex utero: de ventre matris meae, tu es Deus meus.

verses.english: Do not stay far from me now, because trouble is very near, and there is no one else to help me.
verses.latin: Ne discesseris a me, quoniam tribulatio proxima est: quoniam non est qui adjuvet.

verses.english: Many strong young bulls surround me. Powerful and well-fed enemies have pressed in on me from every side.
verses.latin: Circumdederunt me vituli multi: tauri pingues obsederunt me.

verses.english: They open their mouths wide against me, like a ravenous, roaring lion seeking to tear its prey.
verses.latin: Aperuerunt super me os suum, sicut leo rapiens et rugiens.

verses.english: I am poured out like water, completely without strength. All my bones are disjointed and out of place. My heart has become like wax melting within me, in the very center of my being.
verses.latin: Sicut aqua effusus sum: et dispersa sunt omnia ossa mea. Factum est cor meum tamquam cera liquescens in medio ventris mei.

verses.english: My strength is dried up like a broken piece of pottery, and my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. You have brought me down to the dust of death, where all life ends.
verses.latin: Aruit sicut testa virtus mea, et lingua mea adhæsit faucibus meis: et in pulverem mortis deduxisti me.

verses.english: Many wild dogs surround me. A band of wicked men have surrounded me, pressing in on all sides. They have pierced my hands and my feet.
verses.latin: Circumdederunt me canes multi: concilium malignantium obsedit me. Foderunt manus meas et pedes meos.

verses.english: They count every one of my bones, as if I am a skeleton exposed. They stare at me, observing me with cruel satisfaction.
verses.latin: Dinumeraverunt omnia ossa mea. Ipsi vero consideraverunt et inspexerunt me.

verses.english: They divide my clothing among themselves, and for my main tunic, they cast lots to decide who will take it.
verses.latin: Diviserunt sibi vestimenta mea: et super vestem meam miserunt sortem.

verses.english: But You, O Lord, do not hold back Your help from me. Look to my defense, and come quickly to my aid!
verses.latin: Tu autem Domine, ne elongaveris auxilium tuum a me: ad defensionem meam conspice.

verses.english: Rescue my life, O God, from the sword. Deliver my precious, unique life from the power of these wild dogs!
verses.latin: Erue a framea, Deus, animam meam: et de manu canis unicam meam.

verses.english: Save me from the mouth of the roaring lion! And deliver my humble and afflicted soul from the horns of those wild oxen!
verses.latin: Salva me ex ore leonis: et a cornibus unicornium humilitatem meam.

verses.english: I will proclaim Your holy name to my brethren, those who believe in You. Within the assembly of Your Church, I will praise You with joyful song.
verses.latin: Narrabo nomen tuum fratribus meis: in medio ecclesiæ laudabo te.

verses.english: All of you who revere the Lord, praise Him! All descendants of Jacob, who form Your people, give Him glory!
verses.latin: Qui timetis Dominum, laudate eum: universum semen Jacob, glorificate eum.

verses.english: Let all the people of Israel revere Him with deep respect, for He did not scorn nor despise the humble prayer of one who was suffering. He did not turn His face away from me, and when I cried out to Him, He listened and heard my plea.
verses.latin: Timeat eum omne semen Israel: quoniam non sprevit, neque despexit deprecationem pauperis: nec avertit faciem suam a me: et cum clamarem ad eum exaudivit me.

verses.english: My praise for You will be offered in the great assembly of the faithful. I will fulfill the promises I made to You in the presence of all who revere You.
verses.latin: Apud te laus mea in ecclesia magna: vota mea reddam in conspectu timentium eum.

verses.english: Those who have suffered and are spiritually poor will eat of Your bounty and be satisfied. And those who earnestly seek the Lord will praise Him. Their hearts will live on, full of joy, for all eternity.
verses.latin: Edent pauperes, et saturabuntur: et laudabunt Dominum qui requirunt eum: vivent corda eorum in sæculum sæculi.

verses.english: All the nations and peoples throughout the whole earth will remember God and turn back to the Lord. And all the families of the Gentiles will worship before Him, acknowledging His supreme authority.
verses.latin: Reminiscentur et convertentur ad Dominum universi fines terræ: et adorabunt in conspectu ejus universæ familiæ gentium.

verses.english: For the entire kingdom of the universe belongs to the Lord, and He alone will reign over all the nations and peoples.
verses.latin: Quoniam Domini est regnum: et ipse dominabitur gentium.

verses.english: Even those who are rich and powerful on earth have eaten of His bounty and will bow down to worship Him. All who are destined to return to the earth in death will bow before His presence.
verses.latin: Manducaverunt et adoraverunt omnes pingues terræ: in conspectu ejus cadent omnes qui descendunt in terram.

verses.english: My soul, my very being, will live for Him. And my descendants, my spiritual children, will serve Him faithfully.
verses.latin: Et anima mea illi vivet: et semen meum serviet ipsi.

verses.english: A generation yet to be born will be told about the Lord and His wondrous deeds. And the very heavens will proclaim His righteousness to a new people who will be born, a people whom the Lord Himself has brought into being.
verses.latin: Annuntiabitur Domino generatio ventura: et annuntiabunt cæli justitiam ejus populo qui nascetur, quem fecit Dominus.

verses.english: The Lord is my shepherd, and I will lack nothing.
verses.latin: Dominus regit me, et nihil mihi deerit:

verses.english: He has settled me in fields full of fresh, green grass. He has led me up alongside waters of refreshment.
verses.latin: in pascuis virentibus collocavit me. Super aquas refectionis educavit me,

verses.english: He has brought my soul back to Him. He has guided me along paths of righteousness, all for the sake of His name.
verses.latin: animam meam convertit. Deduxit me super semitas justitiæ, propter nomen suum.

verses.english: Even if I walk through the darkest valley of the shadow of death, I will not fear any evil, because You are with me. Your staff and Your rod, these have comforted me.
verses.latin: Nam et si ambulavero in medio umbræ mortis, non timebo mala: quoniam tu mecum es. Virga tua, et baculus tuus, ipsa me consolata sunt.

verses.english: You have prepared a table for me in Your sight, even against those who trouble me. You have anointed my head with oil, and how glorious is my overflowing cup!
verses.latin: Parasti in conspectu meo mensam, adversus eos qui tribulant me. Impinguasti in oleo caput meum: et calix meus inebrians quam præclarus est!

verses.english: And Your mercy will follow me all the days of my life; and I will dwell in the house of the Lord for all eternity.
verses.latin: Et misericordia tua subsequetur me omnibus diebus vitæ meæ: Et ut inhabitem in domo Domini, in longitudinem dierum.

verses.english: A Psalm of David. The Lord shepherds me, and I will want for nothing.
verses.latin: David. Dominus pascit me, et nihil mihi deerit:

verses.english: He settles me in green pastures. He guides me beside restful waters.
verses.latin: in loco pascuae ibi me collocavit. Super aquas refectionis educavit me,

verses.english: He restores my soul. He leads me on paths of righteousness for the glory of His name.
verses.latin: animam meam convertit: deduxit me super semitas justitiae propter nomen suum.

verses.english: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me. Your rod and Your staff—these comfort me.
verses.latin: Nam etsi ambulavero in medio umbrae mortis, non timebo mala: quoniam tu mecum es. Virga tua, et baculus tuus, ipsa me consolata sunt.

verses.english: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows with Your blessings.
verses.latin: Parasti in conspectu meo mensam, adversus eos qui tribulant me. Impinguasti in oleo caput meum: et calix meus inebrians quam praeclarus est!

verses.english: And Your mercy will follow me all the days of my life, so that I may dwell in the house of the Lord for all eternity.
verses.latin: Et misericordia tua subsequetur me omnibus diebus vitae meae: et ut inhabitem in domo Domini in longitudinem dierum.

verses.english: The Lord owns the earth and everything in it; He owns the entire world and all who live there.
verses.latin: DOMINI est terra, et plenitudo ejus; orbis terrarum, et universi qui habitant in eo.

verses.english: For He himself established it upon the seas and secured it upon the rivers.
verses.latin: Quia ipse super maria fundavit eum, et super flumina præparavit eum.

verses.english: Who is worthy to ascend to the Lord's mountain? Or who is worthy to stand in His holy place?
verses.latin: Quis ascendet in montem Domini? aut quis stabit in loco sancto ejus?

verses.english: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who has not set his soul on worthless things, nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbor.
verses.latin: Innocens manibus et mundo corde, qui non accepit in vanum animam suam, nec juravit in dolo proximo suo.

verses.english: He will receive a blessing from the Lord and mercy from God, his Savior.
verses.latin: Hic accipiet benedictionem a Domino, et misericordiam a Deo salutari suo.

verses.english: This is the generation of those who seek Him, of those who seek the face of the God of Jacob—the God of His chosen people.
verses.latin: Hæc est generatio quærentium eum, quærentium faciem Dei Jacob.

verses.english: Lift up your gates, you princes! And be lifted up, you eternal gates, so that the King of glory may enter.
verses.latin: Attollite portas, principes, vestras, et elevamini, portæ æternales, et introibit Rex gloriæ.

verses.english: Who is this King of glory? The Lord, strong and mighty; the Lord, powerful in battle.
verses.latin: Quis est iste Rex gloriæ? Dominus fortis et potens, Dominus potens in prælio.

verses.english: Lift up your gates, you princes! And be lifted up, you eternal gates, so that the King of glory may enter.
verses.latin: Attollite portas, principes, vestras, et elevamini, portæ æternales, et introibit Rex gloriæ.

verses.english: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of all heavenly powers—He Himself is the King of glory.
verses.latin: Quis est iste Rex gloriæ? Dominus virtutum ipse est Rex gloriæ.

verses.english: To you, my Lord, I lift up my entire self.
verses.latin: Psalmus David. Ad te, Domine, levavi animam meam:

verses.english: My God, I trust completely in You. Do not let me be put to shame. Do not let my enemies mock me.
verses.latin: Deus meus, in te confido; non erubescam. Neque irrideant me inimici mei:

verses.english: For all those who wait patiently on You will not be put to shame. Rather, let those who act with injustice and without cause be put to shame.
verses.latin: Etenim universi, qui sustinent te, non confundentur. Confundantur supervacue agentes iniqua.

verses.english: My Lord, show me your ways, and teach me Your paths of righteousness.
verses.latin: Vias tuas, Domine, demonstra mihi, et semitas tuas edoce me.

verses.english: Guide me in Your truth and teach me, for You are God, my Savior, and I have waited on You all day long.
verses.latin: Dirige me in veritate tua, et doce me: quia tu es Deus salvator meus, et te sustinui tota die.

verses.english: My Lord, remember Your tender mercies and Your loving-kindnesses, which have been from the beginning of time.
verses.latin: Reminiscere miserationum tuarum, Domine, et misericordiarum tuarum, quae a saeculo sunt.

verses.english: Do not remember the sins of my youth and my ignorances. According to Your great mercy, remember me, because of Your goodness, my Lord.
verses.latin: Delicta juventutis meae, et ignorantias meas ne memineris. Secundum misericordiam tuam memento mei tu, propter bonitatem tuam, Domine.

verses.english: The Lord is good and righteous. Because of this, He will give His law to those who stray from His path.
verses.latin: Dulcis et rectus Dominus: propter hoc legem dabit delinquentibus in via.

verses.english: He will guide the humble in judgment; He will teach the meek His ways.
verses.latin: Diriget mansuetos in judicio: docebit mites vias suas.

verses.english: All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth to those who seek out His covenant and His testimonies.
verses.latin: Universae viae Domini misericordia et veritas, requirentibus testamentum ejus et testimonia ejus.

verses.english: For the sake of Your own name, My Lord, be merciful and forgive my sin, for it is indeed great.
verses.latin: Propter nomen tuum, Domine, propitiaberis peccato meo; multum est enim.

verses.english: Who is the person who truly fears the Lord? God establishes a law for him on the path which he has chosen.
verses.latin: Quis est homo qui timet Dominum? legem statuit ei in via quam elegit.

verses.english: His soul will dwell in prosperity, and his children's children will inherit the earth.
verses.latin: Anima ejus in bonis commorabitur: et semen ejus haereditabit terram.

verses.english: The Lord is a strong fortress for those who fear Him. He makes His covenant known to them.
verses.latin: Firmamentum est Dominus timentibus eum: et testamentum ipsius ut manifestetur illis.

verses.english: My eyes are always fixed on the Lord, for He himself will free my feet from the trap.
verses.latin: Oculi mei semper ad Dominum: quoniam ipse evellet de laqueo pedes meos.

verses.english: Look upon me and have mercy on me, for I am lonely and poor.
verses.latin: Respice in me, et miserere mei; quia unicus et pauper sum ego.

verses.english: The troubles of my heart have multiplied; deliver me from my necessities.
verses.latin: Tribulationes cordis mei multiplicatae sunt: de necessitatibus meis erue me.

verses.english: Look upon my lowliness and my toil, and forgive all my sins.
verses.latin: Vide humilitatem meam et laborem meum; et dimitte universa delicta mea.

verses.english: Look at my enemies, for they have multiplied, and they hate me with an unjust hatred.
verses.latin: Respice inimicos meos, quoniam multiplicati sunt, et odio iniquo oderunt me.

verses.english: Protect my life and rescue me. I will not be put to shame, for I have placed my hope in You.
verses.latin: Custodi animam meam, et erue me: non erubescam, quoniam speravi in te.

verses.english: Let innocence and uprightness preserve me, because I have waited patiently for You, my Lord.
verses.latin: Innocentia et aequitas custodierunt me, quia sustinui te, Domine.

verses.english: O God, deliver the people of Israel from all their troubles.
verses.latin: Libera, Deus, Israel ex omnibus tribulationibus suis.

verses.english: The Lord is the source of my understanding, and He is my salvation—so whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my entire life—so before whom shall I tremble?
verses.latin: Dominus illuminatio mea, et salus mea: quem timebo? Dominus protector vitae meæ: a quo trepidabo?

verses.english: When evil people approached to utterly destroy me, my very enemies who troubled me were themselves weakened and fell down.
verses.latin: Dum appropiant super me nocentes, ut edant carnes meas: qui tribulant me inimici mei, ipsi infirmati sunt et ceciderunt.

verses.english: If an entire army camps against me, my heart will not be afraid. If a battle rises up against me, even in this situation, I will place my hope in God.
verses.latin: Si consistant adversum me castra, non timebit cor meum; Si exsurgat adversum me prælium, in hoc ego sperabo.

verses.english: I have asked one thing from the Lord, and this I will diligently seek: that I may dwell in the presence of the Lord all the days of my life, that I may perceive the will of the Lord, and that I may seek Him in His holy temple.
verses.latin: Unam petii a Domino, hanc requiram: ut inhabitem in domo Domini omnibus diebus vitæ meæ; ut videam voluntatem Domini, et visitem templum ejus.

verses.english: For He will conceal me within His sacred dwelling. In the day of evils, He will protect me in the secret place of His tent. He will lift me high upon a secure rock.
verses.latin: Quoniam abscondit me in tabernaculo suo: in die malorum protexit me in abscondito tabernaculi sui. In petra exaltavit me.

verses.english: And now, He has raised my head above my enemies, granting me victory. I have walked around His dwelling, and I have offered in His tent a sacrifice of exultation and joy. I will sing and give praise to the Lord.
verses.latin: Et nunc exaltavit caput meum super inimicos meos: Circuivi, et immolavi in tabernaculo ejus hostiam vociferationis: Cantabo, et psalmum dicam Domino.

verses.english: Hear, O Lord, my voice with which I have cried out to You. Show me Your mercy, and hear my prayer.
verses.latin: Exaudi, Domine, vocem meam, qua clamavi ad te: miserere mei, et exaudi me.

verses.english: My heart has said to You, 'My whole being has sought You.' Your face, O Lord, I will continually seek.
verses.latin: Tibi dixit cor meum, exquisivit te facies mea: Faciem tuam, Domine, requiram.

verses.english: Do not turn Your face away from me. Do not, in Your anger, turn away from Your servant. Be my helper; do not abandon me, nor despise me, O God, my Savior.
verses.latin: Ne avertas faciem tuam a me: ne declines in ira a servo tuo. Adjutor meus esto: ne derelinquas me, neque despicias me, Deus salutaris meus.

verses.english: Even if my father and my mother were to abandon me, the Lord would nonetheless take me up and care for me.
verses.latin: Quoniam pater meus et mater mea dereliquerunt me: Dominus autem assumpsit me.

verses.english: Teach me Your way, O Lord. Guide me along a straight path because of my enemies, so I do not falter.
verses.latin: Legem pone mihi, Domine, in via tua: Et dirige me in semita recta propter inimicos meos.

verses.english: Do not deliver me over to the malicious desires of those who trouble me. For unjust witnesses have risen up against me, and their wickedness has proven to be a lie against itself.
verses.latin: Ne tradideris me in animas tribulantium me: Quoniam insurrexerunt in me testes iniqui, et mentita est iniquitas sibi.

verses.english: I am confident that I shall see the good things of the Lord while I am still in the land of the living—that is, in this earthly life.
verses.latin: Credo videre bona Domini in terra viventium.

verses.english: Wait for the Lord; be courageous, and let your heart be strengthened. Yes, continue to wait for the Lord.
verses.latin: Expecta Dominum, viriliter age, et confortetur cor tuum, et sustine Dominum.

verses.english: From David. The Lord is my light, illuminating my path and my salvation; whom should I fear? The Lord protects my life; whom should I dread or be afraid of?
verses.latin: David. Dominus illuminatio mea et salus mea: quem timebo? Dominus protector vitae meae: a quo trepidabo?

verses.english: When evil people came against me, intent on destroying me, my enemies who troubled me, they stumbled and fell. They grew weak and collapsed.
verses.latin: Dum appropiant super me nocentes, ut edant carnes meas: qui tribulant me inimici mei, ipsi infirmati sunt et ceciderunt.

verses.english: Even if an army sets up camp against me, my heart will not be afraid. Even if a war breaks out against me, I will still hope in the Lord and trust Him.
verses.latin: Si consistant adversum me castra, non timebit cor meum. Si exsurgat adversum me proelium, in hoc ego sperabo.

verses.english: I have asked the Lord for one thing, and this is what I will always seek: to live in the presence of the Lord all the days of my life. This is so I may contemplate the beauty of the Lord and always be near His holy temple.
verses.latin: Unam petii a Domino, hanc requiram: ut inhabitem in domo Domini omnibus diebus vitae meae; ut videam voluptatem Domini, et visitem templum ejus.

verses.english: Because in times of trouble, He will hide me in His sacred dwelling place, His tabernacle. He will protect me in the secret depths of His presence.
verses.latin: Quoniam abscondit me in tabernaculo suo: in die malorum protexit me in abscondito tabernaculi sui.

verses.english: He has set me high upon a solid rock. And now, He has raised my head above all my enemies, giving me victory and honor.
verses.latin: In petra exaltavit me: et nunc exaltavit caput meum super inimicos meos.

verses.english: I will circle His tabernacle in joyful procession, and there I will offer a sacrifice of praise with shouts of joy. I will sing and make music to the Lord, giving Him honor.
verses.latin: Circuivi et immolavi in tabernaculo ejus hostiam vociferationis: cantabo, et psalmum dicam Domino.

verses.english: Hear my voice, O Lord, when I call out to You in prayer. Have mercy on me, and listen to my pleas.
verses.latin: Exaudi, Domine, vocem meam, qua clamavi ad te: miserere mei, et exaudi me.

verses.english: My heart spoke to You, saying, 'My entire being seeks You out.' I will diligently seek Your presence, O Lord.
verses.latin: Tibi dixit cor meum, exquisivit te facies mea: faciem tuam, Domine, requiram.

verses.english: Do not turn Your face away from me, and do not reject Your servant in anger. Be my helper. Do not abandon me, nor look down upon me, O God, my Savior and the source of my salvation.
verses.latin: Ne avertas faciem tuam a me: ne declines in ira a servo tuo. Adjutor meus esto: ne derelinquas me, neque despicias me, Deus salutaris meus.

verses.english: Even if my father and my mother were to abandon me, the Lord Himself would take me in and care for me.
verses.latin: Quoniam pater meus et mater mea dereliquerunt me: Dominus autem assumpsit me.

verses.english: Teach me Your way, O Lord. Guide me on a straight and righteous path because of those who watch to harm me.
verses.latin: Legem pone mihi, Domine, in via tua: et dirige me in semita recta propter inimicos meos.

verses.english: Do not give me over to the malicious desires of those who trouble me. For false witnesses have risen up against me, and their wickedness has proven itself to be a lie.
verses.latin: Ne tradideris me in animas tribulantium me: quoniam insurrexerunt in me testes iniqui, et mentita est iniquitas sibi.

verses.english: I firmly believe that I will see the goodness of the Lord here, in this life, in the land of the living.
verses.latin: Credo videre bona Domini in terra viventium.

verses.english: Wait patiently for the Lord to act. Be strong and courageous, and let your heart take courage. Yes, wait patiently for the Lord.
verses.latin: Expecta Dominum, viriliter age, et confortetur cor tuum, et sustine Dominum.

verses.english: A Psalm of David. Offer to the Lord, you divine beings. Offer to the Lord, you mighty ones. Offer to the Lord His glory and honor.
verses.latin: Psalmus David. Afferte Domino, filii Dei, afferte Domino filios arietum. Afferte Domino gloriam et honorem.

verses.english: Offer to the Lord glory in His name. Worship the Lord in His sacred court.
verses.latin: Afferte Domino gloriam nomini eius; adorate Dominum in atrio sancto eius.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord echoes over the waters. The God of Majesty has thundered. The Lord rules over all the mighty waters.
verses.latin: Vox Domini super aquas; Deus majestatis intonuit: Dominus super aquas multas.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord is filled with power. The voice of the Lord is majestic.
verses.latin: Vox Domini in virtute; vox Domini in magnificentia.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord shatters the cedar trees. The Lord shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.latin: Vox Domini confringentis cedros; et confringet Dominus cedros Libani.

verses.english: He makes them, the cedars, leap like a calf from Lebanon. And He makes His beloved land leap like a young wild ox.
verses.latin: Et comminuet eas tamquam vitulum Libani, et dilectus quemadmodum filius unicornium.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord strikes forth flashes of fire.
verses.latin: Vox Domini intercidentis flammam ignis.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord shakes the desert. The Lord makes the desert of Kadesh tremble.
verses.latin: Vox Domini concutientis desertum; et commovebit Dominus desertum Cades.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord causes the deer to give birth, and strips bare the forests. In His sacred temple, everyone will declare His glory.
verses.latin: Vox Domini præparantis cervos, et revelabit condensa: et in templo eius omnes dicent gloriam.

verses.english: The Lord presides over the floodwaters. And the Lord will reign as king forever.
verses.latin: Dominus diluvium inhabitare facit, et sedebit Dominus rex in aeternum.

verses.english: The Lord will give strength to His people. The Lord will bless His people with peace.
verses.latin: Dominus virtutem populo suo dabit; Dominus benedicet populo suo in pace.

verses.english: Offer to the Lord, O celestial beings; offer to the Lord, O powerful ones, your strength.
verses.latin: Afferte Domino, filii Dei, afferte Domino filios arietum.

verses.english: Offer to the Lord glory and honor; offer to the Lord the glory of His name. Worship the Lord in His holy court.
verses.latin: Afferte Domino gloriam et honorem; afferte Domino gloriam nomini ejus; adorate Dominum in atrio sancto ejus.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord is over the vast waters; the God of majesty has thundered; the Lord is enthroned over the mighty waters.
verses.latin: Vox Domini super aquas; Deus majestatis intonuit: Dominus super aquas multas.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord is full of power; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty.
verses.latin: Vox Domini in virtute; vox Domini in magnificentia.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord breaks apart the cedars; indeed, the Lord breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.latin: Vox Domini confringentis cedros, et confringet Dominus cedros Libani.

verses.english: He makes them leap like a young bull of Lebanon, and the beloved land itself skips like a young wild ox.
verses.latin: Et comminuet eas tamquam vitulum Libani, et dilectus quemadmodum filius unicornium.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord strikes forth bolts of lightning.
verses.latin: Vox Domini intercidentis flammam ignis.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord shakes the desert; the Lord causes the desert of Kadesh to tremble.
verses.latin: Vox Domini concutientis desertum; et commovebit Dominus desertum Cades.

verses.english: The voice of the Lord makes the hinds give birth prematurely, and strips bare the dense forests. And in His temple, everyone will proclaim His glory.
verses.latin: Vox Domini præparantis cervos, et revelabit condensa: et in templo ejus omnes dicent gloriam.

verses.english: The Lord presided over the great flood; and the Lord will reign as King forever.
verses.latin: Dominus diluvium inhabitare facit; et sedebit Dominus rex in æternum.

verses.english: The Lord will give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with true peace.
verses.latin: Dominus virtutem populo suo dabit; Dominus benedicet populo suo in pace.

verses.english: For the end. A Psalm of David.
verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.

verses.english: In You, O Lord, I have placed my hope. I will never be confounded or disgraced. By Your justice, set me free.
verses.latin: In te, Domine, speravi, non confundar in aeternum; in justitia tua libera me.

verses.english: Listen closely to me, incline Your ear. Hurry to rescue me. Be my protecting God, my safe home, to deliver me.
verses.latin: Inclina ad me aurem tuam, accelera ut eruas me. Esto mihi in Deum protectorem, et in domum refugii, ut salvum me facias.

verses.english: For You are my strength and my safe place. And for the glory of Your Name, You will lead me and provide for me.
verses.latin: Quoniam fortitudo mea et refugium meum es tu; et propter nomen tuum deduces me et enutries me.

verses.english: You will pull me out of this hidden trap that they set for me, for You are my guardian.
verses.latin: Ejacies me de laqueo hoc quem absconderunt mihi, quoniam tu es protector meus.

verses.english: Into Your hands I entrust my very life. You have saved me, O Lord, God who is truth itself.
verses.latin: In manus tuas commendo spiritum meum; redemisti me, Domine, Deus veritatis.

verses.english: You despise those who foolishly worship worthless things.
verses.latin: Odisti observantes vanitates supervacue.

verses.english: But I, for my part, have put my trust in the Lord.
verses.latin: Ego autem in Domino speravi.

verses.english: I will rejoice and be glad in Your mercy. For You have seen my lowliness, You have delivered my life from desperate distress.
verses.latin: Exsultabo et laetabor in misericordia tua, quoniam respexisti humilitatem meam, salvasti de necessitatibus animam meam.

verses.english: You did not let my enemies trap me. You have given me freedom and a safe place to stand.
verses.latin: Et non conclusisti me in manibus inimici; statuisti in loco spatioso pedes meos.

verses.english: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am in distress. My sight is dim from grief, my soul is consumed by sorrow, and my very body wastes away.
verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam tribulor; conturbatus est in ira oculus meus, anima mea, et venter meus.

verses.english: My life is spent in misery, my years consumed by groans. My strength fails because of my affliction, and my bones are wasting away.
verses.latin: Quoniam defecit in dolore vita mea, et anni mei in gemitibus; infirmata est in paupertate virtus mea, et ossa mea conturbata sunt.

verses.english: Because of all my enemies, I am mocked and shamed. Even my neighbors and my friends are now afraid of me. Everyone who sees me on the street runs away.
verses.latin: Super omnes inimicos meos factus sum opprobrium, et vicinis meis valde, et timor notis meis. Qui videbant me foras fugerunt a me.

verses.english: I am forgotten, as if I were dead and gone from their memory. I am like a broken, useless pot.
verses.latin: Oblivioni datus sum, tamquam mortuus a corde; factus sum tamquam vas perditum.

verses.english: I hear the slanders of many who gather around me. As they conspire against me together, they plan to take my life.
verses.latin: Quoniam audivi vituperationem multorum commorantium in circuitu. In eo dum convenirent simul adversum me, accipere animam meam consiliati sunt.

verses.english: But I, for my part, have trusted in You, O Lord. I declare: 'You are my God!'
verses.latin: Ego autem in te speravi, Domine; dixi: Deus meus es tu.

verses.english: My destiny is in Your hands. Rescue me from the power of my enemies and from those who pursue me.
verses.latin: In manibus tuis sortes meae; eripe me de manu inimicorum meorum, et a persequentibus me.

verses.english: Let Your face shine with favor upon Your servant. Save me because of Your steadfast love.
verses.latin: Illustra faciem tuam super servum tuum; salvum me fac in misericordia tua.

verses.english: O Lord, I will not be put to shame, for I have called upon Your name. Let the wicked be disgraced and cast down into the realm of the dead.
verses.latin: Domine, non confundar, quoniam invocavi te. Erubescant impii, et deducantur in infernum.

verses.english: Let their lying lips be silenced, those who speak evil against the righteous with arrogance and contempt.
verses.latin: Muta fiant labia dolosa, quae loquuntur adversus justum iniquitatem, in superbia et in abusu.

verses.english: How immense is Your goodness, O Lord! You store it up for those who reverence You. You lavish it upon those who trust in You, for all people to see.
verses.latin: Quam magna multitudo dulcedinis tuae, Domine, quam abscondisti timentibus te! Perfecisti eis qui sperant in te, in conspectu filiorum hominum.

verses.english: You keep them safe in Your presence, away from human plotting. You shield them in Your sanctuary from slanderous words.
verses.latin: Abscendes eos in abscondito faciei tuae a conturbatione hominum; proteges eos in tabernaculo a contradictione linguarum.

verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, for He has wondrously shown His faithful love to me as if in a strong, safe city.
verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, quoniam mirificavit misericordiam suam mihi in civitate munita.

verses.english: But I, in my panic and despair, thought: 'I am utterly cut off from Your sight.' Yet You heard my plea when I cried out to You.
verses.latin: Ego autem dixi in excessu mentis meae: Projectus sum a facie oculorum tuorum. Ideo exaudisti vocem orationis meae, dum clamarem ad te.

verses.english: Love the Lord, all His holy ones! For the Lord preserves the faithful, but harshly punishes those who act with arrogance.
verses.latin: Diligite Dominum, omnes sancti ejus, quoniam veritatem requirit Dominus, et retribuit abundantia his qui faciunt superbiam.

verses.english: Be strong and courageous, and let your hearts be strengthened, all of you who place your hope in the Lord.
verses.latin: Viriliter agite, et confortetur cor vestrum, omnes qui speratis in Domino.

verses.english: Blessed are those whose wicked deeds have been forgiven, and whose personal sins have been completely covered by God's mercy.
verses.latin: Beati quorum remissae sunt iniquitates, et quorum tecta sunt peccata.

verses.english: Blessed is the person to whom the Lord does not hold their sin against them, and in whose spirit there is no deceit, no hidden guilt.
verses.latin: Beatus vir cui non imputavit Dominus peccatum, nec est in spiritu ejus dolus.

verses.english: For when I kept silent about my sin and would not confess it, my strength wasted away. My very bones grew weak as I groaned and cried out all day long.
verses.latin: Quoniam tacui, inveteraverunt ossa mea, dum clamarem tota die.

verses.english: For day and night, Your heavy hand of correction was upon me. I was completely exhausted and overwhelmed, like one pierced by a thorn, in my deep distress.
verses.latin: Quoniam die ac nocte gravata est super me manus tua: conversus sum in ærumna mea, dum configitur spina.

verses.english: I made my transgression known to You. And I did not hide my wrongdoing. I said to myself, "I will confess my wrongdoing against myself to the Lord." And You, O Lord, then forgave the wickedness of my sin.
verses.latin: Delictum meum cognitum tibi feci, et injustitiam meam non abscondi. Dixi: Confitebor adversum me injustitiam meam Domino: et tu remisisti impietatem peccati mei.

verses.english: For this reason, every faithful one will pray to You at the proper time of their need. Surely, even when great floods of overwhelming troubles come upon them, these troubles will not come near or overwhelm the faithful.
