verses.latin: Pro hac orabit ad te omnis sanctus in tempore opportuno. Verumtamen in diluvio aquarum multarum, ad eum non approximabunt.

verses.english: You are my safe refuge from the troubles that surround me. You are my joy and my song of triumph. Deliver me from those who would entrap me.
verses.latin: Tu es refugium meum a tribulatione quæ circumdedit me: exsultatio mea, erue me a circumdantibus me.

verses.english: I will give you understanding and insight, says the Lord. And I will teach you the way you should walk. My eyes will be firmly fixed on you, guiding and watching over you.
verses.latin: Intellectum tibi dabo, et instruam te in via hac qua gradieris: firmabo super te oculos meos.

verses.english: Do not be like a horse or a mule, which have no understanding. Their mouths must be restrained with a bit and a bridle; otherwise, they will not come near to you, they will stray.
verses.latin: Nolite fieri sicut equus et mulus, quibus non est intellectus. In camo et freno maxillas eorum constringe, qui non approximant ad te.

verses.english: Many are the scourges and punishments for the wicked who refuse God. But mercy will surround those who put their hope and trust in the Lord.
verses.latin: Multæ flagella peccatoris: sperantem autem in Domino misericordia circumdabit.

verses.english: Rejoice in the Lord! And exult with joy, you righteous ones! And glory in Him, all you who are upright in heart!
verses.latin: Lætamini in Domino, et exsultate justi: et gloriamini omnes recti corde.

verses.english: Rejoice and be joyful, you who are righteous, in the Lord; praise is fitting for those whose hearts are pure.
verses.latin: Exsultate, justi, in Domino; rectos decet laudatio.

verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord with a lyre; sing praises to Him with a ten-stringed harp.
verses.latin: Confitemini Domino in cithara; in psalterio decem chordarum psallite illi.

verses.english: Sing a new song to Him; make music skillfully to Him with loud shouts of joy.
verses.latin: Cantate ei canticum novum; bene psallite ei in vociferatione.

verses.english: For the word of the Lord is right and true, and all of His works are done in faithfulness and truth.
verses.latin: Quia rectum est verbum Domini, et omnia opera ejus in fide sunt.

verses.english: The Lord loves mercy and justice; the earth is full of the Lord's merciful love.
verses.latin: Diligit misericordiam et judicium Dominus; misericordia Domini plena est terra.

verses.english: By the word of the Lord, the universe was made firm, and by the breath of His mouth, all its power and forces came into being.
verses.latin: Verbo Domini caeli firmati sunt, et spiritu oris ejus omnis virtus eorum.

verses.english: He gathers the waters of the sea as if into a waterskin; He places the deep oceans into His storehouses.
verses.latin: Congregans sicut in utre aquas maris; ponens in thesauris abyssos.

verses.english: Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all who inhabit the world stand in awe and reverence of Him.
verses.latin: Timeat Dominum omnis terra; ab eo autem commoveantur omnes inhabitantes orbem.

verses.english: For He spoke, and it came into being; He commanded, and it was created.
verses.latin: Quoniam ipse dixit, et facta sunt; ipse mandavit, et creata sunt.

verses.english: The Lord brings to nothing the plans of the nations; He frustrates the intentions of the peoples, and He rejects the schemes of rulers.
verses.latin: Dominus dissipat consilia gentium; reprobat cogitationes populorum, et reprobat consilia principum.

verses.english: But the plan of the Lord stands firm forever; the intentions of His heart endure from generation to generation.
verses.latin: Consilium autem Domini in aeternum manet; cogitationes cordis ejus in generationem et generationem.

verses.english: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; blessed are the people He has chosen for His own inheritance.
verses.latin: Beata gens cujus est Dominus Deus ejus; populus quem elegit in haereditatem sibi.

verses.english: From the created sky, the Lord looked down; He saw all the children of humankind.
verses.latin: De caelo respexit Dominus; vidit omnes filios hominum.

verses.english: From His prepared dwelling, He looked down upon all those who inhabit the earth.
verses.latin: De praeparato habitaculo suo respexit super omnes qui habitant terram.

verses.english: He who formed each of their hearts individually; He who understands all of their works.
verses.latin: Qui finxit singillatim corda eorum; qui intelligit omnia opera eorum.

verses.english: A king is not saved by a great army; nor is a warrior rescued by his great strength.
verses.latin: Non salvatur rex in multa virtute; et gigas non salvabitur in multitudine virtutis suae.

verses.english: A war-horse is a deceptive means of salvation; nor will it deliver anyone by its abundant power.
verses.latin: Fallax equus ad salutem; in abundantia autem virtutis suae non salvabitur.

verses.english: Behold, the eyes of the Lord are upon those who fear Him; and upon those who hope in His merciful love.
verses.latin: Ecce oculi Domini super metuentes eum; et in eis qui sperant super misericordia ejus:

verses.english: He watches over them to deliver their souls from death; and to keep them alive during times of famine.
verses.latin: Ut eruat a morte animas eorum; et alat eos in fame.

verses.english: Our soul waits patiently for the Lord; for He is our helper and our protector.
verses.latin: Anima nostra sustinet Dominum; quoniam adjutor et protector noster est.

verses.english: For in Him our heart will rejoice; and in His holy name we will place our hope.
verses.latin: Quia in eo laetabitur cor nostrum; et in nomine sancto ejus sperabimus.

verses.english: Let Your merciful love, O Lord, be upon us; just as we have hoped in You.
verses.latin: Fiat misericordia tua, Domine, super nos; quemadmodum speravimus in te.

verses.english: Rejoice in the Lord, you who are righteous; praise is fitting for those whose hearts are upright.
verses.latin: Exsultate, justi, in Domino; rectos decet laudatio.

verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord with the zither; sing to Him with a ten-stringed psaltery.
verses.latin: Confitemini Domino in cithara; in psalterio decem chordarum psallite illi.

verses.english: Sing to Him a new song; play skillfully and shout for joy to Him.
verses.latin: Cantate ei canticum novum; bene psallite ei in vociferatione.

verses.english: Because the word of the Lord is right and true, and all His works are done with faithfulness.
verses.latin: Quia rectum est verbum Domini, et omnia opera ejus in fide.

verses.english: He loves mercy and justice; the whole earth is filled with the Lord's mercy and unfailing love.
verses.latin: Diligit misericordiam et judicium; misericordia Domini plena est terra.

verses.english: By the word of the Lord, the universe was established, and by the breath of His mouth, all its power came into being.
verses.latin: Verbo Domini caeli firmati sunt, et spiritu oris ejus omnis virtus eorum.

verses.english: He gathered the waters of the sea like a wineskin, storing the deep waters in His hidden treasuries.
verses.latin: Congregans sicut in utre aquas maris; ponens in thesauris abyssos.

verses.english: Let all the earth fear the Lord; let all who live in the world tremble before Him.
verses.latin: Timeat Dominum omnis terra; ab eo autem commoveantur omnes inhabitantes orbem.

verses.english: For He spoke, and it came to be; He commanded, and it was created and stood firm.
verses.latin: Quoniam ipse dixit, et facta sunt; ipse mandavit, et creata sunt.

verses.english: The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations; He thwarts the schemes of the peoples and rejects the counsels of their leaders.
verses.latin: Dominus dissipat consilia gentium; repellit autem cogitationes populorum, et reprobat consilia principum.

verses.english: But the Lord's plan stands forever; the intentions of His heart endure from generation to generation.
verses.latin: Consilium autem Domini in aeternum manet; cogitationes cordis ejus in generationem et generationem.

verses.english: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord; blessed are the people He has chosen as His own inheritance.
verses.latin: Beata gens cujus est Dominus Deus ejus; populus quem elegit in haereditatem sibi.

verses.english: From the universe, the Lord looked down; He saw all the children of mankind.
verses.latin: De caelo respexit Dominus; vidit omnes filios hominum.

verses.english: From His established dwelling place, He looked upon all who live on the earth.
verses.latin: De praeparato habitaculo suo respexit super omnes qui habitant terram;

verses.english: He who formed each of their hearts individually; He who understands all their works and actions.
verses.latin: qui finxit singillatim corda eorum; qui intelligit omnia opera eorum.

verses.english: A king is not saved by his great army, nor is a warrior rescued by his vast strength.
verses.latin: Non salvatur rex per multam virtutem, et gigas non salvabitur in multitudine virtutis suae.

verses.english: A warhorse is a deceitful hope for victory; despite its great power, it cannot deliver salvation.
verses.latin: Fallax equus ad salutem; in abundantia autem virtutis suae non salvabitur.

verses.english: Behold, the eyes of the Lord are upon those who fear Him; upon those who hope in His mercy.
verses.latin: Ecce oculi Domini super metuentes eum; et in eis qui sperant super misericordia ejus;

verses.english: He watches over them to rescue their souls from death and to sustain them during famine.
verses.latin: ut eruat a morte animas eorum; et alat eos in fame.

verses.english: Our soul waits patiently for the Lord, for He is our helper and our shield.
verses.latin: Anima nostra sustinet Dominum, quoniam adjutor et protector noster est.

verses.english: Because in Him our heart will rejoice, and we have trusted in His holy Name.
verses.latin: Quia in eo laetabitur cor nostrum, et in nomine sancto ejus speravimus.

verses.english: Let Your mercy, O Lord, be upon us, just as we have hoped in You.
verses.latin: Fiat misericordia tua, Domine, super nos, quemadmodum speravimus in te.

verses.english: This is a psalm of David. He wrote it when he pretended to be insane in front of King Abimelech, who then sent him away.
verses.latin: Psalmus David, cum immutavit vultum suum coram Abimelech, et dimisit eum, et abiit.

verses.english: I will give thanks to the Lord at all times and in every circumstance; His praise will always be upon my lips.
verses.latin: Benedicam Dominum in omni tempore; semper laus ejus in ore meo.

verses.english: My soul will praise the Lord, finding its glory in Him. Let all those who are humble and gentle hear this, and let them rejoice.
verses.latin: In Domino laudabitur anima mea: audiant mansueti, et lætentur.

verses.english: Join with me in praising the Lord; let us together lift up His holy name.
verses.latin: Magnificate Dominum mecum: et exaltemus nomen ejus in idipsum.

verses.english: I sought the Lord in my distress, and He heard my prayer; He rescued me from every single one of my troubles.
verses.latin: Exquisivi Dominum, et exaudivit me; et ex omnibus tribulationibus meis eripuit me.

verses.english: Come close to God, and He will give you light and understanding; then you will not be ashamed or disappointed.
verses.latin: Accedite ad eum, et illuminamini; et facies vestræ non confundentur.

verses.english: This poor man cried out to God for help, and the Lord heard him; He saved him from all of his afflictions.
verses.latin: Iste pauper clamavit, et Dominus exaudivit eum; et ex omnibus tribulationibus ejus salvavit eum.

verses.english: The angel of the Lord camps around those who revere Him, protecting them; and He rescues them from danger.
verses.latin: Immittet angelus Domini in circuitu timentium eum; et eripiet eos.

verses.english: Experience for yourselves and see how good the Lord is; blessed is the man who trusts in Him.
verses.latin: Gustate et videte quoniam suavis est Dominus; beatus vir qui sperat in eo.

verses.english: Respect and revere the Lord, all you His holy ones, because those who truly fear Him lack nothing good.
verses.latin: Timete Dominum, omnes sancti ejus, quoniam non est inopia timentibus eum.

verses.english: Even the wealthy often suffer want and hunger; but those who diligently seek the Lord will never lack any good thing.
verses.latin: Divites eguerunt et esurierunt; inquirentes autem Dominum non minuentur omni bono.

verses.english: Come, my children, and listen to me; I will teach you what it means to truly revere the Lord.
verses.latin: Venite, filii, audite me; timorem Domini docebo vos.

verses.english: Who is the man who desires true life, and longs to see many good days?
verses.latin: Quis est homo qui vult vitam, diligit dies videre bonos?

verses.english: Keep your tongue from speaking evil, and your lips from uttering deceitful words.
verses.latin: Prohibe linguam tuam a malo, et labia tua ne loquantur dolum.

verses.english: Turn away from doing evil, and instead do what is good; seek peace actively, and follow after it.
verses.latin: Diverte a malo, et fac bonum; inquire pacem, et persequere eam.

verses.english: The Lord's gaze is upon those who are righteous, and His ears are open to their prayers.
verses.latin: Oculi Domini super justos, et aures ejus in preces eorum.

verses.english: But the Lord is set against those who do evil, intending to erase their memory from the face of the earth.
verses.latin: Vultus autem Domini super facientes mala, ut perdat de terra memoriam eorum.

verses.english: When the righteous cry out to Him, the Lord hears them; and He delivers them from all their troubles.
verses.latin: Clamaverunt justi, et Dominus exaudivit eos; et ex omnibus tribulationibus eorum liberavit eos.

verses.english: The Lord is close to those whose hearts are broken and contrite; He saves those who are humble in spirit.
verses.latin: Juxta est Dominus his qui tribulato sunt corde, et humiles spiritu salvabit.

verses.english: The righteous will experience many hardships; yet, from all these, the Lord will deliver them.
verses.latin: Multæ tribulationes justorum; et de omnibus his liberabit eos Dominus.

verses.english: The Lord protects every part of their being, down to their very bones; not one of them will be broken.
verses.latin: Custodit Dominus omnia ossa eorum; unum ex his non conteretur.

verses.english: The death of sinners is a terrible end; and those who hate the righteous will be punished for their offenses.
verses.latin: Mors peccatorum pessima; et qui oderunt justum delinquent.

verses.english: The Lord will redeem the souls of His servants; and none of those who place their hope in Him will be condemned or found guilty.
verses.latin: Redimet Dominus animas servorum suorum; et non delinquent omnes qui sperant in eo.
In finem. Psalmus David. Judica, Domine, nocentes me: expugna impugnantes me.
verses.english: For the end. A Psalm of David. Judge, Lord, those who would harm me; fight those who attack me.

verses.latin: Apprehende arma et scutum: et exsurge in adjutorium mihi.
verses.english: Pick up your weapons and your shield, and come to help me!

verses.latin: Effunde frameam, et conclude adversus eos qui persequuntur me: dic animae meae: Salus tua ego sum.
verses.english: Draw your sword, and close in on those who are chasing me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation!”

verses.latin: Confundantur et revereantur quaerentes animam meam. Avertantur retrorsum, et confundantur cogitantes mihi mala.
verses.english: Let those who seek to destroy my life be shamed and disgraced. Let those who plot evil against me be turned back and confused.

verses.latin: Fiant tamquam pulvis ante faciem venti: et angelus Domini coarctans eos.
verses.english: Let them become like dust before the wind, and let the angel of the Lord oppress them.

verses.latin: Fiat via illorum tenebrae et lubricum: et angelus Domini persequens eos.
verses.english: Let their path be dark and slippery, and let the angel of the Lord pursue them.

verses.latin: Quoniam gratis absconderunt mihi interitum laquei sui: et sine causa exprobraverunt animam meam.
verses.english: For they have hidden the pitfall of their net for me without cause, and they have attacked my soul without cause.

verses.latin: Veniat illi laqueus quem ignorat: et captio quam abscondit, apprehendat eum: et in laqueum cadat in ipsum.
verses.english: Let destruction come upon him unexpectedly; let the trap he set catch him, and let him fall into it.

verses.latin: Anima autem mea exsultabit in Domino: et delectabitur super salutari suo.
verses.english: Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord, and delight in His salvation.

verses.latin: Omnia ossa mea dicent: Domine, quis similis tibi? Eripiens inopem de manu fortiorum ejus: egenum et pauperem a diripientibus eum.
verses.english: All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like you?” You rescue the poor from the hands of the strong, and the needy from those who would plunder them.

verses.latin: Surgentes testes iniqui: quae ignorabam interrogabant me.
verses.english: Those who accuse me falsely rise up; they question me about things I do not know.

verses.latin: Retribue mihi bona pro malis: et sterilitatem pro anima mea.
verses.english: They repay me evil for good, and cause me to suffer.

verses.latin: Ego autem cum mihi molesti essent, induebar cilicio.
verses.english: But as for me, when they were attacking me, I put on sackcloth,

verses.latin: Humiliabam in jejunio animam meam: et oratio mea in sinu meo convertetur.
verses.english: I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer will be returned to my own heart.

verses.latin: Quasi proximo, et fratri nostro, sic complacebam: quasi lugens et contristatus, sic humiliabar.
verses.english: I acted as if they were my neighbor and brother; I mourned as if I was grieving and humbled.

verses.latin: Et adversum me laetati sunt, et convenerunt: congregata sunt super me flagella, et ignoravi.
verses.english: But they rejoiced against me and gathered together; they gathered against me to bring trouble, and I did not know it.

verses.latin: Dissipati sunt, nec compuncti: frenduerunt super me dentibus suis.
verses.english: They were scattered, they did not relent; they gnashed their teeth against me.

verses.latin: Domine, quando respicies? Restitue animam meam a nequitiis eorum, a leonibus unicam meam.
verses.english: Lord, when will you look? Rescue my soul from their wickedness, from these lions, my life.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi in ecclesia magna: in populo gravi laudabo te.
verses.english: I will give thanks to you in the great assembly; I will praise you among the great people.

verses.latin: Non supergaudeant mihi qui adversantur mihi inique: qui oderunt me gratis, et annuunt oculis.
verses.english: Let not those who are wrongly attacking me rejoice over me; they hate me without cause, and they wink their eyes.

verses.latin: Quoniam mihi quidem proponebant pacem: et loquentes in ira, dolos cogitabant.
verses.english: For they do not speak of peace to me, but they speak of treachery, devising deceit in their hearts.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Euge, euge, vidit oculus noster.
verses.english: They said, “Aha, aha, our eyes have seen what we wanted!

verses.latin: Vidisti, Domine, ne sileas: Domine, ne discedas a me.
verses.english: You have seen this, Lord, do not be silent; Lord, do not withdraw from me!

verses.latin: Exsurge, et intende judicio meo: Deus meus et Dominus meus in causam meam.
verses.english: Arise and awake for my vindication, for my cause, O my God and my Lord.

verses.latin: Judica me secundum justitiam tuam, Domine Deus meus, et non supergaudeant mihi.
verses.english: Judge me according to your righteousness, O Lord my God, and let them not rejoice over me.

verses.latin: Non dicant in cordibus suis: Euge, euge, desiderium animae nostrae. Nec dicant: Devoravimus eum.
verses.english: Do not let them say in their hearts, “Aha, our hearts’ desire!” Nor let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”

verses.latin: Confundantur et revereantur simul, qui gratulantur malis meis: induantur confusione et verecundia qui magna loquuntur adversum me.
verses.english: Let those who rejoice at my misfortune be ashamed and disgraced; let those who boast against me be clothed with shame and dishonor.

verses.latin: Exsultent et laetentur qui volunt justitiam meam: et dicant semper: Magnificetur Dominus, qui volunt pacem servi sui.
verses.english: Let those who desire my vindication shout for joy and be glad; and let them say continually, “The Lord be magnified, who delights in the peace of His servant.”

verses.latin: Et lingua mea meditabitur justitiam tuam: tota die laudem tuam.
verses.english: And my tongue will meditate on your righteousness and your praise all day long.

verses.latin: Usquequo, Domine, oblivisceris me in finem? usquequo avertis faciem tuam a me?
verses.english: How long, O Lord, will you completely forget me? How long will you turn your face away from me?

verses.latin: Quamdiu ponam consilia in anima mea, dolorem in corde meo per diem?
verses.english: How long will I be forced to consider my anguish in my soul, and my pain in my heart every day?

verses.latin: Usquequo exaltabitur inimicus meus super me? respice et exaudi me, Domine Deus meus.
verses.english: How long will my enemy have power over me? Consider this, and hear me, O Lord my God.

verses.latin: Illumina oculos meos, ne unquam obdormiam in morte, ne quando dicat inimicus meus: Praevalui adversus eum.
verses.english: Enlighten my eyes. Do not ever let me sleep the sleep of death. Otherwise, my enemy will be able to say, 'I have prevailed against him.'

verses.latin: Qui tribulant me, exsultabunt si motus fuero: ego autem in misericordia tua speravi.
verses.english: Those who afflict me will rejoice if I am moved and fall. But I have put my hope in your mercy.

verses.latin: Exsultabit cor meum in salutari tuo: cantabo Domino, qui bona mihi tribuit.
verses.english: My heart will rejoice at your salvation. I will sing to the Lord, because He has given me good things.

verses.latin: Retribuet mihi Dominus secundum justitiam meam, et secundum puritatem manuum mearum in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: The Lord will reward me according to my righteousness, and according to the purity of my hands in his sight.

verses.latin: Quoniam custodivi vias Domini, nec impie gessi a Deo meo.
verses.english: Because I have kept the ways of the Lord, and I have not acted wickedly against my God.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnia judicia ejus in conspectu meo: et justificationes ejus non repuli a me.
verses.english: Because all his judgments are before me; and I have not rejected his justifications.

verses.latin: Et ero immaculatus cum eo: et custodiam me ab iniquitate.
verses.english: And I will be blameless with Him; and I will keep myself from sin.

verses.latin: Et retribuet mihi Dominus secundum justitiam meam, et secundum puritatem manuum mearum in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: And the Lord will reward me according to my righteousness, and according to the purity of my hands in his sight.

verses.latin: Cum sancto sanctus eris, et cum viro innocente innocens eris:
verses.english: You will be holy with the holy, and innocent with the innocent man.

verses.latin: et cum electo electus eris, et cum perverso perverteris.
verses.english: And you will be chosen with the chosen, and with the perverse, you will be perverse.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu populum humilem salvum facies, et oculos superborum humiliabis.
verses.english: For you will save a humble people, and you will bring down the eyes of the proud.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu illuminas lucernam meam, Domine Deus meus: illumina tenebras meas.
verses.english: For you will light my lamp, O Lord my God; illuminate my darkness.

verses.latin: Quoniam in te eripiar a tentatione, et in Deo meo transgrediar murum.
verses.english: For I will be rescued from the temptation in you, and in my God I will cross over the wall.

verses.latin: Deus, via ejus immaculata: eloquia Domini igne examinata: protector est omnium sperantium in se.
verses.english: God's way is immaculate. The words of the Lord are tested by fire; He is the protector of all who hope in Him.

verses.latin: Quis est Deus praeter Dominum? aut quis Deus praeter Deum nostrum?
verses.english: Who is God besides the Lord? Or who is God except our God?

verses.latin: Deus, qui praecinxit me virtute: et posuit immaculatam viam meam.
verses.english: God, who has armed me with virtue, and has made my way immaculate.

verses.latin: Qui perfecit pedes meos quasi cervorum: et super excelsa statuentem me.
verses.english: Who has made my feet like the feet of the deer, and has established me on high places.

verses.latin: Qui docet manus meas ad praelium: et posuisti, ut arcum aereum, brachia mea.
verses.english: Who teaches my hands for battle, and you have made my arms like a bronze bow.

verses.latin: Et dedisti mihi protectionem salutis tuae: et dextera tua suscepit me: et disciplina tua correxit me in finem: et ipsa disciplina tua docuit me.
verses.english: And you have given me the protection of your salvation; and your right hand has sustained me. Your discipline has corrected me to the end; and your discipline has taught me.

verses.latin: Dilatasti gressus meos subtus me: et non sunt infirmata vestigia mea.
verses.english: You have enlarged my steps beneath me, and my footsteps have not weakened.

verses.latin: Persequar inimicos meos, et comprehendam illos: et non convertar donec deficiant.
verses.english: I will pursue my enemies and I will comprehend them; and I will not turn back until they are finished.

verses.latin: Conteram illos, nec poterunt stare: cadent subtus pedes meos.
verses.english: I will shatter them, and they will not be able to stand; they will fall beneath my feet.

verses.latin: Et praecinxisti me virtute ad bellum: et supplantasti insurgentes in me.
verses.english: And you have girded me with virtue for battle; and you have made those who rise against me to stumble.

verses.latin: Et inimicos meos dedisti mihi dorsum, et odientes me disperdisti.
verses.english: And you have given my enemies their backs to me, and you have destroyed those who hate me.

verses.latin: Clamaverunt, et non erat qui salvos faceret: ad Dominum, et non exaudivit eos.
verses.english: They cried out, and there was no one to save them; to the Lord, and he did not hear them.

verses.latin: Et comminuam eos ut pulverem ante faciem venti: ut lutum platearum conteram eos.
verses.english: And I will crush them like dust before the face of the wind. I will trample them like the mud of the streets.

verses.latin: Eripies me de contradictionibus populi: constitues me in caput gentium.
verses.english: You will rescue me from the contradictions of the people; you will establish me as the head of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Populus quem ignoro, servivit mihi: in auditu auris obedivit mihi.
verses.english: A people I do not know has served me; at the hearing of the ear, they have obeyed me.

verses.latin: Filii alieni mentiti sunt mihi: filii alieni inveteraverunt, et claudicaverunt a semitis suis.
verses.english: Foreign children have lied to me; foreign children have grown old, and they have faltered from their paths.

verses.latin: Vivit Dominus, et benedictus Deus meus: et exaltetur Deus salutis meae.
verses.english: The Lord lives, and blessed is my God, and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

verses.latin: Deus, qui das vindictam mihi, et subdis populos sub me.
verses.english: God, who gives me vengeance, and subjects the peoples under me.

verses.latin: Liberator meus de inimicis meis iracundis: ab insurgentibus in me exaltabis me: a viro iniquo eripies me.
verses.english: My liberator from my wrathful enemies. You will exalt me from those who rise up against me; you will rescue me from the wicked man.

verses.latin: Propterea confitebor tibi in gentibus, Domine: et nomini tuo psalmum dicam.
verses.english: Therefore, I will confess to you among the Gentiles, O Lord; and I will sing a psalm to your name.

verses.latin: Magnificans salutes regis ejus, et faciens misericordiam Christo suo David, et semini ejus in saeculum.
verses.english: Magnifying the saving acts of his King, and showing mercy to his Christ, David, and to his seed forever.

verses.latin: Noli æmulari in malignántibus, neque zelaveris faciéntes iniquitátem.
verses.english: Don't be jealous of evildoers or those who make a habit of doing what is evil.

verses.latin: Quóniam tamquam fænum velocíter aridéscent: et quemádmodum olera vírcium cito décident.
verses.english: Their success is brief like grass—it quickly dries up. They are like all those plants that quickly die.

verses.latin: Spera in Dómino, et fac bonitátem: et inhábita terram, et pascéris in divítiis ejus.
verses.english: Trust in the Lord and be good; remain on the land, and He will nourish your soul.

verses.latin: Delectáre in Dómino: et dabit tibi petitiónes cordis tui.
verses.english: Find joy in the Lord, and He will grant what you ask for.

verses.latin: Revéla Dómino viam tuam, et spera in eo: et ipse fáciet.
verses.english: Entrust your way to the Lord; trust in Him, and He will act.

verses.latin: Et edúcet quasi lumen justítiam tuam: et judícium tuum tamquam merídiem.
verses.english: He will cause your justice to shine like light and your judgment like the midday sun.

verses.latin: Subjéctus esto Dómino, et ora eum. Noli æmulári in eo qui prosperátur in via sua: in hómine faciénte injústítias.
verses.english: Submit to the Lord and pray to Him. Don't be jealous of those who succeed through their own means or of people who do wrong.

verses.latin: Désine ab ira, et derelinque furórem: noli æmulári ut malitáre.
verses.english: Refrain from anger, and abandon fury; don't be jealous and resort to evil.

verses.latin: Quóniam qui malígnantur, exterminabúntur: sustinéntes autem Dóminum, ipsi hereditábunt terram.
verses.english: Because those who do evil will be destroyed, but those who trust in the Lord will inherit the land.

verses.latin: Et adhuc pusíllum, et non erit peccátor: et quæres locum ejus, et non invénies.
verses.english: Yet a little while, and the sinner will be no more; you will search for him, but you will not find him.

verses.latin: Mansuéti autem hereditábunt terram: et delectabúntur in multitúdine pacis.
verses.english: But the meek will inherit the land and will delight in the abundance of peace.

verses.latin: Peccátor observat justum: et stridet super eum déntibus suis.
verses.english: The sinner plots against the righteous and gnashes his teeth at him.

verses.latin: Dóminus autem irridébit eum, quóniam próspicit quod vénerit dies ejus.
verses.english: But the Lord will laugh at him because He sees that his day is coming.

verses.latin: Gládium evaginavérunt peccatóres: intenderunt arcum suum, ut dejíciant páuperem et ínopem, et trucídent rectos corde.
verses.english: The sinners have drawn their sword and bent their bow to strike the poor and needy, to slaughter the upright of heart.

verses.latin: Gladius eórum intret in corda ipsórum: et arcus eórum confringátur.
verses.english: Let their sword enter their own hearts, and let their bow be broken.

verses.latin: Mélius est módicum justo, super divítias peccatórum multas.
verses.english: Better is a little that the righteous has than the great wealth of the wicked.

verses.latin: Quóniam brácchia peccatórum confringéntur: confírmat autem justos Dóminus.
verses.english: Because the arms of the sinners will be broken, but the Lord upholds the righteous.

verses.latin: Novit Dóminus dies immaculatórum: et heréditas eórum in ætérnum erit.
verses.english: The Lord knows the days of the blameless, and their inheritance will be eternal.

verses.latin: Non confundéntur in témpore malo, et in diébus famis saturabúntur: quia qui impii, consúmentur.
verses.english: They will not be ashamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they will be satisfied; because the wicked will be consumed.

verses.latin: Quóniam inimíci Dómini, ut honorificáti fúerint et exaltáti: deficiéntes quemádmodum fumus defícient.
verses.english: For the enemies of the Lord, though they may be honored and exalted, will vanish like smoke.

verses.latin: Mutuabitur peccátor, et non solvet: justus autem miserebitur et tríbuet.
verses.english: The sinner borrows but does not pay back, but the righteous shows mercy and gives.

verses.latin: Quia benedícentes ei hereditábunt terram: maledicéntes autem ei, disperíbunt.
verses.english: For those whom He blesses will inherit the land, but those whom He curses will perish.

verses.latin: Apud Dóminum gressus hóminis dirigéntur: et viam ejus voluerit, dilatábit.
verses.english: The steps of a man are directed by the Lord, and when He desires his way, He makes it wide.

verses.latin: Cum cecíderit, non collidétur, quia Dóminus súbicit manum suam.
verses.english: Though he falls, he will not be crushed, because the Lord sustains him with His hand.

verses.latin: Júnior fui, etenim sénui: et non vidi justum derelíctum, nec semen ejus quærens panem.
verses.english: I was young and now I am old, and I have not seen the righteous forsaken or his children begging for bread.

verses.latin: Tota die miserétur et commodat: et semen ejus in benedictióne erit.
verses.english: All day long, the righteous shows mercy and lends, and his seed will be a blessing.

verses.latin: Declína a malo, et fac bonum: et inhábita in sæculum sæculi.
verses.english: Turn away from evil and do good, and remain forever.

verses.latin: Quia Dóminus amat judícium, et non derelinquet sanctos suos: in ætérnum conservabúntur.
verses.english: Because the Lord loves justice and will not forsake His saints; they will be preserved forever.

verses.latin: Iníqui puniéntur: et semen impiórum períbit.
verses.english: The wicked will be punished, and the seed of the impious will perish.

verses.latin: Justi autem hereditábunt terram: et inhabitábunt in sæculum sæculi super eam.
verses.english: But the righteous will inherit the land and will dwell on it forever.

verses.latin: Os justi meditábitur sapiéntiam: et lingua ejus loquétur judícium.
verses.english: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks of justice.

verses.latin: Lex Dei ejus in corde ipsíus: et non supplantabúntur gressus ejus.
verses.english: The law of his God is in his heart, and his steps will not be tripped up.

verses.latin: Consíderat peccátor justum: et quærit mortificáre eum.
verses.english: The sinner watches the righteous and seeks to kill him.

verses.latin: Dóminus autem non derelinquet eum in mánibus ejus: nec damnábit eum cum judicábitur illi.
verses.english: But the Lord will not leave him in his hands nor condemn him when he is judged.

verses.latin: Exspécta Dóminum, et custódi viam ejus: et exaltábit te ut hereditátes terram: cum períerint peccatóres, vidébis.
verses.english: Wait for the Lord and keep His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land; you will see when the sinners are destroyed.

verses.latin: Vidi ímpius superexaltátum, et elevátum sicut cedros Líbani.
verses.english: I have seen the wicked exalted and lifted up like the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.latin: Et transívi, et ecce non erat: et quæsívi eum, et non est invéntus locus ejus.
verses.english: Then I passed by, and behold, he was gone; I searched for him, but his place could not be found.

verses.latin: Custódi innocéntiam, et vide æquitátem: quóniam est relíquiis hómini pacem.
verses.english: Guard innocence and look to integrity, because there is a future for the man of peace.

verses.latin: Iníqui autem disperíbunt simul: relíquiæ impiórum períbunt.
verses.english: But the wicked will perish together, and the future of the impious will be destroyed.

verses.latin: Salus autem justórum a Dómino: et protéctor eórum in témpore tribulatiónis.
verses.english: But the salvation of the righteous comes from the Lord, and He is their protector in the time of tribulation.

verses.latin: Et adjuvábit eos Dóminus, et liberábit eos: et éruet eos a peccatóribus, et salvábit eos: quia speravérunt in eo.
verses.english: And the Lord will help them and deliver them; He will rescue them from the sinners and save them, because they have hoped in Him.

verses.latin: Domine, ne in furore tuo arguas me, neque in ira tua corripias me.
verses.english: Lord, do not rebuke me in your anger, nor correct me in your wrath.

verses.latin: Quoniam sagittae tuae infixae sunt mihi: et confirmasti super me manum tuam.
verses.english: Because your arrows have struck me, and your hand has pressed down upon me.

verses.latin: Non est sanitas in carne mea a facie irae tuae: non est pax ossibus meis a facie peccatorum meorum.
verses.english: My body is in pain because of your anger, and my bones have no rest because of my sins.

verses.latin: Quoniam iniquitates meae supergressae sunt caput meum: sicut onus grave gravatae sunt super me.
verses.english: My sins have overwhelmed me; they are a heavy burden, too heavy for me to bear.

verses.latin: Putruerunt et corruerunt cicatrices meae a facie insipientiae meae.
verses.english: My wounds are foul and festering because of my foolishness.

verses.latin: Laboravi et curvatus sum usque in finem: tota die contristatus ibam.
verses.english: I am bowed down and brought low; all day long I go about mourning.

verses.latin: Quoniam lumbi mei impleti sunt illusionibus: et non est sanitas in carne mea.
verses.english: My loins are filled with fever, and there is no health in my body.

verses.latin: Defectus sum et humiliatus sum nimis: rugiebam a gemitu cordis mei.
verses.english: I am feeble and utterly crushed; I groan because of the anguish of my heart.

verses.latin: Domine, ante te omne desiderium meum: et gemitus meus a te non est absconditus.
verses.english: Lord, all my longing is before you; my sighing is not hidden from you.

verses.latin: Cor meum conturbatum est: dereliquit me virtus mea, et lux oculorum meorum, et ipsa non est mecum.
verses.english: My heart pounds, my strength fails me; even the light of my eyes is gone from me.

verses.latin: Amici mei et proximi mei ante me appropinquaverunt, et steterunt: et qui juxta me erant, de longe steterunt.
verses.english: My friends and companions avoid me because of my affliction; my neighbors stand far off.

verses.latin: Et qui quaerebant animam meam, insidiabantur mihi: et qui quaerebant mala mihi, locuti sunt vana, et dolos tota die meditabantur.
verses.english: Those who seek my life set traps for me, those who want to harm me speak of ruin and meditate treachery all day long.

verses.latin: Ego autem, tamquam surdus, non audiebam: et sicut mutus non aperiens os suum.
verses.english: But I, like the deaf, do not hear; I am like the mute, who cannot open his mouth.

verses.latin: Et factus sum sicut homo non audiens, et non habens in ore suo redargutiones.
verses.english: I am like one who does not hear, whose mouth cannot offer a retort.

verses.latin: Quoniam in te, Domine, speravi: tu exaudies me, Domine Deus meus.
verses.english: I wait for you, Lord; you will answer, Lord my God.

verses.latin: Quia dixi: Nequando supergaudeant mihi inimici mei: et dum conmoverentur pedes mei, super me magna locuti sunt.
verses.english: I said, “Do not let them gloat over me, those who triumph when my foot slips.”

verses.latin: Quoniam ego in flagella paratus sum: et dolor meus in conspectu meo semper.
verses.english: For I am ready to fall, and my pain is ever with me.

verses.latin: Quoniam iniquitatem meam annuntiabo: et cogitabo pro peccato meo.
verses.english: I confess my iniquity; I am sorry for my sin.

verses.latin: Verumtamen inimici mei vivunt, et confirmati sunt super me: et multiplicati sunt qui oderunt me inique.
verses.english: My enemies are vigorous, and those who hate me without cause are numerous.

verses.latin: Qui retribuebant mala pro bonis, detrahebant mihi: quoniam sequebar bonitatem.
verses.english: Those who repay good with evil, they slander me for pursuing good.

verses.latin: Ne derelinquas me, Domine Deus meus: ne discesseris a me.
verses.english: Do not forsake me, Lord; do not be far from me, my God.

verses.latin: Intende in adjutorium meum, Domine Deus salutis meae.
verses.english: Come quickly to help me, O Lord, my Savior.

verses.latin: Dixi: Custodiam vias meas: ut non delinquam in lingua mea. Posui ori meo custodiam, cum consisteret peccator contra me.
verses.english: I said: “I will keep myself from sin, so that I do not sin with my words.” I put a watch over my mouth when wicked men were present, speaking against me.

verses.latin: Obmutui, et humiliatus sum, et silui a bonis: et dolor meus renovatus est.
verses.english: I was silent, and humbled myself, and held my tongue, even from doing good. But my pain was renewed.

verses.latin: Concaluit cor meum intra me: et in meditatione mea exardescet ignis.
verses.english: My heart grew hot within me, and in my meditation, a fire blazed up.

verses.latin: Locutus sum in lingua mea: Notum fac mihi, Domine, finem meum: et numerum dierum meorum quis est? ut sciam quid desit mihi.
verses.english: I spoke then with my tongue: “Show me, Lord, what is my end, and what is the number of my days, so that I might know what I truly lack.”

verses.latin: Ecce mensurabiles posuisti dies meos: et substantia mea tanquam nihilum ante te. Verumtamen universa vanitas, omnis homo vivens.
verses.english: Behold, you have measured out my days, and my substance is as nothing before you. Yes, every man living is mere vanity.

verses.latin: Vere in imagine pertransit homo: sed frustra conturbatur. Thesaurizat: et ignorat cui congregabit ea.
verses.english: Truly, man walks about as a shadow, and he is troubled in vain. He gathers riches but doesn't know who will possess them.

verses.latin: Et nunc, quæ est expectatio mea? Nonne Dominus? et substantia mea apud te est.
verses.english: And now, what is my expectation? Is it not the Lord? And my hope is in you.

verses.latin: Ab omnibus iniquitatibus meis libera me: opprobrium insipientis ne dederis me.
verses.english: Deliver me from all my iniquities. Do not make me a disgrace to the foolish.

verses.latin: Obmutui, et non aperui os meum, quoniam tu fecisti me.
verses.english: I was silent and did not open my mouth, because you have done this.

verses.latin: Amove a me plagas tuas: a fortitudine manus tuae ego defeci.
verses.english: Remove your plagues from me. I am worn out by the power of your hand.

verses.latin: In correptionibus propter iniquitatem corripuisti hominem. Et sicut tinea, tabescere fecisti animam ejus: verumtamen in vanum omnis homo.
verses.english: With rebuke, you have corrected man for iniquity. And like a moth, you have made his soul waste away. Yet, every man is but vanity.

verses.latin: Exaudi orationem meam, Domine, et deprecationem meam; auribus percipe lacrimas meas. Ne sileas: quoniam advena ego sum apud te, et peregrinus sicut omnes patres mei.
verses.english: Hear my prayer, Lord, and heed my supplication. Give ear to my tears. Do not be silent, for I am a stranger before you and a pilgrim like all my fathers.

verses.latin: Remitte mihi, ut refrigerer priusquam abeam, et amplius non ero.
verses.english: Forgive me, that I may be refreshed before I go away and be seen no more.

verses.latin: Exspectans exspectavi Dominum, et intendit mihi.
verses.english: I waited and waited on the Lord, and He turned to me.

verses.latin: Et exaudivit preces meas: et eduxit me de lacu miseriæ et de luto fæcis.
verses.english: He heard my prayers and took me out of the pit of misery and the mud of the swamp.

verses.latin: Et statuit super petram pedes meos, et direxit gressus meos.
verses.english: He set my feet on solid ground, and made my steps sure.

verses.latin: Et immisit in os meum canticum novum, carmen Deo nostro.
verses.english: He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn to our God.

verses.latin: Videbunt multi, et timebunt: et sperabunt in Domino.
verses.english: Many will see and be afraid, and then they will trust in the Lord.

verses.latin: Beatus vir cujus est nomen Domini spes ejus: et non respexit in vanitates et insanias falsas.
verses.english: Blessed is the man whose trust is in the Lord, and who has not looked at vanity and false madness.

verses.latin: Multa fecisti tu, Domine Deus meus, mirabilia tua: et cogitationibus tuis non est qui similis sit tibi.
verses.english: O Lord my God, You have done many wonderful things, and no one can match Your thoughts.

verses.latin: Annuntiavi et locutus sum: multiplicati sunt super numerum.
verses.english: I have proclaimed them, and spoken them, and they have multiplied beyond number.

verses.latin: Sacrificium et oblationem noluisti: aures autem perfecisti mihi.
verses.english: You didn't want sacrifices or offerings; rather, you have perfected my ears.

verses.latin: Holocaustum et pro peccato non postulasti: tunc dixi: Ecce venio.
verses.english: You didn't ask for burnt offerings or sacrifices for sin, so I said, “Behold, I come.”

verses.latin: In capite libri scriptum est de me ut facerem voluntatem tuam: Deus meus, volui, et legem tuam in medio cordis mei.
verses.english: It is written of me in the book: “I want to do Your will, O my God, and Your law is within my heart.”

verses.latin: Annuntiavi justitiam tuam in ecclesia magna: ecce, labia mea non prohibebo: Domine, tu scisti.
verses.english: I have proclaimed Your justice in the great assembly; behold, I do not restrain my lips; O Lord, You know this.

verses.latin: Justitiam tuam non abscondi in corde meo: veritatem tuam et salutare tuum dixi.
verses.english: I have not hidden Your justice in my heart; I have proclaimed Your truth and Your salvation.

verses.latin: Non abscondi misericordiam tuam et veritatem tuam a multitudine magna.
verses.english: I have not concealed Your mercy and Your truth from the great multitude.

verses.latin: Ne prohibeas tu misericordias tuas a me, Domine: misericordia tua et veritas tua semper susceperunt me.
verses.english: Don’t withhold Your mercy from me, O Lord; Your mercy and truth have always protected me.

verses.latin: Quoniam circumdederunt me mala quorum non est numerus: comprehenderunt me iniquitates meæ, et non potui ut viderem.
verses.english: For evils without number have surrounded me; my sins have overtaken me, and I can’t see a way out.

verses.latin: Multiplicati sunt super capillos capitis mei, qui oderunt me gratis.
verses.english: They are more than the hairs on my head, those who hate me without cause.

verses.latin: Confortati sunt qui persecuti sunt me inimici mei injuste: quæ non rapui, tunc solvebam.
verses.english: Those who persecute me are strengthened, my unjust enemies; I was made to pay for what I did not steal.

verses.latin: Deus, ne elongeris a me: Deus meus, in auxilium meum respice.
verses.english: O God, don’t be far from me; my God, look upon me to help me.

verses.latin: Confundantur et revereantur simul, qui quærunt animam meam ut auferant eam.
verses.english: Let them be ashamed and disgraced, all who seek my life to take it away.

verses.latin: Convertantur retrorsum, et revereantur qui mihi mala volunt.
verses.english: Let those who wish me evil turn back and be ashamed.

verses.latin: Ferant statim confusionem suam, qui mihi dicunt: Euge, euge.
verses.english: Let them be brought to immediate shame, those who say to me, “Well done, well done!”

verses.latin: Exsultent et lætentur in te omnes quærentes te: et dicant semper: Magnificetur Dominus, qui diligunt salutare tuum.
verses.english: Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; and let those who love Your salvation always say, “May the Lord be glorified!”

verses.latin: Ego autem mendicus et pauper: Dominus sollicitus est mei.
verses.english: But I am poor and needy; the Lord cares for me.

verses.latin: Adjutor meus et protector meus tu es: Deus meus, ne tardaveris.
verses.english: You are my helper and my protector; O my God, don’t delay.

verses.latin: In finem, pro David, in memoriam.
verses.english: To the end, for David, in memory.

verses.latin: Beatus qui intelligit super egenum et pauperem: in die mala liberabit eum Dominus.
verses.english: Happy is the person who cares for the needy. In the day of evil, the Lord will free him.

verses.latin: Dominus conservet eum, et vivificet eum: et beatum faciat eum in terra, et non tradat eum in animam inimicorum ejus.
verses.english: May the Lord preserve him, and may the Lord make him live. May He bless him upon the earth, and may He not give him over to the will of his enemies.

verses.latin: Dominus opem ferat illi super lectum doloris ejus: universum stratum ejus versasti in infirmitate ejus.
verses.english: May the Lord assist him on his bed of suffering. You have turned over the entire bed for him in his weakness.

verses.latin: Ego dixi: Domine, miserere mei: sana animam meam, quia peccavi tibi.
verses.english: I said, "Lord, have mercy on me; heal my soul, because I have sinned against You."

verses.latin: Inimici mei dixerunt mala mihi: Quando morietur, et peribit nomen ejus?
verses.english: My enemies spoke evil against me. "When will he die, and when will his name perish?"

verses.latin: Et si ingrediebatur ut videret, vana loquebatur: cor ejus congregavit iniquitatem sibi.
verses.english: And if he was entering to see me, he spoke in vain. His heart gathered iniquity for himself.

verses.latin: Ejectus est foras, et loquebatur in idipsum.
verses.english: He was cast out, and he spoke in the same way.

verses.latin: Adversum me susurrabant omnes inimici mei: adversum me cogitabant mala mihi.
verses.english: All my enemies whispered against me. They were thinking up evil against me.

verses.latin: Verbum iniquum constituerunt adversum me: Numquid qui dormit, non adjiciet ut resurgat?
verses.english: They have planned an unjust word against me. "Does he who is sleeping not add to rise again?"

verses.latin: Etenim homo pacis meae, in quo speravi, qui edebat panes meos, magnifice contra me calcaneum suum levavit.
verses.english: For even the man of my peace, in whom I hoped, who ate my bread, greatly lifted his heel against me.

verses.latin: Tu autem, Domine, miserere mei, et resuscita me: et retribuam eis.
verses.english: But You, Lord, have mercy on me, and raise me up that I may repay them.

verses.latin: In hoc cognovi quoniam voluisti me: quoniam non gaudebit inimicus meus super me.
verses.english: By this, I have known that You have wanted me, because my enemy will not rejoice over me.

verses.latin: Me autem propter innocentiam suscepisti: et confirmasti me in conspectu tuo in aeternum.
verses.english: But You have upheld me because of my innocence, and You have confirmed me in Your sight forever.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, a saeculo et usque in saeculum: fiat, fiat.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from all eternity to eternity. So be it, so be it.

verses.latin: Sicut cervus desiderat ad fontes aquarum, ita desiderat anima mea ad te, Deus.
verses.english: Like a deer thirsting for water, my soul thirsts for You, O God.

verses.latin: Sitivit anima mea ad Deum fortem vivum;
verses.english: My soul thirsts for the living God;

verses.latin: quando veniam, et apparebo ante faciem Dei?
verses.english: When will I come and appear before the face of God?

verses.latin: Fuerunt mihi lacrimae meae panes die ac nocte, dum dicitur mihi quotidie: Ubi est Deus tuus?
verses.english: My tears have been my bread day and night, while they say to me daily: "Where is your God?"

verses.latin: Haec memoratus sum, et effudi in me animam meam:
verses.english: I remember these things, and I pour out my soul within me:

verses.latin: quoniam transiturus sum in locum tabernaculi admirabilis, usque ad domum Dei, in voce exultationis et confessionis, sonus epulantis.
verses.english: How I used to walk in the temple, as if to the house of God, among the sound of joy and thanksgiving, with a crowd celebrating a feast.

verses.latin: Quare tristis es, anima mea? et quare conturbas me?
verses.english: Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me?

verses.latin: Spera in Deo, quoniam adhuc confitebor illi salutare vultus mei.
verses.english: Hope in God, for I will still give praise to Him, the saving presence of my countenance.

verses.latin: Deus meus, ad meipsum anima mea conturbata est; propterea memorabor tui de terra Jordanis, et Hermoniim a monte modico.
verses.english: My God, my soul is troubled within me; therefore I will remember you from the land of the Jordan and of Hermon and from the little mountain.

verses.latin: Abyssus abyssum invocat, in voce cataractarum tuarum;
verses.english: Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls;

verses.latin: omnia excelsa tua, et fluctus tui super me transierunt.
verses.english: all your exalted waves and your billows have passed over me.

verses.latin: In die mandavit Dominus misericordiam suam, et nocte canticum ejus.
verses.english: By day the Lord commands his mercy, and at night his song.

verses.latin: Apud me oratio Deo vitae meae, dicam:
verses.english: Let my prayer go to the God of my life, and I will say:

verses.latin: Suscipiens me; quare oblitus es mei? et quare contristatus incedo, dum affligit me inimicus?
verses.english: “Why have you forgotten me? Why do I go about sad, while the enemy afflicts me?”

verses.latin: Dum confringuntur ossa mea, exprobraverunt mihi qui tribulant me inimici mei.
verses.english: As my bones are broken, the enemies who afflict me have reproached me.

verses.latin: Dum dicunt mihi per singulos dies: Ubi est Deus tuus?
verses.english: As they say to me daily: "Where is your God?"

verses.latin: Quare tristis es, anima mea? et quare conturbas me?
verses.english: Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me?

verses.latin: Spera in Deo, quoniam adhuc confitebor illi salutare vultus mei, et Deus meus.
verses.english: Hope in God, for I will still give praise to Him, my salvation, and my God.

verses.latin: Judica me, Deus, et discerne causam meam de gente non sancta: ab homine iniquo et doloso erue me.
verses.english: Give me justice, O God, and defend my cause from a nation that isn’t holy. Deliver me from the hands of wicked and deceitful people.

verses.latin: Quia tu es Deus fortitudo mea: quare me repulisti? et quare contristatus incedo, dum affligit me inimicus?
verses.english: For You are the God who protects me: why have you rejected me? Why do I walk around so sad and downtrodden when my enemies are constantly bothering me?

verses.latin: Emitte lucem tuam et veritatem tuam: ipsa me deduxerunt, et adduxerunt me in montem sanctum tuum, et in tabernacula tua.
verses.english: Send forth Your light and Your truth. Those things have guided me, and lead me back up to your holy mountain, and to Your tabernacles.

verses.latin: Et introibo ad altare Dei: ad Deum qui laetificat juventutem meam.
verses.english: Then I will go to the altar of God: to God, who gives joy to my youth.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi in cithara, Deus, Deus meus: quare tristis es, anima mea? et quare conturbas me?
verses.english: I will give thanks to You with a harp, O God, my God. Why are you sad, my soul? Why do you disturb me?

verses.latin: Spera in Deo, quoniam adhuc confitebor illi: salutare vultus mei, et Deus meus.
verses.english: Hope in God, because I will still give Him thanks. He is the salvation of my face, and He is my God.

verses.latin: In finem, pro filiis Core, intellectus.
verses.english: For the leader. A song for the sons of Korah, a prayer for understanding.

verses.latin: Audite hoc, omnes gentes: auribus percipite, omnes qui habitatis orbem:
verses.english: Listen to this, all you nations. Understand this, all who live on Earth.

verses.latin: quique terrigenae, et filii hominum: simul in unum dives et pauper.
verses.english: Consider this, you who are of the earth, and all the sons of men. Both rich and poor come together, for all are equal.

verses.latin: Os meum loquetur sapientiam: et meditatio cordis mei prudentiam.
verses.english: My mouth will speak wisdom, and my heart will ponder prudence.

verses.latin: Inclinabo in parabolam aurem meam: aperiam in psalterio propositionem meam.
verses.english: I will listen closely to a parable. I will solve the mystery by singing a song.

verses.latin: Cur timebo in die mala? iniquitas calcanei mei circumdabit me.
verses.english: Why should I fear trouble? The wickedness of my life seeks to surround me.

verses.latin: Qui confidunt in virtute sua: et in multitudine divitiarum suarum gloriantur.
verses.english: They trust in their own strength, and boast in the abundance of their riches.

verses.latin: Frater non redimit, redimet homo: non dabit Deo redemptionem suam:
verses.english: No man can pay the price to save a brother. Man cannot give God the price of redemption.

verses.latin: nec dabit Deo propitiationem pro se: et pretium redemptionis animae suae.
verses.english: For he cannot pay to satisfy God's justice, nor give enough to save his own soul.

verses.latin: Et laborabit in aeternum: et vivet adhuc usque in finem.
verses.english: For he will labor forever, and continue to live in his misery without end.

verses.latin: Neque videbit corruptionem, cum viderit sapientes morientes: simul insipiens et stultus pereunt.
verses.english: He will not see corruption, when he sees wise men dying. The fool and the stupid will perish together.

verses.latin: Et relinquent alienis divitias suas.
verses.english: And they leave their riches to others.

verses.latin: Et sepulcra eorum domus illorum in aeternum: tabernacula eorum in progenie et progenie.
verses.english: Their tombs will be their houses forever. Their dwellings will be from generation to generation.

verses.latin: Posuerunt in nominibus terras suas.
verses.english: They have given names to the lands which they possess.

verses.latin: Et homo, cum in honore esset, non intellexit: comparatus est jumentis insipientibus, et similis factus est illis.
verses.english: But man, though living in honor, does not understand. He is compared to unthinking beasts, and becomes like them.

verses.latin: Haec via illorum scandalum ipsis: et postea in ore suo conplacuerunt.
verses.english: This is the way of them that cause trouble. Their mouths approve of their own wickedness.

verses.latin: Sicut oves in inferno positi sunt: mors pascet eos.
verses.english: Like sheep in the grave, death will feed on them.

verses.latin: Et dominabuntur eorum justi in matutino: et auxilia eorum veterascet in inferno a gloria eorum.
verses.english: The just shall rule over them at the resurrection, and their strength will waste away in the grave, far from their glory.

verses.latin: Verumtamen Deus redimet animam meam de manu inferi: cum acceperit me.
verses.english: But God will redeem my soul from the power of hell, for He will receive me.

verses.latin: Ne timueris cum dives factus fuerit, et cum multiplicata fuerit gloria domus ejus.
verses.english: Do not fear when a man becomes rich, or when the glory of his house is increased.

verses.latin: Quoniam cum interierit, non sumet omnia: neque descendet cum eo gloria ejus.
verses.english: For when he dies, he will take nothing. His glory will not follow him down.

verses.latin: Quia anima ejus in vita ipsius benedicetur: confitebitur tibi cum benefeceris ei.
verses.english: Because his soul, while he lives, is blessed. He will give thanks to You when You bless him.

verses.latin: Introibit usque in progenies patrum suorum: usque in aeternum non videbit lumen.
verses.english: He will go to the generation of his fathers. And he will never again see the light.

verses.latin: Et homo cum in honore esset, non intellexit: comparatus est jumentis insipientibus, et similis factus est illis.
verses.english: Man, while living in honor, does not understand. He is compared to unthinking beasts, and becomes like them.

verses.latin: Eructavit cor meum verbum bonum: dico ego opera mea regi.
verses.english: My heart swells with a message from God. I will write my poem to the King.

verses.latin: Lingua mea calamus scribae velociter scribentis.
verses.english: My tongue will be like the ready pen of a skilled writer.

verses.latin: Speciosus forma prae filiis hominum: diffusa est gratia in labiis tuis: propterea benedixit te Deus in aeternum.
verses.english: You are the fairest of all men. Grace is poured out on your lips, and God has blessed you forever.

verses.latin: Accingere gladium tuum super femur tuum, potentissime.
verses.english: Gird your sword upon your thigh, O mighty one.

verses.latin: Specie tua et pulchritudine tua intende, prospere procede, et regna.
verses.english: In your glory and your beauty, ride forth, and reign.

verses.latin: Propter veritatem, et mansuetudinem, et justitiam: et deducet te mirabiliter dextera tua.
verses.english: Ride forth for truth, gentleness, and righteousness. Let your right hand perform awesome deeds.

verses.latin: Sagittae tuae acutae, populi sub te cadent: in corda inimicorum regis.
verses.english: Your arrows are sharp, and nations will fall before you, piercing the hearts of the king's enemies.

verses.latin: Sedis tua, Deus, in saeculum saeculi: virga directionis virga regni tui.
verses.english: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; a scepter of justice is the scepter of your kingdom.

verses.latin: Dilexisti justitiam, et odisti iniquitatem: propterea unxit te Deus, Deus tuus, oleo laetitiae prae consortibus tuis.
verses.english: You love justice and hate wickedness; therefore, God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.

verses.latin: Myrrha, et gutta, et casia a vestimentis tuis, a domibus eburneis: ex quibus delectaverunt te filiae regum in honore tuo.
verses.english: Your robes are fragrant with myrrh, aloes, and cassia; from the ivory palaces, stringed instruments make you rejoice.

verses.latin: Filiae regum in honore tuo: astitit regina a dextris tuis in vestitu deaurato, circumdata varietate.
verses.english: Daughters of kings are among those held in honor; the queen stands at your right hand, adorned with gold from Ophir.

verses.latin: Audi filia, et vide, et inclina aurem tuam: et obliviscere populum tuum et domum patris tui.
verses.english: Hear, O daughter, consider and incline your ear: forget your people and your father's house.

verses.latin: Et concupiscet rex decorem tuum: quoniam ipse est Dominus Deus tuus, et adorabunt eum.
verses.english: And the king will desire your beauty; he is your lord, and you shall bow down to him.

verses.latin: Et filia Tyri in muneribus vultum tuum deprecabuntur: divites plebis.
verses.english: The people of Tyre will seek your favor with gifts; the rich among the people will seek your blessing.

verses.latin: Omnis gloria ejus filiae Regis intrinsecus, in fimbriis aureis circumdata varietatibus.
verses.english: All glorious is the princess within; her gown is woven with gold.

verses.latin: Adducentur regi virgines post eam: proximae ejus afferentur tibi.
verses.english: In embroidered garments she is led to the king; after her the virgins, her companions, are brought to you.

verses.latin: Afferentur in laetitia et exultatione: adducentur in templum Regis.
verses.english: They are led forth with gladness and rejoicing; they enter the palace of the king.

verses.latin: Pro patribus tuis nati sunt tibi filii: constitues eos principes super omnem terram.
verses.english: Your sons will take the place of your fathers; you will make them princes throughout all the earth.

verses.latin: Memorabor nominis tui in omni generatione et generatione.
verses.english: I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;

verses.latin: Propterea populi confitebuntur tibi in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: therefore the peoples will praise you forever and ever.

verses.latin: Canticum psalmi. Filiis Core. Pro anima. [Ad finem.]
verses.english: A song for the liturgical use of the sons of Korah, for the soul.

verses.latin: Deus refugium nostrum, et virtus: adjutor in tribulationibus, quæ invenerunt nos nimis.
verses.english: God is our safe-haven and His power is our strength. He is the help we need during the tribulations that have found us.

verses.latin: Propterea non timebimus dum turbabitur terra: et transferentur montes in cor maris.
verses.english: Therefore, we will not fear even when the earth is shaken. Even if the mountains are moved into the depths of the sea...

verses.latin: Sonuerunt, et turbatæ sunt aquæ eorum: conturbati sunt montes in fortitudine ejus.
verses.english: Their waters have roared and foamed over; the mountains have trembled and been disturbed by His strength.

verses.latin: Fluminis impetus lætificat civitatem Dei: sanctificavit tabernaculum suum Altissimus.
verses.english: The rush of the river brings joy to the city of God. The Most High sanctified His tabernacle.

verses.latin: Deus in medio ejus, non commovebitur: adjuvabit eam Deus mane diluculo.
verses.english: God is in the midst of the city, and it will not be moved. God will help it, even at the break of dawn.

verses.latin: Conturbatæ sunt gentes, et inclinata sunt regna: dedit vocem suam, et motus est terra.
verses.english: The nations were troubled and the kingdoms were inclined. God spoke, and the earth was moved.

verses.latin: Dominus virtutum nobiscum: susceptor noster Deus Jacob.
verses.english: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our protector.

verses.latin: Venite, et videte opera Domini, quæ posuit prodigia super terram.
verses.english: Come and see the works of the Lord, the amazing things He has done on Earth.

verses.latin: Auferens bella usque ad finem terræ: arcum conteret, et confringet arma, et scuta comburet igni.
verses.english: He stops wars all over the Earth. He breaks the bow, shatters the spear, and burns the shields in the fire.

verses.latin: Vacate, et videte quoniam ego sum Deus: exaltabor in gentibus, et exaltabor in terra.
verses.english: Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

verses.latin: Dominus virtutum nobiscum: susceptor noster Deus Jacob.
verses.english: The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our protector.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus cantici filiorum Core.
verses.english: For the leader. A song. The sons of Korah composed this.

verses.latin: Omnes gentes, plaudite manibus: jubilate Deo in voce exultationis.
verses.english: All nations, clap your hands; sing praises to God with a voice of joy.

verses.latin: Quoniam Dominus excelsus, terribilis: rex magnus super omnem terram.
verses.english: For the Lord is high and to be feared. He is the great king over all the land.

verses.latin: Subjecit populos nobis, et gentes sub pedibus nostris.
verses.english: He subdued the people to us, and the nations under our feet.

verses.latin: Elegit nobis haereditatem suam: speciem Jacob, quam dilexit.
verses.english: He chose our inheritance for us, the glory of Jacob whom he loved.

verses.latin: Ascendit Deus in jubilo: et Dominus in voce tubae.
verses.english: God ascends amid shouts of joy, and the Lord, with the sound of the trumpet.

verses.latin: Psallite Deo, psallite: psallite regi nostro, psallite.
verses.english: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our king, sing praises.

verses.latin: Quoniam rex omnis terrae Deus: psallite sapienter.
verses.english: For God is king of all the earth; sing praises with understanding.

verses.latin: Regnabit Deus super gentes: Deus sedet super solium sanctum suum.
verses.english: God reigns over all nations; God sits upon his holy throne.

verses.latin: Principes populorum congregati sunt cum Deo Abraham: quoniam Dei fortes terrae vehementer elevati sunt.
verses.english: The princes of the people have gathered together with the God of Abraham. For the strong ones of the land are greatly exalted in their time.

verses.latin: Canticum psalmi filiorum Core. Magnus Dominus, et laudabilis nimis: in civitate Dei nostri, in monte sancto eius.
verses.english: A song of the psalms, for the sons of Korah. The Lord is great, and worthy of all praise: in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.

verses.latin: Fundatur exultatio universae terrae, montes Sion: latera aquilonis, civitas Regis magni.
verses.english: It is beautiful, the joy of all the earth, Mount Zion, and the sides of the north, the city of the great King.

verses.latin: Deus in domibus eius cognoscetur, cum suscipiet eam.
verses.english: God is known in His houses, when He shall take her.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce reges terrae congregati sunt: convenerunt in unum.
verses.english: For, behold, the kings of the earth are gathered: they have come together.

verses.latin: Ipsi videntes sic stupuerunt, conturbati sunt, commoti sunt.
verses.english: They saw, and so they marveled; they were troubled, they were moved.

verses.latin: Tremor tenuit eos: ibi dolores ut parturientis.
verses.english: Trembling took hold of them: there were pains like a woman in labor.

verses.latin: Spiritu vehementi conteres naves Tharsis.
verses.english: With a strong wind, You will break the ships of Tarshish.

verses.latin: Sicut audivimus, sic vidimus: in civitate Domini virtutum, in civitate Dei nostri: Deus fundavit eam in aeternum.
verses.english: As we have heard, so have we seen: in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God has founded her forever.

verses.latin: Suscepimus, Deus, misericordiam tuam in medio tui.
verses.english: We have received, O God, Your mercy, in the midst of You.

verses.latin: Secundum nomen tuum, Deus, sic et laus tua in fines terrae: justitia plena est dextera tua.
verses.english: According to Your name, O God, so also is Your praise to the ends of the earth: Your right hand is full of justice.

verses.latin: Laetetur mons Sion, et exsultent filiae Judae: propter judicia tua, Domine.
verses.english: Let Mount Zion rejoice, and let the daughters of Judah exult: because of Your judgments, O Lord.

verses.latin: Circuite Sion, et complectimini eam: narrate in turribus eius.
verses.english: Go around Zion, and go around her: tell of her towers.

verses.latin: Ponete corda vestra in virtute eius: et distribuite in turribus eius, ut enarratis in generatione altera.
verses.english: Set your hearts on her power: and distribute it in her towers, that you may tell it in another generation.

verses.latin: Quoniam hic est Deus, Deus noster in aeternum, et in saeculum saeculi: ipse reget nos in saecula.
verses.english: For this is God, our God forever, and for ages of ages: He will rule us forever.

verses.latin: Audite haec, omnes gentes;
verses.english: Listen to this, all you people;

verses.latin: auribus percipite, universi qui habitatis orbem:
verses.english: listen carefully, all who dwell on earth:

verses.latin: quique terrigenæ et filii hominum, simul in unum dives et pauper.
verses.english: people of all classes, people of all kinds, the wealthy and the poor.

verses.latin: Os meum loquetur sapientiam;
verses.english: My mouth will declare wisdom;

verses.latin: et meditatio cordis mei prudentiam.
verses.english: and the meditation of my heart will be prudence.

verses.latin: Inclinabo in parabolam aurem meam;
verses.english: I will incline my ear to a parable;

verses.latin: aperiam in psalterio propositionem meam.
verses.english: I will open my proposition in the psalter.

verses.latin: Cur timebo in die mala? iniquitas calcanei mei circundabit me.
verses.english: Why will I be afraid in the evil day? The iniquity of my heel will surround me.

verses.latin: Confidunt in virtute sua, et in multitudine divitiarum suarum gloriantur.
verses.english: They trust in their own strength, and glory in the multitude of their riches.

verses.latin: Frater non redimit, redimet homo: non dabit Deo redemptionem suam,
verses.english: A brother will not redeem, nor will a man redeem, nor give to God his ransom,

verses.latin: nec pretium redempti animæ suæ.
verses.english: nor the price of the redemption of his soul.

verses.latin: Et laborabit in æternum, et vivet adhuc usque in finem.
verses.english: And he will labor in eternity, and will live forever.

verses.latin: Quoniam non videbit interitum, cum viderit sapientes morientes;
verses.english: For he will not see corruption when he sees the wise dying;

verses.latin: simul insipiens et stultus peribunt: et relinquent alienis divitias suas.
verses.english: at the same time, the foolish and the stupid will perish: and they will leave their riches to others.

verses.latin: Et sepulcra eorum domus illorum in æternum, tabernacula eorum in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: And their sepulchers are their homes forever, their tabernacles from generation to generation.

verses.latin: Posuerunt in linguam suam, et vocabant nominibus suis terras.
verses.english: They set their tongues, and they called the lands by their names.

verses.latin: Et homo cum in honore esset, non intellexit.
verses.english: And man, when he was in honor, did not understand.

verses.latin: Comparatus est jumentis insipientibus, et similis factus est illis.
verses.english: He is compared to the irrational beasts, and made similar to them.

verses.latin: Haec via illorum scandalum ipsis: et postea in ore suo conplacebunt.
verses.english: This is their way: it is a scandal to them: and afterwards they will be pleased in their mouth.

verses.latin: Sicut oves in inferno positi sunt: mors depascet eos. Et dominabuntur eorum justi in matutino: et auxilium eorum vetustate conteretur in inferno.
verses.english: As sheep are placed in hell: death will feed on them. And the just will rule over them in the morning: and their help will be consumed by old age in hell.

verses.latin: Verumtamen Deus redimet animam meam de manu inferi, cum acceperit me.
verses.english: But God will redeem my soul from the hand of hell, when he receives me.

verses.latin: Ne timueris cum dives factus fuerit, et cum multiplicata fuerit gloria domus ejus.
verses.english: Do not fear when he becomes rich, and when the glory of his house is multiplied.

verses.latin: Quoniam cum interierit, non sumet omnia.
verses.english: For when he dies, he will take nothing.

verses.latin: Nec descendet cum eo gloria ejus.
verses.english: And his glory will not descend with him.

verses.latin: Quia anima ejus in vita ipsius benedicetur.
verses.english: Because his soul will be blessed in his life.

verses.latin: Confitebitur tibi cum acceperis, et remunerabis eum.
verses.english: He will confess to you when you receive, and you will repay him.

verses.latin: Introibit usque in generationem patrum suorum: usque in æternum non videbit lumen.
verses.english: He will enter into the generation of his fathers: he will never see the light.

verses.latin: Homo cum in honore esset, non intellexit: comparatus est jumentis insipientibus, et similis factus est illis.
verses.english: Man, when he was in honor, did not understand: he is compared to the irrational beasts, and made similar to them.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Deus, secundum misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, God, according to Your mercy.

verses.latin: Et secundum multitudinem miserationum tuarum, dele iniquitatem meam.
verses.english: And according to the abundance of Your compassion, erase my iniquity.

verses.latin: Amplius lava me ab iniquitate mea: et a peccato meo munda me.
verses.english: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.latin: Quoniam iniquitatem meam ego cognosco: et peccatum meum contra me est semper.
verses.english: For I acknowledge my iniquity, and my sin is always before me.

verses.latin: Tibi soli peccavi, et malum coram te feci: ut justificeris in sermonibus tuis, et vincas cum judicaris.
verses.english: Against You alone have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your sight, so that You may be justified in Your words, and prevail when You are judged.

verses.latin: Ecce enim in iniquitatibus conceptus sum: et in peccatis concepit me mater mea.
verses.english: For behold, I was conceived in iniquities, and in sins did my mother conceive me.

verses.latin: Ecce enim veritatem dilexisti: incerta et occulta sapientiae tuae manifestasti mihi.
verses.english: Behold, You have desired truth; You have made known to me the uncertain and hidden things of Your wisdom.

verses.latin: Asperges me hyssopo, et mundabor: lavabis me, et super nivem dealbabor.
verses.english: You will sprinkle me with hyssop, and I shall be cleansed; You will wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.latin: Auditui meo dabis gaudium et laetitiam: et exsultabunt ossa humiliata.
verses.english: You will give me joy and gladness; and the bones that were humbled shall rejoice.

verses.latin: Averte faciem tuam a peccatis meis: et omnes iniquitates meas dele.
verses.english: Turn Your face away from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.

verses.latin: Cor mundum crea in me, Deus: et spiritum rectum innova in visceribus meis.
verses.english: Create a clean heart in me, God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

verses.latin: Ne projicias me a facie tua: et spiritum sanctum tuum ne auferas a me.
verses.english: Do not cast me away from Your presence, and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.

verses.latin: Redde mihi laetitiam salutaris tui: et spiritu principali confirma me.
verses.english: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and strengthen me with a willing spirit.

verses.latin: Docebo iniquos vias tuas: et impii ad te convertentur.
verses.english: Then I will teach the wicked Your ways, and sinners will be converted to You.

verses.latin: Libera me de sanguinibus, Deus, Deus salutis meae: et exsultabit lingua mea justitiam tuam.
verses.english: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, God, God of my salvation, and my tongue will rejoice in Your justice.

verses.latin: Domine, labia mea aperies: et os meum annuntiabit laudem tuam.
verses.english: O Lord, You will open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise.

verses.latin: Quoniam si voluisses sacrificium, dedissem utique: holocaustis non delectaberis.
verses.english: For if You had desired sacrifice, I would have given it; You will not delight in burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Sacrificium Deo spiritus contribulatus: cor contritum et humiliatum, Deus, non despicies.
verses.english: The sacrifice for God is a contrite spirit; a contrite and humbled heart, God, You will not despise.

verses.latin: Benigne fac, Domine, in bona voluntate tua Sion: ut aedificentur muri Jerusalem.
verses.english: Be gracious, O Lord, in Your good pleasure to Zion, that the walls of Jerusalem may be rebuilt.

verses.latin: Tunc acceptabis sacrificium justitiae, oblationes et holocausta: tunc imponent super altare tuum vitulos.
verses.english: Then You will accept the sacrifice of justice, offerings, and burnt offerings; then they will place young bulls upon Your altar.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Deus, secundum magnam misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, O God, because of Your great mercy.

verses.latin: Et secundum multitudinem miserationum tuarum, dele iniquitatem meam.
verses.english: And because of Your compassion, wipe away my iniquity.

verses.latin: Amplius lava me ab iniquitate mea: et a peccato meo munda me.
verses.english: Wash me completely from my sin and cleanse me.

verses.latin: Quoniam iniquitatem meam ego cognosco: et peccatum meum contra me est semper.
verses.english: Because I know my iniquities, my sins are always before me.
