verses.latin: Tibi soli peccavi, et malum coram te feci: ut justificeris in sermonibus tuis, et vincas cum judicaris.
verses.english: I have sinned against You alone, and done what is evil in Your eyes, so that You are just in Your sentence, and righteous in Your judgment.

verses.latin: Ecce enim in iniquitatibus conceptus sum: et in peccatis concepit me mater mea.
verses.english: Behold, I was conceived in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me.

verses.latin: Ecce enim veritatem dilexisti: incerta et occulta sapientiae tuae manifestasti mihi.
verses.english: Indeed, You love truth in the heart; You have made known to me the secrets of Your wisdom.

verses.latin: Asparges me hyssopo, et mundabor: lavabis me, et super nivem dealbabor.
verses.english: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.latin: Auditui meo dabis gaudium et laetitiam: et exultabunt ossa humilitata.
verses.english: Make me hear joy and gladness; that the bones You have crushed may rejoice.

verses.latin: Averte faciem tuam a peccatis meis: et omnes iniquitates meas dele.
verses.english: Turn Your face away from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.

verses.latin: Cor mundum crea in me, Deus: et spiritum rectum innova in visceribus meis.
verses.english: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.latin: Ne projicias me a facie tua: et spiritum sanctum tuum ne auferas a me.
verses.english: Do not cast me away from Your presence, and do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.

verses.latin: Redde mihi laetitiam salutaris tui: et spiritu principali confirma me.
verses.english: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and sustain me with a willing spirit.

verses.latin: Docebo iniquos vias tuas: et impii ad te convertentur.
verses.english: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, and sinners will return to You.

verses.latin: Libera me de sanguinibus, Deus, Deus salutis meae: et exultabit lingua mea justitiam tuam.
verses.english: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing of Your righteousness.

verses.latin: Domine, labia mea aperies: et os meum annuntiabit laudem tuam.
verses.english: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will proclaim Your praise.

verses.latin: Quoniam si voluisses sacrificium, dedissem utique: holocausta non delectabis.
verses.english: For You do not delight in sacrifice; You would accept a burnt offering.

verses.latin: Sacrificium Deo spiritus contribulatus: cor contritum, et humiliatum, Deus, non despicies.
verses.english: My sacrifice, O God, is a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.

verses.latin: Benigne fac, Domine, in bona voluntate tua Sion: ut aedificentur muri Jerusalem.
verses.english: Be pleased to do good to Zion in Your good pleasure; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Tunc acceptabis sacrificium justitiae, oblationes et holocausta: tunc imponent super altare tuum vitulos.
verses.english: Then You will be pleased with sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; then they will offer bulls on Your altar.

verses.latin: In finem, pro dolore, intellectus David.
verses.english: For the director of music. A Psalm of David, reflecting deep sorrow.

verses.latin: Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus.
verses.english: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.”

verses.latin: Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in iniquitatibus: non est qui faciat bonum.
verses.english: They are corrupt. They have done detestable deeds, none of them does good.

verses.latin: Deus de caelo prospiciens super filios hominum, ut videat si est intellegens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: God looks down from the sky on humankind, to see if there are any who understand, who seek after God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: Everyone has turned away, together they have become useless; no one does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Nonne scient omnes qui operantur iniquitatem? Qui devorant plebem meam ut cibum panis.
verses.english: Do all those evildoers not know? They devour my people as though they were bread.

verses.latin: Deum non invocaverunt.
verses.english: They do not call on God.

verses.latin: Ibi trepidaverunt timore ubi non erat timor: quoniam Deus dissipavit ossa eorum qui hominibus placent: confusi sunt, quoniam Deus sprevit eos.
verses.english: They were in great fear, though there was no reason to fear, because God scattered the bones of those who pleased humanity. They were shamed, because God rejected them.

verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israël? Cum averterit Deus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Jacob, et laetabitur Israël.
verses.english: Who will bring salvation for Israel from Zion? When God restores the fortunes of His people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: To the end. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Dixit insipiens in corde suo: Non est Deus.
verses.english: The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God."

verses.latin: Corrupti sunt, et abominabiles facti sunt in iniquitatibus: non est qui faciat bonum.
verses.english: They have become corrupt; they have become abominable in their wickedness. There is no one who does good.

verses.latin: Deus de caelo prospexit super filios hominum, ut videat si est intelligens, aut requirens Deum.
verses.english: God looked down from the sky upon the sons of men, to see if there were any who understood, or sought God.

verses.latin: Omnes declinaverunt, simul inutiles facti sunt: non est qui faciat bonum, non est usque ad unum.
verses.english: All have turned aside; they have together become useless. There is none who does good, not even one.

verses.latin: Nonne scient omnes qui operantur iniquitatem, qui devorant plebem meam ut cibum panis?
verses.english: Will they not know, all who work iniquity, who devour my people as if they were bread?

verses.latin: Deum non invocaverunt.
verses.english: They have not called upon God.

verses.latin: Ibi trepidaverunt timore, ubi non erat timor.
verses.english: There they trembled with fear where there was no fear.

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus dissipavit ossa eorum qui hominibus placent: confusi sunt, quoniam Deus sprevit eos.
verses.english: For God has scattered the bones of those who please men; they are confused, because God has despised them.

verses.latin: Quis dabit ex Sion salutare Israel? Cum averterit Deus captivitatem plebis suae, exsultabit Iacob, et laetabitur Israel.
verses.english: Who will give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When God returns the captivity of his people, Jacob will rejoice, and Israel will be glad.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus intellectus David,
verses.english: For the leader. A song of contemplation by David.

verses.latin: exaudi, Deus, orationem meam, et ne despexeris deprecationem meam.
verses.english: Hear me, God, and listen to my prayer, and do not look away from my supplication.

verses.latin: Intende mihi, et exaudi me: contristatus sum in meditatione mea, et conturbatus sum
verses.english: Pay attention to me, and hear me. I am troubled in my thoughts, and I am disturbed

verses.latin: a voce inimici, et a tribulatione peccatoris.
verses.english: by the voice of the enemy, and by the oppression of the sinner.

verses.latin: Quoniam incurvaverunt super me iniquitates, et in ira molesti erant mihi.
verses.english: For they have poured wickedness upon me, and they were angry with me.

verses.latin: Cor meum conturbatum est in me, et timor mortis cecidit super me.
verses.english: My heart is troubled within me, and the fear of death has fallen upon me.

verses.latin: Timor et tremor venerunt super me, et contexerunt me tenebrae.
verses.english: Fear and trembling have come upon me, and darkness has covered me.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quis dabit mihi pennas sicut columbae, et volabo, et requiescam?
verses.english: And I said: “Who will give me wings like a dove, so I can fly away, and be at rest?”

verses.latin: Ecce elongavi fugiens, et mansi in solitudine.
verses.english: Behold, I have fled far away and remained in the wilderness.

verses.latin: Expectabam eum qui salvum me faceret a spiritu tempestatis et a tempestate.
verses.english: I was waiting for Him to save me from the spirit of the storm and the tempest.

verses.latin: Præcipita, Domine; divide linguas eorum: quoniam vidi iniquitatem et contradictionem in civitate.
verses.english: Hasten, Lord; divide their tongues; for I have seen wickedness and contradiction in the city.

verses.latin: Die ac nocte circumdabit eam super muros ejus iniquitas, et labor in medio ejus.
verses.english: Day and night, wickedness surrounds it on its walls, and trouble is in its midst.

verses.latin: Iniquitas in medio ejus, et dolus et fraudes non recesserunt de plateis ejus.
verses.english: Wickedness is in the midst of it, and deceit and fraud never depart from its streets.

verses.latin: Quoniam non inimicus exprobravit mihi, et sustinuissem; et qui oderat me super me magna locutus esset, et abscondissem me forsitan.
verses.english: For it was not an enemy who reproached me, and I would have borne it. If he who hated me had spoken great things against me, I would perhaps have hidden myself.

verses.latin: Tu vero homo unanimis, dux meus et notus meus,
verses.english: But it was you, a man of one mind with me, my guide and my acquaintance.

verses.latin: qui simul dulcis capiebamus cibos: in domo Dei ambulavimus cum consensu.
verses.english: Together, we took pleasure in food. We walked in the house of God with agreement.

verses.latin: Veniat mors super illos, et descendant in infernum viventes: quoniam nequitiae in habitaculis eorum, in medio eorum.
verses.english: Let death come upon them, and let them go down to hell alive, for wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.

verses.latin: Ego autem ad Deum clamavi, et Dominus salvabit me.
verses.english: But I cried out to God, and the Lord will save me.

verses.latin: Vespere, et mane, et meridie narrabo et annuntiabo: et exaudiet vocem meam.
verses.english: In the evening, in the morning, and at noon, I will tell and announce it. And He will hear my voice.

verses.latin: Redimet in pace animam meam ab his qui appellant me: quoniam inter multos erant mecum.
verses.english: He will redeem my soul in peace from those who call me. For they were with me, though they are many.

verses.latin: Exaudiat Deus, et humiliabit illos, qui est ante saecula. Non enim est illis commutatio, et non timuerunt Deum.
verses.english: May God hear and humble them—He who is before the ages. For there is no change in them, and they did not fear God.

verses.latin: Extendit manum suam in retribuendo; contaminaverunt testamentum ejus.
verses.english: He stretched out his hand to repay. They have defiled His covenant.

verses.latin: Divisi sunt ab ira vultus ejus: et appropinquaverunt corda ejus.
verses.english: They were separated from the wrath of His countenance, and their hearts drew near.

verses.latin: Molliti sunt sermones ejus super oleo: et ipsi sunt jacula.
verses.english: His words are softer than oil, but they are weapons.

verses.latin: Jacta super Dominum curam tuam, et ipse te enutriet: non dabit in aeternum fluctuationem justo.
verses.english: Cast your care upon the Lord, and He will nourish you. He will not give the just to be in a perpetual state of fluctuation.

verses.latin: Tu vero, Deus, deduces eos in puteum interitus: viri sanguinum et dolosi non dimidiabunt dies suos. Ego autem sperabo in te, Domine.
verses.english: But you, God, will lead them into the pit of destruction. Men of blood and deceit will not live out half their days. But I will trust in you, Lord.

verses.latin: In finem, in verba, David.
verses.english: For the leader. A song of David.

verses.latin: Exaudi, Deus, orationem meam, et ne despicias deprecationem meam.
verses.english: Listen, O God, to my prayer. Don’t ignore my supplication.

verses.latin: Intende mihi, et exaudi me. Contristatus sum in exercitatione mea, et conturbatus.
verses.english: Hear me and answer me. I am troubled by my worries, and I am disturbed.

verses.latin: A voce inimici, et a tribulatione peccatoris.
verses.english: Because of the enemy’s voice, and the sinner’s tribulation.

verses.latin: Quoniam declinaverunt in me iniquitates, et in ira molesti erant mihi.
verses.english: Because they have brought unjust accusations against me. The sinners are so angry at me.

verses.latin: Cor meum conturbatum est in me, et formido mortis cecidit super me.
verses.english: My heart is troubled within me, and the terror of death has fallen on me.

verses.latin: Timor et tremor venerunt super me, et contexerunt me tenebrae.
verses.english: Fear and trembling have come upon me, and darkness has covered me.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Quis dabit mihi pennas sicut columbæ, et volabo, et requiescam?
verses.english: And I said: “Who will give me the wings of a dove, so I can fly away and find rest?”

verses.latin: Ecce elongavi fugiens, et mansi in solitudine.
verses.english: Behold, I have fled far away, and I dwell in the desert.

verses.latin: Exspectabam eum qui salvum me faceret a spiritu tempestatis et a tempestate.
verses.english: I was waiting for the one who would save me from the spirit of storm and from a tempest.

verses.latin: Præcipe, Domine: disperde, et divide linguas eorum.
verses.english: Lord, command this: destroy them, and divide their tongues.

verses.latin: Quoniam vidi iniquitatem et contradictionem in civitate.
verses.english: Because I see injustice and discord in the city.

verses.latin: Die ac nocte circumdabit eam super muros ejus iniquitas.
verses.english: Day and night injustice will surround its walls.

verses.latin: Et in medio ejus labor, et iniquitas, et in plateis ejus dolus et fraus non recessit.
verses.english: And in its midst is labor, and iniquity, and in its streets deceit and fraud will never depart.

verses.latin: Quoniam si inimicus meus maledixisset mihi, sustinuissem utique.
verses.english: For if my enemy had cursed me, I would surely have endured it.

verses.latin: Et si is qui oderat me, super me magna locutus fuisset, abscondissem me forsitan ab eo.
verses.english: And if the one who hated me had spoken great things against me, I would have perhaps hidden myself from him.

verses.latin: Tu vero homo unanimis, dux meus, et notus meus,
verses.english: But you, a man of my own heart, my leader, and my acquaintance,

verses.latin: qui simul dulces capiebamus cibos; in domo Dei ambulavimus cum consensu.
verses.english: who together shared pleasant food; we walked in the house of God with harmony.

verses.latin: Veniat mors super illos, et descendant in infernum viventes: quoniam nequitiae in habitaculis eorum, in medio eorum.
verses.english: Let death come upon them, and let them descend alive into hell: because wickedness is in their dwellings, in their midst.

verses.latin: Ego autem ad Deum clamavi, et Dominus salvabit me.
verses.english: But I cried out to God, and the Lord will save me.

verses.latin: Vespere, et mane, et meridie narrabo, et annuntiabo: et exaudiet vocem meam.
verses.english: Evening, morning, and noon I will tell the story, and I will announce it: and He will hear my voice.

verses.latin: Redimet in pace animam meam ab his qui appropinquant mihi: quoniam inter multos erant mecum.
verses.english: He will redeem my soul in peace from those who approach me: because there were many against me.

verses.latin: Exaudiat Deus, et humiliabit illos, qui est ante sæcula.
verses.english: May God hear and humble them, He who exists from before the ages.

verses.latin: Non enim est illis mutatio, et non timuerunt Deum.
verses.english: For there is no change for them, and they have not feared God.

verses.latin: Extendit manum suam in retribuendo; contaminavit testamentum ejus.
verses.english: He stretched out his hand in retaliation; he profaned His covenant.

verses.latin: Divisi sunt ab ira vultus ejus: et appropinquaverunt cordis ejus.
verses.english: They were divided by the anger of His countenance: and they approached His heart.

verses.latin: Molliti sunt sermones ejus super oleum: et ipsi sunt jacula.
verses.english: His words were smoother than oil: and they themselves are like arrows.

verses.latin: Jacta super Dominum curam tuam, et ipse te enutriet: non dabit in æternum fluctuationem justo.
verses.english: Cast your care upon the Lord, and He will nourish you: He will not allow the just to be shaken forever.

verses.latin: Tu vero, Deus, deduces eos in puteum interitus: viri sanguinum et dolosi non demidiabunt dies suos. Ego autem sperabo in te, Domine.
verses.english: But you, O God, will bring them down to the pit of destruction: men of blood and deceit will not live out their days. But I will hope in you, O Lord.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Deus, miserere mei: quoniam in te confidit anima mea.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, God, have mercy on me: for my soul trusts in you.

verses.latin: Et in umbra alarum tuarum sperabo, donec transeat iniquitas.
verses.english: I will hope in the shadow of your wings until iniquity passes.

verses.latin: Clamabo ad Deum altissimum: Deum qui benefecit mihi.
verses.english: I will cry to the most high God: the God who has done good things for me.

verses.latin: Misit de caelo, et liberavit me: dedit in opprobrium calentes.
verses.english: He sent from the sky, and freed me: He gave them to be mocked.

verses.latin: Misit Deus misericordiam suam et veritatem suam.
verses.english: God has sent his mercy and his truth.

verses.latin: Et eripuit animam meam de medio leonum: dormivi conturbatus.
verses.english: And he delivered my soul from the midst of lions: I slept, troubled.

verses.latin: Filii hominum dentes eorum arma et sagittae: et lingua eorum gladius acutus.
verses.english: The sons of men are armed with teeth, arrows, and a sharp sword of the tongue.

verses.latin: Exaltare super caelos, Deus, et in omnem terram gloria tua.
verses.english: Be exalted above the heavens, God, and let your glory be in all the earth.

verses.latin: Laceraverunt pedem meum: incurvaverunt animam meam.
verses.english: They have caught my foot: they have afflicted my soul.

verses.latin: Injecerunt in foveam animam meam.
verses.english: They have thrown my soul into a pit.

verses.latin: Attendisti ad me, Domine Deus.
verses.english: You have paid attention to me, Lord God.

verses.latin: Excita, et suscita, et exsurge, gloria mea.
verses.english: Awake, and arise, and rise up, my glory.

verses.latin: Exsurgam ad te: quoniam tu es Deus meus.
verses.english: I will arise to you: because you are my God.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi in populis, Domine: et psallam tibi in gentibus.
verses.english: I will give praise to you in the people, Lord: and I will sing psalms to you in the nations.

verses.latin: Quoniam magnificata est usque ad caelos misericordia tua: et usque ad nubes veritas tua.
verses.english: Because your mercy has been magnified up to the sky: and your truth is up to the clouds.

verses.latin: Exaltare super caelos, Deus.
verses.english: Be exalted above the heavens, God.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Deus, miserere mei: quoniam in te confidit anima mea.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, God, have mercy on me. I put my trust in You.

verses.latin: Et in umbra alarum tuarum sperabo, donec praetereat iniquitas.
verses.english: I take refuge in the shadow of Your protection until this trial passes.

verses.latin: Clamabo ad Deum altissimum: Deum qui benefecit mihi.
verses.english: I will call to God, the Most High; to God who gave me good things.

verses.latin: Misit de caelo, et liberavit me: dedit in opprobrium calcatos me.
verses.english: He will send help from the sky, and He will deliver me. He will make them ashamed, those who want to destroy me.

verses.latin: Misit Deus misericordiam suam et veritatem suam.
verses.english: God sent down His mercy and His truth.

verses.latin: Et eripuit animam meam de medio leonum: dormivi conturbatus.
verses.english: He rescued my soul from the lions. I was in a state of distress and couldn't sleep.

verses.latin: Filii hominum, dentes eorum arma et sagitta: et lingua eorum gladius acutus.
verses.english: They are children of men, but their teeth are like weapons, and their tongues are like sharp swords.

verses.latin: Exaltare super caelos, Deus, et in omnem terram gloria tua.
verses.english: Be exalted, God, above the sky! Let Your glory fill the whole land.

verses.latin: Laxaverunt laqueum pedibus meis: et incurvaverunt animam meam.
verses.english: They prepared a trap for my feet and tried to break my spirit.

verses.latin: Foderunt ante faciem meam foveam, et inciderunt in eam.
verses.english: They dug a pit for me, but they fell into it themselves.

verses.latin: Paratum cor meum, Deus, paratum cor meum: cantabo et psalmum dicam.
verses.english: My heart is ready, God; my heart is ready. I will sing and praise You.

verses.latin: Exsurge, gloria mea, exsurge psalterium et cithara: exsurgam diluculo.
verses.english: Wake up, my soul! Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the sun.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi in populis, Domine: et psalmum dicam tibi in gentibus.
verses.english: I will thank You among the peoples, Lord; I will sing Your praises among the nations.

verses.latin: Quoniam magnificata est usque ad caelos misericordia tua: et usque ad nubes veritas tua.
verses.english: For Your mercy is as great as the sky, and Your truth reaches to the clouds.

verses.latin: Exaltare super caelos, Deus: et super omnem terram gloria tua.
verses.english: Be exalted, God, above the sky; let Your glory cover the whole land.

verses.latin: In finem, ne disperdas. David in tituli inscriptione. Psalmus.
verses.english: For the director of music; do not destroy. A psalm of David.

verses.latin: Si vere utique justitiam loquimini, recta judicate, filii hominum.
verses.english: Do you really know how to speak justly? Judge what is right, sons of men.

verses.latin: Etenim in corde iniquitates operamini; in terra iniquitatem manus vestrae concinnant.
verses.english: You have evil in your hearts. Violence is your work in the land.

verses.latin: Alienati sunt peccatores a vulva; erraverunt a ventre, locuti sunt falsa.
verses.english: The wicked are estranged from the womb. They go astray from their birth, speaking lies.

verses.latin: Furor illis secundum similitudinem serpentis; sicut aspidis surdae, et obturantis aures suas,
verses.english: Their venom is like the poison of a snake. They are like a deaf viper, blocking its ears.

verses.latin: quae non exaudiet vocem incantantium, nec venefici incantantis sapienter.
verses.english: It will not listen to the voice of charmers, or of a skilled enchanter.

verses.latin: Deus conteret dentes eorum in ore ipsorum: molas leonum confringet Dominus.
verses.english: Break their teeth in their mouths, O God. Lord, break the fangs of the lions.

verses.latin: Quasi aqua, quae defluit, transibunt; tetenderit arcum suum, donec infirmentur.
verses.english: Let them vanish like water flowing away. Let them be crushed before their arrows are released.

verses.latin: Sicut cera, quae fluit, auferentur; ignis cecidit super eos, et non viderunt solem.
verses.english: Let them be like the wax that melts away. Let fire fall upon them; let them not see the sun.

verses.latin: Priusquam sentiant spinae vestrae ramnum, sicut viventes, sic in ira absorbet eos.
verses.english: So that before your thorns can grow into a thicket, let the living be swept away in wrath.

verses.latin: Laetabitur justus cum viderit vindictam; manus suas lavabit in sanguine peccatoris.
verses.english: The just man will rejoice when he sees revenge. He will wash his hands in the blood of the sinner.

verses.latin: Et dicet homo: Si vere est fructus justo; vere est Deus judicans eos in terra.
verses.english: Then men will say, "Surely there is a reward for the just." Surely God judges those on earth.

verses.latin: In finem, ne disperdas, David, in tituli inscriptione, cum succendisset Syriae Mesopotamiam, et Syriae Soba, et convertisset Joab, et percussisset in valle Salinarum duodecim millia.
verses.english: To the end, lest thou destroy, a song of David, in the inscription of the title, when he burnt Mesopotamia of Syria, and Syria of Soba, and Joab returned, and smote in the valley of salt twelve thousand.

verses.latin: Deus, repulisti nos, et destruxisti nos: iratus es, et misertus es nobis.
verses.english: O God, you rejected us and broke us: you were angry, and showed mercy to us.

verses.latin: Conturbasti terram, et contremuisti eam: sana contritiones ejus, quia commota est.
verses.english: You have disturbed the land, and have shaken it: heal the breaches thereof, for it has been moved.

verses.latin: Ostendisti populo tuo dura: potasti nos vino compunctionis.
verses.english: You have shewn your people hard things: you have given us to drink of the wine of sorrow.

verses.latin: Dedisti metuentibus te significationem, ut fugiant a facie arcus.
verses.english: You have given a sign to those who fear you, that they may flee from before the bow.

verses.latin: Ut liberentur dilecti tui: salvum fac dextera tua, et exaudi me.
verses.english: That your beloved ones may be delivered: save me with your right hand, and hear me.

verses.latin: Deus locutus est in sancto suo: laetabor, et dividam Sichem, et vallem tabernaculorum metiar.
verses.english: God spoke in his holy place: I will rejoice and divide Sichem, and measure out the valley of the tabernacles.

verses.latin: Mea est Galaad, et mea est Manasses: et Ephraim fortitudo capitis mei.
verses.english: Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine: and Ephraim is the strength of my head.

verses.latin: Juda rex meus: Moab olla spei meae.
verses.english: Judah is my king: Moab is the pot of my hope.

verses.latin: In Idumaeam extendam calceamentum meum: mihi alienigenae amici facti sunt.
verses.english: In Idumea I will extend my shoe: to me the strangers are made friends.

verses.latin: Quis deducet me in civitatem munitam? quis deducet me usque in Idumaeam?
verses.english: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will bring me into Idumea?

verses.latin: Nonne tu, Deus, qui repulisti nos? et non egredieris, Deus, in virtutibus nostris?
verses.english: Will not you, O God, who have cast us off? and will not you, O God, go forth with our powers?

verses.latin: Da nobis auxilium de tribulatione: quia vana salus hominis.
verses.english: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the salvation of man.

verses.latin: In Deo faciemus virtutem: et ipse conteret inimicos nostros.
verses.english: In God we will do great things: and he will tread down our enemies.

verses.latin: In finem, pro his qui commutabuntur. David. In doctrina, cum succendit Syri de Mesopotamiam, et Syri Soba: et convertit Joab, et percussit in valle Salinarum duodecim milia.
verses.english: To the end, for those who will change. Of David. In the doctrine when he set on fire the Syrians of Mesopotamia and Syria of Soba: and Joab returned, and struck in the valley of Salt twelve thousand.

verses.latin: Deus, repulisti nos, et destruxisti nos: iratus es, et misertus es nobis.
verses.english: O God, you have rejected us, and have destroyed us; You were angry, but now You have had mercy on us.

verses.latin: Commovisti terram, et conturbasti eam: sana contritiones ejus, quia commota est.
verses.english: You have moved the earth and troubled it. Heal its fractures, for it is shaken.

verses.latin: Ostendisti populo tuo dura: potasti nos vino compunctionis.
verses.english: You have shown Your people harsh things; You have given us to drink the wine of compunction.

verses.latin: Dedisti metuentibus te signum, ut fugiant a facie arcus.
verses.english: You have given a sign to those who fear You, that they may flee from the face of the bow.

verses.latin: Ut liberentur dilecti tui: salvum fac dextera tua, et exaudi me.
verses.english: That Your beloved ones may be delivered; Save me with Your right hand, and hear me.

verses.latin: Deus locutus est in sancto suo: exultabo, et dividam Sichem, et vallem tabernaculorum metiar.
verses.english: God has spoken in His holy place; I will exult and divide Sichem, and measure the valley of tabernacles.

verses.latin: Meus est Galaad, et meus est Manasses: et Ephraim fortitudo capitis mei.
verses.english: Galaad is mine, and Manasses is mine, and Ephraim is the strength of my head.

verses.latin: Moab olla spei meae: in Idumaeam extendam calceamentum meum: mihi alienigenae amici facti sunt.
verses.english: Moab is the pot of my hope; I will extend my shoe into Idumea, and the foreigners have become friends to me.

verses.latin: Quis deducet me in civitatem munitam? quis deducet me usque in Idumaeam?
verses.english: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will bring me into Idumea?

verses.latin: Nonne tu, Deus, qui repulisti nos? et non egredieris, Deus, in virtutibus nostris?
verses.english: Will not You, O God, who have rejected us? And will You not go out, O God, in our powers?

verses.latin: Da nobis auxilium de tribulatione: quia vana salus hominis.
verses.english: Give us help from tribulation, for the safety of man is vain.

verses.latin: In Deo faciemus virtutem: et ipse conteret inimicos nostros.
verses.english: In God, we will do valiantly, and He will crush our enemies.

verses.latin: In finem, pro David, psalmus.
verses.english: For the leader. For David. A Psalm.

verses.latin: Exaudi, Deus, orationem meam: intende deprecationi meae.
verses.english: God, hear my prayer; pay attention to my plea.

verses.latin: A finibus terrae ad te clamavi, dum anxiarétur cor meum: in petra exaltasti me.
verses.english: I called to you from the ends of the earth, when my heart was overwhelmed. You set me high on a rock.

verses.latin: Quia exaltasti me: et deduxisti me, et implevisti me desolatione.
verses.english: For you have been my refuge. You have guided me and filled me with hope.

verses.latin: Reducas me, quia factus sum quasi cinis.
verses.english: You are my protector. And I trust you.

verses.latin: Audiam exultationem et laetitiam: exultabunt ossa humiliata.
verses.english: Let me find joy in God again; and praise him again. All my being is in God.

verses.latin: Averte faciem tuam a peccatis meis, et omnes iniquitates meas dele.
verses.english: Turn your face away from my sins and cleanse all my wrongdoing.

verses.latin: Cor mundum crea in me, Deus: et spiritum rectum innova in visceribus meis.
verses.english: Create a clean heart in me, God, and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.latin: Ne projicias me a facie tua: et spiritum sanctum tuum ne auferas a me.
verses.english: Do not cast me away from your face, and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.

verses.latin: Redde mihi laetitiam salutaris tui: et spiritu principali confirma me.
verses.english: Give me back the joy of your salvation, and strengthen me with a willing spirit.

verses.latin: Docebo iniquos vias tuas: et impii ad te convertentur.
verses.english: Then I will teach the wicked your ways, and sinners will return to you.

verses.latin: Libera me de sanguinibus, Deus, Deus salutis meae: exultabit lingua mea justitiam tuam.
verses.english: Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, God, the God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing aloud of your goodness.

verses.latin: Domine, labia mea aperies: et os meum annuntiabit laudem tuam.
verses.english: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise.

verses.latin: Quoniam si voluisses sacrificium, dedissem utique: holocaustomis non delectaberis.
verses.english: For you will not delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You take no pleasure in burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Sacrificium Deo spiritus contribulatus: cor contritum et humiliatum, Deus, non despicies.
verses.english: My sacrifice, O God, is a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.

verses.latin: Benigne fac, Domine, in bona voluntate tua Sion: ut aedificentur muri Jerusalem.
verses.english: Do good to Zion in your good pleasure; rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Tunc acceptabis sacrificium justitiae, oblationes et holocausta: tunc imponent super altare tuum vitulos.
verses.english: Then you will delight in right sacrifices, offerings and burnt offerings; then young bulls will be offered on your altar.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the end. A Psalm of David.

verses.latin: Deus, Deus meus, ad te de luce vigilo.
verses.english: O God, my God, I watch for you at dawn.

verses.latin: Sitit in te anima mea; quam multipliciter tibi caro mea!
verses.english: My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you!

verses.latin: In terra deserta, et invia, et inaquosa: sic in sancto apparui tibi, ut viderem virtutem tuam, et gloriam tuam.
verses.english: In a desolate land, an empty desert without water: I came to you in the sanctuary, that I might see your power and glory.

verses.latin: Quoniam melior est misericordia tua super vitas: labia mea laudabunt te.
verses.english: Because your mercy is better than life; my lips shall praise you.

verses.latin: Sic benedicam te in vita mea: et in nomine tuo levabo manus meas.
verses.english: So will I bless you in my life: and in your name I will lift up my hands.

verses.latin: Sicut adipe et pinguedine repleatur anima mea: et labiis exultationis laudabit os meum.
verses.english: As with fat and richness is my soul filled: and with lips of joy my mouth shall praise you.

verses.latin: Si memor fui tui super stratum meum, in matutinis meditabor in te.
verses.english: If I have remembered you upon my bed, in the morning I will meditate on you.

verses.latin: Quia fuisti adjutor meus: et in velamento alarum tuarum exultabo.
verses.english: Because you have been my helper, and in the protection of your wings I will rejoice.

verses.latin: Adhaesit anima mea post te: me suscepit dextera tua.
verses.english: My soul has adhered to you: your right hand has taken me up.

verses.latin: Ipsi vero in vanum quaesierunt animam meam: introibunt in inferiorem terrae.
verses.english: But they have sought my soul in vain: they shall enter into the lower parts of the earth.

verses.latin: Tradentur in manus gladii: partes vulpium erunt.
verses.english: They shall be given into the hands of the sword: they shall be the portions of foxes.

verses.latin: Rex vero laetabitur in Deo; laudabitur omnis qui jurat in eo: quia obstructum est os loquentium iniqua.
verses.english: But the king shall rejoice in God; everyone who swears by him shall be praised: because the mouth of those who speak wicked things has been stopped.

verses.latin: Deus, Deus meus, ad te de luce vigilo.
verses.english: God, my God, I watch for you every morning.

verses.latin: Sitivit in te anima mea: quam multipliciter tibi caro mea!
verses.english: My soul thirsts for you; I have such a deep desire for you!

verses.latin: in terra deserta, et invia, et inaquosa.
verses.english: In the land that's barren, and without a path, and without water.

verses.latin: Sic in sancto apparui tibi, ut viderem virtutem tuam, et gloriam tuam.
verses.english: I long to be with you in the holy temple, to behold your power and your glory.

verses.latin: Quoniam melior est misericordia tua super vitas: labia mea laudabunt te.
verses.english: Because your mercy is better than life; my lips will praise you.

verses.latin: Sic benedicam te in vita mea: et in nomine tuo levabo manus meas.
verses.english: So I will bless you for as long as I live, and in your name I will lift up my hands.

verses.latin: Sicut adipe et pinguedine repleatur anima mea: et labiis exsultationis laudabit os meum.
verses.english: My soul is satisfied as with the richest foods, and my mouth will praise you with joyful lips.

verses.latin: Si memor fui tui super stratum meum, in matutinis meditabor in te:
verses.english: When I remember you upon my bed, I meditate on you during the night.

verses.latin: quia fuisti adjutor meus: et in velamento alarum tuarum exsultabo.
verses.english: Because you have been my help, and under the shadow of your wings I will sing.

verses.latin: Adhaesit anima mea post te: me suscepit dextera tua.
verses.english: My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.

verses.latin: Ipsi vero in vanum quaesierunt animam meam: introibunt in inferiores terrae.
verses.english: But those who seek to destroy my soul will go down into the depths of the earth.

verses.latin: Tradentur in manus gladii: partes vulpium erunt.
verses.english: They shall be given over to the sword; they shall be the portion of the foxes.

verses.latin: Rex vero laetabitur in Deo; laudabitur omnis qui jurat in eo: quia obstructum est os loquentium iniqua.
verses.english: But the king will rejoice in God; everyone who swears by him will be praised, because the mouths of those who speak wickedness are stopped.

verses.latin: In finem, in psalmis David.
verses.english: For the leader: A psalm of David.

verses.latin: Te decet hymnus, Deus, in Sion, et tibi reddetur votum in Ierusalem.
verses.english: Praise is due to you, God, in Zion. Vows are paid to you in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Exaudi orationem meam: ad te omnis caro veniet.
verses.english: Hear my prayer. All men will come to you.

verses.latin: Verba iniquorum praevaluerunt super nos: et impietatibus nostris tu propitiaberis.
verses.english: Our sins and weaknesses are too great for us, but by your grace, you forgive our sins.

verses.latin: Beatus, quem elegisti, et assumpsisti: inhabitabit in atriis tuis.
verses.english: How blessed are those whom you have chosen to be with you, and they will dwell with you in your courts.

verses.latin: Replebimur in bonis domus tuae: sanctum est templum tuum, mirabile in aequitate.
verses.english: We will be filled with blessings in your house. Your temple is holy, full of wonders and righteousness.

verses.latin: Exaudi nos, Deus salutaris noster, spes omnium finium terrae, et in mari longe.
verses.english: Hear us, O God, our Savior. You are the hope of all the ends of the earth, and for those far away on the sea.

verses.latin: Praeparans montes in virtute tua, accinctus potentia.
verses.english: You established the mountains by your power, surrounded by strength.

verses.latin: Qui conturbas profundum maris in voce tua.
verses.english: You calm the deep waters with your voice.

verses.latin: Turbabuntur fluctus ejus: a voce iracundiae tuae.
verses.english: The waves and swells crash, due to your anger.

verses.latin: Et timebunt qui habitant terminos a signis tuis: exitus matutini et vespere delectabis.
verses.english: Those who dwell in the farthest reaches of the earth fear your signs. You bring forth the morning and evening with joy.

verses.latin: Visitasti terram, et inebriasti eam: multiplicasti locupletare eam.
verses.english: You visit the earth, and make it fruitful. You greatly enrich it.

verses.latin: Flumen Dei repletum est aquis: parasti cibum illorum: quoniam ita est praeparatio ejus.
verses.english: God's river is filled with water. You provide their food because you prepared the earth to be so.

verses.latin: Rivos ejus inebria: multiplica genimina ejus.
verses.english: You cause the streams to overflow. You make the earth flourish.

verses.latin: In stillicidiis ejus laetabitur germinans: benedic coronabis anni benignitatis tuae.
verses.english: The ground is saturated with water. The new growth rejoices. You crown the year with your bounty.

verses.latin: Benedictio Domini super terram: coronasti annum benignitatis tuae.
verses.english: The Lord blesses the earth. You crown the year with your bounty.

verses.latin: Replebuntur areae deserti: et exultatione collium circumdederunt.
verses.english: The pastures of the wilderness are filled with plenty and the hills are joyful.

verses.latin: Induti sunt arietes ovium, et valles abundabunt frumento: clamabunt, etenim hymnum dicent.
verses.english: The flocks of sheep cover the hills. The valleys are covered in grain. They all sing your praises.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus David.
verses.english: For the leader. A song of David.

verses.latin: Te decet hymnus, Deus, in Sion:
verses.english: Praise is due to You, God, in Zion

verses.latin: et reddetur votum in te in Jerusalem.
verses.english: and vows must be kept, offered up to You in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Exaudi orationem meam: ad te omnis caro veniet.
verses.english: Hear my prayer; all of mankind will come to you.

verses.latin: Verba iniquorum praevaluerunt super nos:
verses.english: The evils of the wicked, including the sins of us all, overwhelm us

verses.latin: et impietatibus nostris tu propitiaberis.
verses.english: but You will make up for our wickedness.

verses.latin: Beatus, quem elegisti, et assumpsisti: inhabitabit in atriis tuis.
verses.english: Happy is the person You have chosen and accepted: they will live in Your holy places.

verses.latin: Satiabimur in bonis domus tuae: sanctum est templum tuum, mirabile in aequitate.
verses.english: We will be fully satisfied by the blessings of Your house; your temple is a holy place, miraculous in its righteousness.

verses.latin: Exaudi nos, Deus salutaris noster, spes omnium finium terrae, et in mari longe.
verses.english: Hear us, O God of our salvation, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the seas far away,

verses.latin: praeparans montes in virtute tua, accinctus fortitudine.
verses.english: who strengthens the mountains with your power, You are girded with strength.

verses.latin: Qui conturbas profundum maris sonum fluctuum ejus.
verses.english: You stir up the deep sea, the sound of its waves.

verses.latin: Turbabuntur gentes, et timebunt qui habitant in finibus a signis tuis: exitus matutini et vespere delectabis.
verses.english: The nations will be terrified and those who dwell in the farthest reaches of the earth will be in awe of your signs. You will bring joy to the rising of the sun and the coming of the evening.

verses.latin: Visitasti terram, et inebriasti eam: multiplicasti locupletare eam.
verses.english: You have visited the earth and watered it; You have greatly enriched it.

verses.latin: Flumen Dei repletum est aquis: parasti cibum illorum: quoniam ita est praeparatio ejus.
verses.english: God's river is filled with water. You prepared food for them, because this is how it should be prepared.

verses.latin: Rivos ejus inebria: multiplica genimina ejus.
verses.english: You fill its streams, and multiply its increase.

verses.latin: In stillicidiis ejus laetabitur germinans: benedic coronabis annum benignitatis tuae.
verses.english: The sprouting plants will rejoice because of You; You will bless the year with Your goodness.

verses.latin: Plenitudo deserti stillabunt.
verses.english: The wilderness will overflow with Your goodness.

verses.latin: Laetabuntur speciosa deserti: et exultabunt colles in circuitu.
verses.english: The beautiful places of the desert will be filled with joy, and the hills will be happy.

verses.latin: Induti sunt arietes ovium, et valles abundabunt frumento: clamabunt, etenim hymnum dicent.
verses.english: The meadows will be covered with flocks and the valleys will overflow with grain. They will shout for joy, they will also sing.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the choir director, for the musicians. A psalm of David.

verses.latin: Jubilate Deo, omnis terra; psalmum dicite nomini ejus; date gloriam laudi ejus.
verses.english: Sing joyfully to God, all the earth; sing a psalm to His name; give glory to His praise.

verses.latin: Dicite Deo: Quam terribilia sunt opera tua, Domine! In multitudine virtutis tuae mentientur tibi inimici tui.
verses.english: Say to God: “How awesome are Your works, O Lord! Your enemies will come to You with lies, pretending to be impressed by Your greatness.”

verses.latin: Omnis terra adoret te, et psallat tibi; psalmum dicat nomini tuo.
verses.english: Let all the earth worship You, and sing to You; let them sing a psalm to Your name.

verses.latin: Venite, et videte opera Dei; terribilis in consiliis super filios hominum.
verses.english: Come and see the works of God; He is awesome in his counsel toward all of mankind.

verses.latin: Convertit mare in aridam; in flumine pertransibunt pede: ibi laetabimur in ipso.
verses.english: He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot; we will rejoice in Him.

verses.latin: Qui dominatur in virtute sua in aeternum; oculi ejus super gentes respiciunt: qui exasperant, non exaltentur in se.
verses.english: He reigns forever by His power; His eyes look upon the nations: let those who provoke Him not become proud.

verses.latin: Benedicite, gentes, Deum nostrum, et auditam facite vocem laudis ejus,
verses.english: Bless our God, O peoples, and make the sound of His praise heard,

verses.latin: qui posuit animam meam in vita, et non dedit in motum pedes meos.
verses.english: who keeps my soul in life, and did not allow my feet to be moved.

verses.latin: Quoniam probasti nos, Deus; ignem nos examinasti, sicut examinatur argentum.
verses.english: For you have tried us, O God; You have tested us in fire, just as silver is tested.

verses.latin: Introduxisti nos in laqueum; posuisti tribulationes in dorso nostro.
verses.english: You led us into the snare; You placed afflictions upon our backs.

verses.latin: Imposuisti homines super capita nostra; transivimus per ignem et aquam: et eduxisti nos in refrigerium.
verses.english: You set men over our heads; we went through fire and water: and You brought us out into refreshment.

verses.latin: Introibo in domum tuam in holocausto; reddam tibi vota mea quae distinxerunt labia mea,
verses.english: I will go into Your house with burnt offerings; I will pay You my vows which my lips have uttered,

verses.latin: et quae promiserunt labia mea in tribulatione mea.
verses.english: and which my lips promised in my tribulation.

verses.latin: Holocausta pingium offeram tibi cum incenso arietum; offeram tibi boves cum hircis.
verses.english: I will offer You burnt offerings of fatlings with the incense of rams; I will offer You bulls with goats.

verses.latin: Venite, audite, et narrabo, omnes qui timetis Deum, quanta fecit animae meae.
verses.english: Come, hear, and I will tell, all you who fear God, how much He has done for my soul.

verses.latin: Ad ipsum ore meo clamavi, et exaltavi sub lingua mea.
verses.english: I cried out to Him with my mouth, and I exalted Him with my tongue.

verses.latin: Si iniquitatem in corde meo aspexi, non exaudiet Dominus.
verses.english: If I had looked upon iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not have heard me.

verses.latin: Propterea exaudivit Deus, et attendit voci deprecationis meae.
verses.english: But God did hear me, and attended to the voice of my supplication.

verses.latin: Benedictus Deus, qui non amovit orationem meam, et misericordiam suam a me.
verses.english: Blessed be God, who did not reject my prayer, nor His mercy toward me.

verses.latin: Deus misereatur nostri, et benedicat nobis: illuminet vultum suum super nos, et misereatur nostri.
verses.english: May God show us His mercy, and may He bless us. May God smile down on us and show us His mercy.

verses.latin: Ut cognoscamus in terra viam tuam: in omnibus gentibus salutare tuum.
verses.english: So that all nations may see that You offer salvation and so they may all know Your ways here on earth.

verses.latin: Confiteantur tibi populi, Deus: confiteantur tibi populi omnes.
verses.english: Let all the nations thank You, God. Yes, let all the nations thank You.

verses.latin: Laetentur et exsultent gentes: quoniam judicas populos in aequitate, et gentes in terra dirigis.
verses.english: May the people rejoice and be glad! For You judge all people fairly. You guide the nations of the earth.

verses.latin: Confiteantur tibi populi, Deus: confiteantur tibi populi omnes.
verses.english: Let all the nations thank You, God. Yes, let all the nations thank You.

verses.latin: Terra dedit fructum suum: benedicat nos Deus, Deus noster.
verses.english: The earth has yielded its harvest. May God, even our God, give us His blessing.

verses.latin: Benedicat nos Deus: et metuant eum omnes fines terrae.
verses.english: May God give us His blessing, and may all the ends of the earth fear Him.

verses.latin: Exsurgat Deus, et dissipentur inimici ejus, et fugiant qui oderunt eum a facie ejus.
verses.english: May God arise, and may His enemies be scattered, and may those who hate Him flee from before His face.

verses.latin: Sicut deficit fumus, deficiant: sicut fluit cera a facie ignis, sic pereant peccatores a facie Dei.
verses.english: As smoke vanishes, let them vanish: as wax melts before fire, so let sinners perish before the face of God.

verses.latin: Justi autem epulentur, et exultent in conspectu Dei, et delectentur in laetitia.
verses.english: But may the just rejoice and be glad in the presence of God, and be delighted in joy.

verses.latin: Cantate Deo, psalmum dicite nomini ejus: iter facite ei, qui ascendit super occasum.
verses.english: Sing to God, sing a psalm to His name: make a way for Him Who ascends above the setting sun.

verses.latin: Dominus nomen illi. Exultate in conspectu ejus, turbabuntur a facie ejus:
verses.english: The Lord is His name. Rejoice before Him, they will be disturbed before His face:

verses.latin: Pater orphanorum et judex viduarum Deus in loco sancto suo.
verses.english: God, the Father of orphans and the judge of widows, is in His holy place.

verses.latin: Deus, qui inhabitare facit unius moris in domo: qui educit vinctos in fortitudine, similiter eos qui exasperant inhabitant in sepulcris.
verses.english: God, Who makes those of one mind dwell in a house: Who brings forth the bound into strength, likewise those who exasperate, inhabit the tombs.

verses.latin: Deus, cum exires in conspectu populi tui, cum pertransires in deserto,
verses.english: O God, when You went forth before Your people, when You passed through the desert,

verses.latin: terra mota est, etenim caeli stillaverunt a facie Dei Sinai, a facie Dei Israël.
verses.english: the earth shook, and the heavens dripped at the presence of God Sinai, at the presence of God of Israel.

verses.latin: Pluviam voluntariam segregabis, Deus, haereditati tuae: et infirmata est, tu vero perfecisti eam.
verses.english: You will separate a voluntary rain, O God, for Your inheritance: and it was weakened, but You strengthened it.

verses.latin: Animalia tua habitabunt in ea: parasti in dulcedine tua pauperi, Deus.
verses.english: Your animals will dwell in it: You have prepared, in Your sweetness, for the poor, O God.

verses.latin: Dominus dabit verbum evangelizantibus virtute multa.
verses.english: The Lord will give the word to those who evangelize with great strength.

verses.latin: Rex virtutum dilecti, dilecti: et speciei domus dividere spolia.
verses.english: The King of powers, of the beloved, of the beloved: and to the beauty of the house, to divide spoils.

verses.latin: Si dormiatis inter medios terminos, pennae columbae deargentatae, et posteriora ejus in pallore auri.
verses.english: If you sleep among the midst of boundaries, the wings of a dove are covered with silver, and its hind parts with the paleness of gold.

verses.latin: Dum discernit caelestis reges super eam, nive dealbabuntur in Selmon.
verses.english: While the Heavenly One dispenses to the kings over her, they will be whitened with snow in Selmon.

verses.latin: Mons Dei, mons pinguis: mons coagulatus, mons pinguis.
verses.english: The mountain of God is a rich mountain: a congealed mountain, a rich mountain.

verses.latin: Ut quid suspicamini montes coagulatos? mons in quo beneplacuit Deo habitare: etenim Dominus habitabit in finem.
verses.english: Why do you suspect the congealed mountains? The mountain in which it pleased God to dwell: for the Lord will dwell to the end.

verses.latin: Currus Dei decem millibus multiplex, millia laetantium: Dominus in eis in Sina in sancto.
verses.english: The chariots of God are manifold, of ten thousand, of thousands rejoicing: the Lord is among them in Sinai, in the holy place.

verses.latin: Ascendisti in altum, cepisti captivitatem, accepisti dona in hominibus: etenim non credentes habitare, ut habitet Dominus Deus.
verses.english: You ascended on high, You led captivity captive, You received gifts among men: for even those who do not believe, may dwell, that the Lord God may dwell.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus die quotidie: prosperum iter faciet nobis Deus salutis nostrae.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord day by day: may God, the God of our salvation, give us a prosperous journey.

verses.latin: Deus noster, Deus salvos faciendi: et Domini, Domini exitus mortis.
verses.english: Our God is the God of saving: and of the Lord, the Lord is the way out of death.

verses.latin: Verumtamen Deus confringet capita inimicorum suorum: crinem capitis perversorum in inquisitionibus eorum.
verses.english: But indeed God will break the heads of His enemies: the hair of the head of those walking in their wickedness.

verses.latin: Dixit Dominus: Ex Basan convertam, convertam in profundum maris:
verses.english: The Lord said: "I will bring back from Basan, I will bring back from the depths of the sea:

verses.latin: Ut intinguatur pes tuus in sanguine: lingua canum tuorum ex inimicis.
verses.english: That your foot may be dipped in blood: the tongue of your dogs from the enemies.

verses.latin: Apparuerunt gressus tui, Deus: gressus Dei mei regis mei, qui est in sancto.
verses.english: Your footsteps have been seen, O God: the footsteps of my God, my King, Who is in the holy place.

verses.latin: Praevenerunt principes juncti psallentibus: in medio juvencularum tympanistriarum.
verses.english: The princes came together before those who were singing psalms: in the midst of the young women playing timbrels.

verses.latin: In ecclesiis benedicite Deo Domino de fontibus Israël.
verses.english: In the churches, bless God the Lord from the fountains of Israel.

verses.latin: Ibi in principiis conparvulus Benjamin, in mentis excessu. Principes Juda, duces eorum: principes Zabulon, principes Nephthali.
verses.english: There is little Benjamin in the beginnings, in a state of ecstasy. The princes of Judah, their leaders: the princes of Zabulon, the princes of Naphtali.

verses.latin: Manda, Deus, virtuti tuae: confirma hoc, Deus, quod operatus es in nobis.
verses.english: Command, O God, Your strength: confirm this, O God, that You have worked in us.

verses.latin: A templo tuo in Jerusalem tibi offerent reges dona.
verses.english: From Your temple in Jerusalem, kings will offer gifts to You.

verses.latin: Increpa feras calami: congregatio taurorum in vaccis populorum, ut excludant eos qui probati sunt argento: dissipa gentes quae bella volunt.
verses.english: Rebuke the wild beasts of the reed: the congregation of bulls among the cows of the peoples, so that they may exclude those who are tried by silver: scatter the nations who desire war.

verses.latin: Venient legati ex AEgypto: AEthiopia praeveniet manus ejus Deo.
verses.english: Envoys will come from Egypt: Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God.

verses.latin: Regna terrae, cantate Deo: psallite Domino.
verses.english: O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God: sing a psalm to the Lord.

verses.latin: Psallite Deo, qui ascendit super caelos caelorum ad orientem: ecce dabit voci suae vocem virtutis.
verses.english: Sing to God, Who ascends above the skies of the heavens in the east: behold, He will give to His voice, the voice of strength.

verses.latin: Date gloriam Deo: super Israël magnificientia ejus, et virtus ejus in nubibus.
verses.english: Ascribe glory to God: His magnificence is above Israel, and His power is in the clouds.

verses.latin: Mirabilis Deus in sanctis suis: Deus Israël ipse dabit virtutem et fortitudinem plebi suae. Benedictus Deus.
verses.english: God is wonderful in His holy ones: God of Israel Himself will give strength and fortitude to His people. Blessed be God.

verses.latin: Deus, in adjutorium meum intende:
verses.english: O God, come quickly to help me.

verses.latin: Domine, ad adjuvandum me festina.
verses.english: Lord, hurry to save me.

verses.latin: Confundantur et revereantur, qui quaerunt animam meam.
verses.english: May all those who seek to take my life be humiliated and ashamed.

verses.latin: Avertantur retrorsum, et erubescant, qui volunt mihi mala.
verses.english: May those who wish me harm turn back and be disgraced.

verses.latin: Avertantur statim erubescentes, qui mihi inrident.
verses.english: May those who mock me be turned back in shame.

verses.latin: Exsultent et laetentur in te omnes qui quaerunt te:
verses.english: May all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You,

verses.latin: et dicant semper: Magnificetur Deus, qui diligunt salutare tuum.
verses.english: and may those who love your salvation say always, “God be praised”.

verses.latin: Ego vero egenus, et pauper sum:
verses.english: But I am poor and needy:

verses.latin: Deus, adjuva me.
verses.english: O God, come to my aid.

verses.latin: Adjutor meus et liberator meus es tu:
verses.english: You are my helper and my savior;

verses.latin: Domine, ne moreris.
verses.english: Lord, do not delay.

verses.latin: In te, Domine, speravi; non confundar in aeternum.
verses.english: In You, Lord, I have placed my hope. May I never be humiliated.

verses.latin: In justitia tua libera me, et eripe me: inclina ad me aurem tuam, et salva me.
verses.english: Free me with Your justice, and rescue me. Hear my prayer, and save me.

verses.latin: Esto mihi in Deum protectorem, et in locum munitum ut salvum me facias:
verses.english: Be to me a God who protects, and a strong place where you can save me:

verses.latin: quoniam fortitudo mea et refugium meum es tu: et propter nomen tuum deduces me, et enutries me.
verses.english: For You are my strength, and my refuge. And because of Your name, lead me to safety, and nourish me.

verses.latin: Educes me de laqueo hoc quem absconderunt mihi: quoniam tu es protector meus.
verses.english: Bring me out of the trap they set for me. Because You are my protector.

verses.latin: In manus tuas commendo spiritum meum: redemisti me, Domine Deus veritatis.
verses.english: Into Your hands I commend my spirit: You have redeemed me, Lord, God of truth.

verses.latin: Odisti observantes vanitates superflue: ego autem in Domino speravi.
verses.english: You hate those who observe false idols. But I have placed my hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Laetabor, et exultabo in misericordia tua: quoniam respexisti humilitatem meam, salvasti de necessitatibus animam meam.
verses.english: I will rejoice and exult in Your mercy. Because You have seen my lowliness, and saved my soul from its troubles.

verses.latin: Nec conclusisti me in manibus inimici: statuisti in loco spatioso pedes meos.
verses.english: You have not handed me over to my enemy. You have set my feet in a spacious place.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam tribulor: conturbatus est in ira oculus meus, anima mea, et venter meus.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, Lord, because I am in trouble. My eye is troubled in anger, my soul, and my belly.

verses.latin: Quoniam defecit in dolore vita mea, et anni mei in gemitibus: infirmata est in paupertate virtus mea, et ossa mea conturbata sunt.
verses.english: For my life has failed in sorrow, and my years in groaning. My strength has become weak in poverty, and my bones have been disturbed.

verses.latin: Super omnes inimicos meos factus sum opprobrium, et vicinis meis valde: et timor notis meis.
verses.english: I have become a reproach to all my enemies, and greatly to my neighbors. And a fear to my acquaintances.

verses.latin: Qui videbant me, foras fugiebant a me.
verses.english: Those who saw me, fled far away from me.

verses.latin: Oblivioni datus sum, tamquam mortuus a corde: factus sum tamquam vas perditum.
verses.english: I am forgotten, as if I were dead from the heart. I have become like a broken vessel.

verses.latin: Quoniam audivi vituperationem multorum commorantium in circuitu: in eo dum convenirent simul adversum me, accipere animam meam cogitaverunt.
verses.english: For I have heard the reproach of many who live around me. While they gather together against me, they plan to take my life.

verses.latin: Ego autem in te speravi, Domine: dixi: Deus meus es tu: in manibus tuis sortes meae.
verses.english: But I have hoped in You, Lord. I said: “You are my God: In Your hands are my lots.”

verses.latin: Eripe me de manu inimicorum meorum, et a persequentibus me.
verses.english: Rescue me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.

verses.latin: Illustra faciem tuam super servum tuum: salvum me fac in misericordia tua.
verses.english: Shine Your face upon Your servant. Save me in Your mercy.

verses.latin: Domine, non confundar, quoniam invocavi te: confundantur impii, et deducantur in infernum.
verses.english: Lord, may I not be humiliated, because I have called upon You. May the wicked be humiliated, and led down to hell.

verses.latin: Muta muta loquentur iniquitatem adversus justum: in contumelia et in persequendo eum.
verses.english: May deceitful mouths speak wickedness against the just man, in contempt and in persecuting him.

verses.latin: Quam magna multitudo dulcedinis tuae, Domine, quam abscondisti iis qui timent te: perfecisti eis qui sperant in te in conspectu filiorum hominum.
verses.english: How great is the multitude of Your sweetness, Lord, which You have hidden for those who fear You. You have prepared it for those who hope in You, in the sight of the sons of men.

verses.latin: Abscondes eos in abscondito faciei tuae a conturbatione hominum: proteges eos in tabernaculo tuo a contradictione linguarum.
verses.english: You will hide them in the secret of Your face, from the turmoil of men. You will protect them in Your tabernacle from the contradiction of tongues.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, quoniam mirificavit misericordiam suam mihi in civitate munitionis.
verses.english: Blessed is the Lord, because He has shown His mercy wonderfully to me in a city of defense.

verses.latin: Ego autem dixi in excessu mentis meae: Projectus sum a facie oculorum tuorum. Ideo exaudisti vocem orationis meae, dum clamarem ad te.
verses.english: But I said in the excess of my mind: “I am cast out from the face of Your eyes.” Therefore You have heard the voice of my prayer while I cried to You.

verses.latin: Diligite Dominum omnes sancti ejus: quoniam veritatem requiret Dominus, et retribuet abundantissime facientibus superbiam.
verses.english: Love the Lord, all you His saints. Because the Lord will seek the truth, and will reward those who act with pride abundantly.

verses.latin: Viriliter agite, et confortetur cor vestrum, omnes qui speratis in Domino.
verses.english: Act with courage, and let your heart be strengthened, all you who hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: In te, Domine, speravi; non confundar in aeternum: in justitia tua libera me.
verses.english: In You, Lord, I put my trust, and I will never be put to shame: free me because you are just.

verses.latin: Inclina ad me aurem tuam, et salva me. *
verses.english: Turn your ear to me, and save me.

verses.latin: Esto mihi in Deum protectorem, et in locum munitum ut salvum me facias:
verses.english: Be my God who protects me, and be a strong place for me, so that you might save me:

verses.latin: quoniam fortitudo mea et refugium meum es tu: et propter nomen tuum deduces me, et enutries me.
verses.english: You are my strength, and you are my refuge. Guide me and sustain me because of your name.

verses.latin: Educes me de laqueo hoc quem absconderunt mihi: quoniam tu es protector meus.
verses.english: Deliver me from the trap they set for me: because you are my protector.

verses.latin: In manus tuas commendo spiritum meum: redemisti me, Domine Deus veritatis.
verses.english: I commit my spirit to your hands: you have redeemed me, Lord God of truth.

verses.latin: Odisti observantes vanitates super vacuam: ego autem in Domino speravi.
verses.english: You hate those who watch over worthless idols, but I have put my trust in the Lord.

verses.latin: Laetabor, et exultabo in misericordia tua: quoniam respexisti humilitatem meam, salvasti de necessitatibus animam meam:
verses.english: I will rejoice and exult in your mercy: because you have looked down on my humility, and you have saved my soul from its troubles.

verses.latin: nec conclusisti me in manibus inimici: statuisti in loco spatioso pedes meos.
verses.english: You have not shut me into the hands of the enemy, but you have set my feet in a broad place.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam tribulor: conturbatus est in ira oculus meus, anima mea, et venter meus.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, Lord, because I am troubled: my eye, my soul, and my belly are troubled because of anger.

verses.latin: Quoniam defecit in dolore vita mea, et anni mei in gemitibus. Infirmata est in paupertate virtus mea, et ossa mea conturbata sunt.
verses.english: My life is failing because of the pain, and my years are spent in groaning. My strength is weakened by the poverty, and my bones are troubled.

verses.latin: Super omnes inimicos meos factus sum opprobrium, et vicinis meis valde: et timor notis meis.
verses.english: I have become an object of scorn to all my enemies, and to my neighbors: and I am a terror to my acquaintances.

verses.latin: Qui videbant me, foras fugiebant a me.
verses.english: Those who saw me fled far away from me.

verses.latin: Oblivioni datus sum, quasi mortuus a corde: factus sum tamquam vas perditum.
verses.english: I am forgotten, like a dead man in their hearts: I am become like a broken vessel.

verses.latin: Quoniam audivi vituperationem multorum commorantium in circuitu: in eo dum convenirent simul adversus me, accipere animam meam cogitaverunt.
verses.english: For I have heard the criticism of many who are gathered around me: they gathered together against me, and planned to take my life.

verses.latin: Ego autem in te speravi, Domine: dixi: Deus meus es tu: in manibus tuis sortes meae.
verses.english: But I put my trust in you, Lord. I said, “You are my God, my destiny is in your hands.”

verses.latin: Eripe me de manu inimicorum meorum, et a persequentibus me.
verses.english: Deliver me from the hands of my enemies, and from those who are persecuting me.

verses.latin: Illustra faciem tuam super servum tuum: salvum me fac in misericordia tua.
verses.english: Show your face to your servant: save me in your mercy.

verses.latin: Domine, non confundar, quoniam invocavi te: confundantur impii, et deducantur in infernum.
verses.english: Lord, I will not be put to shame, for I have called upon you: may the wicked be ashamed, and led down to hell.

verses.latin: Muta fiant labia dolosa: qui loquuntur iniquitatem adversus justum.
verses.english: Let the deceitful lips be silent: those who speak wickedness against the just.

verses.latin: Quam magna multitudo dulcedinis tuae, Domine, quam abscondisti iis qui timent te: perfecisti eis qui sperant in te in conspectu filiorum hominum.
verses.english: How great is the abundance of your sweetness, Lord, which you have hidden for those who fear you: you have accomplished it for those who trust in you, in the sight of the sons of men.

verses.latin: Abscondes eos in abscondito faciei tuae a conturbatione hominum: proteges eos in tabernaculo tuo a contradictione linguarum.
verses.english: You will hide them in the shelter of your face from the troubles of men: you will protect them in your tabernacle from the contradiction of tongues.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, quoniam mirificavit misericordiam suam mihi in civitate munitionis.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, for he has wonderfully shown his mercy to me in a fortified city.

verses.latin: Ego autem dixi in excessu mentis meae: Projectus sum a facie oculorum tuorum. Ideo exaudisti vocem orationis meae, dum clamarem ad te.
verses.english: But I said in my mental confusion: “I am cast out from before your eyes.” Therefore, you have heard the voice of my prayer when I cried out to you.

verses.latin: Diligite Dominum omnes sancti ejus, quoniam veritatem requiret Dominus, et retribuet abundanter facientibus superbiam.
verses.english: Love the Lord, all you his saints, because the Lord will seek out truth, and will give back abundantly to those who act with arrogance.

verses.latin: Viriliter agite, et confortetur cor vestrum, omnes qui speratis in Domino.
verses.english: Be strong, and let your heart be strengthened, all you who hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Deus, judicium tuum regi da: et justitiam tuam filio regis:
verses.english: God, grant your judgment to the king, and your justice to the king's son.

verses.latin: judicare populum tuum in justitia, et pauperes tuos in judicio.
verses.english: May he judge your people justly, and the poor with righteousness.

verses.latin: Suscipiant montes pacem populo: et colles justitiam.
verses.english: May the mountains bring peace to the people, and the hills, justice.

verses.latin: Judicabit pauperes populi, et salvos faciet filios pauperum: et humiliabit calumniatorem.
verses.english: May he judge the poor of the people, and save the children of the poor, and humiliate the oppressor.

verses.latin: Permanebit cum sole, et ante lunam, in generatione et generatione.
verses.english: May he endure as long as the sun and moon, from generation to generation.

verses.latin: Descendet sicut pluvia in vellus: et sicut stillicidia stillantia super terram.
verses.english: May he come down like rain on the fleece, and like the drops falling on the earth.

verses.latin: Orietur in diebus ejus justitia, et abundantia pacis, donec auferatur luna.
verses.english: In his days, justice will flourish, and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.

verses.latin: Et dominabitur a mari usque ad mare: et a flumine usque ad terminos orbis terrarum.
verses.english: May he have dominion from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.

verses.latin: Coram illo procident Aethiopes: et inimici ejus terram lingent.
verses.english: Before him, the Ethiopians will fall prostrate; and his enemies will lick the dust.

verses.latin: Reges Tharsis et insulae munera offerent: reges Arabum et Saba dona adducent.
verses.english: The kings of Tarshish and the islands will offer gifts; the kings of Arabia and Saba will bring offerings.

verses.latin: Et adorabunt eum omnes reges terrae: omnes gentes servient ei:
verses.english: And all the kings of the earth will adore him; all nations will serve him.

verses.latin: Quia liberabit pauperem a potente: et pauperem cui non erat adjutor.
verses.english: For he will free the poor from the oppressor and the poor who have no helper.

verses.latin: Parcet pauperi et inopi: et animas pauperum salvabit.
verses.english: He will spare the poor and the needy, and will save the souls of the poor.

verses.latin: De usuris et iniquitate redimet animas eorum: et honorabile nomen eorum coram illo.
verses.english: From usury and injustice he will redeem their souls, and their name will be honorable before him.

verses.latin: Et vivet, et dabitur ei de auro Arabiae: et adorabunt de ipso semper: tota die benedicent ei.
verses.english: And he will live, and he will be given gold from Arabia. They will adore him always; they will bless him all day long.

verses.latin: Et erit firmamentum in terra in summis montium, superexaltabitur super Libanum fructus ejus: et florebunt de civitate sicut foenum terrae.
verses.english: May there be a foundation in the land, on the tops of the mountains; may his fruit be exalted above Lebanon, and may they flourish from the city like the grass of the earth.

verses.latin: Sit nomen ejus benedictum in saecula: ante solem permanet nomen ejus.
verses.english: May his name be blessed forever. May his name endure before the sun.

verses.latin: Et benedicentur in ipso omnes tribus terrae: omnes gentes magnificabunt eum.
verses.english: And in him, all the tribes of the earth will be blessed. All nations will magnify him.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël, qui facit mirabilia solus.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who alone does marvelous things.

verses.latin: Et benedictum nomen majestatis ejus in saecula: et replebitur majestate ejus omnis terra. Fiat, fiat.
verses.english: And blessed be the name of his majesty forever. May his majesty fill the whole earth. Amen, so be it.

verses.latin: Finitum est opus David, filii Jesse.
verses.english: The work of David, the son of Jesse, is finished.

verses.latin: Quam bonus Israel Deus his, qui recto sunt corde!
verses.english: How good is the God of Israel to those who are pure of heart!

verses.latin: Mei autem pæne moti sunt pedes; pæne effusi sunt gressus mei.
verses.english: But my feet had almost stumbled. My steps were nearly unsteady.

verses.latin: Quia zelavi in iniquis, pacem peccatorum videns.
verses.english: Because I envied those who do evil, seeing the peace of sinners.

verses.latin: Non est enim respectus morti eorum, et firmamentum in plaga eorum.
verses.english: They have no regard for death, and they live free from all harm.

verses.latin: In labore hominum non sunt, et cum hominibus non flagellabuntur.
verses.english: They have no struggles, and they aren’t struck down with others.

verses.latin: Ideo tenuit eos superbia; operuerunt iniquitatem suam et impietatem suam.
verses.english: Therefore, pride grips them. They conceal their sin and their wickedness.

verses.latin: Prodiit quasi ex adipe iniquitas eorum; transierunt in affectum cordis.
verses.english: Their iniquity has burst forth, like a fat man. They pass into their own wicked desires.

verses.latin: Cogitaverunt, et locuti sunt nequitiam; iniquitatem in excelso locuti sunt.
verses.english: They think of and speak of wickedness, they speak evil things from high places.

verses.latin: Posuerunt in cælum os suum, et lingua eorum transivit in terra.
verses.english: They set their mouths in the sky, and their tongues roam the earth.

verses.latin: Ideo convertetur populus meus hic, et dies pleni invenientur in eis.
verses.english: Therefore, my people turn here, and full days will be found for them.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Quomodo scit Deus? et si est scientia in excelso?
verses.english: And they said, “How does God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?”

verses.latin: Ecce ipsi peccatores, et abundantes in sæculo, obtinuerunt divitias.
verses.english: Behold, these are the sinners. They are rich in this world, and they have obtained riches.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Ergo vanum justificavi cor meum, et lavi in innocentiâ manus meas;
verses.english: And I said, “Then in vain have I cleansed my heart, and washed my hands in innocence.

verses.latin: et fui flagellatus tota die, et castigatio mea in matutinis.
verses.english: I have been struck down all day long, and my chastisement comes every morning.”

verses.latin: Si dicebam: Narrabo ut illi; ecce nationem filiorum tuorum reprobavi.
verses.english: If I had said, “I will speak like them,” then I would have rejected the generation of Your children.

verses.latin: Et cogitabam ut scirem hoc; labor est in oculis meis,
verses.english: And I considered how I could know this; it is a labor in my eyes,

verses.latin: donec intrem in sanctuarium Dei, et intelligam in novissimis eorum.
verses.english: until I enter the sanctuary of God, and then I will understand their end.

verses.latin: Verumtamen propter dolos posuisti eis; dejecisti eos dum elevarentur.
verses.english: But truly You have set them in slippery places. You cast them down while they were lifted up.

verses.latin: Quomodo facti sunt in desolationem? subito defecerunt; perierunt propter iniquitatem suam.
verses.english: How they have become desolate! Suddenly they have failed; they have perished through their own iniquity.

verses.latin: Velut somnium surgentium, Domine, in civitate tua imaginem ipsorum ad nihilum rediges.
verses.english: As a dream when one awakens, so, Lord, when You arise, You will despise their image.

verses.latin: Quia inflammatus est cor meum, et renes mei commutati sunt;
verses.english: Because my heart was inflamed, and my reins were changed;

verses.latin: et ego ad nihilum redactus sum, et nescivi.
verses.english: and I was brought to nothing, and I did not know.

verses.latin: Ut jumentum factus sum apud te, et ego semper tecum.
verses.english: I was like a beast before You, but I am always with You.

verses.latin: Tenui manum tuam, et in voluntate tua deduxisti me, et cum gloria suscepisti me.
verses.english: I held Your hand, and in Your will You have led me, and You have received me in glory.

verses.latin: Quid enim mihi est in cælo? et a te quid volui super terram?
verses.english: For what do I have in the universe? And what do I desire on the earth besides You?

verses.latin: Defecit caro mea et cor meum; Deus cordis mei, et pars mea Deus in æternum.
verses.english: My flesh and my heart failed; God is the God of my heart, and my portion is God forever.

verses.latin: Quia ecce qui elongant se a te, peribunt; perdidisti omnem qui fornicatur abs te.
verses.english: For behold, those who distance themselves from You will perish; You have destroyed everyone who is unfaithful to You.

verses.latin: Mihi autem adhaerere Deo bonum est; ponere in Domino Deo spem meam;
verses.english: But for me, to cling to God is good; to put my hope in the Lord God,

verses.latin: ut annuntiem omnes prædicationes tuas in portis filiæ Sion.
verses.english: that I may proclaim all Your praises in the gates of the daughter of Zion.

verses.latin: In finem, in intellectum. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the leader, in understanding. A psalm of David.

verses.latin: Quare, Deus, repulisti in finem? iratus est furor tuus contra oves pascuae tuae?
verses.english: Why have you rejected us, God, forever? Is your anger ignited against the sheep of your pasture?

verses.latin: Memor esto congregationis tuae, quam possedisti ab initio.
verses.english: Remember your community, which you have held since the beginning.

verses.latin: Redemisti virgam haereditatis tuae; montem Sion, in quo habitasti.
verses.english: Remember the tribe of your inheritance; the holy mountain of Zion, where you dwell.

verses.latin: Leva manus tuas in superbas tuas in finem: quanta malignatus est inimicus in sancto!
verses.english: Lift up your hands against the arrogant of the world. See how the enemy has made a mess of the holy place!

verses.latin: Et gloriati sunt qui oderunt te, in medio solemnitatis tuae.
verses.english: Your enemies brag in the place of your solemn festival.

verses.latin: Posuerunt iniquitates suas in finem; non cognoverunt.
verses.english: They put their wickedness to an end; they did not understand.

verses.latin: Posuerunt iniquitates suas in finem; non cognoverunt.
verses.english: They ruined your holy places.

verses.latin: Posuerunt vias suas in obscurum.
verses.english: They made it dark, and they cannot see what they do.

verses.latin: Quoniam Deus, rex noster ante saecula, operatus est salutem in medio terrae.
