verses.english: Indeed, God is our King forever; he has provided salvation here on Earth.

verses.latin: Tu firmasti in virtute tua mare; contrivisti capita draconum in aquis.
verses.english: You, by your power, created the sea; you crushed the heads of the great sea monsters in the water.

verses.latin: Tu confregisti capita draconum; dedisti eum escam populis Aethiopum.
verses.english: You smashed the sea monster’s heads; you gave them as food to the Ethiopians.

verses.latin: Tu dirupisti fontes et torrentes; tu siccasti flumina Ethan.
verses.english: You broke open the fountains and the torrents; you dried up the river Ethan.

verses.latin: Tuus est dies, et tua est nox; tu fabricatus es auroram et solem.
verses.english: The day is yours, and the night is yours; you created the dawn and the sun.

verses.latin: Tu fecisti omnes terminos terrae; aestatem et ver tu plasmasti ea.
verses.english: You made all the boundaries of the earth; you made the summer and the spring.

verses.latin: Memor esto hujus, inimicus improperavit Domino; et populus insipiens incitavit nomen tuum.
verses.english: Remember this, Lord, the enemy has insulted you; and the foolish people have provoked your name.

verses.latin: Ne tradas bestiis animas confitentes tibi, et animas pauperum tuorum ne derelinquas in finem.
verses.english: Do not give the souls of those who praise you to wild beasts; do not forget the souls of your poor people forever.

verses.latin: Respice in testamentum tuum, quia impleti sunt qui obscurati sunt terrae domus iniquitatum.
verses.english: Take note of your covenant, because those who have been cast down into the darkness of the land are filled with wickedness.

verses.latin: Ne avertatur humilis confusus; pauper et inops laudabunt nomen tuum.
verses.english: Do not let the humble be humiliated; the poor and needy will praise your name.

verses.latin: Exsurge, Deus, judica causam tuam; memor esto improperiorum tuorum, eorum quae ab insipiente sunt tota die.
verses.english: Rise up, God, and defend your cause; remember the insults you suffer, which the foolish hurl at you all day long.

verses.latin: Ne obliviscaris voces inimicorum tuorum; superbia eorum qui te oderunt ascendit semper.
verses.english: Do not forget the voices of your enemies; the pride of those who hate you always rises up.

verses.latin: In finem. In canticis. Psalmus Asaph.
verses.english: To the end. A song. A psalm of Asaph.

verses.latin: Notus in Judaea Deus: in Israël magnum nomen ejus.
verses.english: God is known in Judea, His name is great in Israel.

verses.latin: Et factus est in pace locus ejus: et habitatio ejus in Sion.
verses.english: Peaceful is His dwelling, His home is in Zion.

verses.latin: Ibi confregit potentias arcuum, scutum, gladium, et bellum.
verses.english: There, He broke the strength of the bows: He shattered shields, swords, and war.

verses.latin: Illuminas tu mirabiliter a montibus aeternis.
verses.english: You are light, shining from the everlasting mountains.

verses.latin: Conturbati sunt omnes insipientes corde: dormierunt somnum suum.
verses.english: All the foolish in heart were disturbed; they fell into their sleep.

verses.latin: Nihil invenerunt omnes viri divitiarum in manibus suis.
verses.english: All the rich men found nothing in their hands.

verses.latin: Ab increpatione tua, Deus Jacob, dormitaverunt qui ascenderunt equos.
verses.english: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, those who rode horses were made to sleep.

verses.latin: Terribilis tu es, et quis resistet tibi? Ex tunc ira tua.
verses.english: You are to be feared, and who can resist You? From then on, Your wrath reigns.

verses.latin: De caelo auditum fecisti judicium: terra tremuit et quievit
verses.english: You made judgment heard from the sky: the land trembled and was still.

verses.latin: Cum exsurgeret in judicium Deus, ut salvos faceret omnes mansuetos terrae.
verses.english: When God arose to judge, to save all the meek of the earth.

verses.latin: Quoniam cogitatio hominis confitebitur tibi: et reliquiae cogitationis diem festum agent tibi.
verses.english: For the thought of man shall praise You, and the remnants of thought will keep festival for You.

verses.latin: Vovete et reddite Domino Deo vestro: omnes qui in circuitu ejus affertis munera.
verses.english: Vow and give to the Lord your God; all who bring gifts around Him.

verses.latin: Terribili, et ei qui aufert spiritum principum: terribili apud reges terrae.
verses.english: To Him who is to be feared, to Him who takes away the spirit of princes, to Him who is feared by the kings of the earth.

verses.latin: In finem, in carminibus. Psalmus Asaph.
verses.english: To the end, for the songs. A psalm of Asaph.

verses.latin: Notus in Judaea Deus: in Israel magnum nomen ejus.
verses.english: God is known in Judea, and His name is great in Israel.

verses.latin: Et factus est in pace locus ejus: et habitatio ejus in Sion.
verses.english: He has chosen a place of peace, and His home is in Zion.

verses.latin: Ibi confregit potentias arcuum, scutum, gladium, et bellum.
verses.english: There, He broke the strength of bows and destroyed shields, swords, and war.

verses.latin: Lucerna tu es gloriosus prae saeculis: montes praedatorum.
verses.english: You are glorious and shine brighter than everything. The mountains are filled with prey.

verses.latin: Turbati sunt insipientes corde: dormierunt somnum suum.
verses.english: The foolish are troubled in heart and will sleep the sleep of death.

verses.latin: Nihil invenerunt omnes viri divitiarum in manibus suis.
verses.english: All the wealthy will find nothing in their hands.

verses.latin: Ab increpatione tua, Deus Jacob, dormitaverunt qui ascenderunt equos.
verses.english: At your rebuke, God of Jacob, those who rode horses fell into a deep sleep.

verses.latin: Terribilis tu es, et quis resistet tibi? ex tunc ira tua.
verses.english: You are terrible, and who can withstand You once your wrath is roused?

verses.latin: De coelo auditum fecisti judicium: terra tremuit et quievit
verses.english: From the sky, You made Your judgment known. The earth trembled and was still,

verses.latin: cum exsurgeret in judicium Deus, ut salvos faceret omnes mansuetos terrae.
verses.english: when God rose up to judge, to save all the meek of the earth.

verses.latin: Quoniam cogitatio hominis confitebitur tibi: et reliquiae cogitationis diem festum agent tibi.
verses.english: Truly, the thought of man will give thanks to You, and the remainder of thought will keep festival for You.

verses.latin: Vovete, et reddite Domino Deo vestro: omnes qui in circuitu ejus affertis munera.
verses.english: Make vows and give to the Lord your God, all you who bring gifts around Him.

verses.latin: Terribili, et ei qui aufert spiritum principum, terribili apud reges terrae.
verses.english: To the terrible one, who takes away the spirit of princes, who is terrible to the kings of the earth.

verses.latin: Intellectum mihi date, populi mei; et legem vestram, inclinate aurem vestram.
verses.english: Listen to me, my people, and pay attention to my law.

verses.latin: Attendam in parabolam os meum; loquar enigmata antiqua.
verses.english: I will speak to you in a parable; I will tell you the mysteries of the past.

verses.latin: Quanta audivimus et cognovimus ea, et patres nostri narraverunt nobis.
verses.english: What we have heard and known, our fathers have told us.

verses.latin: Non sunt occultata a filiis eorum, in generatione altera.
verses.english: We will not hide it from our children, from their generation to the next.

verses.latin: Narrantes laudes Domini, et virtutes ejus, et mirabilia ejus quae fecit.
verses.english: We will tell of the Lord's praises and virtues, and His wondrous works.

verses.latin: Et suscitavit testimonium in Jacob, et legem posuit in Israël.
verses.english: He established a covenant with Jacob, and the law was made for Israel.

verses.latin: Quanta mandavit patribus nostris nota facere ea filiis suis, ut cognoscat generatio altera.
verses.english: He commanded our fathers to teach them to their children, so that the next generation might know.

verses.latin: Filii qui nascerentur, et exsurgerent, et narrarent filiis suis.
verses.english: The children who would be born and grow up, so they can tell their children.

verses.latin: Ut ponant in Deo spem suam, et non obliviscantur operum Dei, et mandata ejus exquirant.
verses.english: They must put their hope in God, never forgetting the works of God, and keeping His commandments.

verses.latin: Ne fiant sicut patres eorum, generatio prava et contumax.
verses.english: They will not become like their fathers, a perverse and rebellious generation.

verses.latin: Generatio quae non direxit cor suum, et non est credita cum Deo spiritus ejus.
verses.english: A generation that did not keep their hearts right with God, and their spirit did not believe in Him.

verses.latin: Filii Ephraim, intendentes et jacientes arcum, conversi sunt in die belli.
verses.english: The sons of Ephraim, skilled with the bow, turned back in the day of battle.

verses.latin: Non custodierunt testamentum Dei, et in lege ejus noluere ambulare.
verses.english: They did not keep the covenant of God, and they refused to walk in His law.

verses.latin: Et obliti sunt benefactorum ejus, et mirabilium ejus quae ostendit eis.
verses.english: They forgot His benefits, and the wonders He showed them.

verses.latin: Coram patribus eorum fecit mirabilia in terra Aegypti, in campo Taneos.
verses.english: He performed miracles before their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the plain of Zoan.

verses.latin: Dirupit mare, et perduxit eos, et statuit aquas quasi in utre.
verses.english: He split the sea and led them through, and made the waters stand like a wall.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in nubem diei, et tota nocte in illuminatione ignis.
verses.english: He led them with a cloud by day and with the light of fire all night.

verses.latin: Dirupit petras in eremo, et potavit eos quasi in abysso multa.
verses.english: He split the rocks in the desert and gave them drink as from a great depth.

verses.latin: Et eduxit aquam de petra, et deduxit sicut flumina aquas.
verses.english: He brought water out of the rock and made the waters run down like rivers.

verses.latin: Et addiderunt adhuc peccare ei, et exacerbaverunt Altissimum in deserto.
verses.english: Yet they continued to sin against Him, provoking the Most High in the desert.

verses.latin: Et tentaverunt Deum in cordibus suis, ut peterent escas animabus suis.
verses.english: They tested God in their hearts by asking for food to satisfy their craving.

verses.latin: Et maledixerunt Deum, et dixerunt: Numquid poterit Deus parare mensam in deserto?
verses.english: They spoke against God, and said: "Can God prepare a table in the desert?"

verses.latin: Quoniam percussit petram, et fluxerunt aquae, et torrentes inundarunt: numquid et panem poterit dare, aut parare mensam populo suo?
verses.english: Behold, He struck the rock, and waters flowed out, and streams overflowed. Can He also give bread, or prepare a table for His people?

verses.latin: Propterea audivit Dominus, et dolo est iratus: et ignis exarsit in Jacob, et ira ascendit in Israël.
verses.english: Therefore the Lord heard them and was angry, and fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger went up against Israel.

verses.latin: Quia non crediderunt in Deo, nec speraverunt in salute ejus.
verses.english: Because they did not believe in God, nor did they trust in His salvation.

verses.latin: Et mandavit nubibus sursum, et januas caeli aperuit.
verses.english: He commanded the clouds above and opened the doors of the heavens.

verses.latin: Et pluit illis manna ad manducandum, et panem caeli dedit eis.
verses.english: He rained down manna for them to eat and gave them the bread of heaven.

verses.latin: Panem angelorum manducavit homo: cibaria misit eis in abundantia.
verses.english: Man ate the bread of the angels; He sent them food in abundance.

verses.latin: Transtulit austrum de caelo, et induxit in virtute sua africum.
verses.english: He brought the south wind from the heavens and by His power brought in the south wind.

verses.latin: Et pluit super eos sicut pulverem carnes, et sicut sabulum maris volatilia pennata.
verses.english: He rained meat on them like dust and winged birds like the sand of the sea.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt in medio castrorum eorum, circa tabernacula eorum.
verses.english: He let them fall in the midst of their camp, around their dwellings.

verses.latin: Et comederunt, et saturati sunt nimis, et desiderium eorum attulit eis.
verses.english: So they ate and were well filled, and He gave them what they craved.

verses.latin: Non sunt fraudati a desiderio suo: adhuc esca eorum erat in ore illorum.
verses.english: They were not disappointed in their desire; while their food was still in their mouths.

verses.latin: Et ira Dei ascendit super eos: et occidit pinguissimos eorum, et electos Israël incurvavit.
verses.english: The anger of God arose against them, and He killed the fattest of them and struck down the chosen men of Israel.

verses.latin: In omnibus his peccaverunt adhuc, et non crediderunt in mirabilibus ejus.
verses.english: In all these things they still sinned and did not believe in His wonders.

verses.latin: Et defecerunt in vanitate dies eorum, et anni eorum cum festinatione.
verses.english: So their days were spent in futility, and their years in haste.

verses.latin: Cum occideret eos, quaerebant eum, et revertebantur, et mane consurgentes ad eum.
verses.english: When He killed them, they sought Him, and returned and sought God.

verses.latin: Et rememorati sunt quod Deus adjutor eorum est, et Deus altissimus redemptor eorum.
verses.english: They remembered that God was their rock and that the Most High God was their Redeemer.

verses.latin: Et dilexerunt eum in ore suo, et lingua sua mentiti sunt ei.
verses.english: But they flattered Him with their mouths, and their tongues lied to Him.

verses.latin: Cor autem eorum non erat rectum cum eo, nec credentes in testamento ejus.
verses.english: For their heart was not steadfast toward Him, nor were they faithful to His covenant.

verses.latin: Ipse autem est misericors, et propitius erit peccatis eorum, et non disperdet eos.
verses.english: But He, being merciful, forgave their iniquity and did not destroy them.

verses.latin: Et frequenter avertit iram suam, et non accendit omnem iram suam.
verses.english: He often restrained His anger and did not stir up all His wrath.

verses.latin: Et memoratus est quoniam caro sunt: spiritus vadens et non rediens.
verses.english: He remembered that they were flesh, a wind that passes and does not return.

verses.latin: Quotiens exacerbaverunt eum in deserto, in iram concitaverunt eum in inaquoso?
verses.english: How often they provoked Him in the desert, and grieved Him in the wasteland?

verses.latin: Et conversi sunt, et tentaverunt Deum, et Sanctum Israël exacerbaverunt.
verses.english: They turned back and tested God, and vexed the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Non sunt recordati manus ejus, die qua redemit eos de manu tribulantis.
verses.english: They did not remember His hand or the day when He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.latin: Sicut posuit in Aegypto signa sua, et prodigia sua in campo Taneos.
verses.english: How He performed His signs in Egypt and His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

verses.latin: Et convertit in sanguinem flumina eorum, et imbres eorum, ne biberent.
verses.english: He turned their rivers to blood, so that they could not drink their streams.

verses.latin: Misit in eos cœnomyiam, et comedit eos, et ranam, et disperdidit eos.
verses.english: He sent among them swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that destroyed them.

verses.latin: Et dedit erugini fructus eorum, et labores eorum lucustae.
verses.english: He gave their crops to the caterpillar and their labor to the locust.

verses.latin: Occidit in grandine vineas eorum, et moros eorum in pruina.
verses.english: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with frost.

verses.latin: Et tradidit grandini jumenta eorum, et possessionem eorum igni.
verses.english: He gave over their livestock to the hail and their possessions to the fire.

verses.latin: Misit in eos iram indignationis suae, indignationem, et iram, et tribulationem, quae misit per angelos malos.
verses.english: He sent against them the heat of His anger, wrath, indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels.

verses.latin: Dedit viam furori suo, non pepercuit a morte animabus eorum, et jumenta eorum in morte conclusit.
verses.english: He made a path for His anger; He did not spare their soul from death, but gave their lives over to the plague.

verses.latin: Et percussit omne primogenitum in Aegypto, initium omnis laboris eorum in tabernaculis Cham.
verses.english: He struck all the firstborn in Egypt, the first issue of their strength in the tents of Ham.

verses.latin: Et amovit sicut oves populum suum, et eduxit eos quasi gregem in deserto.
verses.english: Then He led forth His people like sheep and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in spe, et non timuerunt, et inimicos eorum operuit mare.
verses.english: He led them safely, so that they were not afraid, but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

verses.latin: Et induxit eos in montem sanctificationis suae: montem quem acquisivit dextera ejus.
verses.english: He brought them to the border of His holy land, to the mountain which His right hand had won.

verses.latin: Et ejecit a facie eorum gentes, et sorte divisit eis terram in funiculo distributionis.
verses.english: He drove out the nations before them; He divided the land to them as an inheritance by lot.

verses.latin: Et habitare fecit in tabernaculis eorum tribus Israël.
verses.english: He made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.

verses.latin: Et excitavit quasi dormientem Dominus, sicut potens crapulatus a vino.
verses.english: Then the Lord awoke as one from sleep, like a warrior refreshed with wine.

verses.latin: Et percussit inimicos suos in posteriora: opprobrium sempiternum dedit illis.
verses.english: He struck His enemies in the back; He put them to everlasting shame.

verses.latin: Et reprobavit tabernaculum Joseph, et tribum Ephraim non elegit:
verses.english: He rejected the tent of Joseph and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,

verses.latin: Sed elegit tribum Juda, montem Sion quem dilexit.
verses.english: But He chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit sicut unicornium sanctificationem suam in terra, quam fundavit in saecula.
verses.english: He built His sanctuary like the high heavens, like the earth that He has established forever.

verses.latin: Et elegit David servum suum, et suscepit eum de gregibus ovium.
verses.english: He chose David His servant and took him from the sheepfolds.

verses.latin: De post foetantes accepit eum: pascere Jacob servum suum, et Israël hereditatem suam.
verses.english: From following the ewes with young, He brought him to shepherd Jacob His people and Israel His inheritance.

verses.latin: Et pavit eos in innocentia cordis sui, et in intellectibus manuum suarum deduxit eos.
verses.english: So he shepherded them with a blameless heart and guided them by his skillful hand.

verses.latin: Intellectum, audi, popule meus, legem meam: inclinate aurem vestram in verba oris mei.
verses.english: Pay attention, my people, and listen to my law. Open your ears to the words I speak.

verses.latin: Aperiam in parabola os meum; loquar propositiones antiquas.
verses.english: I will use parables when I speak; I will speak old stories.

verses.latin: Quanta audivimus et cognovimus ea, et patres nostri narraverunt nobis.
verses.english: I will tell you all that we have heard, and have learned from our fathers.

verses.latin: Non sunt occultata a filiis eorum; in generatione altera.
verses.english: We won’t hide these truths from our children, but we will tell them to the next generation.

verses.latin: Narrantes laudes Domini et virtutes ejus, et mirabilia ejus quae fecit.
verses.english: We will tell how the Lord is worthy of praise, of His mighty deeds and the miracles that He did.

verses.latin: Et suscitavit testimonium in Jacob, et legem posuit in Israël: quanta mandavit patribus nostris nota facere ea filiis suis,
verses.english: He established a covenant with Jacob and gave His law to Israel. He commanded our ancestors to teach these things to their children,

verses.latin: ut cognoscat generatio altera: filii qui nascerentur, et exsurgentes narrent filiis suis.
verses.english: so that the next generation would know them— the children yet to be born. They would tell their own children.

verses.latin: Ut ponant in Deo spem suam, et non obliviscantur operum Dei, et mandata ejus exquirant.
verses.english: Then they would put their hope in God, never forget the works of God, and always keep His commandments.

verses.latin: Ne fiant sicut patres eorum, generatio perversa et exasperans; generatio quae non direxit cor suum, et non est credita cum Deo spiritus ejus.
verses.english: They would not be like their ancestors, a rebellious and stubborn generation, a generation whose heart was not steadfast, and whose spirit was not faithful to God.

verses.latin: Filii Ephraim intendentes et sagittantes, converterunt se in die belli.
verses.english: The men of Ephraim, though armed with bows and arrows, turned their backs in battle.

verses.latin: Non custodierunt testamentum Dei, et in lege ejus nolluerunt ambulare.
verses.english: They did not keep God’s covenant, and they refused to obey His law.

verses.latin: Et obliti sunt benefactorum ejus, et mirabilium ejus quae ostendit eis.
verses.english: They forgot His deeds and the miracles that He had shown them.

verses.latin: Coram patribus eorum quae fecit mirabilia in terra Aegypti, in campo Taneos.
verses.english: He performed miracles in front of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the plain of Zoan.

verses.latin: Divisit mare, et perduxit eos, et statuit aquas quasi in utre.
verses.english: He divided the sea and led them through, and He made the waters stand like walls.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in nube diei, et tota nocte in illuminatione ignis.
verses.english: He led them with a cloud by day, and with the light of fire all night.

verses.latin: Dirupit petras in eremo, et adaquavit eos quasi in abysso multa.
verses.english: He split rocks in the desert and gave them water as from the depths of the sea.

verses.latin: Et eduxit aquam de petra, et deduxit sicut flumina aquas.
verses.english: He caused water to flow from the rock, and made waters run down like rivers.

verses.latin: Et addiderunt adhuc peccare ei; in iram provocaverunt Altissimum in inaquoso.
verses.english: But they continued to sin against Him; they provoked the Most High in the desert.

verses.latin: Et tentaverunt Deum in cordibus suis, ut peterent escas animabus suis.
verses.english: They tested God in their hearts, asking for food to satisfy their desires.

verses.latin: Et maledixerunt Deum, et dixerunt: Numquid poterit Deus parare mensam in deserto?
verses.english: They spoke against God, saying, “Can God really prepare a table in the desert?

verses.latin: Quoniam percussit petram, et fluxerunt aquae, et torrentes inundaverunt: numquid et panem poterit dare, aut parare mensam populo suo?
verses.english: When he struck the rock, water gushed out, and streams overflowed, but can He also give us bread, or supply meat for His people?”

verses.latin: Propterea cum audisset Dominus iratus est: et ignis accensus est in Jacob, et ira ascendit in Israël.
verses.english: When the Lord heard them, He was angry. Fire blazed up against Jacob, and wrath rose against Israel,

verses.latin: Quia non crediderunt in Deo, nec speraverunt in salute ejus.
verses.english: because they did not believe in God, and did not trust in His salvation.

verses.latin: Et mandavit nubibus sursum, et januas caeli aperuit.
verses.english: Yet He commanded the clouds above, and opened the doors of the sky.

verses.latin: Et pluit illis manna ad manducandum, et panem caeli dedit eis.
verses.english: He rained down manna for them to eat, giving them the bread of the heavens.

verses.latin: Panem angelorum manducavit homo; cibaria misit eis in abundantia.
verses.english: Humans ate the food of angels; He sent them food in abundance.

verses.latin: Transtulit austrum de caelo, et induxit in virtute sua africum.
verses.english: He sent an east wind from the sky, and by His power brought in the south wind.

verses.latin: Et pluit super eos quasi pulverem carnes, et sicut harenam maris volatilia pennata.
verses.english: He rained down meat on them like dust, and winged birds like the sand of the sea.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt in medio castrorum eorum circa tabernacula eorum.
verses.english: He made the birds fall in the middle of their camp, all around their tents.

verses.latin: Et manducaverunt, et saturati sunt nimis: et desiderium eorum attulit eis.
verses.english: They ate and were fully satisfied; He gave them what they craved.

verses.latin: Non sunt fraudati a desiderio suo: sed adhuc esca eorum erat in ore ipsorum.
verses.english: But before they could stop eating, and before their cravings were satisfied,

verses.latin: Irritavit ira Dei super eos: et occidit pinguissimos eorum, et electos Israël impedivit.
verses.english: God’s anger rose against them. He killed the strongest among them, and struck down the finest men of Israel.

verses.latin: In omnibus his peccaverunt adhuc: et non crediderunt in mirabilibus ejus.
verses.english: In spite of all this, they kept sinning; they did not believe in His wonders.

verses.latin: Et defecerunt in vanitate dies eorum, et anni eorum cum festinatione.
verses.english: So He brought their days to an end like a breath, and their years in terror.

verses.latin: Cum occideret eos, quaerebant eum, et revertebantur, et mane diluculo veniebant ad eum.
verses.english: When He killed them, they sought Him; they repented and earnestly sought God.

verses.latin: Et rememorati sunt quoniam Deus adjutor eorum est, et Deus altissimus redemptor eorum.
verses.english: Then they remembered that God was their rock, that God Most High was their redeemer.

verses.latin: Et dilexerunt eum in ore suo, et in lingua sua mentiti sunt ei.
verses.english: But they only flattered Him with their mouths; they lied to Him with their tongues.

verses.latin: Cor autem eorum non erat rectum cum eo, nec crediderunt in testamento ejus.
verses.english: Their hearts were not sincere toward Him; they were not faithful to His covenant.

verses.latin: Ipse autem est misericors, et propitius erit peccatis eorum, et non disperdet eos: et frequenter avertit iram suam, et non accendit omnem iram suam.
verses.english: But He, being compassionate, forgave their sin and did not destroy them; He often held back His anger, and did not stir up all His wrath.

verses.latin: Et recordatus est quoniam caro sunt; spiritus vadens et non rediens.
verses.english: He remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passes and does not return.

verses.latin: Quoties exacerbaverunt eum in deserto; in iram provocaverunt eum in inaquoso?
verses.english: How often they defied Him in the desert, how often they grieved Him in the wilderness!

verses.latin: Et conversi sunt, et tentaverunt Deum, et Sanctum Israël exacerbaverunt.
verses.english: Again and again they tested God, and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

verses.latin: Non sunt recordati manus ejus, die qua redemit eos de manu tribulantis.
verses.english: They did not remember His power, nor the day when He redeemed them from the oppressor.

verses.latin: Qui posuit in Aegypto signa sua, et prodigia sua in campo Taneos.
verses.english: He displayed His signs in Egypt, and His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

verses.latin: Et convertit in sanguinem flumina eorum, et imbres eorum, ne biberent.
verses.english: He turned their rivers to blood, so that they could not drink from their streams.

verses.latin: Misit in eos cinomydas, et devoraverunt eos; et ranas, et dissipaverunt eos.
verses.english: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that destroyed them.

verses.latin: Et dedit erugam fructibus eorum, et labores eorum locustae.
verses.english: He gave their crops to the locusts, and the fruit of their labor to the grasshoppers.

verses.latin: Et occidit in grandine vineas eorum, et moros eorum in pruina.
verses.english: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore-fig trees with frost.

verses.latin: Et tradidit grandini jumenta eorum, et possessionem eorum igni.
verses.english: He gave over their cattle to the hail, and their flocks to the lightning.

verses.latin: Misit in eos iram indignationis suae; indignationem, et iram, et tribulationem, immissiones per angelos malos.
verses.english: He unleashed against them the heat of His anger, His wrath, indignation, and trouble—a band of destroying angels.

verses.latin: Viam fecit semitae irae suae: non pepercuit a morte animabus eorum, et jumenta eorum in morte conclusit.
verses.english: He made a path for His anger; He did not spare their lives from death, but gave their lives over to the plague.

verses.latin: Et percussit omne primogenitum in Aegypto; primitias omnis laboris eorum in tabernaculis Cham.
verses.english: He struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

verses.latin: Et amovit, sicut oves, populum suum: et eduxit eos quasi gregem in deserto.
verses.english: But He led out His people like a flock; He guided them like a flock through the desert.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in spe, et non timuerunt: et operuit inimicos eorum mare.
verses.english: He led them safely, and they were not afraid, while the sea engulfed their enemies.

verses.latin: Et induxit eos in montem sanctificationis suae: montem quem acquisivit dextera ejus.
verses.english: He brought them to the border of His holy land, to the mountain His right hand had won.

verses.latin: Et ejecit a facie eorum gentes, et sorte divisit eis terram in funiculo distributionis.
verses.english: He drove out the nations before them, and apportioned their land as an inheritance by lot.

verses.latin: Et habitare fecit in tabernaculis eorum tribus Israël.
verses.english: He made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.

verses.latin: Qui tentaverunt et exacerbaverunt Deum altissimum: et testimonia ejus non custodierunt.
verses.english: But they tested and defied God Most High, and did not keep His decrees.

verses.latin: Et averterunt se, et non custodierunt pactum: quemadmodum patres eorum, conversi sunt in arcum pravum.
verses.english: Like their ancestors, they turned back and were faithless; they were like a treacherous bow.

verses.latin: Filii Ephraim intendentes et sagittantes, conversi sunt in die belli.
verses.english: The men of Ephraim, armed with bows, turned back in the day of battle.

verses.latin: Non custodierunt testamentum Dei, et in lege ejus nolluerunt ambulare.
verses.english: They did not keep God’s covenant and refused to live by His law.

verses.latin: Et obliti sunt benefacta ejus, et mirabilium ejus quae ostendit eis.
verses.english: They forgot His deeds and the wonders He had shown them.

verses.latin: Coram patribus eorum quae fecit mirabilia in terra Aegypti, in campo Taneos.
verses.english: He performed miracles in Egypt, His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

verses.latin: Et convertit in sanguinem flumina eorum, et imbres eorum, ne biberent.
verses.english: He turned their rivers to blood, and they could not drink from their streams.

verses.latin: Misit in eos cinomydas, et devoraverunt eos; et ranas, et dissipaverunt eos.
verses.english: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that destroyed them.

verses.latin: Et dedit erugam fructibus eorum, et labores eorum locustae.
verses.english: He gave their crops to the locusts, and the fruit of their labor to the grasshoppers.

verses.latin: Et occidit in grandine vineas eorum, et moros eorum in pruina.
verses.english: He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore-fig trees with frost.

verses.latin: Et tradidit grandini jumenta eorum, et possessionem eorum igni.
verses.english: He gave their cattle over to the hail, and their flocks to the lightning.

verses.latin: Misit in eos iram indignationis suae: indignationem, et iram, et tribulationem, immissiones per angelos malos.
verses.english: He unleashed against them the heat of His anger, His wrath, indignation, and trouble—a band of destroying angels.

verses.latin: Viam fecit semitae irae suae: non peperciti a morte animabus eorum, et jumenta eorum in morte conclusit.
verses.english: He made a path for His anger; He did not spare their lives from death, but gave their lives over to the plague.

verses.latin: Et percussit omne primogenitum in Aegypto; primitias omnis laboris eorum in tabernaculis Cham.
verses.english: He struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

verses.latin: Et sustulit sicut oves populum suum, et eduxit eos quasi gregem in deserto.
verses.english: But He led out His people like a flock; He guided them like a flock through the desert.

verses.latin: Et eduxit eos in spe, et non timuerunt: et operuit inimicos eorum mare.
verses.english: He led them safely, and they were not afraid, while the sea engulfed their enemies.

verses.latin: Et induxit eos in montem sanctificationis suae: montem quem acquisivit dextera ejus.
verses.english: He brought them to the border of His holy land, to the mountain His right hand had won.

verses.latin: Et ejecit a facie eorum gentes, et sorte divisit eis terram in funiculo distributionis.
verses.english: He drove out the nations before them, and apportioned their land as an inheritance by lot.

verses.latin: Et habitare fecit in tabernaculis eorum tribus Israël.
verses.english: He made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.

verses.latin: Et amovit, et disperdidit eos: et non auxit eos.
verses.english: Then He turned away and abandoned them, and did not give them any more help.

verses.latin: Et iratus est iram, et contempsit Israël vehementer.
verses.english: So He was angry with Israel, and utterly rejected them.

verses.latin: Et repulit in destructionem tabernaculum Silo, tabernaculum suum, ubi habitavit in hominibus.
verses.english: He abandoned the tabernacle in Shiloh, the tent He had pitched among men.

verses.latin: Et tradidit in captivitatem virtutem eorum, et gloriam eorum in manu inimici.
verses.english: He allowed His strength to be captured, and His glory to be in the hands of the enemy.

verses.latin: Et clausit in gladio populum suum: et hereditatem suam non est prosecutus.
verses.english: He gave His people over to the sword, and was not concerned about His inheritance.

verses.latin: Juvenes eorum comedit ignis: et virgines eorum non sunt lamentatae.
verses.english: Fire devoured their young men, and their young women were not praised.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes eorum in gladio ceciderunt: et viduae eorum non plorabantur.
verses.english: Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows were not lamented.

verses.latin: Et excitatus est tamquam dormiens Dominus, tamquam potens crapulatus a vino.
verses.english: Then the Lord awoke as if from sleep, like a warrior refreshed by wine.

verses.latin: Et percussit inimicos suos in posteriora: opprobrium sempiternum dedit illis.
verses.english: He struck his enemies in the rear, and put them to everlasting shame.

verses.latin: Et repulit tabernaculum Joseph, et tribum Ephraim non elegit:
verses.english: He rejected the tent of Joseph, and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim;

verses.latin: sed elegit tribum Juda, montem Sion quem dilexit.
verses.english: but He chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit sicut unicornium sanctificium suum in terra: quam fundavit in saecula.
verses.english: He built His sanctuary like the high heavens, like the earth, which He established forever.

verses.latin: Et elegit David servum suum, et sustulit eum de gregibus ovium.
verses.english: He chose David His servant, and took him from the sheep pens.

verses.latin: De post foetantes accepit eum: ut pasceret Jacob, servum suum, et Israël, hereditatem suam.
verses.english: From tending the ewes with their young, He brought him to shepherd Jacob His people, Israel His inheritance.

verses.latin: Et pascebat eos in innocentia cordis sui: et in intellectibus manuum suarum deduxit eos.
verses.english: He shepherded them with a pure heart, and guided them with skillful hands.

verses.latin: Psalmus Asaph. Deus, venerunt gentes in hereditatem tuam, polluerunt templum sanctum tuum: posuerunt Ierusalem in pomorum custodiam.
verses.english: A Psalm by Asaph. O God, gentiles have entered into your inheritance. They have defiled your holy temple and have made Jerusalem into a pile of rubble.

verses.latin: Posuerunt morticina servorum tuorum escas volatilibus caeli, carnes sanctorum tuorum bestiis terrae.
verses.english: They left the corpses of your servants as food for the birds in the sky. They left the flesh of your saints for the beasts of the land.

verses.latin: Effuderunt sanguinem eorum quasi aquam in circuitu Ierusalem, et non erat qui sepeliret.
verses.english: They have shed their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was no one who would bury them.

verses.latin: Facti sumus opprobrium vicinis nostris; subsannatio et derisio his qui in circuitu nostro sunt.
verses.english: We have become the mockery of our neighbors, a laughingstock and a joke to those around us.

verses.latin: Usquequo, Domine? irasceris in finem? accendetur velut ignis zelus tuus?
verses.english: How long, O Lord? Will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy burn like a fire?

verses.latin: Effunde iram tuam in gentes quae te non noverunt, et in regna quae nomen tuum non invocaverunt.
verses.english: Pour out your wrath on the gentiles who do not know you, and on the kingdoms that have not called on your name.

verses.latin: Quia comederunt Iacob, et locum ejus desolaverunt.
verses.english: For they have consumed Jacob, and they have laid waste his place.

verses.latin: Ne memineris iniquitatum nostrarum antiquarum: cito anticipent nos misericordiae tuae, quia pauperes facti sumus nimis.
verses.english: Do not remember our former iniquities. Let your mercies quickly come to meet us, for we have become very poor.

verses.latin: Adjuva nos, Deus salutaris noster: et propter gloriam nominis tui, Domine, libera nos: et propitius esto peccatis nostris, propter nomen tuum.
verses.english: Help us, O God of our salvation, and for the glory of your name, deliver us. Be gracious to our sins for your name's sake.

verses.latin: Ne forte dicant gentes: Ubi est Deus eorum? et innotescat in nationibus in conspectu nostro ultio sanguinis servorum tuorum qui effusus est.
verses.english: Why should the nations say, "Where is their God?" Let the vengeance for the blood of your servants, which has been poured out, be made known among the nations before our eyes.

verses.latin: Introeat in conspectu tuo gemitus compeditorum: secundum magnitudinem brachii tui, conserva filios mortis.
verses.english: Let the groaning of the prisoners come before you. According to the greatness of your arm, preserve the sons of death.

verses.latin: Et redde vicinis nostris septuplum in sinu eorum: improperium ipsorum quod exprobraverunt tibi, Domine.
verses.english: And repay our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom the reproach with which they have reproached you, O Lord.

verses.latin: Nos autem, populus tuus, et oves pascuae tuae, confitebimur tibi in saeculum. In generationem et generationem adnuntiabimus laudem tuam.
verses.english: But we, your people, and the sheep of your pasture, will give you thanks forever. We will announce your praise from generation to generation.

verses.latin: In finem, pro torcularibus. Psalmus. Asaph.
verses.english: For the leader; for the presses. A Psalm. Of Asaph.

verses.latin: Qui pascis, Israël, intende: qui deducis velut ovem Joseph.
verses.english: O Shepherd of Israel, give ear, You who lead Joseph like a sheep.

verses.latin: Qui sedes super cherubim, manifestare.
verses.english: You who sit above the cherubim, be revealed.

verses.latin: Coram Ephraim, et Benjamin, et Manasse: excita potentiam tuam, et veni ut salvos facias nos.
verses.english: Before Ephraim, and Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up Your power, and come to save us.

verses.latin: Deus, converte nos, et ostende faciem tuam, et salvi erimus.
verses.english: Turn us back, O God, and show us Your face, and we shall be saved.

verses.latin: Domine Deus virtutum, quousque irasceris super orationem servi tui?
verses.english: O Lord God of hosts, how long will You be angry with Your servant's prayer?

verses.latin: Cibabis nos pane lacrimarum: et potum dabis nobis in lacrimis in mensura.
verses.english: You have fed us with the bread of tears, and given us tears to drink in full measure.

verses.latin: Posuisti nos in contradictionem vicinis nostris: et inimici nostri subsannaverunt nos.
verses.english: You have made us a source of conflict for our neighbors, and our enemies mock us.

verses.latin: Deus virtutum, converte nos, et ostende faciem tuam, et salvi erimus.
verses.english: Turn us back, O God of hosts, and show us Your face, and we shall be saved.

verses.latin: Vineam de AEgypto transferisti: ejecisti gentes, et plantasti eam.
verses.english: You brought a vine out of Egypt; You cast out the nations and planted it.

verses.latin: Dux itineris fuisti in conspectu ejus: plantasti radices ejus, et implevit terram.
verses.english: You were the guide of its journey; You planted its roots, and it filled the earth.

verses.latin: Operuit umbra ejus montes: et ramis ejus cedros Dei.
verses.english: Its shadow covered the mountains, and its branches the cedars of God.

verses.latin: Extendit palmites suos usque ad mare: et usque ad flumen propagines ejus.
verses.english: It sent out its branches to the sea, and its shoots to the river.

verses.latin: Ut quid destruxisti maceriam ejus: et vindemiant eam omnes, qui praetergrediuntur viam?
verses.english: Why have You broken down its walls, so that all who pass by the way pluck it?

verses.latin: Exterminavit eam aper de silva: et singularis ferus depastus est eam.
verses.english: The boar from the forest ravages it, and the wild beast devours it.

verses.latin: Deus virtutum, convertere, respice de caelo, et vide: et visita vineam istam.
verses.english: Turn, God of hosts! Look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vine.

verses.latin: Et perfice eam quam plantavit dextera tua: et super filium hominis quem confirmasti tibi.
verses.english: Protect that which Your right hand has planted, and the son of man whom You have strengthened for Yourself.

verses.latin: Incensa igni, et suffossa a comminatione vultus tui.
verses.english: It is burned with fire, and cut down at the rebuke of Your countenance.

verses.latin: Fiat manus tua super virum dexterae tuae: et super filium hominis quem confirmasti tibi.
verses.english: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, and upon the son of man whom You have strengthened for Yourself.

verses.latin: Et non discedimus a te: vivificabis nos, et nomen tuum invocabimus.
verses.english: Then we will not turn back from You; You will revive us, and we will call upon Your name.

verses.latin: Domine Deus virtutum, converte nos: et ostende faciem tuam, et salvi erimus.
verses.english: O Lord God of hosts, turn us back; show Your face, and we shall be saved.

verses.latin: In finem, pro torcularibus, filiis Core. Psalmus.
verses.english: For the leader. A song. For the wine presses, the sons of Korah.

verses.latin: Quam dilecta tabernacula tua, Domine virtutum!
verses.english: How beloved are your tabernacles, Lord of hosts!

verses.latin: Concupiscit et deficit anima mea in atria Domini.
verses.english: My soul longs, and faints, for the courts of the Lord.

verses.latin: Cor meum et caro mea exultaverunt in Deum vivum.
verses.english: My heart and my flesh have rejoiced in the living God.

verses.latin: Etenim passer invenit sibi domum, et turtur nidum sibi, ubi ponat pullos suos:
verses.english: For even the sparrow has found a house for itself, and the turtledove a nest for itself, where it may lay its young.

verses.latin: Altaria tua, Domine virtutum, Rex meus et Deus meus.
verses.english: Your altars, Lord of hosts, my King and my God!

verses.latin: Beati qui habitant in domo tua, Domine: in saecula saeculorum laudabunt te.
verses.english: Blessed are those who dwell in your house, O Lord: they shall praise you for ever and ever.

verses.latin: Beatus vir cujus est ausilium abs te: ascensiones in corde suo disposuit.
verses.english: Blessed is the man whose help comes from you: He has arranged ascensions in his heart.

verses.latin: Transit per vallem flentes, in locum quem posuit.
verses.english: Passing through the valley of tears, in the place that he has appointed.

verses.latin: Etenim benedictionem dabit legislator: ibunt de virtute in virtutem: videbitur Deus deorum in Sion.
verses.english: For the lawgiver will give a blessing: they shall go from strength to strength: the God of gods will be seen in Sion.

verses.latin: Domine Deus virtutum, exaudi orationem meam: auribus percipe, Deus Jacob.
verses.english: O Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob.

verses.latin: Protector noster, vide, Deus: et respice in faciem christi tui.
verses.english: Behold our protector, O God: and look upon the face of your Christ.

verses.latin: Quia melior est dies una in atriis tuis super millia.
verses.english: For one day in your courts is better than a thousand.

verses.latin: Elegi abjectus esse in domo Dei mei magis quam habitare in tabernaculis peccatorum.
verses.english: I have chosen to be a castaway in the house of my God, rather than to dwell in the tents of sinners.

verses.latin: Quia misericordiam et veritatem diligit Deus: gratiam et gloriam dabit Dominus.
verses.english: For God loves mercy and truth: the Lord will give grace and glory.

verses.latin: Non privabit bonis eos qui ambulant in innocentia sua.
verses.english: He will not deprive of goods those who walk in their innocence.

verses.latin: Domine Deus virtutum, beatus homo qui sperat in te.
verses.english: O Lord God of hosts, blessed is the man who hopes in you.

verses.latin: Deus stetit in synagoga deorum, in medio autem eorum diiudicat.
verses.english: God has taken His place among the assembly of all the gods, and He judges them all, fairly.

verses.latin: Usquequo iudicatis iniquitatem, et facies peccatorum sumitis?
verses.english: “How much longer will you judge unfairly? How much longer will you favor the wicked?

verses.latin: Iudicate egenum et pupillum; humilem et pauperem iustificate.
verses.english: Judge the needy, the orphan, the humble, and the poor.

verses.latin: Liberate pauperem; et egestum de manu peccatoris eruite.
verses.english: Rescue the poor and the weak from the hand of the wicked.

verses.latin: Nescierunt, neque intellexerunt; in tenebris ambulant: movebuntur omnia fundamenta terrae.
verses.english: They don't know anything, and they don't understand. They wander in darkness, and they don't know. All the foundations of the earth are shaking.

verses.latin: Ego dixi: Dii estis, et filii Excelsi omnes.
verses.english: I said, 'You are gods; you are all sons of the Most High.'

verses.latin: Vos autem sicut homines moriemini, et sicut unus de principibus cadetis.
verses.english: But you will die as mere men do. You'll fall as any prince would.

verses.latin: Exsurge, Deus, iudica terram: quoniam tu hereditabis in omnibus gentibus.
verses.english: Arise, God, and judge the earth, for You will inherit all the nations.

verses.latin: Canticum psalmi Asaph.
verses.english: The song of Psalm 83 by Asaph.

verses.latin: Deus, quis similis erit tibi? Ne taceas, neque compescaris, Deus.
verses.english: O God, who is like You? Don't be silent, don't hold back, O God.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce inimici tui sonuerunt, et qui oderunt te extulerunt caput.
verses.english: Your enemies are rising up, and those who hate You are growing in power.

verses.latin: Super populum tuum malignaverunt consilium: et cogitaverunt adversus sanctos tuos.
verses.english: They conspire against Your people. They plot against those dedicated to You.

verses.latin: Dixerunt: Venite, et disperdamus eos de gente, et non memoretur nomen Israël ultra.
verses.english: They say, “Come, let's destroy them. Let's wipe out their nation so that Israel is forgotten forever.”

verses.latin: Quoniam cogitaverunt unanimes simul: adversum te testamentum disposuerunt,
verses.english: They all agree and make an alliance against You,

verses.latin: Tabernacula Idumaeorum et Ismahelitae: Moab et Agareni,
verses.english: The tents of Edom, the Ishmaelites, Moab, and the Hagarenes;

verses.latin: Gebal, et Ammon, et Amalec: alienigenae cum his qui habitant Tyrum.
verses.english: Gebal, Ammon, Amalek, Philistia, and the inhabitants of Tyre.

verses.latin: Etenim Assur venit cum illis: facti sunt in auxilium filiis Lot.
verses.english: Assyria has also joined them, supporting the descendants of Lot.

verses.latin: Fac illis sicut Madian et Sisa: sicut Jabin in torrente Cisson.
verses.english: Do to them what You did to Midian and Sisera, what You did to Jabin at the Kishon River.

verses.latin: Qui perierunt in Endor: facti sunt ut stercus terrae.
verses.english: They were defeated at Endor, and they rotted away, polluting the land.

verses.latin: Pone illos, principes eorum, sicut Oreb et Zeb, et Zeba et Salmana: omnes principes eorum.
verses.english: Treat their leaders as You treated Oreb, Zeb, Zeba, and Zalmunna, all of their leaders.

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Hereditate possideamus sanctuarium Dei.
verses.english: They said, “Let’s take possession of God's territory!”

verses.latin: Deus meus, pone illos ut rotam, et sicut stipulam ante faciem venti.
verses.english: O my God, make them like a rolling wheel, like chaff before the wind.

verses.latin: Sicut ignis qui incendit silvam, et sicut flamma comburens montes,
verses.english: As fire consumes a forest, as a flame sets mountains ablaze,

verses.latin: ita persequeris illos in tempestate tua, et in ira tua turbabis eos.
verses.english: So shall You pursue them with Your storm. In Your wrath, terrify them!

verses.latin: Imple facies eorum ignominia, et quaerent nomen tuum, Domine.
verses.english: Fill their faces with shame. Then they will seek Your name, O Lord.

verses.latin: Erubescant et conturbentur in saeculum saeculi: et confundantur, et pereant.
verses.english: May they be ashamed and terrified forever. May they be disgraced and destroyed.

verses.latin: Et cognoscant quia nomen tibi Dominus: tu solus Altissimus in omnem terram.
verses.english: Then they will know that You alone are the Lord. You alone are the Most High over all the earth.

verses.latin: In finem, psalmus ipsi filiis Core.
verses.english: For the leader; a psalm for the sons of Korah.

verses.latin: Quam dilecta tabernacula tua, Domine virtutum!
verses.english: How glorious are your dwelling places, Lord of hosts!

verses.latin: Concupiscit, et deficit anima mea in atria Domini.
verses.english: My soul longs to go where you are. My heart aches for the courts of the Lord.

verses.latin: Cor meum et caro mea exsultaverunt in Deum vivum.
verses.english: My heart and flesh now cry out with joy to the living God.

verses.latin: Etenim passer invenit sibi domum, et turtur nidum sibi, ubi ponat pullos suos:
verses.english: Even the sparrow has found a home for herself, and the turtledove has found a nest for her young.

verses.latin: altaria tua, Domine virtutum, Rex meus et Deus meus.
verses.english: These are your altars, Lord of hosts, my King and my God.

verses.latin: Beati qui habitant in domo tua, Domine: in saecula saeculorum laudabunt te.
verses.english: Happy are those who dwell in your house, O Lord; they will be praising you through all eternity.

verses.latin: Beatus vir cujus est auxilium abs te: ascensiones in corde suo disposuit, in valle lacrimarum, in loco quem posuit.
verses.english: Blessed is the man whose strength is in you; he has prepared his ascent in his heart, in the valley of tears, in the place that God has set.

verses.latin: Etenim benedictionem dabit legislator: ibunt de virtute in virtutem: videbitur Deus deorum in Sion.
verses.english: For the law-giver will give blessings, and the faithful will grow in strength: you will see the God of gods in Zion.

verses.latin: Domine Deus virtutum, exaudi orationem meam: auribus percipe, Deus Jacob.
verses.english: Lord God of hosts, hear my prayer; listen, God of Jacob.

verses.latin: Protector noster, aspice, Deus: et respice faciem christi tui.
verses.english: O God, our protector, look upon us; and look upon the face of your Christ.

verses.latin: Quia melior est dies una in atriis tuis super millia: elegi abjectus esse in domo Dei mei magis quam habitare in tabernaculis peccatorum.
verses.english: One day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere: I have chosen to be cast out in the house of my God rather than to dwell in the tents of sinners.

verses.latin: Quia misericordiam et veritatem diligit Deus: gratiam et gloriam dabit Dominus.
verses.english: For God loves mercy and truth; he will give grace and glory.

verses.latin: Non auferet bona his qui ambulant in innocentia sua: Domine virtutum, beatus homo qui sperat in te.
verses.english: He will not withhold good things from those who walk in innocence: O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in you.

verses.latin: Benedixisti, Domine, terram tuam: avertisti captivitatem Iacob:
verses.english: O Lord, You have shown favor and brought blessings to Your land; You have brought back the captives of Jacob:

verses.latin: Remisisti iniquitatem plebis tuæ: operuisti omnia peccata eorum.
verses.english: You have forgiven the sins of Your people; You have covered over all their transgressions.

verses.latin: Mitigasti omnem iram tuam: avertisti ab ira indignationis tuæ.
verses.english: You have calmed all Your wrath; You have turned away from the heat of Your anger.

verses.latin: Convertere nos, Deus salutaris noster, et averte iram tuam a nobis.
verses.english: Turn to us again, O God of our salvation, and turn away Your anger from us.

verses.latin: Numquid in aeternum irasceris nobis? aut extendes iram tuam a generatione in generationem?
verses.english: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You extend Your anger from one generation to another?

verses.latin: Deus, tu conversus vivificabis nos: et plebs tua laetabitur in te.
verses.english: Will You not revive us again, that Your people may rejoice in You?

verses.latin: Ostende nobis, Domine, misericordiam tuam: et salutare tuum da nobis.
verses.english: Show us Your mercy, O Lord, and grant us Your salvation.

verses.latin: Audiam quid loquatur in me Dominus Deus: quoniam loquetur pacem in plebem suam, et super sanctos suos, et super eos qui convertuntur ad cor.
verses.english: I will listen to what God the Lord says, for He will speak peace to His people, and to His saints, and to those who turn their hearts to Him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen prope timentes eum salutare ipsius: ut inhabitet gloria in terra nostra.
verses.english: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him, that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.latin: Misericordia et veritas obviaverunt sibi: justitia et pax osculatæ sunt.
verses.english: Mercy and truth have met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.latin: Veritas de terra orta est: et justitia de caelo prospexit.
verses.english: Truth springs up from the earth, and righteousness looks down from the sky.

verses.latin: Etenim Dominus dabit benignitatem: et terra nostra dabit fructum suum.
verses.english: Indeed, the Lord will give what is good, and our land will yield its increase.

verses.latin: Justitia ante eum ambulabit: et ponet in via gressus suos.
verses.english: Righteousness will go before Him, and will make His footsteps into a path.

verses.latin: Oratio ipsi David. Inclina, Domine, aurem tuam, et exaudi me: quoniam inops et pauper sum ego.
verses.english: A prayer of David. Lord, please listen to me and answer my prayer because I am lowly and poor.

verses.latin: Custodi animam meam, quoniam sanctus sum: salvum fac servum tuum, Deus meus, sperantem in te.
verses.english: Keep my soul safe, because I am devoted to you; save your servant, O my God, who trusts in you.

verses.latin: Miserere mei, Domine, quoniam ad te clamavi tota die.
verses.english: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I call to you all day long.

verses.latin: Laetifica animam servi tui, quoniam ad te, Domine, animam meam levavi.
verses.english: Bring joy to the soul of your servant, because, O Lord, I lift up my soul to you.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu, Domine, suavis et mitis: et multae misericordiae omnibus invocantibus te.
verses.english: For you, Lord, are good and forgiving, abounding in mercy to all who call upon you.

verses.latin: Auribus percipe, Domine, orationem meam: et intende voci deprecationis meae.
verses.english: Lord, hear my prayer and listen to my plea.

verses.latin: In die tribulationis meae clamavi ad te, quia exaudisti me.
verses.english: In the day of my distress, I called to you because you heard me.

verses.latin: Non est similis tui in diis, Domine: et non est secundum opera tua.
verses.english: Among the gods, there is no one like you, Lord, nor are there any works like your works.

verses.latin: Omnes gentes quascumque fecisti, venient et adorabunt coram te, Domine: et glorificabunt nomen tuum.
verses.english: All the nations you have made will come and worship before you, Lord, and will glorify your name.

verses.latin: Quoniam magnus es tu, et faciens mirabilia: tu es Deus solus.
verses.english: For you are great and do marvelous deeds; you alone are God.

verses.latin: Deduc me, Domine, in via tua, et ingrediar in veritate tua: laetetur cor meum, ut timeat nomen tuum.
verses.english: Teach me your way, O Lord, and I will walk in your truth; give me an undivided heart that I may fear your name.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, Domine Deus meus, in toto corde meo, et glorificabo nomen tuum in aeternum.
verses.english: I will praise you, Lord my God, with all my heart, and I will glorify your name forever.

verses.latin: Quia misericordia tua magna est super me: et eruisti animam meam ex inferno inferiori.
verses.english: For your mercy to me is great, and you have rescued my soul from the depths of hell.

verses.latin: Deus, iniqui insurrexerunt super me, et synagoga potentium quaesierunt animam meam: et non proposuerunt te in conspectu suo.
verses.english: O God, the arrogant have risen against me, and a band of ruthless men seeks my life, not setting you before their eyes.

verses.latin: Et tu, Domine Deus, miserator et misericors, patiens et multae misericordiae, et verax.
verses.english: But you, Lord God, are compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in mercy and faithfulness.

verses.latin: Respice in me, et miserere mei: da imperium tuum puero tuo, et salvum fac filium ancillae tuae.
verses.english: Turn to me and have mercy on me; give your strength to your servant, and save the son of your maidservant.

verses.latin: Fac mecum signum in bonum, ut videant qui oderunt me, et confundantur: quoniam tu, Domine, adjuvasti me, et consolatus es me.
verses.english: Show me a sign of your favor, so that those who hate me may see it and be put to shame, for you, Lord, have helped me and comforted me.

verses.latin: Fundamenta ejus in montibus sanctis.
verses.english: The foundations of Jerusalem are on the holy mountains.

verses.latin: Diligit Dominus portas Sion super omnia tabernacula Jacob.
verses.english: The Lord loves the gates of Jerusalem more than all the dwelling places of Israel.

verses.latin: Gloriosa dicta sunt de te, civitas Dei.
verses.english: Glorious things are said about you, city of God.

verses.latin: Memor ero Rahab et Babylonis scientium me.
verses.english: I will remember Rahab and Babylon, who know me.

verses.latin: Ecce, Philisthim, et Tyrus, et populus Æthiopum, hi fuerunt illic.
verses.english: Behold, Philistia, Tyre, and the people of Ethiopia; these were there.

verses.latin: Mater Sion dicet: Homo et homo natus est in ea: et ipse fundavit eam Altissimus.
verses.english: And it shall be said of Zion: “Every man was born there; and the Most High has founded her.”

verses.latin: Dominus narrabit in scriptura populorum et principum, horum qui fuerunt in ea.
verses.english: The Lord shall record in the book of the peoples and of the princes, of those who were in her.

verses.latin: Sicut lætantes omnium habitatio est in te.
verses.english: The dwelling places of all rejoice in you.

verses.latin: Domine, Deus salutis meæ: in die clamavi, et nocte coram te.
verses.english: O Lord, God of my salvation: by day I have cried out, and in the night before you.

verses.latin: Intret in conspectu tuo oratio mea: inclina aurem tuam ad precem meam.
verses.english: Let my prayer enter into your presence: incline your ear to my prayer.

verses.latin: Quia repleta est malis anima mea: et vita mea inferno adpropinquavit.
verses.english: For my soul is filled with evils: and my life has approached to the abyss.

verses.latin: Aestimatus sum cum descendentibus in lacum: factus sum sicut homo sine adjutorio,
verses.english: I am counted among those who go down into the pit: I have become like a man without help,

verses.latin: inter mortuos liber: sicut vulnerati dormientes in sepulcris, quorum non es memor amplius: et ipsi de manu tua repulsi sunt.
verses.english: free among the dead: like the wounded sleeping in the sepulchres, of whom you are no longer mindful: and they have been cast off from your hand.

verses.latin: Posuerunt me in lacu inferiori: in tenebris, et in umbra mortis.
verses.english: They have laid me in the lowest pit: in darkness, and in the shadow of death.

verses.latin: Super me confirmatus est furor tuus: et omnes fluctus tuos induxisti super me.
verses.english: Your wrath has been confirmed over me: and you have brought all your waves over me.

verses.latin: Longasti notos meos a me: posuerunt me abominationem sibi.
verses.english: You have distanced my acquaintances from me: they have made me an abomination to themselves.

verses.latin: Traditus sum, et non egrediebar: oculi mei languerunt præ inopia.
verses.english: I have been delivered, and I could not go out: my eyes languished for want.

verses.latin: Clamavi ad te, Domine, tota die: expandi ad te manus meas.
verses.english: I have cried to you, O Lord, all day: I have extended my hands to you.

verses.latin: Numquid mortuis facies mirabilia? aut medici suscitabunt, et confitebuntur tibi?
verses.english: Will you work wonders for the dead? or will the doctors raise them up, and confess to you?

verses.latin: Numquid narrabit aliquis in sepulcro misericordiam tuam, et veritatem tuam in perditione?
verses.english: Will anyone declare your mercy in the sepulchre, and your truth in perdition?

verses.latin: Numquid cognoscentur in tenebris mirabilia tua, et justitia tua in terra oblivionis?
verses.english: Will your wonders be known in the dark, and your justice in the land of oblivion?

verses.latin: Et ego ad te, Domine, clamavi: et mane oratio mea præveniet te.
verses.english: And I, O Lord, have cried to you: and in the morning my prayer will come before you.

verses.latin: Ut quid, Domine, repellis animam meam: avertis faciem tuam a me?
verses.english: Why, O Lord, do you cast off my soul: you turn your face away from me?

verses.latin: Pauper sum ego, et in laboribus a juventute mea: exaltatus autem, humiliatus sum et conturbatus.
verses.english: I am poor, and in labors from my youth: but being exalted, I was humbled and disturbed.

verses.latin: In me transierunt iræ tuæ: et terrores tui conturbaverunt me.
verses.english: Your wrath has passed over me: and your terrors have troubled me.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt me sicut aqua tota die: circumdederunt me simul.
verses.english: They have surrounded me like water all day: they have surrounded me together.

verses.latin: Elongasti a me amicum et proximum: et notos meos a miseria.
verses.english: You have removed from me friend and neighbor: and my acquaintances because of misery.

verses.latin: Domine, in finem dilexi te: et non recedam.
verses.english: O Lord, you've been my only love from all of eternity; and I will not be parted from you.

verses.latin: Defecit caro mea, et cor meum: Deus cordis mei, et pars mea Deus in aeternum.
verses.english: My flesh is now decaying, and my heart is failing: but God is the strength of my heart, and God will be my portion for all eternity.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce qui elongant se a te, peribunt: perdidisti omnes qui fornicantur abs te.
verses.english: For see, those who try to separate themselves from you will be lost: you will destroy everyone who abandons you.

verses.latin: Mihi autem adhaerere Deo bonum est: ponere in Domino Deo spem meam: ut annuntiem omnes praedicationes tuas in portis filiae Sion.
verses.english: But for me, it's a good thing to cling to God; I place my hope in the Lord God, so I can tell all the things you've done in the gates of the daughter of Zion.

verses.latin: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto.
verses.english: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper, et in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.

verses.latin: Benedixisti, Domine, terram tuam: avertisti captivitatem Jacob.
verses.english: Lord, you've blessed the earth; You have turned again the captivity of Jacob.

verses.latin: Remisisti iniquitatem plebis tuae: operuisti omnia peccata eorum.
verses.english: You've forgiven the iniquity of your people; you've covered all their sins.

verses.latin: Mitigasti omnem iram tuam: avertisti ab ira furoris tui.
verses.english: You have calmed all your anger; you have turned away from your wrath.

verses.latin: Convertere nos, Deus salutaris noster: et averte iram tuam a nobis.
verses.english: Turn to us, O God our savior; and turn away your anger from us.

verses.latin: Numquid in aeternum irasceris nobis? aut extendes iram tuam a generatione in generationem?
verses.english: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you stretch out your anger from one generation to another?

verses.latin: Deus, tu conversus vivificabis nos: et plebs tua laetabitur in te.
verses.english: God, if you turn back to us, you will give us life; and your people will rejoice in you.

verses.latin: Ostende nobis, Domine, misericordiam tuam: et salutare tuum da nobis.
verses.english: Show us your mercy, O Lord; and grant us your salvation.

verses.latin: Audiam quid loquatur in me Dominus Deus: quoniam loquetur pacem in plebem suam, et super sanctos suos, et super eos qui convertuntur ad cor.
verses.english: I will listen to what the Lord God speaks; for he will speak peace to his people, and to his saints, and to those who turn their heart to him.

verses.latin: Verumtamen prope timentes eum salutare ipsius, ut inhabitet gloria in terra nostra.
verses.english: Surely his salvation is near to those who fear him, that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.latin: Misericordia et veritas obviaverunt sibi: justitia et pax osculatae sunt.
verses.english: Mercy and truth meet together; justice and peace have kissed each other.

verses.latin: Veritas de terra orta est: et justitia de caelo prospexit.
verses.english: Truth has sprung from the earth; and justice has looked down from heaven.

verses.latin: Etenim Dominus dabit benignitatem: et terra nostra dabit fructum suum.
verses.english: Surely the Lord will give us what is good; and our land will yield its fruit.

verses.latin: Justitia ante eum ambulabit: et ponet in via gressus suos.
verses.english: Justice will walk before him; and he will set his footsteps in the way.

verses.latin: Domine, refugium factus es nobis a generatione in generationem.
verses.english: Lord, you have been our refuge from one generation to the next.

verses.latin: Priusquam montes fierent, aut formaretur terra et orbis; a saeculo et usque in saeculum tu es.
verses.english: Even before the mountains were made, before the earth and all the universe were formed, you have always existed, and you will always exist.

verses.latin: Ne avertas hominem in humilitatem: et dixisti: Convertimini, filii hominum.
verses.english: You turn men back to dust and say: “Return, sons of men!”

verses.latin: Quoniam mille anni ante oculos tuos tamquam dies hesterna, quae praeteriit, et sicut vigilia in nocte.
verses.english: Because a thousand years in your sight are like the passing of yesterday, like a fleeting moment in the night.

verses.latin: Quae pro nihilo habentur, eorum anni erunt. Mane quasi herba transeat,
verses.english: You sweep people away in death; their lives are a mere moment. They’re like grass that quickly withers,

verses.latin: mane floreat, et transeat: vespere decidat, induret et arescat.
verses.english: that flourishes in the morning, but by evening it is cut down, withered, and dried up.

verses.latin: Quia defecimus in ira tua, et in furore tuo turbati sumus.
verses.english: We are consumed by your anger; we are terrified by your wrath.

verses.latin: Posuisti iniquitates nostras in conspectu tuo: saeculum nostrum in irradiatione vultus tui.
verses.english: You have placed our sins before you, our secret sins under the light of your presence.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnes dies nostri defecerunt, et in ira tua deficimus.
verses.english: All of our days pass under your wrath; we are consumed in a moment.

verses.latin: Anni nostri sicut aranea meditabuntur. Dies annorum nostrorum in ipsis, septuaginta anni.
verses.english: The years of our lives pass like a spider’s web. The span of our lives is seventy years,

verses.latin: Si autem in potentibus, octoginta anni: et amplius eorum labor et dolor.
verses.english: or perhaps, if we are strong, eighty years; even then, their lives are spent mostly in toil and sorrow.

verses.latin: Quoniam supervenit mansuetudo, et corripiemur.
verses.english: They quickly pass away; we fade.

verses.latin: Quis novit potestatem irae tuae, et prae timore tuo iram tuam dinumerare?
verses.english: Who knows the power of your anger? Who understands the full extent of your wrath?

verses.latin: Dexteram tuam sic notam fac, et comeditos in corde sapientia.
verses.english: Teach us to number our days so that we may gain a heart of wisdom.

verses.latin: Convertere, Domine, usquequo? et deprecabilis esto super servos tuos.
verses.english: Return, O Lord! How long will you delay? Have pity on your servants.

verses.latin: Repleti sumus mane misericordia tua: et exultavimus, et delectati sumus omnibus diebus nostris.
verses.english: Satisfy us each morning with your love so that we may be filled with joy for all our days.

verses.latin: Laetificati sumus pro diebus, quibus nos humiliasti: annis, quibus vidimus mala.
verses.english: Make us rejoice for as long as you have afflicted us, for the years when we saw suffering.

verses.latin: Respice in servos tuos, et in opera tua: et dirige filios eorum.
verses.english: Show your servants your work, and show your glory to their children.

verses.latin: Et sit splendor Domini Dei nostri super nos: et opera manuum nostrarum dirige super nos: et opus manuum nostrarum dirige.
verses.english: May the Lord, our God, show us his favor. Make all that we do succeed. Yes, make it all succeed.

verses.latin: Qui habitat in adjutorio Altissimi, in protectione Dei caeli commorabitur.
verses.english: If you dwell and rest in the help of the Highest God, then you will also dwell in the protection of the sky.

verses.latin: Dicet Domino: Susceptor meus es, et refugium meum: Deus meus, sperabo in eum.
verses.english: You will say to God the Father: "You are my protector and my refuge: my God, in You I will hope."

verses.latin: Quoniam ipse liberavit me de laqueo venantium, et a verbo duro.
verses.english: Because He freed me from the snare of the hunters and from a harsh word.

verses.latin: In scapulis suis obumbrabit tibi, et sub pennis ejus sperabis:
verses.english: With His wings He will overshadow you and protect you, and under His protection you will hope:

verses.latin: scutum et clipeus veritas ejus.
verses.english: His truth and love is a shield and a protection.

verses.latin: Non timebis a timore nocturno, a sagitta volante in die,
verses.english: You will not fear the fear of the darkness of night, nor will you be frightened by the arrow of sin that flies in the day,

verses.latin: a peste in tenebris ambulante, a ruinam, et daemonio meridiano.
verses.english: nor of the plague that travels in darkness, nor of the destruction and the devil of the midday sun.

verses.latin: Cadent a latere tuo mille, et decem millia a dextris tuis:
verses.english: Though a thousand men may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand:

verses.latin: ad te autem non appropinquabit.
verses.english: it will not come near you.

verses.latin: Verumtamen oculis tuis considerabis: et retributionem peccatorum videbis.
verses.english: But your eyes will see what the true nature of things are, and you will see the punishment of sinners.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu es, Domine, spes mea:
verses.english: Because you are, O Lord, my hope:

verses.latin: Altissimum posuisti refugium tuum.
verses.english: You have made God the Highest, your refuge.

verses.latin: Non accedet ad te malum: et flagellum non appropinquabit tabernaculo tuo.
verses.english: Evil shall not come to you, and the scourge of sin will not come near your dwelling.

verses.latin: Quoniam angelis suis mandavit de te, ut custodiant te in omnibus viis tuis.
verses.english: For He has given His angels the command to guard you in all your ways.

verses.latin: In manibus portabunt te: ne forte offendas ad lapidem pedem tuum.
verses.english: They will carry you in their hands, so you will not strike your foot against a stone.

verses.latin: Super aspidem et basiliscum ambulabis: et conculcabis leonem et draconem.
verses.english: You will walk over the asp and the basilisk: and you will trample on the lion and the dragon.

verses.latin: Quoniam in me speravit, liberabo eum: protegam eum, quoniam cognovit nomen meum.
verses.english: “Because he has hoped in Me, I will free him, and I will protect him, because he knows My Name.

verses.latin: Clamabit ad me, et ego exaudiam eum: cum ipso sum in tribulatione: eripiam eum, et glorificabo eum.
verses.english: When he calls to Me, I will hear him: I am with him in tribulation: I will rescue him, and I will glorify him.

verses.latin: Longitudine dierum replebo eum: et ostendam illi salutare meum.
verses.english: I will fill him with length of days, and I will show him My salvation.

verses.latin: Psalmus cantici in die sabbati.
verses.english: This is a Psalm for singing on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Bonum est confiteri Domino: et psallere nomini tuo, Altissime;
verses.english: It is right to give praise to God; and to sing hymns to your name, Most High God;

verses.latin: Ad annuntiandum mane misericordiam tuam, et veritatem tuam per noctem:
verses.english: Proclaiming Your mercy in the morning, and Your truth through the night:

verses.latin: In decachordo psalterio, cum cantico in cithara.
verses.english: With a ten-stringed instrument, with a hymn on the harp.

verses.latin: Quia delectasti me, Domine, in factura tua: et in operibus manuum tuarum exsultabo.
verses.english: For You have made me glad, O Lord, by Your works: and in the works of Your hands I will rejoice.

verses.latin: Quam magnificata sunt opera tua, Domine! nimis profundae factae sunt cogitationes tuae.
verses.english: How great are Your works, O Lord! Your thoughts are exceedingly deep.

verses.latin: Vir insipiens non cognoscet: et stultus non intellegit haec.
verses.english: The foolish man does not know this, and the stupid man does not understand.

verses.latin: Cum exorti fuerint peccatores, sicut foenum: et apparuerint omnes qui operantur iniquitatem.
verses.english: When the wicked spring up like grass, and all those who work iniquity have appeared,

verses.latin: Ut intereant in saeculum saeculi: tu autem altissimus in aeternum, Domine.
verses.english: They will perish forever. But you, O Lord, are most high forever.

verses.latin: Quoniam ecce inimici tui, Domine, quoniam ecce inimici tui peribunt: et dispergentur omnes qui operantur iniquitatem.
verses.english: For behold, Your enemies, O Lord, for behold, Your enemies will perish: and all who work iniquity will be scattered.

verses.latin: Et exaltabitur sicut unicornis cornu meum: et senectus mea in misericordia uberi.
verses.english: And my horn will be exalted like that of a unicorn: and my old age will abound in mercy.

verses.latin: Et despexit oculus meus inimicos meos: et in insurgentibus in me malignantibus audiet auris mea.
verses.english: My eye has looked down on my enemies, and my ear has heard the wicked who rise up against me.

verses.latin: Justus ut palma florebit: sicut cedrus Libani multiplicabitur.
verses.english: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree: and will grow like the cedar of Lebanon.

verses.latin: Plantati in domo Domini, in atriis domus Dei nostri florebunt.
verses.english: Planted in the house of the Lord, they will flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.latin: Adhuc multiplicabuntur in senecta uberi: et bene patientes erunt, ut annuntient.
verses.english: They will still multiply in old age: and will be prosperous, that they may announce.

verses.latin: Quoniam rectus Dominus Deus noster: et non est iniquitas in eo.
verses.english: For the Lord our God is just: and there is no iniquity in Him.

verses.latin: Dominus regnavit, decorem indutus est;
verses.english: The Lord is reigning. He is wearing majestic glory.

verses.latin: indutus est Dominus fortitudinem, et praecinxit se.
verses.english: The Lord has put on strength and is always ready.

verses.latin: Etenim firmavit orbem terrae, qui non commovebitur.
verses.english: Indeed, He has established the Earth itself so that it will not be moved.

verses.latin: Parata sedes tua ex tunc: a saeculo tu es.
verses.english: Your throne was established long ago: From eternity, You are.

verses.latin: Elevaverunt flumina, Domine, elevaverunt flumina vocem suam.
verses.english: The floods have lifted up, O Lord. The floods have lifted their voices.

verses.latin: Elevaverunt flumina fluctus suos, a vocibus aquarum multarum.
verses.english: The floods have lifted up their waves, louder than the sound of rushing waters.

verses.latin: Mirabiles proluviones maris: mirabilis in altis Dominus.
verses.english: More wonderful than the waves of the sea; The Lord in the heavens is to be admired.

verses.latin: Testimonia tua credibilia facta sunt nimis: domui tuae decet sanctitudo, Domine, in longitudinem dierum.
