verses.english: Your testimonies are completely trustworthy. Holiness is fitting for your house, O Lord, forever and ever.

verses.latin: Deus ultionum Dominus: Deus ultionum libere egit.
verses.english: The God of vengeance is the Lord, and He will right all wrongs.

verses.latin: Exaltare qui judicas terram: redde retribucionem superbis.
verses.english: He will raise Himself up to judge the earth, and He will give every arrogant person what they deserve.

verses.latin: Usquequo peccatores, Domine, usquequo peccatores gloriabuntur?
verses.english: Lord, how much longer will the wicked sin? How much longer will the wicked be honored?

verses.latin: Effabuntur, et loquentur iniquitatem: loquentur omnes qui operantur iniquitatem?
verses.english: They are always saying evil things, and they are always saying them.

verses.latin: Populum tuum, Domine, humiliaverunt: et hereditatem tuam vexaverunt.
verses.english: Lord, they are crushing your people, and they are tormenting your inheritance.

verses.latin: Viduam et advenam interfecerunt: et pupillos occiderunt.
verses.english: They murder widows and foreigners, and they kill orphans.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Non videbit Dominus, nec intelliget Deus Jacob.
verses.english: They say, “The Lord will not see it, and the God of Jacob will not understand.”

verses.latin: Intelligite, insipientes in populo: et stulti, aliquando sapite.
verses.english: Understand this, foolish people. You fools, wake up!

verses.latin: Qui plantavit aurem, non audiet? aut qui finxit oculum, non considerat?
verses.english: God made our ears, and He will hear us. God made our eyes, and He will see us.

verses.latin: Qui corripit gentes, non arguet? qui docet hominem scientiam?
verses.english: God teaches knowledge to man and will correct the nations.

verses.latin: Dominus novit cogitationes hominum, quoniam vanae sunt.
verses.english: The Lord knows the thoughts of men, that they are vain.

verses.latin: Beatus homo quem tu erudieris, Domine: et de lege tua docueris eum,
verses.english: Happy is the man whom the Lord corrects; He will teach him out of His law.

verses.latin: ut mitescat a diebus malis: donec fodiatur peccatori fovea.
verses.english: God will give him rest from the evil days until the pit is dug for the wicked man.

verses.latin: Quia non derelinquet Dominus plebem suam: et hereditatem suam non derelinquet.
verses.english: Because the Lord will not forsake His people, nor will He abandon His inheritance.

verses.latin: Quoadusque revertetur judicium ad justitiam: et qui sequuntur illud, omnes corde recto?
verses.english: Until justice comes back to the righteous, those who follow it will be right.

verses.latin: Quis consurget mihi adversus malignantes? aut quis stabit mecum adversus operantes iniquitatem?
verses.english: Who will stand up with me against the wicked? Who will take a stand with me against the evildoers?

verses.latin: Nisi quia Dominus adjuvit me, paululum habitasset in inferno anima mea.
verses.english: If the Lord had not helped me, my soul would have already been in the realm of the dead.

verses.latin: Si dicebam: Motus est pes meus: misericordia tua, Domine, adjuvabat me.
verses.english: If I said, “My foot is slipping,” your mercy, Lord, was helping me.

verses.latin: Secundum multitudinem dolorum meorum in corde meo, consolationes tuae laetificaverunt animam meam.
verses.english: When I was distressed, your consolations gave joy to my soul.

verses.latin: Numquid adhaeret tibi sedes iniquitatis: qui fingis laborem in praecepto?
verses.english: Is your seat a seat of wickedness? Do you make trouble with your commandments?

verses.latin: Captabunt in animam justi: et sanguinem innocentem condemnnabunt.
verses.english: They hunt for the soul of the righteous and condemn innocent blood.

verses.latin: Et factus est mihi Dominus in refugium: et Deus meus in auxilium spei meae.
verses.english: But the Lord has become my refuge; and my God is a help to my hope.

verses.latin: Et reddet illis iniquitatem ipsorum: et in malitia eorum disperdet eos: disperdet eos Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: God will give them back what they deserve, and in their wickedness, He will destroy them, the Lord our God.

verses.latin: Cantate Domino canticum novum: cantate Domino omnis terra.
verses.english: Sing a new song to the Lord: Sing to the Lord, all you of the earth.

verses.latin: Cantate Domino, et benedicite nomini ejus: annuntiate de die in diem salutare ejus.
verses.english: Sing to the Lord, and bless His name: announce His salvation day by day.

verses.latin: Annuntiate inter gentes gloriam ejus: in omnibus populis mirabilia ejus.
verses.english: Declare His glory among the nations: His wonders among all peoples.

verses.latin: Quoniam magnus Dominus, et laudabilis nimis: terribilis est super omnes deos.
verses.english: Because the Lord is great, and worthy of very great praise: He is terrifying above all the false gods.

verses.latin: Quoniam omnes dii gentium daemonia: Dominus autem caelos fecit.
verses.english: For all the gods of the Gentiles are demons: but the Lord created the sky.

verses.latin: Majestas et pulchritudo in conspectu ejus: sanctimonia et magnitudo in sanctificatione ejus.
verses.english: Majesty and beauty are in His sight: holiness and greatness are in His sanctification.

verses.latin: Afferte Domino, familiae gentium, afferte Domino gloriam et honorem:
verses.english: Offer to the Lord, families of the nations, offer the Lord glory and honor:

verses.latin: afferte Domino gloriam nominis ejus: adorate Dominum in sancto atrio ejus.
verses.english: offer the Lord the glory of His name: adore the Lord in His holy courtyard.

verses.latin: Contremisce a facie ejus universa terra: dicite in gentibus quia Dominus regnavit.
verses.english: Tremble before Him, all the earth: say among the nations that the Lord reigns.

verses.latin: Etenim correxit orbem terrae, qui non movebitur: judicabit populos in aequitate.
verses.english: For He has established the world and it will not be moved: He will judge the peoples in righteousness.

verses.latin: Laetentur caeli, et exultet terra: commoveatur mare et plenitudo ejus.
verses.english: Let the skies rejoice, and let the earth exult: let the sea and its fullness be moved.

verses.latin: Exultabunt campi, et omnia quae in eis sunt: tunc exultabunt omnia ligna silvarum
verses.english: The fields will exult, and everything that is in them: then all the trees of the forests will exult

verses.latin: a facie Domini: quia venit, quoniam venit judicare terram. Judicabit orbem terrae in justitia, et populos in veritate sua.
verses.english: before the face of the Lord: because He comes, because He comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world in justice, and the peoples in His truth.

verses.latin: Dominus regnavit, exultet terra; laetentur insulae multae.
verses.english: The Lord reigns! The whole earth rejoices. The islands and their people are glad.

verses.latin: Nubes et caligo in circuitu ejus; justitia et judicium correctio sedis ejus.
verses.english: Clouds and a thick fog surround Him, but God's justice and judgment form the foundation of His throne.

verses.latin: Ignis ante ipsum praecedet, et inflammabit in circuitu inimicos ejus.
verses.english: Fire goes ahead of Him, and burns up His enemies all around.

verses.latin: Illuxerunt fulgura ejus orbi terrae; vidit et commota est terra.
verses.english: His lightnings illumine the whole world; the earth sees and trembles.

verses.latin: Montes sicut cera fluxerunt a facie Domini; a facie Domini omnis terrae.
verses.english: The mountains melt like wax before the Lord, before the Lord of all the earth.

verses.latin: Annuntiaverunt caeli justitiam ejus, et viderunt omnes populi gloriam ejus.
verses.english: The heavens proclaim His justice; all peoples see His glory.

verses.latin: Confundantur omnes qui adorant sculptilia, et qui gloriantur in simulacris suis.
verses.english: All who worship idols and boast in their false gods will be disgraced.

verses.latin: Adorate eum omnes angeli ejus; audivit et laetata est Sion.
verses.english: All His angels should worship Him. Zion, the city of God, hears and rejoices.

verses.latin: Et exultaverunt filiae Judae, propter judicia tua, Domine.
verses.english: The daughters of Judah rejoice because of Your judgments, O Lord.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu Dominus altissimus super omnem terram; nimis exaltatus es super omnes deos.
verses.english: For You, O Lord, are most high over all the earth. You are greatly exalted above all gods.

verses.latin: Qui diligitis Dominum, odite malum: custodit Dominus animas sanctorum suorum; de manu peccatoris liberabit eos.
verses.english: You who love the Lord, hate evil! The Lord protects the souls of His faithful; He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

verses.latin: Lux orta est justo, et rectis corde laetitia.
verses.english: Light dawns for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.

verses.latin: Laetamini justi in Domino, et confitemini memoriae sanctificationis ejus.
verses.english: Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones! Praise His holy name.

verses.latin: Dominus regnavit: exultet terra; laetentur insulae multae.
verses.english: The Lord reigns. Let the whole earth sing; let all the distant lands rejoice.

verses.latin: Nubes, et caligo in circuitu ejus; justitia et judicium correctio sedis ejus.
verses.english: Dark storm clouds are all around Him. His throne is justice and righteous judgment.

verses.latin: Ignis ante ipsum praecedet, et inflammabit in circuitu inimicos ejus.
verses.english: Fire travels ahead of Him, and this will be the fate of His enemies.

verses.latin: Illuxerunt fulgura ejus orbi terrae; vidit, et commota est terra.
verses.english: The whole universe saw His lightnings; the earth saw and was shaken.

verses.latin: Montes sicut cera fluxerunt a facie Domini; a facie Domini universae terrae.
verses.english: The mountains melted like wax before the Lord, before the Lord of all the earth.

verses.latin: Annuntiaverunt caeli justitiam ejus; et viderunt omnes populi gloriam ejus.
verses.english: The sky proclaims His justice, and all the peoples have seen His glory.

verses.latin: Confundantur omnes qui adorant sculptilia, et qui gloriantur in simulacris suis. Adorate eum omnes angeli ejus.
verses.english: All who worship idols and boast in their worthless images will be put to shame. Worship Him, all you angels!

verses.latin: Audivit, et laetata est Sion, et exultaverunt filiae Judae, propter judicia tua, Domine.
verses.english: Zion heard and rejoiced, and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of Your judgments, O Lord.

verses.latin: Quoniam tu Dominus altissimus super omnem terram; nimis exaltatus es super omnes deos.
verses.english: For You, Lord, are most high over all the earth; You are far exalted over all gods.

verses.latin: Qui diligitis Dominum, odite malum: custodit Dominus animas sanctorum suorum; de manu peccatoris liberabit eos.
verses.english: You who love the Lord, hate evil! The Lord keeps the souls of His saints; He will deliver them from the hand of the wicked.

verses.latin: Lux orta est justo, et rectis corde laetitia.
verses.english: Light is sown for the righteous and joy for the upright in heart.

verses.latin: Laetamini justi in Domino, et confitemini memoriae sanctificationis ejus.
verses.english: Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous, and give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.

verses.latin: Cantate Domino canticum novum: quia mirabilia fecit.
verses.english: Sing to the Lord a new song, because He has done great wonders.

verses.latin: Salvavit sibi dextera ejus, et brachium sanctum ejus.
verses.english: His own right hand and holy arm delivered Him.

verses.latin: Notum fecit Dominus salutare suum: in conspectu gentium revelavit justitiam suam.
verses.english: The Lord has made known His salvation, revealing His justice to the nations.

verses.latin: Recordatus est misericordiae suae, et veritatis suae domu Israel.
verses.english: He remembered His mercy and His truth to the house of Israel.

verses.latin: Viderunt omnes termini terrae salutare Dei nostri.
verses.english: All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.latin: Jubilate Deo, omnis terra: cantate, et exultate, et psallite.
verses.english: Shout with joy to God, all the earth; sing, rejoice, and make music.

verses.latin: Psallite Domino in cithara; in cithara et voce psalmi:
verses.english: Sing to the Lord with a harp, with a harp, and the sound of a psalm.

verses.latin: in tubis ductilibus, et voce tubae cornae: jubilate in conspectu regis Domini.
verses.english: With trumpets and the sound of the trumpet, shout before the King, the Lord.

verses.latin: Moveatur mare et plenitudo ejus: orbis terrarum et qui habitant in eo.
verses.english: Let the sea resound, and everything in it; the world, and those who dwell in it.

verses.latin: Flumina plaudent manu: simul jubilent montes
verses.english: Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains rejoice together.

verses.latin: a conspectu Domini: quoniam venit judicare terram.
verses.english: Before the Lord, because He comes to judge the earth.

verses.latin: Judicabit orbem terrarum in justitia, et populos in aequitate.
verses.english: He will judge the world with justice, and the peoples with equity.

verses.latin: Dominus regnavit: irascantur populi: qui sedet super cherubim, moveatur terra.
verses.english: The Lord is King! Let the nations shake with anger! He sits above the cherubim; let the earth be moved.

verses.latin: Dominus in Sion magnus, et excelsus super omnes populos.
verses.english: The Lord is great in Zion, higher than all the peoples.

verses.latin: Confiteantur nomini tuo magno, quoniam terribile est, et sanctum est:
verses.english: Let them praise Your great name, because it is fearsome and holy.

verses.latin: et honor regis judicium diligit. Tu parasti directiones: judicium et justitiam in Jacob tu fecisti.
verses.english: The King loves justice and is merciful. You created what is just and righteous in Jacob.

verses.latin: Exaltate Dominum Deum nostrum, et adorate scabellum pedum ejus, quoniam sanctum est.
verses.english: Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at his footstool, for it is holy.

verses.latin: Moyses et Aaron in sacerdotibus ejus: et Samuel inter eos qui invocant nomen ejus.
verses.english: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, and Samuel among those who called upon his name.

verses.latin: Invocabant Dominum, et ipse exaudiebat eos: in columna nubis loquebatur ad eos.
verses.english: They called upon the Lord, and he heard them. He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud.

verses.latin: Custodiebas testimonia ejus, et præcepta ejus, quæ dedit illis.
verses.english: They kept his commandments and the law that he gave them.

verses.latin: Domine Deus noster, tu exaudiebas eos: Deus, tu propitius fuisti eis, et ulcisceris in cunctis adinventionibus eorum.
verses.english: Lord our God, you answered them. You were a forgiving God to them, but you punished them for their wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Exaltate Dominum Deum nostrum, et adorate in monte sancto ejus, quoniam sanctus Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: Exalt the Lord our God and worship on his holy mountain, because the Lord our God is holy.

verses.latin: Jubilate Deo, omnis terra:
verses.english: Sing praises to God, all the earth:

verses.latin: servite Domino in laetitia.
verses.english: serve the Lord with gladness.

verses.latin: Introite in conspectu ejus, in exsultatione.
verses.english: Enter into his presence with a joyous cry.

verses.latin: Scitote quoniam Dominus ipse est Deus:
verses.english: Know that the Lord Himself is God:

verses.latin: ipse fecit nos, et non ipsi nos:
verses.english: He has made us, and we are His creation:

verses.latin: populus ejus, et oves pascuae ejus.
verses.english: We are His people, the sheep of His pasture.

verses.latin: Introite portas ejus in confessione:
verses.english: Enter His gates with thanksgiving:

verses.latin: atria ejus in hymnis:
verses.english: His courts with hymns:

verses.latin: confitemini illi.
verses.english: Give praise to Him.

verses.latin: Laudate nomen ejus:
verses.english: Praise His name:

verses.latin: quoniam suavis Dominus:
verses.english: for the Lord is good:

verses.latin: in aeternum misericordia ejus, et usque in generationem et generationem veritas ejus.
verses.english: His mercy is everlasting, and His truth endures through every generation.

verses.latin: Domine, exaudi orationem meam, et clamor meus ad te veniat.
verses.english: Lord, hear my prayer, and let my cry come to you.

verses.latin: Non avertas faciem tuam a me: in quacumque die tribulor, inclina ad me aurem tuam.
verses.english: Don't turn your face away from me; on whatever day I am troubled, incline your ear to me.

verses.latin: In quacumque die invocavero te, velociter exaudi me.
verses.english: On whatever day I call upon you, quickly hear me.

verses.latin: Quia defecerunt sicut fumus dies mei: et ossa mea sicut cremium aruerunt.
verses.english: Because my days have vanished like smoke, and my bones have dried up like a fire's ash.

verses.latin: Percussus sum ut foenum, et aruit cor meum: quia oblitus sum comedere panem meum.
verses.english: I am struck like grass, and my heart has withered, because I have forgotten to eat my bread.

verses.latin: A voce gemitus mei adhaesit os meum carni meae.
verses.english: Because of the voice of my groaning, my bone has clung to my flesh.

verses.latin: Similis factus sum pelicano solitudinis: factus sum sicut nycticorax in domicilio.
verses.english: I have become like a pelican in the wilderness; I am like a night raven in a dwelling.

verses.latin: Vigilavi, et factus sum sicut passer solitarius in tecto.
verses.english: I have watched and become like a solitary sparrow on a roof.

verses.latin: Tota die exprobrabant mihi inimici mei: et qui laudabant me, adversum me jurabant.
verses.english: All day my enemies reproached me, and those who praised me swore against me.

verses.latin: Quia cinerem quasi panem manducabam, et potum meum cum fletu miscebam.
verses.english: Because I ate ash as my bread, and I mixed my drink with weeping.

verses.latin: A facie irae et indignationis tuae: quia elevans allisisti me.
verses.english: Because of your anger and indignation, because you raised me up and cast me down.

verses.latin: Dies mei sicut umbra declinaverunt: et ego sicut foenum arefactus sum.
verses.english: My days have declined like a shadow, and I have dried up like grass.

verses.latin: Tu autem Domine in aeternum permanes: et memoria tui in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: But you, Lord, remain forever, and your memory endures to all generations.

verses.latin: Tu exurgens misereberis Sion: quia tempus miserendi ejus, quia venit tempus.
verses.english: You will arise, and have mercy on Zion; for the time to have mercy on it has come, because the time has come.

verses.latin: Quoniam placuerunt servis tuis lapides ejus: et terrae ejus miserebuntur.
verses.english: For your servants have found pleasure in her stones, and they will have mercy on her lands.

verses.latin: Et timebunt gentes nomen Domini: et omnes reges terrae gloriam tuam.
verses.english: And the nations will fear the name of the Lord, and all the kings of the earth will fear your glory.

verses.latin: Quia aedificavit Dominus Sion, et videbitur in gloria sua.
verses.english: Because the Lord has built up Zion, and he will be seen in his glory.

verses.latin: Respexit in orationem humilium, et non sprevit precem eorum.
verses.english: He has regarded the prayer of the humble, and he has not despised their prayer.

verses.latin: Scribantur haec in generationem alteram: et populus qui creabitur laudabit Dominum.
verses.english: Let this be written for the next generation, and the people who are being created will praise the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia prospexit de excelso sancto suo: Dominus de caelo in terram aspexit:
verses.english: Because he has looked down from his holy height, the Lord looked from heaven to the earth:

verses.latin: Ut audiret gemitus compeditorum: ut solveret filios interemptorum:
verses.english: To hear the groaning of those in chains, to release the sons of those slain:

verses.latin: Ut annuntient in Sion nomen Domini: et laudem ejus in Jerusalem.
verses.english: That they may declare in Zion the name of the Lord, and his praise in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In conveniendo populos in unum: et reges ut serviant Domino.
verses.english: When peoples come together, and kings to serve the Lord.

verses.latin: Respondit ei in via virtutis suae: Paucitatem dierum meorum annuntia mihi.
verses.english: He answered him in the way of his power, 'Tell me the smallness of my days.'

verses.latin: Ne reveces me in dimidio dierum meorum: in generationem et generationem anni tui.
verses.english: Do not take me away in the middle of my days. Your years are generation after generation.

verses.latin: Initio tu, Domine, terram fundasti: et opera manuum tuarum sunt caeli.
verses.english: In the beginning, Lord, you founded the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.latin: Ipsi peribunt, tu autem permanes: et omnes sicut vestimentum veterascent.
verses.english: They will perish, but you will remain, and all things will grow old like a garment.

verses.latin: Et sicut operimentum mutabis eos, et mutabuntur: tu autem idem ipse es, et anni tui non deficient.
verses.english: And like a covering you will change them, and they will be changed. But you are the same, and your years will not fail.

verses.latin: Filii servorum tuorum habitabunt: et semen eorum in saeculum dirigetur.
verses.english: The sons of your servants will dwell, and their seed will be directed to eternity.

verses.latin: Benedic, anima mea, Domino: et omnia quae intra me sunt, nomini sancto ejus.
verses.english: My soul, bless the Lord! And all that is within me, bless His holy name.

verses.latin: Benedic, anima mea, Domino, et noli oblivisci omnes retributions ejus.
verses.english: My soul, bless the Lord, and do not forget His rewards.

verses.latin: Qui propitiatur omnibus iniquitatibus tuis: qui sanat omnes infirmitates tuas.
verses.english: He forgives all your iniquities; He heals all your illnesses.

verses.latin: Qui redemit de interitu vitam tuam: qui coronat te in misericordia et miserationibus.
verses.english: He redeems your life from destruction; He crowns you with mercy and compassion.

verses.latin: Qui explet in bonis desiderium tuum: renovabitur ut aquilae juventus tua.
verses.english: He fills your desire with good things, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

verses.latin: Facit misericordias Dominus, et judicium omnibus injuriam patientibus.
verses.english: The Lord does acts of mercy and justice for all who are wronged.

verses.latin: Notas fecit vias suas Moysi, filiis Israël voluntates suas.
verses.english: He made known His ways to Moses, and His will to the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Miserator et misericors Dominus: longanimis et multum misericors.
verses.english: The Lord is compassionate and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in mercy.

verses.latin: Non in perpetuum irascetur: neque in aeternum irascer.
verses.english: He will not always be angry, nor will He keep His anger forever.

verses.latin: Non secundum peccata nostra fecit nobis: neque secundum iniquitates nostras retribuit nobis.
verses.english: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor has He repaid us according to our iniquities.

verses.latin: Quoniam quantum exaltatur caelum a terra: tantum corroboravit misericordiam suam super timentes eum.
verses.english: For as high as the universe is above the earth, so great is His mercy toward those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Quantum distat ortus ab occidente: tantum separavit a nobis iniquitates nostras.
verses.english: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.

verses.latin: Quomodo miseretur pater filiorum, misertus est Dominus timentium se.
verses.english: As a father has compassion on his children, so the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Quoniam ipse cognovit figmentum nostrum: recordatus est quoniam pulvis sumus.
verses.english: For He knows our frame; He remembers that we are dust.

verses.latin: Homo, sicut foenum dies ejus: tamquam flos agri sic efflorebit.
verses.english: As for man, his days are like grass; as a flower in the field, so he flourishes.

verses.latin: Quoniam spiritus pertransibit in illo, et non subsistet: et non cognoscet amplius locum suum.
verses.english: For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and its place knows it no more.

verses.latin: Misericordia autem Domini ab aeterno et usque in aeternum super timentes eum.
verses.english: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity to eternity toward those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Et justitia illius in filios filiorum, his qui custodiunt testamentum ejus: et memores sunt mandatorum ipsius ad faciendum ea.
verses.english: And His justice extends to the children's children, to those who keep His covenant, and remember His commandments to do them.

verses.latin: Dominus in caelo paravit sedem suam: et regnum ipsius omnibus dominabitur.
verses.english: The Lord has established His throne in the sky, and His kingdom rules over all.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnes angeli ejus: potentes virtute, facientes verbum illius, ad audiendam vocem sermones ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you angels; you mighty ones, who do His word, hearkening to the voice of His word.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnes virtutes ejus: ministri ejus, qui facitis voluntatem ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you His hosts; you ministers of His, who do His will.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnia opera ejus: in omni loco dominationis ejus. Benedic, anima mea, Domino.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you works of His, in all places of His dominion. My soul, bless the Lord!

verses.latin: Benedic, anima mea, Domino: et omnia, quae intra me sunt, nomini sancto ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, O my soul: and let all my innermost being bless His holy name.

verses.latin: Benedic, anima mea, Domino, et noli oblivisci omnes retributiones ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and do not forget all the benefits that He gives to you.

verses.latin: Qui propitiatur omnibus iniquitatibus tuis: qui sanat omnes infirmitates tuas.
verses.english: He pardons all your iniquities: He heals all your diseases.

verses.latin: Qui redimit de interitu vitam tuam: qui coronat te in misericordia et miserationibus.
verses.english: He redeems your life from destruction: He crowns you with mercy and compassion.

verses.latin: Qui adimplet in bonis desiderium tuum: renovabitur ut aquilae juventus tua.
verses.english: He satisfies your desire with good things: your youth is renewed like the eagle's.

verses.latin: Facit misericordias Dominus, et judicium omnibus injuriam patientibus.
verses.english: The Lord does merciful deeds and judgments for all who are oppressed.

verses.latin: Notas fecit vias suas Moysi: filiis Israël voluntatem suam.
verses.english: He made known His ways to Moses, and to the sons of Israel His will.

verses.latin: Miserator et misericors Dominus: patiens et multum misericors.
verses.english: The Lord is compassionate and merciful, patient, and very merciful.

verses.latin: Non in perpetuum irascetur, neque in aeternum comminabitur.
verses.english: He will not be angry forever, nor will He threaten eternally.

verses.latin: Non secundum peccata nostra fecit nobis: neque secundum iniquitates nostras retribuit nobis.
verses.english: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, nor has He repaid us according to our iniquities.

verses.latin: Quoniam quantum exaltatur caelum a terra: tantum confirmavit misericordiam suam super timentes se.
verses.english: For as the universe is high above the earth, so great is His mercy toward those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Quantum distat ortus ab occidente: tantum separavit a nobis iniquitates nostras.
verses.english: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our iniquities from us.

verses.latin: Quomodo miseretur pater filiorum, misertus est Dominus timentium se.
verses.english: As a father has mercy on his children, so the Lord has mercy on those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Quoniam ipse cognovit figmentum nostrum: recordatus est quoniam pulvis sumus.
verses.english: For He knows our frame; He remembers that we are dust.

verses.latin: Homo, sicut foenum, dies ejus: tamquam flos agri, sic effloruit.
verses.english: Man's days are like grass; like a flower of the field, so he flourishes.

verses.latin: Quoniam spiritus pertransibit in illo, et non subsistet: et non cognoscet amplius locum suum.
verses.english: For the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and its place knows it no more.

verses.latin: Misericordia autem Domini ab aeterno, et usque in aeternum super timentes eum.
verses.english: But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity, and to eternity, on those who fear Him.

verses.latin: Et justitia illius in filios filiorum: his qui servant testamentum ejus, et memores sunt mandatorum ipsius ad faciendum ea.
verses.english: And His justice is in the sons of sons, for those who keep His covenant and remember His commandments, so as to do them.

verses.latin: Dominus in caelo paravit sedem suam: et regnum ipsius omnibus dominabitur.
verses.english: The Lord has prepared His throne in the sky, and His kingdom rules over all.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnes angeli ejus: potentes virtute, facientes verbum illius, ad audiendam vocem sermonum ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you His angels, mighty in power, doing His word, to heed the voice of His words.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnes virtutes ejus: ministri ejus, qui facitis voluntatem ejus.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you His powers; His ministers, who do His will.

verses.latin: Benedicite Domino, omnia opera ejus: in omni loco dominationis ejus. Benedic, anima mea, Domino.
verses.english: Bless the Lord, all you His works, in every place of His dominion. Bless the Lord, O my soul.

verses.latin: Benedic, anima mea, Domino.
verses.english: Praise God, my soul!

verses.latin: Domine Deus meus, magnificatus es veheménter.
verses.english: You are truly magnificent, my Lord God.

verses.latin: Confessionem et decórem induísti.
verses.english: You have robed yourself with majesty and beauty.

verses.latin: Amíctus lúmine sicut vestiménto.
verses.english: You are clothed in light as if with a garment.

verses.latin: Exténdens cælum sicut pellem.
verses.english: You spread out the sky like a tent.

verses.latin: Qui tegis in aquis superióra ejus.
verses.english: You build your home above the sky; your high dwelling is in the heavens.

verses.latin: Qui ponis nubem ascensum tuum.
verses.english: You make the clouds your chariot,

verses.latin: Qui ámbulas super pennas ventórum.
verses.english: You travel on the wings of the wind.

verses.latin: Qui facis ángelos tuos spíritus,
verses.english: You make the winds your messengers,

verses.latin: et minístros tuos ignem flammántem.
verses.english: and flaming fire your servants.

verses.latin: Qui fundasti terram super stabilitátem suam:
verses.english: You set the earth on its foundations

verses.latin: non inclinábitur in sæculum sæculi.
verses.english: so that it shall never be moved.

verses.latin: Abýssus sicut vestiméntum, amíctus ejus:
verses.english: You covered it with the deep as with a garment;

verses.latin: super montes stabunt aquæ.
verses.english: the waters stood above the mountains.

verses.latin: Ab increpatióne tua fúgient:
verses.english: At your rebuke they fled,

verses.latin: a voce tonítrui tui formidábunt.
verses.english: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

verses.latin: Ascéndunt montes, et descéndunt campi
verses.english: They rose up to the mountains, they went down into the valleys

verses.latin: in locum, quem fundasti eis.
verses.english: to the place which you established for them.

verses.latin: Terminum posuísti, quem non transgrediéntur,
verses.english: You set a boundary which they shall not pass,

verses.latin: neque converténtur operíre terram.
verses.english: neither shall they return to cover the earth.

verses.latin: Qui emíttis fontes in convállibus:
verses.english: You cause springs to gush forth in the valleys;

verses.latin: inter médium móntium pertransíbunt aquæ.
verses.english: they flow between the mountains.

verses.latin: Potábunt omnes béstiæ agri:
verses.english: They give drink to every beast of the field;

verses.latin: expectábunt ónagri in siti sua.
verses.english: the wild asses quench their thirst.

verses.latin: Super ea vólucres cæli habitábunt:
verses.english: Beside them the birds of the heavens dwell;

verses.latin: de médio ramiórum dant vocem.
verses.english: they sing among the branches.

verses.latin: Rigans montes de superióribus suis:
verses.english: From your lofty abode you water the mountains;

verses.latin: de fructu óperum tuórum satiábitur terra.
verses.english: the earth is satisfied with the fruit of your works.

verses.latin: Producens fœnum jumentis,
verses.english: You cause the grass to grow for the cattle,

verses.latin: et herbam servitúti hóminum:
verses.english: and plants for the service of man,

verses.latin: ut edúcas panem de terra:
verses.english: that you may bring forth food from the earth,

verses.latin: et vinum lætíficet cor hóminis:
verses.english: and wine to gladden the heart of man,

verses.latin: ut exhiláret fáciem in óleo,
verses.english: to make his face shine with oil,

verses.latin: et panis cor hóminis confírmet.
verses.english: and bread to strengthen man's heart.

verses.latin: Saturabúntur ligna campi, et cedri Líbani, quos plantávit:
verses.english: The trees of the Lord are watered abundantly, the cedars of Lebanon, which he planted.

verses.latin: illi pásseres nidificábunt.
verses.english: There the birds build their nests;

verses.latin: Ciconiæ domus dux est eórum.
verses.english: the stork has its home there.

verses.latin: Montes excélsi cervis:
verses.english: The high mountains are for the wild goats;

verses.latin: petra refúgium herináciis.
verses.english: the rocks are a refuge for the rock badgers.

verses.latin: Fecit lunam in témpora:
verses.english: You have made the moon to mark the seasons;

verses.latin: sol cognóvit occásum suum.
verses.english: the sun knows its time for setting.

verses.latin: Posuísti ténebras, et facta est nox:
verses.english: You make darkness, and it is night,

verses.latin: in ipsa pertransíbunt omnes béstiæ silvæ.
verses.english: when all the beasts of the forest move about.

verses.latin: Cátuli leónum rugiéntes, ut rapiant, et quærant a Deo cibum sibi.
verses.english: The young lions roar for their prey, seeking their food from God.

verses.latin: Ortus est sol, et congregáti sunt:
verses.english: When the sun rises, they go away,

verses.latin: et in cubílibus suis collocabúntur.
verses.english: and lie down in their dens.

verses.latin: Exíbit homo ad opus suum,
verses.english: Man goes forth to his work

verses.latin: et ad operatiónem suam usque ad vésperum.
verses.english: and to his labor until the evening.

verses.latin: Quam magnificáta sunt ópera tua, Dómine!
verses.english: How manifold are your works, O Lord!

verses.latin: omnia in sapiéntia fecísti:
verses.english: In wisdom you have made them all;

verses.latin: repléta est terra possessióne tua.
verses.english: the earth is full of your creatures.

verses.latin: Hæc máre magnum et spatiósum manibus:
verses.english: Here is the sea, great and wide,

verses.latin: illic reptília, quorum non est númerus:
verses.english: which teems with things innumerable,

verses.latin: animália pusilla cum magnis.
verses.english: living things both small and great.

verses.latin: Ibi naves pertransíbunt:
verses.english: There go the ships,

verses.latin: draco iste, quem formásti ad illudéndum ei.
verses.english: and Leviathan, which you formed to sport in it.

verses.latin: Omnia a te exspéctant, ut des illis in témpore.
verses.english: These all look to you, to give them their food in due season.

verses.latin: Dante te illis cólligent: aperiénte te manum tuam, ómnia implebúntur bonitáte.
verses.english: When you give to them, they gather it up; when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.

verses.latin: Averténte autem te fáciem, turbabúntur:
verses.english: When you hide your face, they are dismayed;

verses.latin: auferes spíritum eórum, et defícient, et in púlverem suum reverténtur.
verses.english: when you take away their breath, they die and return to their dust.

verses.latin: Emíttes spíritum tuum, et creabúntur:
verses.english: When you send forth your spirit, they are created,

verses.latin: et renovábis fáciem terræ.
verses.english: and you renew the face of the ground.

verses.latin: Sit glória Domini in sæcula:
verses.english: May the glory of the Lord endure for ever,

verses.latin: lætábitur Dóminus in opéribus suis.
verses.english: may the Lord rejoice in his works.

verses.latin: Qui réspicit terram, et facit eam tremere:
verses.english: Who looks on the earth, and it trembles,

verses.latin: qui tangit montes, et fúmigant.
verses.english: who touches the mountains, and they smoke!

verses.latin: Cantábo Domino in vita mea:
verses.english: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;

verses.latin: psallam Deo meo, quámdiu sum.
verses.english: I will sing praise to my God while I have being.

verses.latin: Jucúndum sit ei elóquium meum:
verses.english: May my meditation be pleasing to him,

verses.latin: ego vero delectábor in Domino.
verses.english: for I will rejoice in the Lord.

verses.latin: Defíciant peccatóres a terra, et iníqui, ita ut non sint.
verses.english: Let sinners be consumed from the earth, and the wicked be no more.

verses.latin: Benedic, ánima mea, Dómino.
verses.english: Praise the Lord, my soul!

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, et invocate nomen ejus: annuntiate inter gentes opera ejus.
verses.english: Praise the Lord, call on his name: announce among the nations his works.

verses.latin: Cantate ei, et psallite ei: narrate omnia mirabilia ejus.
verses.english: Sing to him, and sing songs to him: tell all his marvelous acts.

verses.latin: Laudate nomen sanctum ejus: laetetur cor quaerentium Dominum.
verses.english: Praise his holy name: let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.

verses.latin: Quaerite Dominum, et confirmamini: quaerite faciem ejus semper.
verses.english: Seek the Lord and be made strong: always seek his face.

verses.latin: Recordamini mirabilium ejus quae fecit: prodigia ejus, et judicia oris ejus.
verses.english: Remember the marvels he has made: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth.

verses.latin: Semen Abraham, servi ejus: filii Jacob, electi ejus.
verses.english: Offspring of Abraham, his servant: sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.

verses.latin: Ipse Dominus Deus noster: in universa terra judicia ejus.
verses.english: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

verses.latin: Memor fuit in saeculum testamenti sui: verbi quod mandavit in mille generationes.
verses.english: He has remembered his covenant forever: the word he commanded to a thousand generations.

verses.latin: Quod disposuit ad Abraham: et juramentum suum ad Isaac:
verses.english: Which he arranged for Abraham: and his oath to Isaac:

verses.latin: Et statuit illud Jacob in praeceptum: et Israel in testamentum aeternum:
verses.english: And he established it for Jacob as a precept: and for Israel as an everlasting testament:

verses.latin: Dicens: Tibi dabo terram Chanaan: funiculum hereditatis vestrae.
verses.english: Saying: “To you I will give the land of Canaan: the measuring cord of your inheritance.”

verses.latin: Cum essent pauci numero: paucissimi, et incolae ejus:
verses.english: When they were few in number: the fewest, and inhabitants of it:

verses.latin: Et pertransierunt de gente in gentem, et de regno ad populum alterum.
verses.english: And they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people.

verses.latin: Non reliquit hominem nocere eis: et corripuit pro eis reges.
verses.english: He did not let any man hurt them: and he rebuked kings for them.

verses.latin: Nolite tangere christos meos: et in prophetis meis nolite malignari.
verses.english: Do not touch my anointed ones: and do not mistreat my prophets.

verses.latin: Et vocavit famem super terram: et omne firmamentum panis contrivit.
verses.english: And he called a famine upon the land: and he broke all the support of bread.

verses.latin: Misit ante eos virum: in servum venumdatus est Joseph.
verses.english: He sent a man before them: Joseph was sold as a slave.

verses.latin: Humiliaverunt in compedibus pedes ejus: ferrum pertransivit animam ejus.
verses.english: They humbled his feet in chains: iron passed through his soul.

verses.latin: Donec veniret verbum ejus: sermo Domini inflammavit eum.
verses.english: Until his word came: the word of the Lord set him ablaze.

verses.latin: Misit, et solvit eum: regem populorum, et dimisit eum.
verses.english: He sent and released him: the king of the peoples set him free.

verses.latin: Constituit eum dominum domus suae: et principem omnis possessionis suae:
verses.english: He established him as lord of his house: and prince over all his possessions:

verses.latin: Ut doceret principes ejus sicut se: et senes ejus prudentiam.
verses.english: That he might teach his princes like himself: and his elders wisdom.

verses.latin: Et intravit Israel in Aegyptum: et Jacob accola fuit in terra Cham.
verses.english: And Israel entered Egypt: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Ham.

verses.latin: Et auxit populum suum vehementer: et infirmavit eos super inimicos eorum.
verses.english: And he greatly increased his people: and made them stronger than their enemies.

verses.latin: Convertit cor eorum, ut odirent populum ejus: et dolum facerent in servos ejus.
verses.english: He turned their heart to hate his people: and to deal deceitfully with his servants.

verses.latin: Misit Moysen servum suum: Aaron quem elegit sibi.
verses.english: He sent Moses his servant: Aaron whom he chose for himself.

verses.latin: Posuerunt in eis verba signorum suorum: et signorum suorum in terra Cham.
verses.english: They placed among them the words of his signs: and his signs in the land of Ham.

verses.latin: Misit tenebras, et obscuravit: et non exacerbavit verba sua.
verses.english: He sent darkness, and it was darkened: and he did not exacerbate his words.

verses.latin: Convertit aquas eorum in sanguinem: et occidit pisces eorum.
verses.english: He turned their waters into blood: and killed their fish.

verses.latin: Edidit terra eorum ranas: in penetralibus regum eorum.
verses.english: Their land brought forth frogs: in the inner chambers of their kings.

verses.latin: Dixit, et venit ciniphes: et sciniphes in omnibus finibus eorum.
verses.english: He spoke, and there came gnats: and gnats in all their borders.

verses.latin: Dedit pluvias eorum grandinem: ignem comburentem in terra eorum.
verses.english: He gave them hail for rain: fire burning in their land.

verses.latin: Et percussit vites eorum, et ficus eorum: et contrivit lignum finium eorum.
verses.english: And he struck their vines and their fig trees: and broke the wood of their borders.

verses.latin: Dixit, et venit locusta, et brucus: cujus non erat numerus.
verses.english: He spoke, and the locust came, and the caterpillar: of which there was no number.

verses.latin: Et comedit omne foenum in terra eorum: et comedit omnem fructum terrae eorum.
verses.english: And it ate every blade of grass in their land: and ate every fruit of their land.

verses.latin: Et percussit omne primogenitum in terra eorum: primitias omnis laboris eorum.
verses.english: And he struck every firstborn in their land: the first fruits of all their labor.

verses.latin: Et eduxit eos cum argento et auro: et non erat in tribubus eorum infirmus.
verses.english: And he led them out with silver and gold: and not one weak person was among their tribes.

verses.latin: Laetata est Aegyptus in profectione eorum: quia timor eorum ceciderat super eos.
verses.english: Egypt rejoiced in their departure: because the fear of them had fallen upon them.

verses.latin: Expandit nubem in protectionem eorum: et ignem ut illuminaret eis nocte.
verses.english: He spread a cloud for their protection: and a fire to light them at night.

verses.latin: Petierunt, et venit coturnix: et pane caeli saturavit eos.
verses.english: They asked, and the quail came: and he satisfied them with bread from the sky.

verses.latin: Dirupit petram, et fluxerunt aquae: in deserto: et exierunt sicut flumina.
verses.english: He split the rock, and waters flowed: in the desert: and they went out like rivers.

verses.latin: Quia memor fuit verbi sancti sui: quod locutus est ad Abraham puerum suum.
verses.english: Because he remembered his holy word: which he spoke to Abraham his servant.

verses.latin: Et eduxit populum suum in exsultatione: et in laetitia electos suos.
verses.english: And he led out his people with exultation: and his chosen ones with joy.

verses.latin: Et dedit illis regiones gentium: et labores populorum possederunt:
verses.english: And he gave them the lands of the nations: and they possessed the labors of the peoples:

verses.latin: Ut custodiant justificationes ejus: et legem ejus requirant.
verses.english: That they might keep his ordinances: and seek his law.

verses.latin: Amen.
verses.english: Amen.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to God, because He is good, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Dicant qui redempti sunt a Domino, quos redemit de manu inimici,
verses.english: Let those who were saved by God declare it! He saved them from the hands of the enemy.

verses.latin: et de regionibus congregavit eos, a solis ortu et occasu, ab aquilone et mari.
verses.english: He gathered them from the ends of the earth, from the east and the west, the north and the sea.

verses.latin: Erraverunt in solitudine in via aquae: viam civitatis habitaculi non invenerunt.
verses.english: They wandered in the desert, lost, without a way to reach a city where they could be safe.

verses.latin: Esurientes et sitientes, anima eorum in ipsis defecit.
verses.english: They were hungry and thirsty, and their life nearly failed within them.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum eruit eos.
verses.english: But they cried out to God in their distress, and He saved them from their troubles.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in viam rectam, ut irent in civitatem habitationis.
verses.english: Then He led them on the right path, so that they could find the city where they could live.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus, et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum:
verses.english: Let them thank God for His mercy and for the wonders He does for all people:

verses.latin: quia satiavit animam inanem, et animam esurientem satiavit bonis.
verses.english: He satisfies the thirsty and the hungry.

verses.latin: Sedentes in tenebris et umbra mortis, vinctos in mendicitate et ferro.
verses.english: Some sat in darkness, bound in poverty and chains.

verses.latin: Quia exacerbaverunt eloquia Dei, et consilium Altissimi irritaverunt.
verses.english: They rejected God's word and rejected the plan of the Most High.

verses.latin: Et humiliatum est in laboribus cor eorum: infirmati sunt, nec fuit qui adjuvaret.
verses.english: Then their hearts were crushed by labor, they were weak, and there was no one to help them.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum liberavit eos.
verses.english: But they cried out to God in their distress, and He saved them from their troubles.

verses.latin: Et eduxit eos de tenebris, et umbra mortis: et confregit vincula eorum.
verses.english: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their chains.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus, et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum:
verses.english: Let them thank God for His mercy and for the wonders He does for all people:

verses.latin: quia contrivit portas aeris, et vectes ferreos confregit.
verses.english: He shattered the bronze gates, and broke the iron bars.

verses.latin: Suscepit eos de via iniquitatis eorum: propter injustitias enim suas humiliai sunt.
verses.english: Some were punished for their sinful ways, because of their iniquities.

verses.latin: Omnem escam abominata est anima eorum, et appropinquaverunt usque ad portas mortis.
verses.english: They abhorred all food, and came close to the gates of death.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum salvavit eos.
verses.english: But they cried out to God in their distress, and He saved them from their troubles.

verses.latin: Misit verbum suum, et sanavit eos: et eripuit eos de interitu eorum.
verses.english: He sent out His word and healed them, saving them from destruction.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus, et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum:
verses.english: Let them thank God for His mercy and for the wonders He does for all people:

verses.latin: et sacrificent sacrificium laudis, et enarrent opera ejus in exsultatione.
verses.english: Let them offer sacrifices of praise, and declare His works with joy.

verses.latin: Qui descendunt mare in navibus, facientes operationem in aquis multis,
verses.english: Some sail the sea in ships, doing business on the great waters,

verses.latin: ipsi viderunt opera Domini, et mirabilia ejus in profundo.
verses.english: They saw God's works, and His wonders in the deep.

verses.latin: Dixit, et stetit spiritus procellae, et exaltati sunt fluctus ejus.
verses.english: He commanded, and a stormy wind arose, lifting up the waves.

verses.latin: Ascendunt usque ad caelos, et descendunt usque ad abyssos: anima eorum in malis tabescebat.
verses.english: They were tossed up to the sky, and plunged down to the depths; their souls melted away in their troubles.

verses.latin: Turbati sunt, et moti sunt sicut ebrius: et omnis sapientia eorum devorata est.
verses.english: They reeled and staggered like a drunken man, and all their wisdom was consumed.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum eduxit eos.
verses.english: Then they cried out to God in their distress, and He brought them out of their troubles.

verses.latin: Et statuit tempestatem ejus in auram, et siluerunt fluctus ejus.
verses.english: He stilled the storm and caused the waves to cease.

verses.latin: Et laetati sunt quia siluerunt: et deduxit eos in portum voluntatis eorum.
verses.english: They rejoiced because it was calm, and He led them to the harbor they desired.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus, et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum:
verses.english: Let them thank God for His mercy and for the wonders He does for all people:

verses.latin: et exaltet eum in ecclesia plebis, et in cathedra seniorum laudent eum.
verses.english: Let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people, and praise Him in the council of the elders.

verses.latin: Posuit flumina in desertum: et exitus aquarum in sitim.
verses.english: He turned rivers into a desert and springs of water into thirst.

verses.latin: Terram fructiferam in salsuginem, a malitia eorum qui habitant in ea.
verses.english: He turned fertile land into a salt waste, because of the wickedness of those who live there.

verses.latin: Posuit desertum in stagnum aquarum, et terram sine aqua in exitus aquarum.
verses.english: He turned the desert into a pool of water, and a dry land into springs of water.

verses.latin: Et collocavit illic esurientes: et constituerunt civitatem habitationis.
verses.english: And there He let the hungry dwell, and they founded a city to live in.

verses.latin: Et seminaverunt agros, et plantaverunt vineas, et fecerunt fructum nativitatis.
verses.english: They sowed fields, planted vineyards, and reaped a fruitful harvest.

verses.latin: Et benedixit eis, et multiplicati sunt nimis: et jumenta eorum non minoravit.
verses.english: He blessed them and they multiplied greatly, and He did not decrease their livestock.

verses.latin: Et pauci facti sunt, et vexati sunt a tribulatione malorum et dolore.
verses.english: But then they were few, and oppressed by trouble and sorrow.

verses.latin: Effusa est contemptio super principes: et errare fecit eos in invia, et non in via.
verses.english: He poured contempt upon princes, and caused them to wander in a pathless waste.

verses.latin: Et adjutorio egebat pauper, et egebat inopia.
verses.english: But He lifted up the poor and needy out of their suffering.

verses.latin: Vidit justi, et laetati sunt: et omnes iniquitas opposuit os suum.
verses.english: The righteous saw and rejoiced, and all wickedness closed its mouth.

verses.latin: Quis sapiens et conservabit haec? et intelligeret misericordias Domini.
verses.english: Whoever is wise will consider these things, and will understand the goodness of God.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord, because He is good, His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Dicant qui redempti sunt a Domino, quos redemit de manu inimici,
verses.english: Let them say this, those who have been redeemed by the Lord, those whom He redeemed from the hand of the enemy,

verses.latin: et de regionibus congregavit eos, a solis ortu, et occasu, a septentrione, et mari.
verses.english: and gathered from every place on the earth, from the rising and setting of the sun, from the north and from the sea.

verses.latin: Erraverunt in solitudine in via aquae: viam civitatis habitaculi non invenerunt.
verses.english: They wandered in a desert, on the wrong paths. They didn't find any city to dwell in.

verses.latin: Esurientes et sitientes, anima eorum in ipsis defecit.
verses.english: They were hungry and thirsty, and they were faint from exhaustion.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum eripuit eos.
verses.english: Then they cried out to the Lord in their suffering, and He delivered them from their distress.

verses.latin: Et deduxit eos in viam rectam, ut irent in civitatem habitationis.
verses.english: He led them on the right path, so they could arrive in a city to live in.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus: et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum.
verses.english: Let them thank the Lord for His mercy, and for His wondrous works for the children of men.

verses.latin: Quia satiavit animam inanem, et animam esurientem satiavit bonis.
verses.english: Because He satisfied the empty soul, and filled the hungry soul with good things.

verses.latin: Sedentes in tenebris et umbra mortis, vinctos in mendicitate et ferro.
verses.english: Those who sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, bound in poverty and in chains,

verses.latin: Quia exacerbaverunt eloquia Dei, et consilium Altissimi irritaverunt.
verses.english: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and scorned the counsel of the Most High.

verses.latin: Et humiliatum est in laboribus cor eorum: infirmati sunt, nec fuit qui adjuvaret.
verses.english: He humbled their hearts through labor: they were weakened, and there was no one to help.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum salvavit eos.
verses.english: Then they cried out to the Lord in their suffering, and He saved them from their distress.

verses.latin: Et eduxit eos de tenebris et umbra mortis: et vincula eorum dirupit.
verses.english: He led them out of darkness and the shadow of death: and broke their chains.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus: et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum.
verses.english: Let them thank the Lord for His mercy, and His wondrous works for the children of men.

verses.latin: Quia contrivit portas aeris, et vectes ferreos confregit.
verses.english: Because He broke the gates of bronze, and shattered the iron bars.

verses.latin: Suscepit eos de via iniquitatis eorum: propter injustitias enim suas humilitati sunt.
verses.english: He took them from the way of their wickedness: for they were brought low because of their injustices.

verses.latin: Omnem cibum abominata est anima eorum: et appropinquaverunt usque ad portas mortis.
verses.english: Their soul abhorred every kind of food: and they drew near to the gates of death.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum liberavit eos.
verses.english: Then they cried out to the Lord in their suffering, and He delivered them from their distress.

verses.latin: Misit verbum suum, et sanavit eos: et eripuit eos de interitu eorum.
verses.english: He sent the Son to them, and healed them: and saved them from their destruction.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus: et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum.
verses.english: Let them thank the Lord for His mercy, and His wondrous works for the children of men.

verses.latin: Et sacrificent sacrificium laudis: et annuntient opera ejus in exsultatione.
verses.english: Let them sacrifice a sacrifice of praise: and declare His works with joy.

verses.latin: Qui descendunt mare in navibus, facientes negotiationem in aquis multis,
verses.english: Those who go down to the sea in ships, doing business in many waters,

verses.latin: ipsi viderunt opera Domini, et mirabilia ejus in profundo.
verses.english: They saw the works of the Lord, and His wonders in the deep.

verses.latin: Dixit, et stetit spiritus procellarum: et exaltati sunt fluctus ejus.
verses.english: He spoke, and the stormy wind stood still: and the waves of the sea rose up.

verses.latin: Ascendunt usque ad caelos, et descendunt usque ad abyssos: anima eorum in malis tabescebat.
verses.english: They ascended to the heavens, and descended to the depths: their soul melted away with trouble.

verses.latin: Turbati sunt, et moti sunt sicut ebrius: et omnis sapientia eorum devorata est.
verses.english: They were troubled, and moved like a drunken man: and all their wisdom was consumed.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt ad Dominum cum tribularentur: et de necessitatibus eorum eduxit eos.
verses.english: Then they cried out to the Lord in their suffering, and He brought them out of their distress.

verses.latin: Et statuit procellam ejus in auram: et siluerunt fluctus ejus.
verses.english: He established their storm into a breeze: and the waves were still.

verses.latin: Et laetati sunt quia siluerunt: et deduxit eos in portum voluntatis eorum.
verses.english: And they rejoiced that they were still: and He led them to the harbor they desired.

verses.latin: Confiteantur Domino misericordiae ejus: et mirabilia ejus filiis hominum.
verses.english: Let them thank the Lord for His mercy, and His wonders for the children of men.

verses.latin: Et exaltet eum in ecclesia plebis: et in cathedra seniorum laudet eum.
verses.english: And let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people: and praise Him in the chair of the elders.

verses.latin: Posuit flumina in desertum: et fontes aquarum in sitim.
verses.english: He turned the rivers into a desert: and the springs of water into thirst.

verses.latin: Terram fructiferam in salsuginem: a malitia eorum qui habitant in ea.
verses.english: He turned the fruitful land into a salt marsh: because of the wickedness of those who lived there.

verses.latin: Posuit desertum in stagna aquarum: et terram sine aqua in fontes aquarum.
verses.english: He turned the desert into pools of water: and the land without water into springs of water.

verses.latin: Et collocavit illic esurientes: et constituerunt civitatem habitationis.
verses.english: And He settled the hungry there: and they established a city to live in.

verses.latin: Et seminaverunt agros, et plantaverunt vineas: et fecerunt fructum nativitatis.
verses.english: And they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and produced fruits for their crops.

verses.latin: Et benedixit eis, et multiplicati sunt nimis: et jumenta eorum non minoravit.
verses.english: And He blessed them, and they multiplied greatly: and He did not diminish their livestock.

verses.latin: Et pauci facti sunt, et vexati sunt a tribulatione malorum, et dolore.
verses.english: Then they were reduced to a few, and they were afflicted by the tribulation of evils, and by sorrow.

verses.latin: Effusa est contemptio super principes: et errare fecit eos in invia, et non in via.
verses.english: Contempt was poured out on the leaders: and He caused them to wander in the pathless way, and not on the road.

verses.latin: Et adjutorio egit pauperem de paupertate: et posuit sicut oves familias.
verses.english: But He helped the poor from their poverty: and made their families like sheep.

verses.latin: Videbunt recti, et laetabuntur: et omnis iniquitas oppilabit os suum.
verses.english: The upright will see this, and they will rejoice: and all wickedness will shut its mouth.

verses.latin: Quis sapiens et custodiet haec? et intelliget misericordias Domini.
verses.english: Who is wise, and will observe these things? And will understand the mercies of the Lord.

verses.latin: Canticum David. Deus laudem meam ne taceas: quoniam os peccatoris, et os dolosi super me apertum est.
verses.english: A hymn of David. O God, keep singing my praises, and do not be silent: for the mouth of the sinner, and the mouth of the deceitful, is opened against me.

verses.latin: Locuti sunt adversum me lingua dolosa, et sermonibus odii circumdederunt me: et expugnaverunt me gratis.
verses.english: With a lying tongue, they spoke against me, and with words of hatred, they surrounded me: and they fought against me for nothing.

verses.latin: Pro eo ut me diligerent, detrahebant mihi: ego autem orabam.
verses.english: For their love of me, they slandered me: but I prayed.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt adversum me mala pro bonis, et odium pro dilectione mea.
verses.english: And they repaid me with evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verses.latin: Constitue super eum peccatorem, et diabolus stet a dextris ejus.
verses.english: Appoint a sinner against him, and let the devil stand at his right hand.

verses.latin: Cum judicatur, exeat damnatus: et oratio ejus fiat in peccatum.
verses.english: When he is judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

verses.latin: Fiant dies ejus pauci: et episcopatum ejus accipiat alter.
verses.english: Let his days be few: and let another receive his office.

verses.latin: Fiant filii ejus orphani, et uxor ejus vidua.
verses.english: Let his children be orphans, and his wife a widow.

verses.latin: Nutantes transferantur filii ejus, et mendicent: eiciantur de habitationibus suis.
verses.english: Let his sons be transferred, and beg: let them be cast out of their habitations.

verses.latin: Scrutetur fœnerator omnem substantiam ejus: et diripiant alieni labores ejus.
verses.english: Let the usurer search out all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labors.

verses.latin: Non sit ei adjutor: nec sit qui misereatur pupillis ejus.
verses.english: Let there be no one to help him: nor let there be anyone to pity his orphans.

verses.latin: Fiant nati ejus in interitum: in generatione una deleatur nomen ejus.
verses.english: Let his children be devoted to destruction: in one generation let his name be blotted out.

verses.latin: In memoria habeatur iniquitas patrum ejus in conspectu Domini: et peccatum matris ejus non deleatur.
verses.english: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.latin: Sint contra Dominum semper: et dispereat de terra memoria eorum.
verses.english: Let them be always against the Lord: and let the memory of them perish from the earth.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod non est recordatus facere misericordiam, sed persecutus est hominem inopem et mendicum, et compunxit usque ad mortem cor contriti.
verses.english: Because he did not remember to show mercy, but persecuted the poor man and the beggar, and broke the heart of the afflicted until death.

verses.latin: Et dilexit maledictionem, et veniet ei: et noluit benedictionem, et elongabitur ab eo.
verses.english: And he loved cursing, and it will come to him: and he did not want blessing, and it will be far from him.

verses.latin: Et induit maledictionem sicut vestimentum: et intravit sicut aqua in interiore ejus, et sicut oleum in ossibus ejus.
verses.english: And he put on cursing as a garment: and it entered like water into his inner self, and like oil into his bones.

verses.latin: Fiat ei sicut vestimentum quo operitur, et sicut zona qua praecingitur semper.
verses.english: May it be to him like the garment with which he is covered, and like the belt with which he is always girded.

verses.latin: Hoc opus eorum qui detrahunt mihi apud Dominum, et qui loquuntur mala adversus animam meam.
verses.english: This is the work of those who detract from me before the Lord, and who speak evil against my soul.

verses.latin: Et tu Domine Domine, fac mecum propter nomen tuum: quia suavis est misericordia tua.
verses.english: But you, O Lord, O Lord, deal with me for your name's sake: because your mercy is sweet.

verses.latin: Libera me, quia egenus et pauper ego sum: et cor meum conturbatum est in me.
verses.english: Deliver me, because I am needy and poor: and my heart is troubled within me.

verses.latin: Sicut umbra cum porrigitur, ablatus sum: et excussus sum sicut locustae.
verses.english: I have been taken away like a shadow when it is extended: and I have been shaken off like locusts.

verses.latin: Genua mea infirmata sunt a jejunio: et caro mea immutata est propter oleum.
verses.english: My knees have been weakened by fasting: and my flesh has been changed because of oil.

verses.latin: Et ego factus sum opprobrium illis: viderunt me, et moverunt capita sua.
verses.english: And I have become a reproach to them: they saw me, and shook their heads.

verses.latin: Adjuva me, Domine Deus meus: salvum me fac secundum misericordiam tuam.
verses.english: Help me, O Lord my God: save me according to your mercy.

verses.latin: Et sciant quia manus tua hæc: et tu Domine fecisti eam.
verses.english: And let them know that this is your hand: and you, O Lord, have done it.

verses.latin: Maledicent illi, et tu benedices: qui insurgunt in me confundantur: servus autem tuus lætabitur.
verses.english: Let them curse, but you bless: let those who rise up against me be confounded: but your servant will rejoice.

verses.latin: Induantur qui detrahunt mihi, pudorem: et operiantur sicut diploide confusione sua.
verses.english: Let those who detract from me be clothed with shame: and let them be covered as with a double cloak of their own confusion.

verses.latin: Confitebor Domino nimis in ore meo: et in medio multorum laudabo eum.
verses.english: I will give thanks greatly to the Lord with my mouth: and I will praise him in the midst of many.

verses.latin: Quia astitit a dextris pauperis: ut salvam faceret a persequentibus animam meam.
verses.english: Because he has stood at the right hand of the poor: to save my soul from those who persecute me.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis:
verses.english: A Psalm of David. The Lord said to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand.

verses.latin: Donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum.
verses.english: I will make your enemies into the footstool of your throne.”

verses.latin: Virgam virtutis tuae emittet Dominus de Sion: dominare in medio inimicorum tuorum.
verses.english: The Lord will send forth your royal scepter from Zion, and you will rule in the midst of your enemies.

verses.latin: Tecum principium in die virtutis tuae in splendoribus sanctorum: ex utero ante luciferum genui te.
verses.english: You are a priest forever, with all of your royal glory. You are radiant with divine holiness; You were born before the morning star.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus, et non pœnitebit eum: Tu es sacerdos in æternum secundum ordinem Melchisedech.
verses.english: The Lord has sworn an oath, and He will not change his mind, “You are a priest forever, just like Melchizedek.”

verses.latin: Dominus a dextris tuis: confregit in die iræ suæ reges.
verses.english: The Lord is at your right hand, crushing kings on the day of His wrath.

verses.latin: Judicabit in nationibus, implebit ruinas: conquassabit capita in terra multorum.
verses.english: He will pass judgment on the nations and He will bring an end to wickedness. He will shatter the heads of the wicked all over the earth.

verses.latin: De torrente in via bibet: propterea exaltabit caput.
verses.english: The Son drinks from the stream along the way; so He will raise up His head.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Dixit Dominus Domino meo: Sede a dextris meis,
verses.english: A Psalm of David. The Lord says to my Lord: “Sit at my right hand,

verses.latin: donec ponam inimicos tuos scabellum pedum tuorum.
verses.english: until I make your enemies a footstool for you.”

verses.latin: Virgam virtutis tuae emittet Dominus ex Sion: dominare in medio inimicorum tuorum.
verses.english: The Lord will send forth the scepter of your power from Zion: rule in the midst of your enemies.

verses.latin: Tecum principium in die virtutis tuae in splendoribus sanctorum: ex utero ante luciferum genui te.
verses.english: Yours is princely power on the day of your strength, with the splendor of holiness; from the womb, before the morning star, I have brought you forth.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus, et non paenitebit: Tu es sacerdos in aeternum secundum ordinem Melchisedech.
verses.english: The Lord has sworn an oath and will not change his mind: “You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.”

verses.latin: Dominus a dextris tuis: confregit in die irae suae reges.
verses.english: The Lord is at your right hand; he has broken kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.latin: Judicabit in nationibus, implebit ruinas: conquassabit capita in terra multorum.
verses.english: He will judge the nations, filling them with corpses; he will shatter heads over the wide earth.

verses.latin: De torrente in via bibet: propterea exaltabit caput.
verses.english: He will drink from the brook beside the way; therefore he will lift up his head.

verses.latin: Alleluja. Confitebor tibi, Domine, in toto corde meo: in consilio justorum, et congregatione.
verses.english: Praise the Lord! I will confess to You, Lord, with my whole heart; in the counsel of the just, and in the congregation.

verses.latin: Magna opera Domini: exquisita in omnes voluntates ejus.
verses.english: Great are the works of the Lord, sought after and desired by all those who love Him.

verses.latin: Confessio et magnificentia opus ejus: et justitia ejus manet in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: His work has confession and magnificence, and His justice remains unto the age of ages.

verses.latin: Memoriam fecit mirabilium suorum, misericors et miserator Dominus:
verses.english: He made a memory of his wonders; merciful and compassionate is the Lord.

verses.latin: escam dedit timentibus se.
verses.english: He has given food to those who fear Him;

verses.latin: Memor erit in saeculum testamenti sui: virtutem operum suorum annuntiabit populo suo,
verses.english: He will be mindful forever of His covenant; He will announce the power of his works to His people

verses.latin: ut det illis haereditatem gentium.
verses.english: so as to give them the inheritance of the gentiles.

verses.latin: Opera manuum ejus veritas et judicium: fidelia omnia mandata ejus,
verses.english: The works of His hands are truth and judgment; all His commandments are faithful,

verses.latin: confirmata in saeculum saeculi, facta in veritate et aequitate.
verses.english: established forever, made in truth and equity.

verses.latin: Redemptionem misit populo suo: mandavit in aeternum testamentum suum.
verses.english: He has sent redemption to His people, He has commanded His covenant forever.

verses.latin: Sanctum et terribile nomen ejus:
verses.english: Holy and terrible is His name;

verses.latin: initium sapientiae timor Domini: intellectus bonus omnibus facientibus eum: laudatio ejus manet in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. A good understanding for all those who do this; His praise remains forever.

verses.latin: Laudate pueri Dominum: laudate nomen Domini.
verses.english: Children, praise the Lord; praise the Lord’s name.

verses.latin: Sit nomen Domini benedictum, ex hoc nunc et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: May the name of the Lord be blessed, from now on and forever.

verses.latin: A solis ortu usque ad occasum, laudabile nomen Domini.
verses.english: From sunrise to sunset, praise the Lord’s praiseworthy name.

verses.latin: Excélsus super omnes gentes Dominus, super caelos gloria ejus.
verses.english: The Lord is high above all nations, and above the universe is His glory.

verses.latin: Quis sicut Dominus Deus noster, qui in altis habitat:
verses.english: Who is like the Lord our God, who dwells in the highest heavens:

verses.latin: Et humilia respicit in caelo et in terra?
verses.english: He looks down at the low and humble, in the sky and on the earth?

verses.latin: Súscitans a terra inopem, et de stércore erigens pauperem:
verses.english: He raises the poor from the ground and lifts the needy from the dirt:

verses.latin: Ut collocet eum cum principibus, cum principibus populi sui.
verses.english: So that he may place them with princes, the leaders of His people.

verses.latin: Qui habitare facit sterilem in domo, matrem filiorum laetantem.
verses.english: He causes the barren woman to dwell in a home with a joyful motherhood.

verses.latin: Laudate, pueri, Dominum: laudate nomen Domini.
verses.english: Praise God, you children! Praise the name of God!

verses.latin: Sit nomen Domini benedictum, ex hoc nunc et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: Praise the name of God forever!

verses.latin: A solis ortu usque ad occasum, laudabile nomen Domini.
verses.english: From sunrise to sunset, the name of God deserves praise.

verses.latin: Excélsus super omnes gentes Dóminus, super caelos glória ejus.
verses.english: God is above all nations; His glory extends above the skies.

verses.latin: Quis sicut Dóminus Deus noster, qui in altis habitat,
verses.english: Who can compare to God our Lord, who lives in Heaven,

verses.latin: et humilia réspicit in caelo et in terra?
verses.english: and looks down on both the highest heavens and on Earth?

verses.latin: Súscitans a terra inopem, et de stércore erigens pauperem:
verses.english: He raises the poor from the dust, and lifts the needy from the dung heap:

verses.latin: Ut collocet eum cum princíipibus, cum princíipibus pópuli sui.
verses.english: so that he may be with the princes, with the princes of His people.

verses.latin: Qui habitare facit stérilem in domo, matrem filiórum laetántem.
verses.english: He grants the barren woman a home, making her a joyful mother.

verses.latin: In exitu Israël de Aegypto, domus Jacob de populo barbaro:
verses.english: When Israel left Egypt, the family of Jacob left a foreign people:

verses.latin: facta est Judaea sanctificatio ejus, Israël potestas ejus.
verses.english: Judah became His sanctuary, and Israel became His authority.

verses.latin: Mare vidit, et fugit: Jordanis conversus est retrorsum.
verses.english: The sea saw, and fled; the Jordan turned back.

verses.latin: Montes exsultaverunt ut arietes, et colles sicut agni ovium.
verses.english: The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like lambs.

verses.latin: Quid est, mare, quod fugisti? et tu, Jordanis, quia conversus es retrorsum?
verses.english: Why, sea, did you flee? And you, Jordan, why did you turn back?

verses.latin: Montes, exultastis sicut arietes, et colles, sicut agni ovium?
verses.english: Mountains, did you skip like rams, and hills like lambs?

verses.latin: A facie Domini mota est terra, a facie Dei Jacob:
verses.english: The earth was shaken before the Lord, the God of Jacob.

verses.latin: qui convertit petram in stagna aquarum, et silicem in fontes aquarum.
verses.english: He turns the rock into pools of water, and the flint into fountains of water.

verses.latin: Non nobis, Domine, non nobis: sed nomini tuo da gloriam.
verses.english: Not to us, Lord, not to us, but give glory to Your name.

verses.latin: Super misericordia tua, et veritate tua.
verses.english: Because of Your mercy and Your truth.

verses.latin: Ne forte dicant gentes: Ubi est Deus eorum?
verses.english: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”

verses.latin: Deus autem noster in caelo: omnia quaecumque voluit, fecit.
verses.english: Our God is in the sky. He has done all that He willed.

verses.latin: Simulacra gentium argentum et aurum, opera manuum hominum.
verses.english: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of human hands.

verses.latin: Os habent, et non loquentur: oculos habent, et non videbunt.
verses.english: They have a mouth, and they will not speak; they have eyes, and they will not see.

verses.latin: Aures habent, et non audient: nares habent, et non odorabunt.
verses.english: They have ears, and they will not hear; they have nostrils, and they will not smell.

verses.latin: Manus habent, et non palpabunt: pedes habent, et non ambulabunt: non clamabunt in gutture suo.
verses.english: They have hands, and they will not feel; they have feet, and they will not walk; they will not make a sound with their throats.

verses.latin: Similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea: et omnes qui confidunt in eis.
verses.english: May those who make them become like them, and everyone who trusts in them.

verses.latin: Domus Israël speravit in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: The family of Israel has hoped in the Lord; He is their help and their protector.

verses.latin: Domus Aaron speravit in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: The house of Aaron has hoped in the Lord; He is their help and their protector.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, speraverunt in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord; He is their help and their protector.

verses.latin: Dominus memor fuit nostri: et benedicat nos:
verses.english: The Lord was mindful of us, and He has blessed us:

verses.latin: benedicat domui Israël: benedicat domui Aaron.
verses.english: May He bless the family of Israel, may He bless the house of Aaron.

verses.latin: Benedicat omnibus qui timent Dominum, pusillos cum majoribus.
verses.english: May He bless all those who fear the Lord, both small and great.

verses.latin: Adjiciat Dominus super vos: super vos, et super filios vestros.
verses.english: May the Lord increase His blessings on you, on you and your children.

verses.latin: Benedicti vos a Domino, qui fecit caelum et terram.
verses.english: May you be blessed by the Lord, who made the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Caelum caeli Domino: terram autem dedit filiis hominum.
