verses.english: The sky is the Lord's, but He gave the earth to the children of men.

verses.latin: Non mortui laudabunt te, Domine: neque omnes qui descendunt in infernum.
verses.english: The dead will not praise You, Lord, nor will those who go down to hell.

verses.latin: Sed nos qui vivimus, benedicimus Domino, ex hoc nunc et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: But we who live bless the Lord, from this time forth and forevermore.

verses.latin: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto.
verses.english: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper, et in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.

verses.latin: Non nobis, Domine, non nobis, sed nomini tuo da gloriam.
verses.english: Not to us, Lord—no, not to us—but to Your Name, give the glory.

verses.latin: Super misericordia tua, et veritate tua.
verses.english: Because of Your mercy and Your truth.

verses.latin: Ut quid dicent gentes: Ubi est Deus eorum?
verses.english: Why do the nations say: "Where is their God?"

verses.latin: Deus autem noster in caelo: omnia quaecumque voluit fecit.
verses.english: But our God is in the sky; He does whatever He wants to.

verses.latin: Simulacra gentium argentum et aurum, opera manuum hominum.
verses.english: The idols of the nations are silver and gold—the work of human hands.

verses.latin: Os habent, et non loquentur: oculos habent, et non videbunt.
verses.english: They have mouths, but they cannot speak. They have eyes, but they cannot see.

verses.latin: Aures habent, et non audient: nares habent, et non odorabunt.
verses.english: They have ears, but they cannot hear. They have noses, but they cannot smell.

verses.latin: Manus habent, et non palpabunt: pedes habent, et non ambulabunt: non clamabunt in gutture suo.
verses.english: They have hands, but they cannot feel. They have feet, but they cannot walk. They cannot cry out with their throats.

verses.latin: Similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea: et omnes qui confidunt in eis.
verses.english: May those who make them be like them, and may all who trust in them be like them.

verses.latin: Domus Israel speravit in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: The house of Israel has hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and protector.

verses.latin: Domus Aaron speravit in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: The house of Aaron has hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and protector.

verses.latin: Qui timent Dominum, speraverunt in Domino: adjutor eorum et protector eorum est.
verses.english: Those who fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord. He is their helper and protector.

verses.latin: Dominus memor fuit nostri: et benedicet nobis.
verses.english: The Lord has remembered us, and He will bless us.

verses.latin: Benedicet domui Israel: benedicet domui Aaron.
verses.english: He will bless the house of Israel. He will bless the house of Aaron.

verses.latin: Benedicet omnibus qui timent Dominum, pusillos cum majoribus.
verses.english: He will bless all who fear the Lord—the small and the great.

verses.latin: Adjiciat Dominus super vos: super vos et super filios vestros.
verses.english: May the Lord give you even more blessings—to you and your children.

verses.latin: Benedicti vos a Domino, qui fecit caelum et terram.
verses.english: May you be blessed by the Lord, who made the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Caelum caeli Domino: terram autem dedit filiis hominum.
verses.english: The highest heavens are the Lord's, but He gave the earth to the sons of men.

verses.latin: Non mortui laudabunt te, Domine: neque omnes qui descendunt in infernum.
verses.english: The dead will not praise You, Lord, nor will all those who descend into Hell.

verses.latin: Sed nos qui vivimus benedicimus Domino, ex hoc nunc et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: But we who live bless the Lord, now and forever.

verses.latin: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto.
verses.english: Glory to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper, et in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: As it was in the beginning, is now, and will be forever, world without end. Amen.

verses.latin: Dilexi, quoniam exaudiet Dominus vocem orationis meae.
verses.english: I love God because He hears the voice of my prayers.

verses.latin: Quia inclinavit aurem suam mihi: et in diebus meis invocabo.
verses.english: Because He has listened to me, I call upon Him all the days of my life.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt me dolores mortis: et pericula inferni invenerunt me.
verses.english: The terrors of death surrounded me. The dangers of the grave came upon me.

verses.latin: Tribulationem et dolorem inveni: et nomen Domini invocavi.
verses.english: I found myself in trouble and sorrow, so I called upon the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: O Domine, libera animam meam: misericors Dominus, et justus, et Deus noster miseretur.
verses.english: “Lord, deliver my soul!” For the Lord is merciful, just, and our God is full of mercy.

verses.latin: Custodiens parvulos Dominus: humiliatus sum, et liberavit me.
verses.english: The Lord protects the simple. I was humbled, and He saved me.

verses.latin: Convertere, anima mea, in requiem tuam: quia Dominus benefecit tibi.
verses.english: Return, my soul, to your rest, for the Lord has dealt graciously with you.

verses.latin: Quia eripuit animam meam de morte: oculos meos a lacrimis, pedes meos a lapsu.
verses.english: For He has delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

verses.latin: Placebo Domino in regione vivorum.
verses.english: I will walk before the Lord in the land of the living.

verses.latin: Credidi, propter quod locutus sum: ego autem humiliatus sum nimis.
verses.english: I believed, and so I spoke. I was greatly afflicted.

verses.latin: Ego dixi in excessu meo: Omnis homo mendax.
verses.english: I said in my confusion, “All men are liars.”

verses.latin: Quid retribuam Domino pro omnibus quae retribuit mihi?
verses.english: How can I repay the Lord for all that He has given to me?

verses.latin: Caliicem salutaris accipiam: et nomen Domini invocabo.
verses.english: I will take the chalice of salvation and call upon the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Vota mea Domino reddam coram omni populo ejus: pretiosa in conspectu Domini mors sanctorum ejus.
verses.english: I will pay my vows to the Lord in the presence of all His people. Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of His saints.

verses.latin: O Domine, quia ego servus tuus: ego servus tuus, et filius ancillae tuae.
verses.english: O Lord, I am Your servant. I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid.

verses.latin: Dirupisti vincula mea: tibi sacrificabo hostiam laudis, et nomen Domini invocabo.
verses.english: You have broken my bonds. I will offer a sacrifice of praise to You, and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Vota mea Domino reddam in conspectu omnis populi ejus: in atriis domus Domini, in medio tui, Jerusalem.
verses.english: I will pay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all His people, in the courts of the Lord's house, in your midst, O Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: O give thanks to the Lord, because He is good, and His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Dicat domus Israël: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let the house of Israel say, “His mercy endures forever.”

verses.latin: Dicat domus Aaron: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let the house of Aaron say, “His mercy endures forever.”

verses.latin: Dicant qui timent Dominum: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let those who fear the Lord say, “His mercy endures forever.”

verses.latin: De tribulatione clamavi ad Dominum: et exaudivit me in latitudine.
verses.english: In my anguish, I called to the Lord, and the Lord answered me, setting me free.

verses.latin: Dominus mihi adjutor: non timebo quid faciat mihi homo.
verses.english: The Lord is with me, therefore I will not fear what man can do to me.

verses.latin: Dominus mihi adjutor: et ego despiciam inimicos meos.
verses.english: The Lord is with me, and I shall look down on those who hate me.

verses.latin: Bonum est confidere in Domino, quam confidere in homine.
verses.english: It is better to trust in the Lord than to trust in men.

verses.latin: Bonum est sperare in Domino, quam sperare in principibus.
verses.english: It is better to hope in the Lord than to hope in princes.

verses.latin: Omnes gentes circuierunt me: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.
verses.english: All nations surrounded me, but in the name of the Lord I cut them off.

verses.latin: Circumdantes circumdederunt me: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.
verses.english: They surrounded me on all sides, but in the name of the Lord I cut them off.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt me sicut apes, et exarserunt sicut ignis in spinis: et in nomine Domini quia ultus sum in eos.
verses.english: They surrounded me like bees, and blazed like a fire among thorns, but in the name of the Lord I cut them off.

verses.latin: Impulsus eversus sum ut caderem: et Dominus suscepit me.
verses.english: I was driven and pushed back, so that I might fall, but the Lord took me up.

verses.latin: Fortitudo mea et laus mea Dominus: et factus est mihi in salutem.
verses.english: The Lord is my strength and my song, and He has become my salvation.

verses.latin: Dextera Domini fecit virtutem: dextera Domini exaltavit me.
verses.english: The right hand of the Lord does valiantly, the right hand of the Lord exalts me.

verses.latin: Non moriar, sed vivam: et narrabo opera Domini.
verses.english: I shall not die, but live, and I will declare the works of the Lord.

verses.latin: Castigans castigavit me Dominus: et morti non tradidit me.
verses.english: The Lord has chastised me and corrected me, but He has not given me over to death.

verses.latin: Aperite mihi portas justitiae, ingressus in eas confitebor Domino:
verses.english: Open to me the gates of righteousness, so that I may enter and give thanks to the Lord.

verses.latin: haec porta Domini: justi intrabunt in eam.
verses.english: This is the gate of the Lord; the righteous shall enter through it.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.
verses.english: I will give thanks to you because you have heard me, and you have become my salvation.

verses.latin: Lapis quem reprobaverunt aedificantes: hic factus est in caput anguli.
verses.english: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.

verses.latin: A Domino factum est istud: et est mirabile in oculis nostris.
verses.english: This is the Lord's doing; it is wonderful in our eyes.

verses.latin: Haec est dies quam fecit Dominus: exsultemus et laetemur in ea.
verses.english: This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.latin: O Domine, salvum me fac: o Domine, prosperum iter da.
verses.english: O Lord, save us, we beseech Thee; O Lord, give us success.

verses.latin: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini: benediximus vobis de domo Domini.
verses.english: Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord; we bless you from the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Deus Dominus, et illuxit nobis. Constituite diem sollemnem in condensis, usque ad cornuum altare.
verses.english: God is the Lord, and He has shone upon us. Bind the feast with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

verses.latin: Deus meus es tu, et confitebor tibi: Deus meus es tu, et exaltabo te.
verses.english: You are my God, and I will give thanks to you. You are my God, and I will extol you.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.
verses.english: I will give thanks to you because you have heard me, and you have become my salvation.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: O give thanks to the Lord, because He is good, and His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give praise to the Lord, because He is good. Yes, His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Dicat nunc Israel quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let Israel now proclaim, "God is good!" — because God's mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Dicat nunc domus Aaron: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let the house of Aaron say: “God's mercy endures forever.”

verses.latin: Dicant nunc qui timent Dominum: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Let those who fear God now say it: because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: De tribulatione invocavi Dominum: et exaudivit me in latitudine.
verses.english: In my trial, I called upon the Lord. And He heard me and rescued me.

verses.latin: Dominus mihi adjutor: non timebo quid faciat mihi homo.
verses.english: The Lord is my helper; I will not fear what any man can do to me.

verses.latin: Dominus mihi adjutor: et ego despiciam inimicos meos.
verses.english: The Lord helps me. So I will look down on my enemies.

verses.latin: Bonum est confidere in Domino, quam confidere in homine.
verses.english: It is good to trust in the Lord, rather than to trust in man.

verses.latin: Bonum est sperare in Domino, quam sperare in principibus.
verses.english: It is better to trust in God, than to trust in princes.

verses.latin: Omnes gentes circuierunt me, et in nomine Domini, quia ultus sum in eis.
verses.english: All nations surrounded me, but in the name of the Lord, I took vengeance on them.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt me, et circumdederunt me: et in nomine Domini, quia ultus sum in eis.
verses.english: They surrounded me. Yes, they surrounded me, but in the name of the Lord, I triumphed over them.

verses.latin: Circumdederunt me sicut apes, et exarserunt sicut ignis in spinis: et in nomine Domini, quia ultus sum in eis.
verses.english: They surrounded me like bees, and they burned against me like a fire in thorns: and in the name of the Lord, I turned against them.

verses.latin: Impulsus eversus sum ut caderem: et Dominus suscepit me.
verses.english: I was about to fall and be lost, but then God caught me and held me.

verses.latin: Fortitudo mea et laus mea Dominus: et factus est mihi in salutem.
verses.english: My strength and my praise is the Lord: and He became for me the salvation.

verses.latin: Dextera Domini fecit virtutem: dextera Domini exaltavit me: dextera Domini fecit virtutem.
verses.english: The Lord's right hand made strength: the Lord's right hand lifted me up: the Lord's right hand made strength.

verses.latin: Non moriar, sed vivam: et narrabo opera Domini.
verses.english: I will not die, but I will live; and I will tell of the works of the Lord.

verses.latin: Castigans castigavit me Dominus: et morti non tradidit me.
verses.english: God chastened me, but He did not hand me over to death.

verses.latin: Aperite mihi portas justitiae, ingressus in eas confitebor Domino.
verses.english: Open to me the gates of justice! As I enter, I will give thanks to the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec porta Domini: justi intrabunt in eam.
verses.english: This is the Lord's gate: only the just shall enter through it.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.
verses.english: I will offer you thanks because you have heard me. And you have become my salvation.

verses.latin: Lapis quem reprobaverunt aedificantes: hic factus est in caput anguli.
verses.english: The stone which the builders rejected— this has become the cornerstone.

verses.latin: A Domino factum est istud: et est mirabile in oculis nostris.
verses.english: This thing was made by the Lord. It is a wonder to behold, in our sight.

verses.latin: Haec est dies quam fecit Dominus: exultemus, et laetemur in ea.
verses.english: This is the day that the Lord has made: let us rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.latin: O Domine, salvum me fac: o Domine, prosperum iter fac.
verses.english: O Lord, save me, I pray! O Lord, make this day a success!

verses.latin: Benedictus qui venit in nomine Domini. Benediximus vobis de domo Domini.
verses.english: Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord. We bless you from the Lord's house.

verses.latin: Deus Dominus, et illuxit nobis. Constituite diem solemnem in condensis, usque ad cornu altaris.
verses.english: God the Lord has arrived, and He has shined forth upon us. Prepare the feast-day procession, with branches, all the way to the altar.

verses.latin: Deus meus es tu, et confitebor tibi: Deus meus es tu, et exaltabo te.
verses.english: You are my God, and I will praise You: You are my God, and I will exalt You.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi quoniam exaudisti me: et factus es mihi in salutem.
verses.english: I will give thanks to You because You have heard me, and You have become my salvation.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to God, because God is good, and God’s mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Beati immaculati in via: qui ambulant in lege Domini.
verses.english: Blessed are those with a pure heart: who walk according to the law of the Lord.

verses.latin: Beati qui scrutantur testimonia ejus: in toto corde exquirunt eum.
verses.english: Those who study God's testimony are blessed; with their whole heart, they seek Him.

verses.latin: Non enim qui operantur iniquitatem, in viis ejus ambulaverunt.
verses.english: The wicked do not travel in His paths.

verses.latin: Tu mandasti mandata tua custodiri nimis.
verses.english: You commanded that Your laws be guarded very carefully.

verses.latin: Utinam dirigantur viæ meæ ad custodiendas justificationes tuas!
verses.english: Oh, that my ways would be set straight, to guard your teachings!

verses.latin: Tunc non confundar, cum perspexero in omnibus mandatis tuis.
verses.english: I won't be ashamed when I understand all your commands.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi in directione cordis: in eo quod didici judicia justitiæ tuæ.
verses.english: I will give thanks to you with the direction of my heart: in that I have learned the judgments of your justice.

verses.latin: Justificationes tuas custodiam: ne derelinquas me usquequaque.
verses.english: I will keep your teachings: do not abandon me, ever and always.

verses.latin: In quo corrigit junior viam suam? In custodiendo sermones tuos.
verses.english: How does a young man correct his path? By keeping your instructions, by obeying what God teaches.

verses.latin: In toto corde meo exquisivi te: ne repellas me a mandatis tuis.
verses.english: With all my heart, I have sought you: do not let me turn away from your commands.

verses.latin: In corde meo abscondi eloquia tua: ut non peccem tibi.
verses.english: In my heart, I hid your words of truth, so that I might not sin against you.

verses.latin: Benedictus es, Domine: doce me justificationes tuas.
verses.english: You are blessed, Lord: teach me your judgments.

verses.latin: In labiis meis pronuntiavi omnia judicia oris tui.
verses.english: In my own lips, I have announced all your judgments, and I do not fear what awaits.

verses.latin: In via testimoniorum tuorum delectatus sum, sicut in omnibus divitiis.
verses.english: I find joy in the things you teach, like the joy one finds in vast riches.

verses.latin: In mandatis tuis exercebor: et considerabo vias tuas.
verses.english: I will focus on Your commandments, and I will consider Your ways.

verses.latin: In justificationibus tuis meditabor: non obliviscar sermones tuos.
verses.english: I will meditate on Your instructions: I will not forget Your sayings.

verses.latin: Retribue servo tuo: vivifica me, et custodiam sermones tuos.
verses.english: Help me, your servant. Give me life, and I will keep your words.

verses.latin: Revela oculos meos: et considerabo mirabilia de lege tua.
verses.english: Open my eyes so I may understand and consider the wonders of your law.

verses.latin: Incola ego sum in terra: non abscondas a me mandata tua.
verses.english: I am a sojourner on the land. Do not hide Your commandments from me.

verses.latin: Concupivit anima mea desiderare justificationes tuas in omni tempore.
verses.english: My soul desired to desire Your laws, in every era and season.

verses.latin: Increpasti superbos: maledicti qui declinant a mandatis tuis.
verses.english: You have rebuked the arrogant. Cursed are those who abandon your commandments.

verses.latin: Aufer a me opprobrium et contemptum: quia testimonia tua exquisivi.
verses.english: Take away from me all the shame and contempt: because I have sought after your testimonies.

verses.latin: Etenim sederunt principes, et adversum me loquebantur: servus autem tuus exercebatur in justificationibus tuis.
verses.english: The leaders sat and spoke against me, but your servant was occupied with your commandments.

verses.latin: Nam et testimonia tua meditatio mea est: et consilium meum justificationes tuæ.
verses.english: For your divine decrees are my meditation, and I find joy in your commandments, which are a sign of God’s justice.

verses.latin: Adhaesit pavimento anima mea: vivifica me secundum verbum tuum.
verses.english: My soul adheres to the dust: give me life according to your word.

verses.latin: Vias meas enarravi, et exaudisti me: doce me justificationes tuas.
verses.english: I have recounted my ways to you, and you have answered me: teach me how to live according to your will.

verses.latin: Viam justificationum tuarum instrue me: et exercebor in mirabilibus tuis.
verses.english: Make me understand how your rules are right, and I will keep them and think about your wonders.

verses.latin: Dormitavit anima mea præ tædio: confirma me in verbis tuis.
verses.english: My soul is in deep distress: strengthen me in your words.

verses.latin: Viam iniquitatis amove a me: et de lege tua miserere mei.
verses.english: Remove the path of wickedness from me, and have mercy on me according to Your law.

verses.latin: Viam veritatis elegi: judicia tua non sum oblitus.
verses.english: I have chosen the way of truth; I haven’t forgotten Your teachings.

verses.latin: Adhæsi testimoniis tuis, Domine: noli me confundere.
verses.english: I have adhered to Your testimonies, Lord. Don't ever let me be ashamed.

verses.latin: Viam mandatorum tuorum cucurri, cum dilatasti cor meum.
verses.english: I ran the path of Your commandments, when You expanded my heart.

verses.latin: Legem pone mihi, Domine, viam justificationum tuarum: et exquiram eam semper.
verses.english: Show me, Lord, the path of Your commandments. I will seek it always.

verses.latin: Da mihi intellectum, et scrutabor legem tuam: et custodiam illam in toto corde meo.
verses.english: Give to me the ability to understand Your law, and I will search it: and I will keep it in my whole heart.

verses.latin: Deduc me in semitam mandatorum tuorum: quia hanc volui.
verses.english: Show me the path of your commandments, because this path I have chosen.

verses.latin: Inclina cor meum in testimonia tua: et non in avaritiam.
verses.english: Turn my heart to Your testimonies, and not to greed.

verses.latin: Averte oculos meos ne videant vanitatem: in via tua vivifica me.
verses.english: Keep my eyes from seeing vanity: give me life through Your law.

verses.latin: Statue servo tuo eloquium tuum in timore tuo.
verses.english: Fulfill your promise to me. Make me honor you, because I am your servant.

verses.latin: Aufer opprobrium meum quod suspicatus sum: quia judicia tua jucunda.
verses.english: Remove my shame, which I have suspected of myself: because your judgments are pleasant.

verses.latin: Ecce concupivi mandata tua: in æquitate tua vivifica me.
verses.english: See, I've desired Your commands. Grant me life through Your justice.

verses.latin: Et veniat super me misericordia tua, Domine: salutare tuum secundum eloquium tuum.
verses.english: Let Your mercy come upon me, Lord. Grant me salvation, as You have promised.

verses.latin: Et respondebo exprobrantibus mihi verbum: quia speravi in verbis tuis.
verses.english: And I will respond to those who insult me because I trust in Your words.

verses.latin: Et ne auferas de ore meo verbum veritatis usquequaque: quia in judiciis tuis speravi.
verses.english: And never remove the truth from my mouth forever, because I have put my hope in Your judgments.

verses.latin: Et custodiam legem tuam semper: in sæculum et in sæculum sæculi.
verses.english: And I will always keep Your law: for all of time, and for all of time to come.

verses.latin: Et ambulabam in latitudine: quia mandata tua exquisivi.
verses.english: I traveled in a wide-open place because I sought out Your commands.

verses.latin: Et loquebar in testimoniis tuis in conspectu regum: et non confundebar.
verses.english: I spoke of your testimonies in front of kings, and I wasn't ashamed.

verses.latin: Et meditabar in mandatis tuis, quæ dilexi.
verses.english: And I continued to think about Your commandments, which I love.

verses.latin: Et levavi manus meas ad mandata tua quæ dilexi: et exercebar in justificationibus tuis.
verses.english: And I lifted up my hands toward Your commands, which I love, and I have meditated on Your righteous rulings.

verses.latin: Memor esto verbi tui servo tuo, in quo mihi spem dedisti.
verses.english: Remember what you promised, as a servant to you—the one in whom you gave me hope.

verses.latin: Hæc me consolata est in humilitate mea: quia eloquium tuum vivificavit me.
verses.english: This is my comfort, from my lowly state: for your word brought me back to life.

verses.latin: Superbi inique agebant usquequaque: a lege autem tua non declinavi.
verses.english: Arrogant people were behaving wickedly everywhere; but I didn't stop following your law.

verses.latin: Memor fui judiciorum tuorum a sæculo, Domine: et consolatus sum.
verses.english: I have remembered Your judgments from of old, Lord, and have been comforted.

verses.latin: Defectio tenuit me pro peccatoribus, derelinquentibus legem tuam.
verses.english: My own being was seized by fear for sinners, those who abandon your law.

verses.latin: Cantabiles mihi erant justificationes tuæ in loco peregrinationis meæ.
verses.english: Your decrees have been the subject of my songs, and they were so wonderful to me, during my time of wandering.

verses.latin: Memor fui nocte nominis tui, Domine: et custodivi legem tuam.
verses.english:
I remembered Your name in the darkness, O Lord;
and I kept Your law.

verses.latin: Hæc facta est mihi: quia justificationes tuas exquisivi.
verses.english: This will be my lot; for I have searched for your directives.

verses.latin: Portio mea, Domine, dixi custodire legem tuam.
verses.english: My portion, O Lord, I have resolved to keep Your law.

verses.latin: Deprecatus sum faciem tuam in toto corde meo: miserere mei secundum eloquium tuum.
verses.english: I have pleaded with you with all my heart, God; show mercy to me according to your promise.

verses.latin: Cogitavi vias meas: et converti pedes meos in testimonia tua.
verses.english:
I thought about my ways,
and I turned my feet to your testimonies.

verses.latin: Paratus sum, et non sum turbatus: ut custodiam mandata tua.
verses.english: I am ready, and I am not hesitant to keep your commands.

verses.latin: Funes peccatorum circumplecterunt me: et legem tuam non sum oblitus.
verses.english: The ropes of sin ensnared me; but I have not forgotten your law.

verses.latin: Media nocte surgebam ad confitendum tibi, super judicia justificationis tuæ.
verses.english: In the middle of the night, I would rise to give thanks to you, because of the just decisions that come from you.

verses.latin: Particeps ego sum omnium timentium te: et custodientium mandata tua.
verses.english:
I am a companion to all who hold you in awe,
and to those who faithfully keep Your commandments.

verses.latin: Misericordia tua, Domine, plena est terra: justificationes tuas doce me.
verses.english: Your mercy, O Lord, fills the entire earth. Teach me Your commands.

verses.latin: Bonitatem fecisti cum servo tuo, Domine, secundum verbum tuum.
verses.english: You have been good to your servant, O Lord, according to your word.

verses.latin: Bonitatem et disciplinam et scientiam doce me: quia mandatis tuis credidi.
verses.english: Teach me your goodness, Your instruction, and Your knowledge, because I have believed in Your commands.

verses.latin: Priusquam humiliarer, ego deliqui: propterea eloquium tuum custodivi.
verses.english: Before I was humbled, I made a mistake: and because of that, I have kept Your teaching.

verses.latin: Bonus es tu: et in bonitate tua doce me justificationes tuas.
verses.english: You are good, O Lord, and in Your goodness, teach me Your ways.

verses.latin: Multiplicata est super me iniquitas superborum: ego autem in toto corde meo scrutabor mandata tua.
verses.english: The arrogance of the proud has caused many afflictions to me; but I will still search for your commandments with all my heart.

verses.latin: Coagulatum est sicut lac cor eorum: ego vero legem tuam meditatus sum.
verses.english: Their heart has become thick, like curdled milk. But I have always focused on your divine instruction.

verses.latin: Bonum mihi quod humiliasti me: ut discam justificationes tuas.
verses.english: It was good for me that you humbled me, so that I might learn your statutes.

verses.latin: Bonum mihi lex oris tui: super millia auri et argenti.
verses.english: It is good for me that Your Law has been established, more valuable to me than thousands of gold and silver coins.

verses.latin: Manus tuæ fecerunt me, et plasmaverunt me: da mihi intellectum, et discam mandata tua.
verses.english:
Your hands made me, and formed me with care.
Grant me understanding, and I will learn your commands.

verses.latin: Qui timent te videbunt me, et lætabuntur: quia in verbis tuis speravi.
verses.english: Those who fear you, Lord, will see me and will rejoice, because I have placed my hope in your words.

verses.latin: Cognovi, Domine, quia æquitas judicia tua: et in veritate humiliasti me.
verses.english: I know, Lord, that your judgments are right; and in your faithfulness you have humbled me.

verses.latin: Fiat misericordia tua ut consolatio mea: secundum eloquium tuum servo tuo.
verses.english: Let Your mercy be my comfort, as You promised Your servant.

verses.latin: Veniant mihi misericordiæ tuæ, et vivam: quia lex tua meditatio mea est.
verses.english: Let Your mercy come to me, so that I may live; because Your law is my constant meditation.

verses.latin: Confundantur superbi, quia injuste iniquitatem fecerunt in me: ego autem exercebor in mandatis tuis.
verses.english: Let the proud be put to shame; they have done injustice and acted wickedly against me. But I will continue to meditate on your commands.

verses.latin: Convertantur mihi timentes te: et qui sciunt testimonia tua.
verses.english:
Let those who fear you and know your teachings turn to me.

May those who reverence God by living according to His revealed will turn their attention to me.

verses.latin: Fiat cor meum immaculatum in justificationibus tuis: ut non confundar.
verses.english: May my heart be sound in your ways, so that I will not be ashamed.

verses.latin: Defecit in salutare tuum anima mea: et in verbum tuum speravi.
verses.english: My soul grew weak awaiting your salvation; but I put my hope in your word.

verses.latin: Defecerunt oculi mei in eloquium tuum, dicentes: Quando consolaberis me?
verses.english: My eyes grew tired from waiting for your promise, as I kept asking, "When will you bring me comfort?"

verses.latin: Quia factus sum sicut uter in pruina: justificationes tuas non sum oblitus.
verses.english:
Because I have become like a wineskin in the frost;
I have not forgotten your statutes.

verses.latin: Quot sunt dies servi tui? Quando facies de persequentibus me judicium?
verses.english: How many days are left for your servant? When will you bring justice against those who are persecuting me?

verses.latin: Narrationes impiorum exterminaverunt me: sed non ut lex tua.
verses.english: The enemies of God’s law have tried to destroy me with their wicked teachings; but I will not turn away from your law.

verses.latin: Omnia mandata tua veritas: inique persecuti sunt me: adiuva me.
verses.english: All of your commands are truth. They have pursued me unjustly; help me.

verses.latin: Paulominus consummaverunt me in terra: ego autem non dereliqui mandata tua.
verses.english: They tried to destroy me completely on earth; but I did not turn away from Your commands.

verses.latin: Secundum misericordiam tuam vivifica me: et custodiam testimonia oris tui.
verses.english: Because of your steadfast love, keep me alive: and I will obey the teachings that come from your mouth.

verses.latin: In æternum, Domine, verbum tuum permanet in cælo.
verses.english: Eternally, O Lord, your Word remains in the sky.

verses.latin: In generationem et generationem veritas tua: fundasti terram, et permanet.
verses.english:
Through all generations your faithfulness endures.
Your truth is established forever; you founded the land, and it remains.

verses.latin: Ordinatone tua permanet dies: quoniam omnia serviunt tibi.
verses.english: By your decree the days continue, because all things are in your service.

verses.latin: Nisi quod lex tua meditatio mea est: tunc forte periissem in humilitate mea.
verses.english:
Had not your Law been my constant meditation,
I would have perished long ago from my humiliations.

verses.latin: In æternum non obliviscar justificationes tuas: quia in ipsis vivificasti me.
verses.english: I will never forget your clear instructions, because through them you have given me new life.

verses.latin: Tuus sum ego, salvum me fac: quoniam justificationes tuas exquisivi.
verses.english: I belong to you and you alone, so please rescue me, for I have searched for your divine judgments.

verses.latin: Me expectaverunt peccatores ut perderent me: testimonia tua intellexi.
verses.english: Sinners were waiting to ambush me and destroy me; I am understanding your testimonies.

verses.latin: Omnis consummationis vidi finem: latum mandatum tuum nimis.
verses.english: I have seen the end of all things; your commandment is exceedingly broad.

verses.latin: Quomodo dilexi legem tuam, Domine? tota die meditatio mea est.
verses.english: How I loved your law, O Lord! It is my constant meditation all the day long.

verses.latin: Super inimicos meos prudentem me fecisti mandatum tuum: quia in æternum mihi est.
verses.english: Your commandment has made me wiser than my enemies because it is with me forever.

verses.latin: Super omnes doctores meos intellexi: quia testimonia tua meditatio mea est.
verses.english:
I understood more than all my teachers,
because your testimonies are my constant meditation.

verses.latin: Super senes intellexi: quia mandata tua quæsivi.
verses.english: From my understanding, I've learned more than from all the teachers, because I have always sought to obey your instructions.

verses.latin: Ab omni via mala prohibui pedes meos: ut custodiam verba tua.
verses.english: I have kept my feet from every evil path, so that I may obey your teachings.

verses.latin: A judiciis tuis non declinavi: quia tu legem posuisti mihi.
verses.english: I have not strayed from your decrees: because you have established the law for me.

verses.latin: Quam dulcia faucibus meis eloquia tua: super mel ori meo.
verses.english:
How sweet your words are to my mouth,
sweeter than honey to my lips.

verses.latin: A mandatis tuis intellexi: propterea odivi omnem viam iniquitatis.
verses.english: From your commands I have gained understanding; therefore I hate every path of wickedness.

verses.latin: Lucerna pedibus meis verbum tuum: et lux semitis meis.
verses.english:
Your Word is like a lamp for my feet,
and a light for my path.

verses.latin: Juravi, et statui custodire judicia justitiæ tuæ.
verses.english: I have sworn, and I will carry out my vow, to observe the righteous judgments of your law.

verses.latin: Humiliatus sum usquequaque, Domine: vivifica me secundum verbum tuum.
verses.english:
I have been brought low in every way, O Lord;
strengthen me and give me life according to Your promises.

verses.latin: Voluntaria oris mei beneplacita fac, Domine: et judicia tua doce me.
verses.english: Make my offerings from my mouth pleasing, Lord, and teach me your judgments.

verses.latin: Anima mea in manibus meis semper: et legem tuam non sum oblitus.
verses.english: My soul is constantly in my hands, and I have not forgotten your law.

verses.latin: Posuerunt peccatores laqueum mihi: et de mandatis tuis non erravi.
verses.english: Trouble-makers have set a trap for me, but I have not strayed from your instructions.

verses.latin: Hæreditate acquisivi testimonia tua in æternum: quia exultatio cordis mei sunt.
verses.english: I have made your testimonies my lifelong inheritance, because they are the joy of my heart.

verses.latin: Inclinavi cor meum ad faciendas justificationes tuas in æternum, propter retributionem.
verses.english: I have set my heart to do Your statutes forever, because of the reward.

verses.latin: Iniquos odio habui: et legem tuam dilexi.
verses.english: I hated those who were wicked, and I loved your Law.

verses.latin: Adjutor et susceptor meus es tu: et in verbum tuum speravi.
verses.english: You are my shield and my protector. I have placed all my hope in your word.

verses.latin: Declinate a me, maligni: et scrutabor mandata Dei mei.
verses.english: Turn away from me, you wicked people; I will obey the commands of my God.

verses.latin: Suscipe me secundum eloquium tuum, et vivam: et non confundas me ab expectatione mea.
verses.english: Uphold me according to your promise, and I will live, and do not let me be disappointed in my hopes.

verses.latin: Adjuva me, et salvus ero: et meditabor in justificationibus tuis semper.
verses.english:
Help me, and I will be saved.
And I will meditate on Your eternal decrees forever.

verses.latin: Sprevisti omnes discedentes a judiciis tuis: quoniam injusta cogitatio eorum.
verses.english: You have rejected everyone who abandons your laws. Their thoughts are wrong, and so they must be set aside.

verses.latin: Prævaricantes reputavi omnes peccatores terræ: ideo dilexi testimonia tua.
verses.english: I consider all the godless people on earth to be traitors, and for that reason I love your testimonies.

verses.latin: Confige timore tuo carnes meas: a judiciis enim tuis timui.
verses.english: My flesh is pierced with Your fear; for I am in awe of Your judgments.

verses.latin: Feci judicium et justitiam: non tradas me calumniantibus me.
verses.english: I have done what is right and just. Do not hand me over to those who oppress me.

verses.latin: Suscipe servum tuum in bonum: non calumnientur me superbi.
verses.english: Receive your servant for his benefit; may the proud not slander me.

verses.latin: Oculi mei defecerunt in salutare tuum: et in eloquium justitiæ tuæ.
verses.english: My eyes have grown weary, longing for your salvation; and for your promise of righteousness.

verses.latin: Fac cum servo tuo secundum misericordiam tuam: et justificationes tuas doce me.
verses.english:
Deal with me, Your servant, according to Your mercy,
and teach me Your commandments.

verses.latin: Servus tuus sum ego: da mihi intellectum, ut sciam testimonia tua.
verses.english: I am your servant: grant me understanding, that I may know your decrees.

verses.latin: Tempus faciendi, Domine: dissipaverunt legem tuam.
verses.english:
It is time to act, O Lord,
because they have disregarded Your law.

verses.latin: Propterea dilexi mandata tua super aurum et topazion.
verses.english: I have loved your commandments more than gold and precious stones.

verses.latin: Propterea in omnia mandata tua dirigebar: omnem viam iniquam odio habui.
verses.english: Because of this, I keep my life aligned with all your commandments; I have hated every path of wickedness.

verses.latin: Mirabilia testimonia tua: ideo scrutata est ea anima mea.
verses.english: Your testimonies are amazing; therefore my soul has searched them out.

verses.latin: Declaratio sermonum tuorum illuminat: et intellectum dat parvulis.
verses.english:
The declaration of your words brings illumination
and gives understanding to the simple.

verses.latin: Os meum aperui, et attraxi spiritum: quia mandata tua desiderabam.
verses.english: I opened my mouth, and I drew in your Spirit, because I longed for your commands.

verses.latin: Aspice in me, et miserere mei: secundum judicium diligentium nomen tuum.
verses.english: Look upon me, and have mercy: according to the divine plan for those who love Your name.

verses.latin: Gressus meos dirige secundum eloquium tuum: et non dominetur mei omnis injustitia.
verses.english:
Direct my steps according to Your Word,
and do not let any injustice rule over me.

verses.latin: Redime me a calumniis hominum: et custodiam mandata tua.
verses.english: Redeem me from the slanders of men; and I will keep Your commandments.

verses.latin: Faciem tuam illumina super servum tuum: et doce me justificationes tuas.
verses.english: Let Your face shine upon Your servant; and teach me Your judgments.

verses.latin: Exitus aquarum deduxerunt oculi mei: quia non custodierunt legem tuam.
verses.english: My eyes have streamed water; because they did not keep your law.

verses.latin: Justus es, Domine: et rectum judicium tuum.
verses.english: You are just, O Lord, and your judgment is righteous.

verses.latin: Mandasti justitiam testimonia tua: et veritatem tuam nimis.
verses.english: You commanded justice, and your truth and promises, which are everlasting, guiding me always.

verses.latin: Con-sumpsit me zelus meus: quia obliti sunt verba tua inimici mei.
verses.english: My fervent devotion consumes me, for my enemies have forgotten your words.

verses.latin: Ignitum eloquium tuum vehementer: et servus tuus dilexit illud.
verses.english: Your promise is like pure gold, incredibly valuable and refined by fire: and I, your servant, love it.

verses.latin: Adolescentulus ego sum et contemptus: justificationes tuas non sum oblitus.
verses.english: I am still young and unrespected; however, I have never forgotten Your commands.

verses.latin: Justitia tua, justitia in æternum: et lex tua veritas.
verses.english: Your justice, O Lord, is eternal justice: and your law is truth.

verses.latin: Tribulatio et angustia invenerunt me: mandata tua meditatio mea.
verses.english: Trouble and distress have found me. Your commandments are my constant meditation.

verses.latin: Æquitas testimonia tua in æternum: da mihi intellectum, et vivam.
verses.english: Your testimony is always righteous; grant me understanding, and I will live.

verses.latin: Clamavi in toto corde meo, exaudi me, Domine: justificationes tuas requiram.
verses.english: I cried out with my whole heart. Answer me, O Lord; I will seek Your righteous decrees.

verses.latin: Clamavi ad te, salvum me fac: ut custodiam mandata tua.
verses.english: I cried out to you, "Save me!" so that I may keep your commandments.

verses.latin: Præveni in maturitate, et clamavi: quia in verbis tuis speravi.
verses.english: I was up before dawn, and I cried out to you; I put my hope in your promises.

verses.latin: Prævenerunt oculi mei ad te diluculo: ut meditarer eloquia tua.
verses.english: My eyes saw you before the morning light began to travel; I wanted to meditate on your words.

verses.latin: Vocem meam audi secundum misericordiam tuam, Domine: et secundum judicium tuum vivifica me.
verses.english: Hear my voice according to Your mercy, O Lord; give me life according to Your judgment.

verses.latin: Appropinquaverunt persequentes me iniquitati: a lege autem tua longe facti sunt.
verses.english:
Those who pursue me with evil have come close.
But they have turned away from your law.

verses.latin: Prope es tu, Domine: et omnes viæ tuæ veritas.
verses.english:
You are near, O Lord,
and all Your ways are faithfulness.

verses.latin: Initio cognovi de testimoniis tuis: quia in æternum fundasti ea.
verses.english:
I knew from the very beginning about your instructions:
because you established them eternally.

verses.latin: Vide humilitatem meam, et eripe me: quia legem tuam non sum oblitus.
verses.english: Look at my suffering, and save me. I haven't forgotten Your teachings.

verses.latin: Judica causam meam, et libera me: propter eloquium tuum vivifica me.
verses.english: Judge my cause, and deliver me: give me life according to your promise.

verses.latin: Longe a peccatoribus salus: quia justificationes tuas non exquiserunt.
verses.english: Salvation is far from sinners: because they have not sought out your teachings.

verses.latin: Misericordiæ tuæ multæ, Domine: secundum judicium tuum vivifica me.
verses.english: Your many mercies, Lord: give me life according to Your judgment.

verses.latin: Multi qui persequuntur me, et tribulant me: a testimoniis tuis non declinavi.
verses.english: Many who were pursuing me, and troubling me, yet from your instructions I did not turn aside.

verses.latin: Vidi prævaricantes, et tabescere: quia mandata tua non custodierunt.
verses.english: I saw the people who strayed from God's path, and they were wasting away: because they did not keep your commands.

verses.latin: Vide quoniam mandata tua dilexi, Domine: in misericordia tua vivifica me.
verses.english:
I am keenly aware of how much I have loved your commands, Lord;
by your mercy, bring me back to life and give me strength.

verses.latin: Principium verborum tuorum veritas: in æternum omnia judicia justitiæ tuæ.
verses.english: The beginning of Your words is truth; all the eternal judgments of Your justice.

verses.latin: Principes persecuti sunt me gratis: et a verbis tuis formidavit cor meum.
verses.english: Princes have persecuted me for nothing. My heart has been afraid of your words.

verses.latin: Lætabor ego super eloquia tua: sicut qui invenit spolia multa.
verses.english: I will rejoice over your teachings; it is like finding much plunder.

verses.latin: Iniquitatem odio habui, et abominatus sum: legem autem tuam dilexi.
verses.english: I have hated falsehood, and I detest it; but Your Law I have loved.

verses.latin: Septies in die laudem dixi tibi, super judicia justitiæ tuæ.
verses.english: Seven times a day I have given praise to you, for your righteous judgments.

verses.latin: Pax multa diligentibus legem tuam: et non est illis scandalum.
verses.english: There is great peace for those who love your law; and nothing causes them to stumble.

verses.latin: Speravi in salutare tuum, Domine: et mandata tua dilexi.
verses.english: I have trusted in Your salvation, O Lord; and I have loved Your commandments.

verses.latin: Custodivit anima mea testimonia tua: et dilexit ea vehementer.
verses.english: My soul kept Your testimonies; and I loved them vehemently.

verses.latin: Servavi mandata tua et testimonia tua: quia omnes viæ meæ in conspectu tuo.
verses.english: I have kept your commands and your testimony: for all my ways are visible before you.

verses.latin: Appropinquet deprecatio mea in conspectu tuo, Domine: intellectum da mihi secundum eloquium tuum.
verses.english: May my prayer come to You, O Lord, according to Your Word. Give me understanding so I can know Your law.

verses.latin: Intret postulatio mea in conspectu tuo: secundum eloquium tuum libera me.
verses.english: Let my prayer enter into God's presence; O Lord, set me free according to Your decree.

verses.latin: Eructabunt labia mea hymnum, cum docueris me justificationes tuas.
verses.english: My lips will overflow with singing Your praises, when You teach me Your divine commands.

verses.latin: Pronuntiabit lingua mea eloquium tuum: quia omnia mandata tua æquitas.
verses.english: My tongue will declare Your decrees: for all Your commands are just.

verses.latin: Fiat manus tua ut salvet me: quoniam mandata tua elegi.
verses.english: May your hand be near to save me, because I have chosen your commands.

verses.latin: Concupivi salutare tuum, Domine: et lex tua meditatio mea est.
verses.english: I have longed for Your salvation, O Lord; and Your law is my meditation.

verses.latin: Vivet anima mea et laudabit te: et judicia tua adjuvabunt me.
verses.english:
My very life and soul will live on. My life will be sustained, and it will praise you.
Your just decrees are my support.

verses.latin: Erravi, sicut ovis quæ periit: quære servum tuum, quia mandata tua non sum oblitus.
verses.english: I have strayed, like a lost sheep; seek out your servant, for I have not forgotten your commandments.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Ad Dominum cum tribularer clamavi, et exaudivit me.
verses.english: A song of ascents. I cried out to the Lord when I was afflicted, and He heard me.

verses.latin: Domine, libera animam meam a labiis iniquis, et a lingua dolosa.
verses.english: O Lord, deliver my soul from wicked lips, and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.latin: Quid detur tibi, aut quid apponatur tibi, ad linguam dolosam?
verses.english: What will be given to you, or what will be added to you, for a deceitful tongue?

verses.latin: Sagittae potentis acutae, cum carbonibus desolatoriis.
verses.english: Sharp arrows of the powerful, with coals of the deserts.

verses.latin: Heu mihi, quia incolatus meus prolongatus est! habitavi cum habitantibus Cedar;
verses.english: Woe is me, because my sojourning has been prolonged! I have dwelt with the inhabitants of Cedar;

verses.latin: multum incola fuit anima mea.
verses.english: My soul has been a long time a sojourner.

verses.latin: Cum his, qui oderunt pacem, eram pacificus: cum loquebar illis, impugnabant me.
verses.english: I was peaceful with those who hated peace: when I spoke to them, they attacked me.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Levavi oculos meos in montes, unde veniet auxilium mihi.
verses.english: A song of ascents. I raised my eyes to the mountains, from where will my help come to me?

verses.latin: Auxilium meum a Domino, qui fecit caelum et terram.
verses.english: My help comes from the Lord, Who created the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Non det in commotionem pedem tuum, neque dormitet qui custodit te.
verses.english: He will not let your foot slip, nor will the one who watches over you slumber.

verses.latin: Ecce, non dormitabit neque dormiet qui custodit Israel.
verses.english: Behold, He does not slumber or sleep, the one who watches over Israel.

verses.latin: Dominus custodit te; Dominus protectio tua super manum dexteram tuam.
verses.english: The Lord watches over you; the Lord is your protection, at your right hand.

verses.latin: Per diem sol non uret te, neque luna per noctem.
verses.english: The sun will not burn you during the day, nor the moon at night.

verses.latin: Dominus custodit te ab omni malo; custodiat animam tuam Dominus.
verses.english: The Lord protects you from all evil; may the Lord guard your soul.

verses.latin: Dominus custodiat introitum tuum et exitum tuum, ex hoc nunc et usque in saeculum.
verses.english: The Lord will protect your going out and your coming in, from now on and forever.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. David.
verses.english: A song of ascents, by David.

verses.latin: Laetatus sum in his, quae dicta sunt mihi: In domum Domini ibimus.
verses.english: I was joyful when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the Lord!”

verses.latin: Pedes nostri stant in atriis tuis, Jerusalem.
verses.english: Our feet were standing in your courtyards, O Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Jerusalem, quae aedificatur ut civitas, cujus participatio ejus in idipsum:
verses.english: Jerusalem is built as a city, all joined together:

verses.latin: illuc enim ascenderunt tribus, tribus Domini: testimonium Israël, ad confitendum nomini Domini.
verses.english: There the tribes went up, the tribes of the Lord, as it was the testimony of Israel, to give praise to the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia illic sederunt sedes in judicio, sedes super domum David.
verses.english: For there were set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

verses.latin: Rogate quae ad pacem sunt Jerusalem: et abundantia diligentibus te.
verses.english: Pray for the things that make for the peace of Jerusalem, that those who love you may be abundant with gifts.

verses.latin: Fiat pax in virtute tua, et abundantia in turribus tuis.
verses.english: May peace be within your walls, and prosperity in your towers.

verses.latin: Propter fratres meos et proximos meos, loquebar pacem de te.
verses.english: For the sake of my brothers and those near me, I will speak of peace.

verses.latin: Propter domum Domini Dei nostri, quæsivi bona tibi.
verses.english: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I have sought good things for you.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Nisi Dominus aedificaverit domum, in vanum laboraverunt qui aedificant eam. Nisi Dominus custodierit civitatem, frustra vigilat qui custodit eam.
verses.english: A Song of Ascents. Unless the Lord builds a home, the builders labor in vain. Unless the Lord protects the city, the watchman guards it in vain.

verses.latin: Vanum est vobis ante lucem surgere: surgite postquam sederitis, qui manducatis panem doloris.
verses.english: It is useless to wake up before dawn. You who work so hard to earn a living, you will still be left with little.

verses.latin: Cum dederit dilectis suis somnum: ecce haereditas Domini, filii, merces, fructus ventris.
verses.english: For those who trust in God, He gives rest. Behold, sons are a heritage from the Lord, the reward of the fruit of the womb.

verses.latin: Sicut sagittae in manu potentis: ita filii excussorum.
verses.english: As arrows are in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one's youth.

verses.latin: Beatus vir qui implevit desiderium suum ex ipsis: non confundentur cum loquentur inimicis suis in porta.
verses.english: Happy is the man who has filled his quiver with them. They will not be ashamed when they fight against their enemies in the gates of the city.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, dicat nunc Israël:
verses.english: A Song of Ascents. If the Lord hadn't been on our side—let Israel say so:

verses.latin: Nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, cum exsurgerent in nos homines,
verses.english: If the Lord hadn't been on our side when men rose up against us,

verses.latin: forsitan vivos deglutissent nos, cum irasceretur furor eorum in nos.
verses.english: they would have swallowed us alive when their fury blazed against us.

verses.latin: Forsitan aqua absorbuisset nos.
verses.english: The flood waters might have drowned us.

verses.latin: Torrentem pertransivit anima nostra.
verses.english: The torrent of their anger surged over our souls.

verses.latin: Forsitan pertransisset anima nostra aquam intolerabilem.
verses.english: We might have been swept away by an intolerable flood.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, qui non dedit nos in praedam dentibus eorum.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, who didn't give us as prey to their teeth.

verses.latin: Anima nostra sicut passer erepta est de laqueo venantium.
verses.english: We escaped like a bird from the fowler’s snare.

verses.latin: Laqueus contritus est, et nos liberati sumus.
verses.english: The snare was broken, and we were freed.

verses.latin: Adjutorium nostrum in nomine Domini, qui fecit caelum et terram.
verses.english: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum.
verses.english: A song of the steps.

verses.latin: Nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, dicat nunc Israël:
verses.english: “If the Lord hadn't been on our side,” let Israel say:

verses.latin: Nisi quia Dominus erat in nobis, cum insurgerent in nos homines,
verses.english: “If the Lord hadn't been on our side when men rose up against us,”

verses.latin: forsitan vivos deglutissent nos.
verses.english: They would have swallowed us alive then.

verses.latin: Forsitan aqua absorbuisset nos.
verses.english: Maybe the flood waters would have washed us away.

verses.latin: Torrentem pertransivit anima nostra.
verses.english: Our soul passed through the great rushing waters.

verses.latin: Forsitan pertransisset anima nostra aquam intolerabilem.
verses.english: Maybe our soul would have passed through the unbearable waters.

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus, qui non dedit nos in praedam dentibus eorum.
verses.english: Blessed be the Lord, because He did not give us over as prey to their teeth.

verses.latin: Anima nostra sicut passer erepta est de laqueo venantium:
verses.english: Our soul, like a bird, was freed from the trap of the hunters:

verses.latin: laqueus contritus est, et nos liberati sumus.
verses.english: the trap was broken, and we were set free.

verses.latin: Adjutorium nostrum in nomine Domini, qui fecit caelum et terram.
verses.english: Our help is in the name of the Lord, the one who made the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Cum reduceret Dominus captivitatem Sion, facti sumus quasi somniantes.
verses.english: A song of the steps. When the Lord returned the captives of Zion, we were like men dreaming.

verses.latin: Tunc repletum est gaudio os nostrum, et lingua nostra exultatione. Tunc dicent inter gentes: Magnificavit Dominus facere cum eis.
verses.english: Then our mouths were filled with joy, and our tongues sang with happiness. Then the nations said among themselves: "The Lord has done great things with them."

verses.latin: Magnificavit Dominus facere nobiscum: facti sumus laetantes.
verses.english: The Lord has done great things with us: we were filled with joy.

verses.latin: Converte, Domine, captivitatem nostram, sicut torrens in austro.
verses.english: Turn back our captivity, O Lord, as in the torrents of the south.

verses.latin: Qui seminant in lacrimis, in exultatione metent.
verses.english: Those who sow in tears, shall reap in exultation.

verses.latin: Euntes ibant et flebant, mittentes semina sua. Venientes autem venient cum exultatione, portantes manipulos suos.
verses.english: They went forth weeping, casting seeds. But they will come again with happiness, carrying their sheaves.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Nisi Dominus aedificaverit domum, in vanum laboraverunt, qui aedificant eam. Nisi Dominus custodierit civitatem, frustra vigilat, qui custodit eam.
verses.english: A Song of Ascents. If the Lord does not build a house, then those who build it have labored in vain. If the Lord does not protect a city, then the watchman guards it in vain.

verses.latin: Vanum est vobis ante lucem surgere: surgite postquam sederitis, qui manducatis panem doloris.
verses.english: It is useless for you to get up early; rise only after you have been seated, you who eat the bread of sorrow.

verses.latin: Cum dederit dilectis suis somnum: ecce hereditas Domini filii: merces, fructus ventris.
verses.english: When He gives sleep to those He loves, a heritage from the Lord is given. Sons are a reward, the fruit of the womb.

verses.latin: Sicut sagittae in manu potentis: ita filii excussorum.
verses.english: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one’s youth.

verses.latin: Beatus vir qui implevit desiderium suum ex ipsis: non confundentur cum loquentur inimicis suis in porta.
verses.english: Happy is the man who fills his quiver with them! They will not be shamed when they speak to their enemies in the gate.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Beati omnes qui timent Dominum, qui ambulant in viis ejus.
verses.english: A song for the degrees of ascent. Blessed are all those who fear God and walk in His ways.

verses.latin: Laborum manuum tuarum quia manducabis: beatus es, et bene tibi erit.
verses.english: You shall eat the fruit of your hands' labor. Blessed are you, and it will be well with you.

verses.latin: Uxor tua sicut vitis abundans, in lateribus domus tuæ.
verses.english: Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine in the inner parts of your house.

verses.latin: Filii tui sicut novellæ olivarum, in circuitu mensæ tuæ.
verses.english: Your children will be like olive plants all around your table.

verses.latin: Ecce sic benedicetur homo qui timet Dominum.
verses.english: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed who fears God.

verses.latin: Benedicat tibi Dominus ex Sion: et videas bona Jerusalem omnibus diebus vitæ tuæ.
verses.english: May God bless you from Zion, and may you see the good things of Jerusalem all the days of your life.

verses.latin: Et videas filios filiorum tuorum, pacem super Israël.
verses.english: May you see your children's children, and may there be peace upon Israel.

verses.latin: De profundis clamavi ad te, Domine:
verses.english: From the depths of trouble, I cry to You, Lord:

verses.latin: Domine, exaudi vocem meam.
verses.english: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.latin: Fiant aures tuæ intendentes in vocem deprecationis meæ.
verses.english: May Your ears be open to the sound of my supplication.

verses.latin: Si iniquitates observaveris, Domine: Domine, quis sustinebit?
verses.english: If You, Lord, should mark iniquities, Lord, who shall stand?

verses.latin: Quia apud te propitiatio est: et propter legem tuam sustinui te, Domine.
verses.english: But there is forgiveness with You, that You may be feared, Lord.

verses.latin: Sustinuit anima mea in verbo ejus: speravit anima mea in Domino.
verses.english: My soul has relied upon His Word. My soul has hoped in the Lord.

verses.latin: A custodia matutina usque ad noctem, speret Israel in Domino.
verses.english: From the morning watch until night, let Israel hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia apud Dominum misericordia, et copiosa apud eum redemptio.
verses.english: Because with the Lord there is mercy and His redemption is plentiful.

verses.latin: Et ipse redimet Israel ex omnibus iniquitatibus ejus.
verses.english: And He will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.

verses.latin: De profundis clamavi ad te, Domine:
verses.english: From the deepest part of the sea of troubles, I call to You, Lord:

verses.latin: Domine, exaudi vocem meam.
verses.english: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.latin: Fiant aures tuæ intendentes, in vocem deprecationis meæ.
verses.english: Let Your ears be attentive to the sound of my prayers.

verses.latin: Si iniquitates observaveris, Domine:
verses.english: If You, Lord, kept a record of sins,

verses.latin: Domine, quis sustinebit?
verses.english: Lord, who can possibly stand before You?

verses.latin: Quia apud te propitiatio est:
verses.english: But there is forgiveness with You,

verses.latin: et propter legem tuam sustinui te, Domine.
verses.english: so we may fear and obey Your laws, Lord.

verses.latin: Sustinuit anima mea in verbo ejus:
verses.english: My soul has waited on His promise,

verses.latin: speravit anima mea in Domino.
verses.english: my soul has hoped in the Lord.

verses.latin: A custodia matutina usque ad noctem, speret Israel in Domino.
verses.english: From morning watch until night, let Israel hope in the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia apud Dominum misericordia, et copiosa apud eum redemptio.
verses.english: For there is mercy with the Lord, and redemption is abundant with Him.

verses.latin: Et ipse redimet Israel, ex omnibus iniquitatibus ejus.
verses.english: And He will redeem Israel from all of his sins.

verses.latin: Domine, non est exaltatum cor meum, neque elati sunt oculi mei.
verses.english: Lord, my heart is not puffed up with pride, nor have my eyes turned to arrogance.

verses.latin: Neque ambulavi in magnis, neque in mirabilibus super me.
verses.english: I have not occupied myself with great things, nor with wonders beyond my ability.

verses.latin: Si non humiliter sentiebam, sed exaltavi animam meam:
verses.english: Indeed, if I was not humble, but haughty in my thoughts:

verses.latin: sicut ablactatus est super matre sua, ita retributio in anima mea.
verses.english: as a weaned child on its mother's lap, so is my soul.

verses.latin: Speret Israël in Domino, ex hoc nunc et usque in sæculum.
verses.english: Let Israel hope in the Lord, now and forever.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Memento, Domine, David, et omnis mansuetudinis ejus.
verses.english: A song of ascents. Remember, O Lord, David, and all his meekness.

verses.latin: Quomodo juravit Domino, votum vovit Deo Jacob:
verses.english: How he swore an oath to the Lord and promised a vow to the God of Jacob:

verses.latin: Si introiero in tabernaculum domus meae, si ascendero in lectum stratum meum,
verses.english: “I will not enter into my house, nor will I go up to my bed,

verses.latin: si dedero somnum oculis meis, et palpebris meis dormitationem,
verses.english: I will not give sleep to my eyes, nor slumber to my eyelids,

verses.latin: et requiem temporibus meis, donec inveniam locum Domino, tabernaculum Deo Jacob.
verses.english: nor rest to my temples, until I find a place for the Lord, a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.”

verses.latin: Ecce audivimus eam in Ephrata: invenimus eam in campis silvae.
verses.english: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah: we found it in the fields of the forest.

verses.latin: Introibimus in tabernaculum ejus: adorabimus in loco ubi steterunt pedes ejus.
verses.english: Let us go into his tabernacle; let us worship in the place where his feet stood.

verses.latin: Surge, Domine, in requiem tuam, tu et arca sanctificationis tuae.
verses.english: Arise, O Lord, into your rest, you and the ark of your holiness.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes tui induantur justitiam, et sancti tui exsultent.
verses.english: Let your priests be clothed with justice, and let your holy ones rejoice.

verses.latin: Propter David, servi tui, non avertas faciem christi tui.
verses.english: For the sake of your servant David, do not turn away the face of your Christ.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus David veritatem, et non poenituit eum: De fructu ventris tui ponam super sedem tuam.
verses.english: The Lord swore to David in truth, and He will not change His mind: “From the fruit of your womb I will set upon your throne.”

verses.latin: Si custodierint filii tui testamentum meum, et testimonia mea haec quae docebo eos, et filii eorum usque in saeculum sedebunt super sedem tuam.
verses.english: “If your sons keep my covenant and my testimonies that I will teach them, then their sons also will sit upon your throne forever.”

verses.latin: Quoniam elegit Dominus Sion: elegit eam in habitationem sibi.
verses.english: For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has chosen it to be His dwelling.

verses.latin: Hic requies mea in saeculum saeculi: hic habitabo quoniam elegi eam.
verses.english: “This is my rest forever; here I will dwell, for I have chosen it.”

verses.latin: Viduam ejus benedicens benedicam: pauperes ejus saturabo panibus.
verses.english: I will bless her widow and bless her poor with bread.

verses.latin: Sacerdotes ejus induam salutari: et sancti ejus exsultatione exsultabunt.
verses.english: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her holy ones will rejoice.

verses.latin: Illuc producam cornu David: paravi lucernam christo meo.
verses.english: There I will cause the horn of David to spring forth; I have prepared a lamp for my Christ.

verses.latin: Inimicos ejus induam confusione: super ipsum autem florebit sanctificatio mea.
verses.english: I will clothe his enemies with shame, but upon him my holiness will flourish.

verses.latin: Canticum graduum. Ecce quam bonum et quam jucundum habitare fratres in unum.
verses.english: A song of ascents. How very good and how very pleasant it is when brothers dwell together in unity.

verses.latin: Quasi unguentum in capite, quod descendit in barbam, barbam Aaron, quod descendit in oram vestimenti ejus.
verses.english: It is like the most precious oil that was poured on the head, that ran down the beard, the beard of Aaron, running down his garment’s collar.

verses.latin: Sicut ros Hermon, qui descendit in montem Sion: quoniam illic mandavit Dominus benedictionem, et vitam usque in saeculum.
verses.english: It is like the dew of Hermon that falls on Mount Zion, for there the Lord has commanded the blessing and life forevermore.

verses.latin: Laudate nomen Domini; laudate, servi, Dominum:
verses.english: Praise the Lord's name! All you servants of God, praise the Lord!

verses.latin: qui statis in domo Domini, in atriis domus Dei nostri.
verses.english: You stand in the house of the Lord, in the courtyards of our God’s house.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum, quoniam bonus Dominus: psallite nomini ejus, quoniam suavis.
verses.english: Praise the Lord, because the Lord is good! Sing to His name, because His name is sweet.

verses.latin: Quoniam Jacob elegit Dominus sibi: Israel in possessionem suam.
verses.english: For the Lord chose Jacob as His own, Israel for his inheritance.

verses.latin: Quia ego cognovi quod magnus est Dominus, et Deus noster prae omnibus diis.
verses.english: For I know that the Lord is great, and our God is above all other gods.

verses.latin: Quaecumque voluit Dominus, fecit in caelo et in terra, in mari et in omnibus abyssis.
verses.english: The Lord does whatever He wants in the universe and on the earth, in the sea and in all the depths.

verses.latin: Educent nubes ab extremis terrae; fulgura in pluviam fecit.
verses.english: He brings up clouds from the ends of the earth; He makes lightning for the rain.

verses.latin: Qui emittit ventos de thesauris suis.
verses.english: He sends out the winds from His storehouses.

verses.latin: Qui percussit primogenita Aegypti, ab homine usque ad pecus.
verses.english: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, from man to beast.

verses.latin: Et misit signa et prodigia in medio tui, Aegyptie; in Pharaonem et in omnes servos ejus.
verses.english: He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt; against Pharaoh and all his servants.

verses.latin: Qui percussit gentes multas, et occidit reges fortes:
verses.english: He struck down many nations, and killed strong kings.

verses.latin: Seon regem Amorrhaeorum, et Og regem Basan, et omnia regna Chanaan:
verses.english: He killed Seon the king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

verses.latin: Et dedit terram eorum in haereditatem, haereditatem Israel populo suo.
verses.english: He gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to Israel, His people.

verses.latin: Domine, nomen tuum in aeternum; Domine, memoria tua in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: Lord, Your name lasts forever; Lord, Your memory endures from one generation to the next.

verses.latin: Quia judicabit Dominus populum suum, et in servis suis deprecabitur.
verses.english: For the Lord will judge His people, and will have compassion on His servants.

verses.latin: Simulacra gentium argentum et aurum, opera manuum hominum.
verses.english: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the works of human hands.

verses.latin: Os habent, et non loquentur: oculos habent, et non videbunt.
verses.english: They have mouths, but they don't speak; they have eyes, but they don't see.

verses.latin: Aures habent, et non audient: neque enim est spiritus in ore ipsorum.
verses.english: They have ears, but they don't hear; there is no breath in their mouths.

verses.latin: Similes illis fiant qui faciunt ea: et omnes qui confidunt in eis.
verses.english: Those who make them are like them, and so are all who trust in them.

verses.latin: Domus Israel, benedicite Domino: domus Aaron, benedicite Domino.
verses.english: O house of Israel, bless the Lord; O house of Aaron, bless the Lord.

verses.latin: Domus Levi, benedicite Domino: qui timetis Dominum, benedicite Domino.
verses.english: O house of Levi, bless the Lord; you who fear the Lord, bless the Lord.

verses.latin: Ex Sion benedicatur Dominus, qui habitat in Jerusalem.
verses.english: May the Lord be blessed from Zion, He who dwells in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino quoniam bonus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord, because He is good, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Deo deorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to the God of gods, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino dominorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui facit mirabilia magna solus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He alone does great wonders, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui fecit caelos in intellectu, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He made the universe by His wisdom, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui firmavit terram super aquas, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He established the earth upon the waters, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui fecit luminaria magna, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He made the great lights, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Solem in potestatem diei, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: The sun to rule the day, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Lunam et stellas in potestatem noctis, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: The moon and stars to rule the night, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui percussit Aegyptum cum primogenitis eorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui eduxit Israël de medio eorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He led Israel out from among them, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: In manu potenti, et brachio excelso, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: With a strong hand and an outstretched arm, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui divisit mare Rubrum in divisiones, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He divided the Red Sea into parts, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et eduxit Israël per medium ejus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And led Israel through the midst of it, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et excussit Pharaonem, et virtutem ejus in mari Rubro, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui eduxit populum suum per desertum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He led His people through the desert, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui percussit reges magnos, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: He struck down great kings, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et occidit reges fortes, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And killed mighty kings, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Sehon regem Amorrhaeorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Sehon, king of the Amorites, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et Og regem Basan, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And Og, king of Bashan, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et dedit terram eorum in hereditatem, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And gave their land as a heritage, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Hereditatem Israël servo suo, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: A heritage to Israel His servant, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui in humilitate nostra memor fuit nostri, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who remembered us in our low estate, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et redemit nos ab inimicis nostris, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And delivered us from our enemies, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui dat escam omni carni, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who gives food to all flesh, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Deo caeli, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Give thanks to the God of the universe, because His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, quoniam bonus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Praise the Lord, for He is good; His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Deo deorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Praise the God of gods, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino dominorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Praise the Lord of lords, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui facit mirabilia magna solus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who alone does great wonders, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui fecit caelos in intellectu, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who made the universe with wisdom, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui firmavit terram super aquas, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who fixed the earth upon the waters, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui fecit luminaria magna, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who made the great lights, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Solem in potestatem diei, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: The sun to rule the day, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Lunam et stellas in potestatem noctis, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: The moon and the stars to rule the night, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui percussit Aegyptum cum primogenitis eorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who struck Egypt with its firstborn, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et eduxit Israel de medio eorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who led Israel out from among them, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: In manu potenti, et brachio excelso, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: With a powerful hand and an outstretched arm, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui divisit Mare Rubrum in divisiones, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who divided the Red Sea, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et eduxit Israel per medium ejus, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And led Israel through its midst, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et dejecit Pharaonem, et virtutem ejus in Mari Rubro, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui eduxit populum suum per desertum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who led His people through the desert, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui percussit reges magnos, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who struck great kings, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et occidit reges fortes, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
