verses.english: And killed mighty kings, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Sehon regem Amorrhaeorum, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Sehon, king of the Amorites, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et Og regem Basan, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And Og, king of Bashan, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et dedit terram eorum in haereditatem, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And gave their land as an inheritance, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Haereditatem Israel servo suo, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: An inheritance to Israel His servant, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui in humilitate nostra memor fuit nostri, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who remembered us in our low estate, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et redemit nos ab inimicis nostris, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And rescued us from our enemies, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Qui dat escam omni carni, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Who gives food to all flesh, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Confitemini Deo caeli, quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: Praise the God of the universe, for His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Super flumina Babylonis illic sedimus et flevimus, cum recordaremur Sion.
verses.english: By the rivers of Babylon, we sat and wept when we remembered Zion.

verses.latin: In salicibus in medio ejus suspendimus organa nostra.
verses.english: We hung our instruments of music in the willows there.

verses.latin: Quia illic interrogaverunt nos qui captivos duxerunt nos verba cantionum, et qui abduxerunt nos, hymnum.
verses.english: For there, those who had taken us captive asked for a song, and those who had led us away asked for a hymn.

verses.latin: Canticum cantate nobis de canticis Sion.
verses.english: Sing us one of the songs of Zion!

verses.latin: Quomodo cantabimus canticum Domini in terra aliena?
verses.english: How can we sing the Lord's song in a foreign land?

verses.latin: Si oblitus fuero tui, Jerusalem, oblivioni detur dextera mea.
verses.english: If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand be forgotten!

verses.latin: Si non meminero tui, si non praetulero Jerusalem in principio laetitiae meae.
verses.english: If I do not remember you, if I do not prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy...

verses.latin: Memor esto, Domine, filiorum Edom in die Jerusalem, qui dicunt: Exinanite, exinanite usque ad fundamentum in ea.
verses.english: Lord, remember the children of Edom on the day of Jerusalem, who said: "Raze it, raze it, down to its foundation."

verses.latin: Filia Babylonis misera: beatus qui retribuet tibi vicem tuam quam retribuisti nobis.
verses.english: O daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction: blessed is he who repays you for what you have done to us!

verses.latin: Beatus qui tenebit, et allidet parvulos tuos ad petram.
verses.english: Blessed is he who seizes your little ones and dashes them against the rock!

verses.latin: Domine, probasti me, et cognovisti me.
verses.english: Lord, you put me to the test, and I know that you know me.

verses.latin: Tu cognovisti sessionem meam, et surrectionem meam;
verses.english: You know when I sit down, and when I stand up;

verses.latin: intellexisti cogitationes meas de longe.
verses.english: You read my thoughts from afar.

verses.latin: Semitam meam et funiculum meum investigasti;
verses.english: You have surveyed my path and my journey;

verses.latin: et omnes vias meas praevidisti.
verses.english: and you have foreseen all my ways.

verses.latin: Quia nondum est sermo in lingua mea, ecce, Domine, tu cognovisti omnia.
verses.english: Because before the words come out of my mouth, you know them completely, Lord.

verses.latin: Post, et ante, formasti me, et posuisti super me manum tuam.
verses.english: You formed me from the very beginning, and you have always been present.

verses.latin: Mirabilis facta est scientia tua ex me;
verses.english: This is a great wonder to me;

verses.latin: confortata est, et non potero ad eam.
verses.english: it is so powerful, and I can't begin to comprehend it.

verses.latin: Quo ibo a spiritu tuo? et quo a facie tua fugiam?
verses.english: Where can I go to escape your spirit? Where can I flee from your face?

verses.latin: Si ascendero in caelum, tu illic es;
verses.english: If I ascend into the sky, you are there;

verses.latin: si descendero in infernum, ades.
verses.english: if I go down to hell, you are there.

verses.latin: Si sumpsero pennas meas diluculo, et habitavero in extremis maris,
verses.english: If I fly to the ends of the earth and take wings in the morning,

verses.latin: etenim illuc manus tua deducet me, et tenebit me dextera tua.
verses.english: even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Forsitan tenebræ conculcabunt me;
verses.english: And I said, "Surely darkness will conceal me;"

verses.latin: et nox illuminatio mea in deliciis meis.
verses.english: and night will be my light in my pleasure.

verses.latin: Quoniam tenebræ non obscurabuntur a te, et nox sicut dies illuminabitur: sicut tenebræ ejus, ita et lumen ejus.
verses.english: Even darkness isn't dark to you, and night is as bright as the day: both the darkness and the light are the same to you.

verses.latin: Quia tu possedisti renes meos;
verses.english: For you have made me;

verses.latin: suscepisti me de utero matris meæ.
verses.english: you have received me in my mother's womb.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi, quia terribiliter magnificatus es;
verses.english: I will praise you, because you are a wonderful, amazing God;

verses.latin: mirabilia opera tua, et anima mea cognoscit nimis.
verses.english: your works are miraculous, and my soul knows this well.

verses.latin: Non est occultum os meum a te, quod fecisti in occulto;
verses.english: My body was not hidden from you when I was being formed secretly;

verses.latin: et substantia mea in inferioribus terræ.
verses.english: and all parts of my body were being made in the depths of the earth.

verses.latin: Imperfectionem meam viderunt oculi tui, et in libro tuo omnes scribentur;
verses.english: Your eyes saw my imperfection, and in your book all things were written;

verses.latin: dies formabuntur, et nemo in eis.
verses.english: the days of my life have been formed, and not one of them is without you.

verses.latin: Mihi autem nimis honorati sunt amici tui, Deus; nimis confortatus est principatus eorum.
verses.english: And how precious to me are your friends, O God! How powerful are their leaders!

verses.latin: Dinumerabo eos, et super arenæ multiplicabuntur: exsurrexi, et adhuc sum tecum.
verses.english: I will count them, and they will increase more than the sand: if I rise up, I am still with you.

verses.latin: Si occideris, Deus, peccatores, viri sanguinum, declinate a me:
verses.english: If you slay the wicked, God, men of bloodshed, get away from me:

verses.latin: quia dicitis in cogitatione: Accipient in vanum civitates tuas.
verses.english: because they speak deceitfully and take your cities in vain.

verses.latin: Nonne qui oderunt te, Domine, oderam? et super inimicos tuos tabescébam?
verses.english: Do I not hate those who hate you, Lord? Am I not grieved for your enemies?

verses.latin: Perfecto odio oderam illos: inimici facti sunt mihi.
verses.english: I hated them with perfect hatred: they have become my enemies.

verses.latin: Proba me, Deus, et scito cor meum; interroga me, et cognosce semitas meas.
verses.english: Examine me, God, and know my heart; test me, and know my ways.

verses.latin: Et vide si via iniquitatis in me est: et deduc me in via æterna.
verses.english: And see if there is any path of wickedness in me: and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.latin: Domine, probasti me, et cognovisti me.
verses.english: O Lord, you have examined me, and you have known me.

verses.latin: Tu cognovisti sessionem meam, et resurrectionem meam.
verses.english: You know my sitting and my rising.

verses.latin: Intellexisti cogitationes meas de longe.
verses.english: You have understood my thoughts from afar.

verses.latin: Semitam meam, et funiculum meum investigasti.
verses.english: You have investigated my path, and my measuring cord.

verses.latin: Et omnes vias meas praevidisti: quia non est sermo in lingua mea.
verses.english: And you have seen all my ways. Because there is no word in my tongue.

verses.latin: Ecce, Domine, tu cognovisti omnia novissima et antiqua.
verses.english: Behold, O Lord, you have known all things new and old.

verses.latin: Tu formasti me, et posuisti super me manum tuam.
verses.english: You have made me, and put your hand upon me.

verses.latin: Mirabilis facta est scientia tua ex me: confortata est, et non potero ad eam.
verses.english: Your knowledge has become wonderful and mysterious, and I cannot attain it.

verses.latin: Quo ibo a spiritu tuo? et quo a facie tua fugiam?
verses.english: Where shall I go from your Spirit? Or where shall I flee from your face?

verses.latin: Si ascendero in caelum, tu illic es: si descendero in infernum, ades.
verses.english: If I go up into the sky, you are there. If I go down into the underworld, you are there.

verses.latin: Si sumpsero pennas meas diluculo, et habitavero in extremis maris,
verses.english: If I take my wings in the morning, and dwell in the farthest parts of the sea,

verses.latin: etenim illuc manus tua deducet me: et tenebunt me dextera tua.
verses.english: Even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.

verses.latin: Et si dixero: Forsitan tenebrae conculcabunt me: et nox illuminatio mea in deliciis meis:
verses.english: And if I say: Perhaps the darkness will overwhelm me: and night will be my illumination in my delights:

verses.latin: quia tenebrae non obscurabuntur a te, et nox sicut dies illuminabitur: sicut tenebrae ejus, ita et lux ejus.
verses.english: Even the darkness will not be hidden from you, and night will be illuminated like day. As is its darkness, so is its light.

verses.latin: Quia tu possedisti renes meos: suscepisti me de utero matris meae.
verses.english: For you have possessed my kidneys: you have taken me from my mother's womb.

verses.latin: Confitebor tibi: quia terribiliter magnificatus es: mirabilia opera tua, et anima mea cognoscit nimis.
verses.english: I will give you praise: because you have been fearfully magnified. Wonderful are your works, and my soul knows this exceedingly well.

verses.latin: Non est occultatum os meum a te, quod fecisti in occulto: et substantia mea in inferioribus terrae.
verses.english: My bone was not hidden from you, that you have made in secret: and my substance in the lower parts of the earth.

verses.latin: Imperfectionem meam viderunt oculi tui, et in libro tuo omnes scribentur: dies formabuntur, et nemo in eis.
verses.english: Your eyes have seen my imperfection, and in your book all are written: days will be formed, and there will be none among them.

verses.latin: Mihi autem nimis honorati sunt amici tui, Deus: nimis confortatus est principatus eorum.
verses.english: But to me, your friends are greatly honored, O God: their leadership is greatly strengthened.

verses.latin: Dinumerabo eos, et super arenam multiplicabuntur: exsurrexi, et adhuc sum tecum.
verses.english: I will count them, and they will be multiplied above the sand: I have risen, and I am still with you.

verses.latin: Si occideris, Deus, peccatores: viri sanguinum, sanguinem, quaerite a me.
verses.english: If, O God, you will kill the sinners: men of blood, seek blood from me.

verses.latin: Qui dicitis in cogitatione: Assument in vanitate civitates tuas.
verses.english: Who say in thought: We will take your cities in vain.

verses.latin: Nonne qui oderunt te, Domine, oderam? et super inimicos tuos tabescbam?
verses.english: Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord? And do I not waste away because of your enemies?

verses.latin: Perfecto odio oderam illos: inimici facti sunt mihi.
verses.english: I hated them with a perfect hatred: they have become my enemies.

verses.latin: Proba me, Deus, et scito cor meum: interroga me, et cognosce semitas meas.
verses.english: Test me, O God, and know my heart: question me, and know my ways.

verses.latin: Et vide si via iniquitatis in me est: et deduc me in via aeterna.
verses.english: And see if the way of iniquity is in me: and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.latin: In finem. Psalmus David.
verses.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

verses.latin: Domine, clamavi ad te, exaudi me: intende voci meae, cum clamavero ad te.
verses.english: Lord, I cried to you. Hear me. Pay attention to my voice when I cry out to you.

verses.latin: Dirigatur oratio mea sicut incensum in conspectu tuo: elevatio manuum mearum sacrificium vespertinum.
verses.english: May my prayer rise before you like incense. May my hands lifted up be a sacrifice in the evening.

verses.latin: Pone, Domine, custodiam ori meo: et ostium circumdationis labiis meis.
verses.english: O Lord, set a guard over my mouth. And keep watch at the door of my lips.

verses.latin: Non declinabis cor meum in verba malitiae, ad excusandas excusationes in peccatis.
verses.english: Do not turn my heart to the words of evil. Do not let me make excuses for my sins.

verses.latin: Cum hominibus operantibus iniquitatem: et non communicabo cum electis eorum.
verses.english: Do not let me make excuses with those who do evil, nor should I befriend those who are evil.

verses.latin: Corripiet me justus in misericordia, et increpabit me: oleum autem peccatoris non impinguet caput meum.
verses.english: Let the righteous correct me with mercy, and rebuke me. But the oil of a sinner should not make my head fat.

verses.latin: Quoniam adhuc et oratio mea in beneplacitis eorum: devorati sunt juncti petrae judices eorum.
verses.english: Because my prayer is always their will. Their judges are completely destroyed by their sins.

verses.latin: Audient verba mea quoniam potuerunt: sicut crassitudo terrae crepuit super terram, dispersa sunt ossa eorum secundum infernum.
verses.english: They will hear my words and understand that they could not resist my prayer, as the very earth cracked open. Their bones are scattered according to the grave.

verses.latin: Quia ad te, Domine, Domine, oculi mei: in te speravi, non auferas animam meam.
verses.english: Because my eyes are turned towards you, O Lord. I have put my trust in you. Do not take away my soul.

verses.latin: Custodi me a laqueo quem statuerunt mihi: et a scandalis operantium iniquitatem.
verses.english: Keep me from the trap they have set for me, and from the snares of those who do evil.

verses.latin: Cadent in retiaculo ejus peccatores: singulariter sum ego donec transeam.
verses.english: The wicked will fall into their own net. Meanwhile, I am alone until I pass through their traps.

verses.latin: Domine, clamavi ad te, exaudi me: intende voci meae, cum clamavero ad te.
verses.english: Lord, I am calling to You. Answer me. Listen to my voice as I call to You.

verses.latin: Dirigatur oratio mea sicut incensum in conspectu tuo; elevatio manuum mearum sacrificium vespertinum.
verses.english: Let my prayer be as incense in Your sight, and the lifting up of my hands be as the evening sacrifice.

verses.latin: Pone, Domine, custodiam ori meo, et ostium circumstantiae labiis meis.
verses.english: Set a guard, Lord, over my mouth, and a door to enclose my lips.

verses.latin: Non declines cor meum in verba malitiae, ad excusandas excusationes in peccatis.
verses.english: Do not incline my heart to words of evil or to the making of excuses for sin.

verses.latin: Cum hominibus operantibus iniquitatem: et non communicabo cum electis eorum.
verses.english: Let me not take part in the works of the evildoers. May I not be numbered among them.

verses.latin: Corripiet me justus in misericordia, et increpabit me: oleum autem peccatoris non impinguet caput meum.
verses.english: The just man will strike me with mercy and will rebuke me. But the oil of the sinner will not anoint my head.

verses.latin: Quoniam adhuc et oratio mea in beneplacitis eorum: absorpti sunt juncti petrae judices eorum.
verses.english: For even in their evil prayers, their judges have been swallowed up in the rock.

verses.latin: Audientur verba mea, quoniam potuerunt: sicut crassitudo terrae, corruit super terram, dissipata sunt ossa eorum secundum infernum.
verses.english: My words are heard for they have prevailed. Like the earth, they are upon the earth. Their bones are scattered near hell.

verses.latin: Quia ad te, Domine, Domine, oculi mei: in te speravi, non auferas animam meam.
verses.english: For my eyes are turned to You, Lord. I have hoped in You, do not take away my soul.

verses.latin: Custodi me a laqueo quem statuerunt mihi: et a scandalis operantium iniquitatem.
verses.english: Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me, and from the snares of those who do evil.

verses.latin: Cadent in retiaculo ejus peccatores: singulariter sum ego, donec transeam.
verses.english: The sinners will fall in the net that they made for themselves. I will be alone until I pass by.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Domine, exaudi orationem meam: auribus percipe obsecrationem meam in veritate tua: exaudi me in tua justitia.
verses.english: A Psalm of David. Lord, hear my prayer; listen to my plea, and fulfill it. Respond to my prayer in truth, and hear my plea in your justice.

verses.latin: Et non intres in judicium cum servo tuo: quia non justificabitur in conspectu tuo omnis vivens.
verses.english: Do not enter into judgment with your servant, because no living thing will be just by your standards.

verses.latin: Quia persecutus est inimicus animam meam: humiliavit in terra vitam meam.
verses.english: My enemy has hounded my soul and humiliated my life in this world.

verses.latin: Collocavit me in tenebris sicut mortuos saeculi: et anxiatus est in me spiritus meus, in me turbatum est cor meum.
verses.english: I am placed in the darkness, among those in the grave. My spirit is anxious, my heart is troubled.

verses.latin: Memor fui dierum antiquorum; meditatus sum in omnibus operibus tuis: in factis manuum tuarum meditabam.
verses.english: I recall the days of old, I reflect on all your works, and I meditate on what your hands have made.

verses.latin: Expandi manus meas ad te: anima mea sicut terra sine aqua tibi.
verses.english: I stretch out my hands to you; my soul is like a barren land yearning for you.

verses.latin: Velociter exaudi me, Domine: defecit spiritus meus.
verses.english: Answer me quickly, Lord; my spirit fails.

verses.latin: Non avertas faciem tuam a me: et similis ero descendentibus in lacum.
verses.english: Do not turn your face away from me, lest I be like those who go down to the pit.

verses.latin: Auditam fac mihi mane misericordiam tuam, quia in te speravi.
verses.english: Let me hear your kindness in the morning, for I trust in you.

verses.latin: Notam fac mihi viam, in qua ambulem: quia ad te levavi animam meam.
verses.english: Show me the way I should go, for I lift up my soul to you.

verses.latin: Eripe me de inimicis meis, Domine: ad te confugio.
verses.english: Rescue me from my enemies, Lord; I flee to you for refuge.

verses.latin: Doce me facere voluntatem tuam, quia Deus meus es tu.
verses.english: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God.

verses.latin: Spiritus tuus bonus deducet me in terram rectam: propter nomen tuum vivificabis me.
verses.english: Your good Spirit will lead me on the right path; for the sake of your name, revive me.

verses.latin: Quia in justitia tua educes de tribulatione animam meam.
verses.english: In your justice, bring my soul out of trouble.

verses.latin: Et in misericordia tua disperdes inimicos meos, et perdes omnes qui tribulant animam meam: quoniam ego servus tuus sum.
verses.english: In your mercy, destroy my enemies and destroy all who harass my soul, for I am your servant.

verses.latin: Psalmus David. Domine, exaudi orationem meam: auribus percipe obsecrationem meam in veritate tua: exaudi me in tua justitia.
verses.english: A psalm of David. Lord, listen to my prayer. Hear my plea in your truth. Listen to me in your righteousness.

verses.latin: Et non intres in judicium cum servo tuo: quia non justificabitur in conspectu tuo omnis vivens.
verses.english: Do not punish me with a judgment because no person can be made just by God.

verses.latin: Quia persecutus est inimicus animam meam: humiliavit in terra vitam meam.
verses.english: The enemy has hunted my soul, and has crushed my life.

verses.latin: Collocavit me in tenebris sicut mortuos saeculi: et anxiatus est in me spiritus meus: in me turbatum est cor meum.
verses.english: He has put me into darkness, like those who are in the grave. My spirit has grown faint. My heart is troubled within me.

verses.latin: Memor fui dierum antiquorum; meditatus sum in omnibus operibus tuis: in factis manuum tuarum meditabar.
verses.english: I remember the ancient days; I reflect on all your works, and I meditate on your achievements.

verses.latin: Expandi manus meas ad te: anima mea sicut terra sine aqua tibi.
verses.english: I stretch out my hands to you; my soul is like land that thirsts for your presence.

verses.latin: Velociter exaudi me, Domine: defecit spiritus meus. Non avertas faciem tuam a me: et similis ero descendentibus in lacum.
verses.english: Answer me quickly, Lord. My spirit fails. Do not turn your face away from me, or I will be like those who go down into the pit.

verses.latin: Auditam fac mihi mane misericordiam tuam: quia in te speravi. Notam fac mihi viam, in qua ambulem: quia ad te levavi animam meam.
verses.english: Let me hear of your loving kindness in the morning because I put my trust in you. Show me the way I should go, because to you I lift up my soul.

verses.latin: Eripe me de inimicis meis, Domine: ad te confugio. Doce me facere voluntatem tuam: quia Deus meus es tu.
verses.english: Deliver me from my enemies, Lord, because I run to you for help. Teach me to do your will because you are my God.

verses.latin: Spiritus tuus bonus deducet me in terram rectam: propter nomen tuum vivificabis me.
verses.english: Let your good Spirit lead me into a land of uprightness, and for your name’s sake, give me life.

verses.latin: In justitia tua educes de tribulatione animam meam: et in misericordia tua disperdes inimicos meos.
verses.english: In your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble. Destroy my enemies in your mercy.

verses.latin: Et perdes omnes qui tribulant animam meam: quoniam ego servus tuus sum.
verses.english: Destroy all those who torment my soul because I am your servant.

verses.latin: Exaltabo te Deus meus rex: et benedicam nomini tuo in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: I will exalt you, my God, the King, and I will bless your name for all time and forever.

verses.latin: Per singulos dies benedicam tibi: et laudabo nomen tuum in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: Every day I will bless you, and I will praise your name for all time and forever.

verses.latin: Magnus Dominus et laudabilis nimis: et magnitudinis ejus non est finis.
verses.english: Great is the Lord, and exceedingly praiseworthy, and there is no end to his greatness.

verses.latin: Generatio et generatio laudabit opera tua: et potentiam tuam pronuntiabunt.
verses.english: Generation after generation will praise your works, and will announce your power.

verses.latin: Magnificentiam gloriae sanctitatis tuae loquentur: et mirabilia tua narrabunt.
verses.english: They will speak of the magnificence of the glory of your holiness, and they will tell of your wonders.

verses.latin: Et potentiam terribilium tuorum dicent: et magnitudinem tuam narrabunt.
verses.english: They will speak of the power of your awesome deeds, and they will narrate your greatness.

verses.latin: Memoriam abundantiae suavitatis tuae eructabunt: et in justitia tua exultabunt.
verses.english: They will pour forth the memory of your abundant sweetness and will rejoice in your justice.

verses.latin: Miserator et misericors Dominus: patiens et multae misericordiae.
verses.english: The Lord is merciful and compassionate, patient, and of great mercy.

verses.latin: Suavis Dominus universis: et miserationes ejus super omnia opera ejus.
verses.english: The Lord is good to all, and his mercies are over all his works.

verses.latin: Confiteantur tibi Domine omnia opera tua: et sancti tui benedicant tibi.
verses.english: May all your works give thanks to you, O Lord, and may your holy ones bless you.

verses.latin: Gloriam regni tui dicent: et potentiam tuam loquentur:
verses.english: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and they will talk of your power:

verses.latin: Ut notam faciant filiis hominum potentiam tuam: et gloriam decoris regni tui.
verses.english: so that they may make known to the sons of men your power and the glory of the beauty of your kingdom.

verses.latin: Regnum tuum regnum omnium saeculorum: et dominatio tua in omni generatione et generatione.
verses.english: Your kingdom is the kingdom of all ages, and your dominion is in every generation.

verses.latin: Fidelis Dominus in omnibus verbis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.
verses.english: The Lord is faithful in all his words, and holy in all his works.

verses.latin: Confirmat Dominus omnes qui corruunt: et erigit omnes qui conpunguntur.
verses.english: The Lord strengthens all who are falling, and raises up all who are bowed down.

verses.latin: Oculi omnium in te sperant Domine: et tu das illis cibum in tempore opportuno.
verses.english: The eyes of all hope in you, O Lord, and you give them food in due season.

verses.latin: Aperis tu manum tuam: et imples omne animal benedictione.
verses.english: You open your hand and fill every living thing with blessing.

verses.latin: Justus Dominus in omnibus viis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.
verses.english: The Lord is just in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

verses.latin: Prope est Dominus omnibus invocantibus eum: omnibus qui invocant eum in veritate.
verses.english: The Lord is near to all who call upon him, to all who call upon him in truth.

verses.latin: Voluntatem timentium se faciet: et deprecationem eorum exaudiet, et salvos faciet eos.
verses.english: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him, and he will hear their prayer and save them.

verses.latin: Custodit Dominus omnes diligentes se: et omnes peccatores disperdet.
verses.english: The Lord protects all who love him, but he will destroy all the wicked.

verses.latin: Laudationem Domini loquetur os meum: et benedicat omnis caro nomini sancto ejus in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord, and let all flesh bless his holy name for all time and forever.

verses.latin: Exaltabo te, Deus meus, rex meus: et benedicam nomini tuo in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: I will praise you, my God, and King. I will give thanks to your name forever and ever.

verses.latin: Per singulos dies benedicam tibi: et laudabo nomen tuum in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: Every single day I will bless you. I will praise your name forever and ever.

verses.latin: Magnus Dominus, et laudabilis nimis: et magnitudinis ejus non est finis.
verses.english: The Lord is great, and praiseworthy above all things. His greatness has no end.

verses.latin: Generatio et generatio laudabit opera tua: et potentiam tuam pronuntiabunt.
verses.english: Each generation will praise your works. They will declare your power.

verses.latin: Magnificentiam gloriae sanctitatis tuae loquentur: et mirabilia tua narrabunt.
verses.english: They will speak of the magnificence of your holy glory and will tell of your wondrous deeds.

verses.latin: Et potentiam terribilium tuorum dicent: et magnitudinem tuam narrabunt.
verses.english: They will declare the power of your terrifying works and tell of your greatness.

verses.latin: Memoriam abundantiae dulcedinis tuae eructabunt: et de justitia tua exsultabunt.
verses.english: They will burst forth with the memory of your abundant goodness and rejoice in your justice.

verses.latin: Miserator et misericors Dominus: patiens et multae misericordiae.
verses.english: The Lord is merciful and kind, patient, and of great mercy.

verses.latin: Suavis Dominus universis: et miserationes ejus super omnia opera ejus.
verses.english: The Lord is sweet to all. His mercy is over all his works.

verses.latin: Confiteantur tibi, Domine, omnia opera tua: et sancti tui benedicant tibi.
verses.english: All your works, O Lord, will give thanks to you, and your holy ones will bless you.

verses.latin: Gloriam regni tui dicent: et potentiam tuam loquentur,
verses.english: They will declare the glory of your kingdom and speak of your power,

verses.latin: ut notam faciant filiis hominum potentiam tuam: et gloriam decoris regni tui.
verses.english: to make known to the sons of men your power and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

verses.latin: Regnum tuum regnum omnium saeculorum: et dominatio tua in omni generatione et generationem.
verses.english: Your kingdom is a kingdom of all ages. Your dominion endures through all generations.

verses.latin: Fidelis Dominus in omnibus verbis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.
verses.english: The Lord is faithful in all His words and holy in all His works.

verses.latin: Supportat Dominus omnes qui cadunt: et erigit omnes qui conpunguntur.
verses.english: The Lord supports all who fall and raises up all who are bowed down.

verses.latin: Oculi omnium in te sperant, Domine: et tu das illis escam in tempore opportuno.
verses.english: The eyes of all look to you, O Lord, and you give them food at the proper time.

verses.latin: Aperis tu manum tuam: et imples omne animal benedictione.
verses.english: You open your hand, and you fill every living thing with blessing.

verses.latin: Justus Dominus in omnibus viis suis: et sanctus in omnibus operibus suis.
verses.english: The Lord is just in all His ways and holy in all His works.

verses.latin: Prope est Dominus omnibus invocantibus eum: omnibus qui invocant eum in veritate.
verses.english: The Lord is near to all who call upon Him, to all who call upon Him in truth.

verses.latin: Voluntatem timentium se faciet: et deprecationem eorum exaudi et salvos faciet eos.
verses.english: He will fulfill the will of those who fear Him. He hears their prayer and saves them.

verses.latin: Custodit Dominus omnes diligentis se: et omnes peccatores disperdet.
verses.english: The Lord protects all who love Him, but He will destroy all the wicked.

verses.latin: Laudem Domini loquetur os meum: et benedicat omnis caro nomini sancto ejus in saeculum et in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord, and all flesh will bless His holy name forever and ever.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum quoniam bonus est; psallite Deo nostro, quoniam suavis.
verses.english: Praise God, because He is good! Sing to our God, because He is full of joy.

verses.latin: Aedificans Ierusalem Dominus: dispersiones Israhel congregabit.
verses.english: God is the one who builds Jerusalem; He will gather all the scattered people of Israel.

verses.latin: Qui sanat contritos corde, et alligat contritiones eorum.
verses.english: He heals those whose hearts are broken, and He binds up their wounds.

verses.latin: Qui numerat multitudinem stellarum, et omnibus eis nomina vocat.
verses.english: He knows the number of the stars and calls each of them by name.

verses.latin: Magnus Dominus noster, et magna virtus ejus: et sapientiæ ejus non est numerus.
verses.english: Our Lord is great, and His power is great, and there is no limit to His wisdom.

verses.latin: Suscipiens mansuetos Dominus: humilians autem peccatores usque ad terram.
verses.english: God supports the gentle. But He humbles sinners down to the earth.

verses.latin: Praecinite Domino in confessione: psallite Deo nostro in cithara.
verses.english: Sing to God, giving thanks; sing to our God with a harp.

verses.latin: Qui operit caelum nubibus, et parat terrae pluviam: qui producit in montibus foenum, et herbam servituti hominum.
verses.english: He covers the sky with clouds, and He prepares rain for the earth. He makes grass grow on the mountains, and crops for the service of men.

verses.latin: Dans jumento pabulum ejus: et pullis corvorum invocantibus eum.
verses.english: He gives food to the cattle, and to the young ravens when they call to Him.

verses.latin: Non in fortitudine equi voluntatem habebit, nec in tibiis viri beneplacitum erit ei.
verses.english: He does not delight in the strength of the horse, nor does He take pleasure in the legs of a man.

verses.latin: Beneplacitum est Domino super timentes eum, et in eis qui sperant super misericordiam ejus.
verses.english: God takes pleasure in those who fear Him, and in those who hope in His mercy.

verses.latin: Lauda Ierusalem Dominum: lauda Deum tuum, Sion.
verses.english: Praise the Lord, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!

verses.latin: Quoniam confortavit seras portarum tuarum: benedixit filiis tuis in te.
verses.english: Because He has strengthened the locks of your gates; He has blessed your children within you.

verses.latin: Qui posuit fines tuos pacem: et adipe frumenti satiat te.
verses.english: He makes peace in your borders and fills you with the finest wheat.

verses.latin: Qui emittit eloquium suum in terra: velociter currit sermo ejus.
verses.english: He sends out His word to the earth; quickly runs His word.

verses.latin: Qui dat nivem sicut lanam: nebulam sicut cinerem spargit.
verses.english: He gives snow like wool, scatters the mist like ashes.

verses.latin: Mittit crystallum suam sicut buccellas: ante faciem frigoris ejus quis sustinebit?
verses.english: He sends His ice like crumbs; who can stand against His cold?

verses.latin: Emittet verbum suum, et liquefaciet ea: flabit spiritus ejus, et fluent aquae.
verses.english: He sends out His word and melts them; He blows His spirit, and the waters flow.

verses.latin: Qui annuntiat verbum suum Jacob: justitias et judicia sua Israël.
verses.english: He declares His word to Jacob, His justice and judgements to Israel.

verses.latin: Non fecit taliter omni nationi: et judicia sua non manifestavit eis.
verses.english: He has not done this for every nation, and He has not revealed His judgements to them.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum, quoniam bonus est: psallite Deo nostro, quoniam suavis est.
verses.english: Praise God, because He is good. Sing to our God because He is merciful.

verses.latin: Aedificans Ierusalem Dominus: dispersiones Israëlis congregabit.
verses.english: God rebuilds Jerusalem; He gathers the scattered people of Israel.

verses.latin: Qui sanat contritos corde, et alligat contritiones eorum.
verses.english: He heals those with broken hearts, and binds up their wounds.

verses.latin: Qui numerat multitudinem stellarum, et omnibus eis nomina vocat.
verses.english: He determines the number of the stars and calls each of them by their name.

verses.latin: Magnus Dominus noster, et magna virtus ejus: et sapientiæ ejus non est numerus.
verses.english: Great is our God, and His power is great; His wisdom has no limit.

verses.latin: Suscipiens mansuetos Dominus: humilians autem peccatores usque ad terram.
verses.english: God helps the poor, but He humbles the wicked and the proud.

verses.latin: Præcinite Domino in confessione: psallite Deo nostro in cithara.
verses.english: Sing to God with thanksgiving, and sing to our God with the harp.

verses.latin: Qui operit cælum nubibus, et parat terræ pluviam: qui producit in montibus fœnum, et herbam servituti hominum.
verses.english: He covers the sky with clouds, provides the rain for the land, makes the grass grow in the mountains, and herbs for human use.

verses.latin: Dans jumentis escam ipsorum: et pullis corvorum invocantibus eum.
verses.english: He gives food to the cattle and the young ravens when they call to Him.

verses.latin: Non in fortitudine equi voluntatem habebit: nec in tibiis viri beneplacitum est ei.
verses.english: He doesn’t take pleasure in the strength of a horse or the speed of a man.

verses.latin: Beneplacitum est Domino super timentes eum: et in his qui sperant in misericordia ejus.
verses.english: God takes pleasure in those who fear Him and those who hope in His mercy.

verses.latin: Lauda Ierusalem Dominum: lauda Deum tuum, Sion.
verses.english: Praise God, Jerusalem; Praise your God, Zion.

verses.latin: Quoniam confortavit seras portarum tuarum: benedixit filiis tuis in te.
verses.english: He strengthens the gates of your city and blesses your children.

verses.latin: Qui posuit fines tuos pacem: et adipe frumenti satiat te.
verses.english: He makes peace in your land, and fills you with the finest wheat.

verses.latin: Qui emittit eloquium suum in terram: velociter currit sermo ejus.
verses.english: He sends out His word to the earth and His word runs swiftly.

verses.latin: Qui dat nivem sicut lanam: nebulam sicut cinerem spargit.
verses.english: He gives snow like wool; He scatters frost like ashes.

verses.latin: Mittit crystallum suam sicut buccellas: ante faciem frigoris ejus quis sustinebit?
verses.english: He throws down ice in pieces; who can endure His cold?

verses.latin: Emittet verbum suum, et liquefaciet ea: flabit spiritus ejus, et fluent aquæ.
verses.english: He sends out His word, and melts the ice, and when His wind blows, the waters flow.

verses.latin: Qui annuntiat verbum suum Jacob: justitias et judicia sua Israël.
verses.english: He proclaims His word to Jacob, His laws and judgments to Israel.

verses.latin: Non fecit taliter omni nationi: et judicia sua non manifestavit eis. Alleluia.
verses.english: He has not done this for any other nation, and has not revealed His judgments to them. Praise God.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum de caelis: laudate eum in excelsis.
verses.english: Praise God from the universe! Praise him in the highest heavens.

verses.latin: Laudate eum, omnes angeli ejus: laudate eum, omnes virtutes ejus.
verses.english: Praise him, all you angels! Praise him, all the hosts of heaven.

verses.latin: Laudate eum, sol et luna: laudate eum, omnes stellae lucis.
verses.english: Praise him, sun and moon! Praise him, all the stars and the light they give.

verses.latin: Laudate eum, caeli caelorum: et aquae omnes, quae super caelos sunt, laudent nomen Domini.
verses.english: Praise him, highest sky of the heavens! And you waters above the sky, praise the name of God.

verses.latin: Quia ipse dixit, et facta sunt: ipse mandavit, et creata sunt.
verses.english: Because he spoke, and it was made. He commanded, and everything was created.

verses.latin: Statuit ea in aeternum, et in saeculum saeculi: praeceptum posuit, et non praeteribit.
verses.english: He established them for the ages, for all time. He gave a law that cannot be broken.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum de terra, dracones et omnes abyssi:
verses.english: Praise God from the earth, all dragons and all the deep seas:

verses.latin: Ignis, grando, nix, glacies, spiritus procellarum, quae faciunt verbum ejus:
verses.english: Fire, hail, snow, ice, storm winds, all obeying his word:

verses.latin: Montes et omnes colles: ligna fructifera et omnes cedri:
verses.english: Mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars:

verses.latin: Bestiae et universa pecora: serpentes et volucres pennatae:
verses.english: Wild beasts and all livestock, creeping things and birds:

verses.latin: Reges terrae et omnes populi: principes et omnes judices terrae:
verses.english: Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of the earth:

verses.latin: Juvenis et virgo: senes cum junioribus laudent nomen Domini:
verses.english: Young men and maidens, old men and children, let them all praise God's name:

verses.latin: Quia exaltatum est nomen ejus solius:
verses.english: For his name alone is exalted,

verses.latin: confessio ejus super caelum et terram.
verses.english: his glory is above the universe and the earth.

verses.latin: Et exaltavit cornu populi sui: hymnus omnibus sanetis ejus: filiis Israël, populo appropinquanti sibi.
verses.english: He raised up the horn of his people, the song of praise of all his saints, of the children of Israel, the people drawing near to him.

verses.latin: Cantate Domino canticum novum: laus ejus in ecclesia sanctorum.
verses.english: Sing to the Lord a new song, and give praise to him with the congregation of the saints.

verses.latin: Laetetur Israël in eo qui fecit eum: et fili Sion exsultent in rege suo.
verses.english: Let Israel rejoice that God made them, and let the children of Zion be joyful in their king.

verses.latin: Laudent nomen ejus in choro: in tympano et psalterio psallant ei.
verses.english: Let them praise his name with dancing, and in musical accompaniment, they shall sing to him.

verses.latin: Quia beneplacitum est Domino in populo suo: et exaltabit mansuetos in salutem.
verses.english: For God is pleased by his people. He will exalt the humble with salvation.

verses.latin: Exsultabunt sancti in gloria: laetabuntur in cubilibus suis.
verses.english: The saints will exult in glory, and will rejoice on their beds.

verses.latin: Exaltationes Dei in gutture eorum: et gladii ancipites in manibus eorum.
verses.english: Let the praise of God be in their throats, and let them carry the two-edged swords in their hands.

verses.latin: Ad faciendam vindictam in nationibus: increpationes in populis.
verses.english: This is to bring vengeance on the nations and punishments on the peoples.

verses.latin: Ad alligandos reges eorum in compedibus: et nobiles eorum in manicis ferreis.
verses.english: To bind their kings in chains and their nobles in iron shackles.

verses.latin: Ut faciant in eis judicium conscriptum: gloria haec est omnibus sanctis ejus.
verses.english: This is the judgment written for them, and it is the glory that comes to all the saints.

verses.latin: Laudate Dominum in sanctis ejus: laudate eum in firmamento virtutis ejus.
verses.english: Praise God in his holy place! Praise him in the great universe He created and rules.

verses.latin: Laudate eum in virtutibus ejus: laudate eum secundum multitudinem magnitudinis ejus.
verses.english: Praise Him for the many things He can do! Praise Him because of how great He is!

verses.latin: Laudate eum in sono tubae: laudate eum in psalterio et cithara.
verses.english: Praise Him with trumpets! Praise Him with harps and lyres.

verses.latin: Laudate eum in tympano et choro: laudate eum in chordis et organo.
verses.english: Praise Him with drums and in dances! Praise Him with stringed instruments and flutes.

verses.latin: Laudate eum in cymbalis sonantibus: laudate eum in cymbalis jubilationis: omnis spiritus laudet Dominum.
verses.english: Praise Him with clashing cymbals! Praise Him with loud cymbals! Let everyone and everything with breath praise the Lord!
